name: Proyecto Calcatreu, Rio Negro, Argentina
headline: The project Calcatreu near Ingeniero Jacobacci, Rio Negro province, was stopped in 2005 by local opposition and ancestral indigenous rights. Patagonia Gold bought this project from PAS in 2017, and tries to reactivate it.

name: Water Contamination by Rahim Yar Khan sugar mill, Pakistan
headline: Sugar mill factory polluting drinking water sources and putting life at risk for thousands. Residents staged a protest and demand owners to act

name: Oak Flat copper and molybdenum mining, USA
headline: Resolution Copper (Rio Tinto and BHP) threatens to destroy Apache ceremonial grounds at Chi'chil Bildagoteel in Arizona for critical materials for the so-called energy transition

name: New airport on Tioman Island, Malaysia
headline: Residents, NGOs and tourism businesses protest revival of a plan for new airport off the coast of Tioman Island. Land reclamation for the project would damage coral reefs, seagrass beds and white sand beaches that are the main attraction for visitors.

name: Intensive rice cultivation by Group Addoha, Senegal
headline: Local  population protests against the concession of 10.000ha to a Moroccan company to cultivate rice.  The Senegalese President stated that the lease would be cancelled. This decision  not yet implemented.

name: Illegal logging, land grabbing and deaths of Zé Claudio and Maria do Espirito Santo, Pará,  Brazil
headline: "The story of Amazon destruction and those who are fighting against it does not end with the death of Zé Claudio and Maria. Hardly. As you read this, hundreds of rural environmental activists face death threats in Brazil."

name: Pesticides contaminate drinking water in Bretagne, France
headline: 43% of the Bretagne's population drank water contaminated by pesticides, says a report.

name: Sewage floods in Hebron city, West Bank
Copper mine Quellaveco on the Asana river, Peru
headline: A four year mega-project for the diversion of the Asana river is about to start. The agreement reached in 2012 hasn't appeased concerns for the mining detrimental consequences.

name: Jiaokou Feimei Aluminum Industry Co., Ltd. , LvLiang, Shanxi, China
headline: Feimei Aluminum, a Xinfa subsidiary in Jiaokou, Shanxi was blamed for polluting villages. Dozens of households in the lower reaches of its red mud reservoir were relocated over fears of a tailings dam failure and lye leaks

name: Wind farm, Nowe Skalmierzyce, Poland
headline: In 2012, residents blocked the construction of a wind farm with more than 20 turbines. In 2021, mobilization resumed, as the investor's new plans - for only 3 turbines - prevented the development of a large area due to the 'anti-wind turbines' act.

name: Kamchay dam, Kampot province, Cambodia
headline: Cambodia’s first large dam, located in the unique Bokor national park, provoked concerns and protests over unjust implementation procedures as well as over environmental and social impacts.

name: Phosphate mining in Anitápolis, Brazil
headline: Since 2007 local communities are organized against a phosphate mining project in Anitápolis which would destroy part of Mata Atlântica.

name: Surya Sawit Sejat, oil palm plantation in Kotawaring district, Indonesia
headline: United Plantations established a palm oil plantation in Kotawaringin District, Central Kalimantan, without having the required permits and without consulting the local communities. Despite mobilization, their operations continue.

name: WPB Colliery in Dullstroom, Mpumalanga, South Africa
headline: The community of Dullstroom has been fighting against the WPB coal mine, which has been mining illegally for years in the surrounding endangered wetlands.

name: A decade longe battle against Yeelirrie uranium mine led by Tjiwarl women, Australia
headline: Tjiwarl women alongside other people have fought the Yeelirrie mine  for more than ten years. The mine has been approved by Federal Authorities. But they continue with the resistance.

name: Lake Chad desertification, Chad
Xochicuautla, an indigenous community against a road, Lerma, Mexico
headline: Resistance since 2007 by an Otomí community near Mexico city against a four-lane motorway (Naucalpan-Toluca) that would cut across their sacred territory and forest.

name: Developments along the shores of Lake Elementaita, Kenya
Coltan in the Kivu Region, DR of Congo
headline: Persistent illegal Coltan mining in DR of Congo, using  child labour and increasing biodiversity loss and environmental risks. On March 20th 2016, the priest Vincent Machozi was shot dead for denouncing the mass killing of the Nande community

name: Batang Toru dam, North Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: A dam has been proposed in a high-value conservation area in Indonesia that is home to the few remaining members of a rare orangutan species.

name: Sime Darby Plantation land conflict, Liberia
Toxic waste management in Abaco Island, The Bahamas
headline: In 1995, the government of Bahamas jointly with Owens-Illinois Corporation cleaned-up a  sugar mill site where during the 70´s more than 40 fifty-gallon of pesticides were disposed of.

name: Anglo Platinum Mogalakwena mine lawsuit, South Africa
Mobil oil spills in the Atlantic Coast line, Nigeria
Oil drilling in the National Park of Calilegua, Argentina
headline: Moblization of various different social actors to stop the oil drilling activities in the Calilegua National Park. In spite of their opposition and against the envrionmental laws in force, the oil drilling license has been extended.

name: Gold mining in Rebkong endangers human lives and ecology, TAP Huangnan, Qinghai, China
headline: A Chinese gold mining operation pollutes the Gu Chu river putting in danger sources of livelihood for Tibetans.

name: Stop Irish Cement Ltd. (Limerick) from burning tyres and other waste, Ireland
headline: A cement production plant seeks to shift from fossil fuel burning to incineration of tyres and other waste  despite community fears over air pollution and dioxins.

name: Planta de energía nuclear de Montalto di Castro
headline: La central nuclear de Montalto di Castro: la movilización de la ciudadanía y la popular voluntad llevará al cierre del histórico central.

name: Tribals, Forest Rights Activists Oppose Telangana Government's Tree-Plantation Programme, India
headline: Haritha Haram is a tree-plantation programme by the Government of Telangana, which was launched in 2015. It has often coincided  with tree-felling, thus leading to protests in cities and countryside.

name: Yalova VOPAK Chemical Storage Terminal, Turkey
Rare Earth Mining in Kachin State, Myanmar
headline: Myanmar's ethnic minorities bear the brunt of Rare Earth mining for energy transition.  Chinese firms  outsource this toxic mining industry from China to Myanmar in this "sacrifice zone".

name: Illegal gold mining and killing of anti-mining indigenous leaders, Mindanao, Philippines
headline: Life for gold: Several members of CSO KASILO, including Jimmy Liguyon, indigenous leader of the lumad Matigsalog tribe and vocal opponent of large-scale gold mining, were killed for refusing to support mining interests on indigenous lands

name: Depredación Ecológica en el Cerro El Cimatario, Querétaro, México
headline: El crecimiento acelerado y desmedido de la mancha urbana de la ciudad de Querétaro, invade y amenaza el Parque Nacional del Cerro El Cimatario lo que ha generado un proceso de defensa ambiental por parte de organizaciones locales.

name: Contaminación del Río Piraí, Bolivia
headline: 1983, Santa Cruz vive uno de los desastres ambientales más recordados de su historia. Excesiva explotación de los áridos de su río hace desbordar las aguas, arrastrando todo a su paso. Hoy, el río sufre altos niveles de contaminación

name: Chuangyuan aluminium plant pollution in Hunan, China
Buryatia (Tunka National Park) vs Yukos oil, Russian Federation
headline: Yukos planned to build a pipeline to China through Tunka National Park next to Lake Baikal. Local opposition stopped it.  Values of respect for and sacredness of nature played a role.

name: WISCO Soalala iron ore, Madagascar
Sahara India Eco Tourism Project in Sundarbans, West Bengal, India
Illegal landfill near Qalqilyah, between the towns of Jayus and Azun, Palestine
headline: Dump site used for  industrial and chemical waste from Israeli factories located inside the Green Line as well as domestic waste settlements contaminates groves and puts community's health at risk

name: Exploratory Fracking at Kirby Misperton, Yorkshire, UK
headline: The small Yorkshire village of Kirby Misperton has become a fracking frontline, with ongoing protests since Third Energy were granted planning permission to carry out hydraulic fracturing tests. This sets a precedent for fracking in the UK.

name: Bedford Biofuels Jatropha, Tana Delta, Kenya
Derrame de petroleo en el campo de Frade, Brasil
headline: In 2011 a spill of crude oil of great proportion was registered in the sea, following the rupture of a pipeline. At the moment, a criminal action is ongoing but Chevron still operates freely on Brazilian territory

name: Chemehuevi Indian Tribe Off-Roading Damage, CA, USA
headline: Off-road vehicles threaten land sacred to the Chemehuevi Indian Tribe and biodiversity in their area. Authorities reply they do not have appropriate funding to adequately patrol and enforce these areas and legal processes have been delayed numerous times.

name: Clayoquot Sound, Canada
headline: During the 'War in the Woods' in Clayoquot Sound in the 90s, over 800 people were arrested and Canada's environmental movement came-of-age. These protests continue to shape Canada’s political landscape.

name: Adani's solar power plant taking land away from farmers, Rajasthan, India
headline: Adani's ultra mega solar power plant encroaches on Nedan village and threatens the local sacred lands and traditional agricutural and grazing commons.

name: Nuclear Waste Storage in Villar de Cañas, Spain
headline: The nuclear waste deposit (ATC) in Villar de Cañas in the region of Castilla La Mancha has been running into increased difficulties since the plan was launched in 2004.

name: Mis Valley Hydropower plant, Italy
Bakun dam, Malaysia
Varun land grabbing, Madagascar
Vindelälven hydel project, Sweden
headline: Successful movement against a dam. The site has become a protected area, also a Ramsar area.

name: Ashiyan City project and land grabbing in wetlands, Bangladesh
headline: Land grabbing in the name of township development in biodiverse wetlands. Complaints and petitions of the local people stopped the project for now but a long legal battle awaits ahead

name: Langtang  incinerator stopped in Luoding, Guangdong, China
headline: Plans for an incinerator in Langtang township, Luoding city, belonging to China Resources Cement Holdings, were discarded after demonstrations by citizens and clashes with the police in April 2015.

name: Minería en Jardín, Antioquia, Colombia
headline: "Somos sembradores, no somos mineros!" - Siguen proyectos mineros de extracción de oro en el Cinturón de Oro de Antioquia. Marchas en la plaza principal, foros y reuniones: la comunidad se ha posicionado en un “No a la minería”

name: Illegal boreholes for strawberry farming in Doñana, Spain
headline: Doñana is a Natural World Heritage wetland, highly dependent on water, which is threatened by the - often illegal - water abstractions and inefficient use at 6,000 hectares of strawberry farms.

name: PT Ampibabo and PT Agri Toribulu oil palm companies in Parimo Regency,  Central Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: Several sub-districts of Parigi Moutong Regency are mobilizing has against palm oil developments in the regency. Focus is put on the operations of PT Ampibabo Agro Lestari and PT Agri Toribulu Asri, who administer oil palm concessions in 4 sub-districts.

name: Exxaro Leeuwpan Mining Project, South Africa
Kosova e Re lignite power plant
Coastal megaprojects in Bahia de Jiquilisco, El Salvador
headline: A Ramsar site and a very rich mangrove area is threatened by gigantic tourism development projects. Local fishermen and local communities complain.

name: Iron ore mining and transport in Sonshi, Goa, India
headline: A protest against iron ore mining and transport leading to arrest of 45 villagers including 23 women might successfully stop the projects in Sonshi village in North Goa.

name: Fracking en municipios del Maestrat y Els Ports en Castellón, Comunitat Valenciana, Spain
headline: Fracking frontiers expanding in the Comunitat Valenciana; a Canadian company and its Spanish subsidiary promises jobs and revenues but local committees oppose the explorations.

name: Minería en el cerro sagrado Care Perro en Antioquia, Colombia
MacArthur Metallic / Black Sand Mining, Philippines
headline: MacArthur, a town endowed with rich fertile lands and a lake is threatened by black sand mining.

name: Russas and Valparaíso REDD+ projects in Acre, Brazil
headline: Despite high promises, these two carbon offset projects show that REDD+ is not an idea that comes from the communities, nor one that benefits these. Instead it creates a new commodity of carbon credits that permits ongoing pollution in the Global North.

name: Ecological Disaster on popular Khalaktyrsky Beach, Kamchatka, Russia
headline: An ecological disaster took place in Eastern Kamchatka and resulted in the washing up of marine corpses onto the shores of Khalaktyrsky beach. The incident sparked nationwide outrage.

name: Dominican Republic´s farmers threatened by new seed bill
headline: Dominican Republic Senator affiliated with chemical industry promotes a new seed law that touches off  farmers movement

name: Farmworkers sued chemical companies, Ivory Coast
headline:
Farmworkers claims against manufacturers,_x000D_
distributors, and users of the pesticide DBCP for genocide and crimes against humanity under the Alien Tort Statute (“ATS”) in Ivory Coast.

name: Pollution of the Obangué River (also Dubanga River), Gabon
headline: Addax Petroleum,  a subsidiary of the  Sinopec Group, from China,  has been  in Gabon since 2004, polluting the river Obangué, and engaged in conflicts over taxes with the Gabon government.

name: Shale Gas Fracking on Île Anticosti, Quebec, Canada
headline: Quebec's bid for energy independence threatens island refuge with plans to test novel fracking technologies. Locals are calling the plans to frack: "the theft of the century."

name: Rubber tree plantation and latex factory near Dja Reserve, by Sudcam Hévéa S.A., Cameroon
headline: The creation of a huge rubber plantation near the Dja Reserve is a threat for wildlife and people in this important area of the Congo Basin. It can affect to endangered species and is already damaging the lifes of the local community.

name: Killing of Asháninka leader Estela Casanto Mauricio in Junín, Peru
headline: On March 12, 2021, Asháninka leader Estela Casanto Mauricio was killed after years of being threatened for her indigenous land rights advocacy

name: Asbestos in Salonit Anhovo, Slovenia
Metal Mining in Tumpang Pitu, Banyuwangi, East Java, Indonesia
headline: Mount Tumpang Pitu is a small mountain located in Banyuwangi Regency. Since 1995, corporate mining activities in the area met esistance by local communities, followed by criminalization of activists.

name: Military Polygon on Sinjajevina, Montenegro
headline: Save Sinjajevina! From a territory of life, traditional pastoralist communities and unique outstanding alpine landscapes of Europe, to a territory of death, warfare, and destruction!

name: Olkiluoto Nuclear Power Plant, Euraåminne, Finland
headline: After a very long delays in construction (ten years) it seems that this nuclear power plant might start in 2020.

name: Cellulose industry in Gualeguaychu, Uruguay and Argentina
Construction of the highway Moscow-Petersburg through the Khimki forest, Russia
Series of pollution events by Guangxi Xinfa Aluminum & Electricity, Jingxi, China
headline: Low-cost aluminum producer, Guangxi Xinfa pollutes   land, water and air, threatening human safety and health, food security, livelihoods as well as the landscape. A court decision has not yet been reached.

name: Habitantes de Shaglli contra proyecto minero Shyri, Ecuador
headline: Inhabitants of Shaglli strongly complained in 2012 against the Canadian mining company Cornerstone. Seventeen of them were "criminalized" by the government of Ecuador.

name: Anti-fracking uprising in Ain Salah, Algeria
headline: As a desert oasis, Ain Salah relies on a sensitive aquifer system now overlapping with at least four intensive shale gas fields. From the start of 2015, huge anti-fracking protests erupted, some sustained for more than 5 months despite brutal repression.

name: Complejo inmobiliario MÍTIKAH y Ciudad Viva en Ciudad de México, México
headline: Xoco, un pueblo originario de la Ciudad de México, defiende el agua, las áreas verdes y sus tradiciones frente a la especulación inmobiliaria

name: Caño Limón oilfield in Arauquita, Arauca, Colombia
headline: Caño Limón has attracted armed violence ever since it was established. Extrajudicial killings of environmental defenders are commonplace, such as that of Maria Del Carmen Moreno Páez.

name: Represas del río Santa Cruz, Argentina
headline: Resistance against a large hydroelectric project pulled together a coalition of national NGOs. They achieved increased visibility, an EIA and public hearings, but the project is now under construction with Chinese funds

name: Residents protest against several planned electroplating plants in Dongyang, Zhejiang, China
headline: Nearly 1,000 residents clashed with riot police outside Dongyang Government offices in the eastern province of Zhejiang in protest over plans for an electro-plating plant near their homes.

name: Illegal exploitation of tropical wood by Norsudtimber, in DR Congo
headline: Norsudtimber operates 18 of its 20 concessions in DRC illegally and exports endangerered species mainly to Portugal, France, China and Vietnam.

name: Newmont's Ahafo gold mine, Ghana
headline: IFC supported exploitation of Ahafo Gold mine by Newmont. Communities suffer from displacement, loss of livelihoods and recurring cyanide pollution

name: Presa de El Zapotillo, Jalisco, Mexico
Plantations in North Sumatra displacing indigenous Rakyat Pununggu, Indonesia
headline: For many years, plantation company PTPN II has repeatedly displaced peasant farming communities across indigenous Rakyat Pununggu settlements using military force. Locals resist evictions mainly with blockades at great physical risk to themselves.

name: Jirau and Santo Antonio Dams on Madeira River, Brazil
headline: The two mega hydroelectic power plants, fueled by the Jipau and Santo Antonio dams on the Madeira River are to be completed by 2015, despite local opposition violation of human rights. In Jan 2016, Nilce de Souza Magalhães of MAB was assassinated.

name: Jamsher solid waste treatment plant in Jalandhar, Punjab, India
Mutanda Mine, Democratic Republic of Congo
headline: Mutanda Mine is the world largest cobalt producer. While different organizations are working on defending the victims of the mine and give them justice, the mining company still does not take enough responsibility and continues to violate human rights.

name: Waste incinerator in Boluo county, Guangdong, China
headline: In September 2014, thousands of residents took to the streets during one weekend to protest against the development of a proposed garbage incinerator in Boluo County, Guangdong. Following the protest, 24 protestors were detained.

name: Dugarajapatnam Port, Andhra Pradesh, India
Mokorón Hill, Nicaragua
headline: City dwellers demonstrate against the urbanization of the Mokorón Hill. One of the last tropical dry forest ecosystem in Central America and the most important aquifer recharge for the water supply in Managua.

name: Illegal stone quarry in Andarawewa forest reserve, Sri Lanka
headline: Corruption, clientelism and land grabbing for stone quarries in a forest reserve

name: Marble Mining in Indigenous Mollo Territory in West Timor, Indonesia
headline: Government officials seized land and gave  permits to mining companies to extract marble from Mutis Mountain without consent from the Mollo people. The mines closed after years of protests.

name: Water pollution caused by coal mines and gas field at Xiaohaotu, Shaanxi, China
headline: A performance art exhibition by Brother Nut brought public and government's attention to the water pollution at Xiaohaotu Township at the border of Shaanxi and Inner Mongolia in China, caused by closeby coal mines and a gas field.

name: Site C Dam, Canada
headline: Clean Energy Act is paving the way for "clean" projects, and exempts them from impacts evaluation and consultation with local inhabitants. However, First Nations, Landowners and Environmentalists Resist this controversial dam in British Columbia.

name: Sponge Iron Factories in West Bengal, India
Hotel complex construction and displacement of Roma families, Skopje, Macedonia
headline: Forced eviction exposed Roma communities to cramped and unhygienic conditions in shelters and at risk of racially-motivated violence.

name: Saemangeun reclamation project, South Korea
Proyecto Caycayén  (Grupo Mexico) paralizado, Chos Malal, Neuquén, Argentina
headline: Caycayén copper mining project is rejected by the "Vecinos Autoconvocados de Chos Malal", a self sumoned neighbours' assembly, in Neuquén province.

name: Water privatisation, Egypt
Guajajara community against illegal loggers in Terra Indígena Araribóia, Maranhão, Brazil
headline: Systematically lacking help from the government, communities of the TI Araribóia have started to protect themselves against illegal logging and the advancing of the deforestation frontier but now face ongoing violence and impunity.

name: Wanning Waste-to-Energy Plant, Hainan, China
headline: The Wanning Waste-to-Energy Project has been suspended twice because of concerns over siting voiced by local residents in two towns.

name: Paks Nuclear plant expansion, Hungary
Basra Polluted Water Crisis, Iraq
headline: The number of Iraqis poisoned by polluted drinking water in Basra is nearing 100,000, with officials failing to tackle a weeks-long crisis.

name: Public Interest Litigation against Tianji Lu’an Chemical due to air pollution, Shanxi, China
headline: China Biodiversity Conservation and Green Development Foundation (CBCGDF) filed the first env public interest litigation in Shanxi against Tianji Lu’an Chemical on the ground of air pollution in 2016, which came to a mediation agreement after 5 years.

name: Oil palm and National Park Jeannette Kawas, Honduras
headline: Jeanette Kawas was murdered on 6 February 1995. Kawas opposed planting oil palm in protected areas and illegal logging. She is known as the first environmental martyr of Honduras.

name: Decimation of Palestine’s fishing industry, Palestine
headline: Palestine's fishing industry and fisher-people's livelihoods devastated by Israel's closure of Palestine's maritime waters for military purposes and to protect gas exploration, platforms and pipelines.

name: Northstar oil field, Alaska, USA
headline: Greenpeace and  Inupiat groups tried to stop exploitation of oil in Beaufort Sea  through a court case, but this failed in 2001.

name: Conexão-Abrolhos campaign against the auction of oil and gas blocks, Brazil
headline: In October 2019, the National Petroleum Agency of Brazil, without an exploitation license, auctioned four oil and gas blocks close to the Abrolhos region. The CONEXÃO ABROLHOS group working on marine conservation initiated a campaign against this auction.

name: Chachi indigenous centre El Encanto vs Durini, Ecuador
Fehmarn Belt Fixed Link, Germany - Denmark
Planta Fotovoltaica Los Prados (53 MW), Namasigüe, Honduras
headline: Plans of a Norwegian company to install a solar plant provoked residents' protest and resistance due to livelihood impacts. The conflict escalated with the repression and criminalization of protesters. One community leader was assassinated.

name: Saramaka people's lawsuit against state, Suriname
Waste Management in Subotica, Serbia
headline: In Subotica, Serbia, communities and municipality cooperate for managing waste treatment. A case where important institutional and legislative changes might help improve the waste management.

name: Ankara wastepickers struggle to be formally incorporated into the legal waste collecting framework, Turkey
headline: New technologies and economic structures led to increases in Turkey’s recycling rate  but 500.000  wastepickers are excluded from commercial gains in the recycling and waste collection sector.

name: Alibag SEZ in Mumbai, MH, India
Palm Islands (Palm Jumeira), United Arab Emirates
headline: A massive artificial island that spans about 25 square km, is the first of many to be built on the Gulf coast of Dubai. Behind all the luxurious hotels and resorts, it has destructive impacts on the environment

name: Champlain Hudson Power Express, Quebec, Canada
headline: The Champlain Hudson Power Express is a proposed 333-mile long hydropower transmission line that brings energy from Quebec to power New York City. However, the creation of new dams has negative health impacts on Canadian indigenous communities.

name: Illegal mining at Bainaimiao Coal Mine in Siziwang Banner, Ulanqab, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: The land acquisition and pollution caused by illegal mining and coal-seam fire at Bainaimiao Coal Mine led to environmental, social and health concerns among local herders. Environmental NGO CBCGDF filed a public interest litigation in July 2018.

name: Health and environmental impacts of the petrochemical complex in Tarragona, Spain
headline: The petrochemical complex  causes fatal accidents and pollution. Some organizations denounce health and environmental threats but the administration refuses to act due to the economic relevance of the industry.

name: Homestead Air Reserve Base Superfund Site, Florida, USA
headline: Privatized Temporary Shelter for Unaccompanied Migrant Children located directly next to Superfund site of hazardous chemicals and toxins finally closes in October of 2019

name: Ilisu Dam Project, Turkey
headline: With the continuation of the construction of the Ilisu Dam and Hydroelectric Power Plant on the Tigris River in December 2014, the dam construction site has been militarized intensely. Check out more here!

name: Alton Gas storage project, Nova Scotia, Canada
headline: Mi’kmaq communities and non-Indigenous allies have been actively opposing the completion of the Alton Gas project near Stewiacke, Nova Scotia. They are building the solutions in the pathway of the problem.

name: Bedouin Israeli citizens expelled from their land by the state, Israel
headline: Palestinian Arab Bedouin, indigenous inhabitants of the Negev live in "unrecognized villages," in the south of Israel.  Israel has been demolishing villages to make way for Jewish towns, military installations and infrastructure projects.

name: Karad Airport expansion, Maharashtra, India
headline: Farmer strong mobilizations against Karad airport Expansion to save fertile and irrigated land.

name: Rotura de dique de relaves de Minera Caudalosa y contaminaciones en lagunas de Castrovirreyna, Huancavelica, Peru
headline: This region of Peru that includes the beautiful lakes of Castrovirreyna is being very badly damaged by regular pollution by mining, and also by the collapse of tailings dams.

name: Urban construction sites provoked pneumoconiosis crisis in Shuangxi Village, Hunan, China
headline: Hundreds of migrant workers who contributed to the urbanisation process in Shenzhen got contracted with pneumoconiosis. They are on a hard road to protest for compensations and justice.

name: Fairy Creek old-growth logging protests in the southern Vancouver Island region of British Columbia, Canada
headline: The Fairy Creek protests against old-growth logging began in August 2020 and are ongoing. Protests are focused on logging operations in the Fairy Creek watershed area of Southern Vancouver Island.

name: TotalEnergies' Bateke plantation: a “cover up” for damaging oil production, Republique of the Congo
headline: "These people came to kill us on our own land." TotalEnergies, with involvement Macron and the Republic of the Congo dictator, is developing a 40,000ha industrial plantation in the Bateke Plateaux dispossessing local farmers.

name: Qingshuihe Waste Incineration Power Plant, Luohu District, Shenzhen, China
headline: On 8th January 2006, residents of Qingshuihe took to the streets to protest against the plan of the local authority to expand a waste incinerator.  There is also a landfill.

name: Shell contractors fingered in Bodo community oil theft/explosion, Nigeria
Sand mining related deaths in Jatpura Village, Garhwa district, Jharkhand, India
headline: In May 2017 villagers in Jatpura, about 260 km from Jharkhand state capital Ranchi, tried to stop workers from lifting sand from a river bed. There was a clash with several deaths.

name: Oil exploration within Somalia's semi-autonomous Puntland region, Somalia
headline: Oil exploration fuels ethnic and religious conflicts in the semi-autonomous Puntland region in Somalia.

name: Excessive blood lead caused by Haijiu Battery Co., Ltd. in Deqing, Zhejiang, China
headline: Hundreds of people living near a battery manufacturer in Zhejiang province have been found to have dangerously high levels of lead in their blood, 200 people blocked the roads and stormed the factory.

name: The Deep Well Oil and Gas Sawn Lake project and the Lubicon Lake Nation, Canada
headline: “They can drag me off to jail and lock me up and throw away the key. I have many children and grandchildren, they keep going even if I am locked up. They can lock up my boys and I still have grandchildren that will carry on the fight.” Councillor Walter W

name: Koroama Women stage protest alleging neglect by Shell, Nigeria
Lignite mining Jänschwalde (Horno), Germany
Appiko movement, Western Ghats, India
Dams and embankments in the Ganga-Kosi floodplains, BR, India
headline: Flood control structures and management paradigms have proved to be highly problematic for livelihood security, ecological productivity, and human development especially for marginalised sections of Bihari society, who have been reduced to flood refugees

name: Citinickel's Pulot Sofronio mine in Palawan, Philippines
headline: Claimed to bring progress, the Pulot Citinickel mine has brought large environmental destruction to Palawan. Villagers and indigenous communities oppose mining projects in the area.

name: Polo Petroquímico de Dock Sud en  “Villa Inflamable”, Argentina.
headline: Residents in "Villa Inflamable" are suffering the effects of living in a contaminated place; complaints about air, soil, and water pollution abound, but so do denial, confusion, and uncertainty about its extent and effects.

name: Presa La Boquilla en Chihuahua, Mexico
headline: Represión mortal contra los agricultores que se quejan ante la CONAGUA por el trasvase de agua hacia los EE. UU. en cumplimiento del Tratado de Aguas Internacionales de 1944 entre México y los EE. UU.

name: Valdecaballeros nuclear power station, Spain
headline: This power station was never finished because of strong local opposition and a permanent moratorium in 1984 in Spain on new nuclear power.  However, this created the "nuclear debt" that citizens paid for 30 years through their electricity bills.

name: Vieques Navy Military Pollution, Puerto Rico
Silent Valley Hydro-Electric Project, Kerala, India
headline: The Save Silent Valley movement is a source of inspiration for many later anti-dam movements in the country. Back in the '80s it led to the scrapping of a hydro plant and to the declaration of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve

name: Monoculture plantation in Araucania, Chile
Contaminación en el Lago de Maracaibo, Venezuela
headline: Desde hace muchos años la industria petrolera contamina al Lago de Maracaibo en Venezuela. El alto número y volumen de los derrames, afectan enormemente ecosistemas sensibles. Entre 1 y 3 millones de personas son afectadas.

name: Ain Dara Cement Factory, Lebanon
headline: Fattouch's death factory meets heavy opposition from the locals of Ain Dara. The Ain Dara municipality refuses to give Fattouch a license to start building due serious environmental and health impact .

name: Minería en Támesis, Colombia
headline: La poblacion del “Cinturón de Oro de Colombia” dice NO a la mineria de oro, propone un "“Cinturón Ambiental Occidental" y organiza marchas y "Abrazos a la Montanya".

name: Nuclear power plant in Le Carnet, France
headline: To compensate for the increase in hydrocarbon prices and further reduce its dependence on fossil fuels, France tried to build another NNP, causing outrage because of environmental, social and economic impacts.

name: Nación Yaqui contra el gasoducto Guaymas – El Oro, Sonora. Mexico
headline: Loma de Bácum, uno de los ocho pueblos tradicionales de la Tribu Yaqui, resiste la imposición de un gasoducto en su territorio y sufre criminalización, ataques y hostigamiento.

name: PT LonSum conflict, Sumatra
Erdenetsagaan Without Mining movement, Eastern Mongolia
headline: In Erdenetsagaan, a herder community  suffers severe environmental degradation due to mining of coal and other minerals. Those projects threaten both the environment and herders'  way of living.

name: Lunik IX Roma settlement:  potable water monitored by police and segregated by wall in Košice, Slovak Republic
headline: In 2005 Roma people were forced to live in hazardous and unhealthy environmental and housing conditions in  a segregated settlement in Košice’s called Luník IX just on the outskirts of the town

name: Lead in enamel paint campaign, Sri Lanka
headline: Decorative paints with high lead levels are still being sold in Sri Lanka even after the legislation passed by the Consumer Affairs Authority came into force at the beginning of 2013.

name: Dust instead of water: degradation and desecation of Lake Cuitzeo, Michoacan, Mexico.
headline: Because of roads crossing the lake and water drawing, the lake lacks water,  the wind takes away its sediments making storms of dust out of them, damaging the health of neighbouring comunities.

name: Est-For Invest's pulp mill at the Emajõgi river, Estonia
headline: This so-called ‘biorefinery' would consume a quarter of Estonia’s wood supply and pollute the country’s second largest river. Opposition is strong, with support from the City of Tartu and from all over the world.

name: Cerro El Alguacil (INARWA), Colombia
Proyecto de presa en el río Cuira “Sistema Tuy IV” Venezuela
headline: "Sistema Tuy IV" entre el discurso y las promesas del Estado Venezolano en el desarrollo de los proyectos  y los derechos de los gricultores del Río Cuira en el estado Miranda.

name: Tularosa Basin Downwinders and Trinity blast, New Mexico, USA
headline: Communities in the region have long suffered from the atomic blast at Trinity and the subsequent nuclear colonialism in the region. The impacts of Trinity--and subsequent nuclear blasts in the Southwest-- include contaminated water, air, and cancer

name: Holistic Forest Conservation Program by Air France and WWF, Madagascar
Komo Airfield, Papua New Guinea
headline: Komo Airfield, with the longest runway in Papua New Guinea, was built specifically for delivery of equipment for the ExxonMobil led PNG LNG (liquefied natural gas) project. Pre-existing land disputes were intensified by land acquisition for the project

name: Fibria and Eldorado Brasil project in Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil
headline: Fibria, a Brazilian company, took over eucalyptus plantations and a pulp mill which started functioning in 2009. Eldorado Brasil project was launched a bit later and has bought lands and planted eucalyptus.

name: Oil refinery blast in Limbé, Cameroon
headline: In May 2019, an explosion destroyed Cameroon's only oil refinery. The government claimed it was an accident, while separatist guerrilla claimed authorship. The refinery is  being rebuilt (July 2023).

name: Great Manmade River, Libya
headline: To make up for the gap in its traditional supplies, the Libyan government, headed by Gaddafi, undertook the largest civil engineering project in the world, popularly known as The Great Man Made River Project (GMMR), to green the northern deserts of Libya

name: Pascua Lama Mine, Argentina
headline: Sentenced by Chilean justice for the non-respect of envrionmental regulations, Barrick Gold suspended the mining activities in Pascua-Lama, while the surrounding glaciers are still threaten by the presence of the company.

name: Rio Tinto's Rössing Uranium Mine, Namibia
headline: This is an uranium mine belonging to Rio Tinto (about 70%) and to the government of Iran (15%). It is near the new town of Arandis. Since the apartheid era there are allegations of health damage to workers at Rössing.

name: Las Chancas copper mining, Perú
headline: The resistence of communities paralyzed the Las Chancas project, a strategic copper mining project in the region of Apurimac

name: Yacyreta Dam on the Parana River, Argentina-Paraguay
headline: Yacyreta dam is named as a as a "monument to corruption". It was built without prior consultation of the local population and displaced thousands of them.

name: Desertificación de Lago Poopó, Bolivia
headline: The Desaguadero connects vast Lake Titicaca with Lake Poopó - this second lake dried up in late 2015. Climate change has melted the Andean glaciers that fed the lake. Water has been diverted for mining and agriculture. Plus the worst drought in 25 years.

name: Kaolin pipeline on Quilombo land in Moju, Para, Brazil
headline: Quilombola´s communities against a pipeline that leads to the loss of 20% of their territories. In 2011, the Federal Court in Belém (PA) condemned VALE to pay monthly damages to families affected. In 2012, Vale sold the CADAM to KaMin company

name: Eucalyptus producer Portucel Group, Mozambique
“Cidade Nova Atlântida” mega-tourist-complex threatens the Tremembé indigenous people, Ceará, Brazil
headline: Tremembé indigenous resistance stops a mega-tourist-complex to be built by the Spanish firm Afirma Inmobiliario, despite being threatened and abused. They call for legal demarcation of their lands.

name: Amboseli National Park; downgrading to a game reserve, Kenya
Land resumption of Choi Yuen Village for XRL high-speed rail, Hong Kong, China
headline: The Guangzhou–Hong Kong high-speed rail (XRL) would destroy Choi Yuen Tsuen, a farming village of about 500 people. Journalists and activists joined in the protests against the resumption of land.

name: Gobindpura Thermal Power Plant, Punjab, India
AmaZone a Défendre against a solar-to-hydrogen megapower plant, French Guyana
headline: The indigenous Kali'na people defend their customary lands and practices from a solar-to-hydrogen power plant in the Amazon rainforest. They are determined to fight to the latest consequences, with legal cases, sabotage, blockades and occupation.

name: Parque Regional Urbano de Aguzzano - Casale Alba 1
headline: El Parque Regional Urbano de Aguzzano: Como recurso para el vecindario, debido a una pequeña política de futuro, se ha convertido en un lugar de conflicto.

name: Shrimp farming in Canavieiras, Brazil
Genetically Modified Salmon ('Frankenfish') for direct human consumption, Canada
headline: AquAdvantage salmon is the first genetically modified animal for human consumption and has been a highly contested issue in Canada and United States. The opponents call it 'Frankenfish' and warn about its health and environmental impacts.

name: Mines of Cerro Rico, Potosi, Bolivia
headline: After centuries of mining the bowels of Cerro Rico, the iconic mountain risks to collapse, threatening the whole city of Potosi.

name: The UN resettled 600 Roma to a mining/smelting complex exposing them to lead poisoning, Kosovo
headline: Trepça is a mining complex with lead tailings in contact with drinking water. The United Nations Administration (UNMIK) housed  600 Roma refugees there, exposing them to years of lead poisoning by air, water, and soil.

name: Yokosuka Coal Power Plant , Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
headline: Residents are protesting against installation of two Coal-Fired Power Plants in Yokosuka City claiming to emit 7.26 million tons of carbon dioxide annually.

name: Oil and coal Extraction in the Indigenous Motilon Bari Territory, Colombia
headline: The abundance of natural resources on the Motilon Bari peoples' territory and the intentions from multinationals and from the Colombian national government to exploit them makes impossible for the Bari to prevent these outsiders' ravages.

name: Massive deforestation in indigenous lands and protected areas of the Xingu Basin, Pará and Mato Grosso, Brazil
headline: The Xingu has always suffered from environmental destruction and violation of indigenous rights but from 2018, it has grown drastically and became the epicenter of an illegal massive deforestation.

name: Contaminación del río San Juan, Querétaro, México
headline: Desde hace más de una década el río San Juan ha sido foco de denuncias ciudadanas por contaminación debido a la pérdida de la biodiversidad dentro de las inmediaciones del río, así como las distintas afectaciones a más de 500 mil personas

name: Lamu Port and related infrastructure, Kenya
headline: The development of a new port and associated infrastructure at Magogoni in Manda Bay near Lamu are proposals set out in Vision 2030 to transform  Northern Kenya. They leave aside a holistic approach and apply individual EIAs to projects.

name: Geothermal plant Cerro Pabellón, Chile
Unsafe access to water for Roma communities in Bardejov, Slovak Republic
headline: Roma community only water resource is a natural well, which has been contaminated with pesticides by intensive and industrialised farm situated only 500 m from Roma settlement.

name: Overfishing and poaching at Lake Naivasha, Kenya
headline: Joan Root, famous documentarist, was murdered in 2006 for attempting to reduce overfishing and illegal fish poaching with a task force in Lake Naivasha, Kenya.

name: Chuvashka village in Kuzbass (Kemerovo oblast) covered in black snow from coal mining, Russia
headline: In the Kuzbass, coal mining razed forests, blackened rivers, contaminated the air with dust. Shor Turkic ethnic group says the region became a black moonscape. The environment and the people are vanishing.

name: Andal Airetropolis, India
Datang Duolun Coal Chemical Project, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: Since the beginning in 2006, the residents nearby suffered from and complained about land dispossession and environmental pollution issues such as wastewater discharge, air and noise pollution and coal ash dust.

name: Dai Ninh Hydropower Project, Dong Nai River, Vietnam
headline: In spite of serious concerns regarding resettlement issues, the Dai Ninh Hydropower Project moved forward. While the produced electricity benefits Vietnamese growing urban areas, social and environmental costs are largely carried by ethnic minorities.

name: Cienaga de Ayapel, Colombia
Canada Carbon's Miller graphite mine project, Canada
headline: The CPTAQ finally suspended the Miller mine in July 2021. This is a half-victory though. The company can nonetheless continue exploration work for the time being

name: Land acquisition for Chennai-Salem 8 lane expressway, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: Protest against the fast and murky conception and acceptance of the proposal for building an 8-lane expressway between Salem and Chennai.  Issues of land and livelihood rights and ecological degradation.

name: Bhagtanwala Solid Waste Management Plant in Amritsar, Punjab, India
Protest against setting up of Indian Institute of Technology campus in Goa, India
headline: Villagers in South Goa district protest to save their fertile and sacred land from being turned into a university campus, citing climate change as a reason

name: Embalse La Tranca, Valle de Cogotí, Chile
headline: "El embalse La Tranca no va!" Resistance by the community of El Durazno stops in 2018 the project by the company Typsa for the La Tranca dam in Coquimbo province

name: Solar Power Plants, Drniš, Croatia
headline: Local people and municipality representatives opposed the project of building solar power plants in the vicinity of the town of Drniš.

name: “No a la Piñería” (pineapple monocultures), Costa Rica
headline: Cultivated area of pineapples for export in Costa Rica grew in the last two decades leading to serious environmental and health damages to local communities.

name: REA Kaltim, oil palm plantations in East Kalimantan, Indonesia
headline: Ongoing land conflicts in PT REA Kaltim oil palm Plantations since its establishment in 1991.

name: Planta nuclear en Sierra Grande, Río Negro, Argentina
headline: The government secured Chinese funds in May 2017 (USD 8 billion) to build the 5th nuclear power plant in the country, in Patagonia. There is opposition in the states of Rio Negro and Chubut.

name: Nembe creek oil spill: Communities livelihoods threatened
Foz Côa dam at Guarda, Portugal
headline: “The engravings cannot swim”: local communities and protest movements stop the construction of dams that would endanger the country’s cultural heritage

name: Wind farm in Wyczechowo, Poland
headline: The inhabitants of the Kiełpino village became 'hostages' of the wind farm under construction in the neighboring commune. They realized that they could not build any new houses because they would be too close to the turbines.

name: Cultivo intensivo de caña en la Laguna de Sonso, Colombia
headline: La expansión de la industria de la caña de azúcar en el Valle del Cauca ha cambiado el paisaje del  departamento con las miles de hectáreas sembradas, pero además ha ocasionado la disminución de los cuerpos de agua, así como la extinción de flora y fauna.

name: Typhoon Bopha´s post-disaster climate injustices and relief corruption, Compostela Valley, Philippines
headline: Typhoon Bopha (aka Typhoon Pablo) was a super-storm worsened by ecological devastation from mining, logging, and agroplantations. Relief aid  was mismanaged as part of a larger corruption scheme. Protestors were threatened and  killed.

name: North Stream 2 (Severny Potok) Natural Gas Pipeline at Kurgalsky Reserve, Russia
headline: The Kurgalsky reserve is one of the most valuable natural territories in north-west Russia. But the planned route of the Nord Stream 2 (Severny Potok) Natural Gas Pipeline cuts right through the Kurgalsky reserve.

name: La fiebre del coltán amenaza a indígenas guajibo, piaroa y e’ñepa en Bolívar y Amazonas, Venezuela
headline: There is a "coltan rush" in indigenous territories, with various actors involved. After the terrible events related to  coltan extraction in Africa, a dramatic conflict might also arise in Venezuela.

name: Thalifushi landfill: a toxic bomb in the ocean, Maldives
headline: What originally looked like typical Maldives paradisiac lagoon has now became a 'Toxic bomb in the ocean'; since in 1991 autorities have decided to extablish in Thilafushi a landfill to solve the Male's garbage predicament.

name: Kedung Ombo dam, Indonesia
Residents of Nachodka protest against the increasing coal dust, Nachodka, Russia
headline: Residents of Nachodka protest against coal transshipping with a number of official complaints and public protests reaching up to 3000 people as on February 7th 2017.

name: Tuzluca Dam, Turkey
headline: Aras River Bird Sanctuary, which hosts the highest number of bird species in eastern Turkey, is under threat of destruction and will not exist in maps anymore. If the planned Tuzluca Dam is constructed in Aras Valley, the area with 49 bird species

name: Krsko Nuclear Power Plant, Slovenia
Eurovegas Macro-Casino Complex in Alcorcón (Madrid), Spain
La Puya, proyecto minero el Tambor, Guatemala
headline: The pacific resistence of "La Puya": Thousands of mestizo and  Maya-Kaqchikel women from San José del Golfo and San Pedro Ayampuc communities have been resisting from 2012 against a gold mining project. They are the inspiration to other resistances

name: Members of peasant organizations  murdered in 2017, Calatagan, Batangas, Philippines
headline: Two farmer leaders killed in 2017, Lito Casalla and Engracio de los Reyes, were at the forefront of the long opposition to Ramon Ang‘s landgrabbing for limestone for cement by his company Asturias Chemical Industry.

name: Hung Phu Residential Area, Cái Răng, Vietnam
headline: Evictions and unfair compensations provoked a farmer to attempt to commit suicide, while his wife and daughter stripped naked to protest: the actual cost of urban modernization

name: Electrolyte factories for EV market, Godzikowice, Silesia, Poland
headline: The local community came together in the face of the health and environmental risks associated with China's investment-led development of liquid Li-ion battery electrolytes factories for EV market. They won!

name: “Protect Kok-Zhailau”, Ile-Alatau State National nature park, Kazakhstan
headline: An exclusive ski resort with infrastructure, hotels, restaurants, supermarkets, entertainment centers and playgrounds in the middle of a natural park becomes a threat for environment and local people

name: La Granja ,  Chota, Rio Tinto, Peru
headline: La Granja is potentially a very large copper mine in Cajamarca owned by Rio Tinto. There has been some local resistance, and the investment is in standby in 2016 partly because of low copper prices.

name: Oil and gas exploration at Woodburn Forest, Ireland
headline: In May 2016, after considerable opposition, the company InfraStrata  started drilling at Woodburn Forest site in County Antrim, Northern Ireland. Stop the Drill campaigners are seeking to stop it.

name: Toxic Waste Landfill in Kettleman City, Calif.  A case of environmental racism. USA
headline: In 1979, without informing Kettleman City's residents, a toxic dump owned by Chemical Waste Management - the world's largest waste disposal company - was established 3.5 miles from the town.

name: Minería de Tierras Raras en Penco, Región del Biobío, Chile
headline: Desde 2015, en los cerros de la ciudad de Penco comenzó a gestarse un proyecto minero de Tierras Raras que podría afectar a su población y a los ecosistemas en torno al Gran Concepción.

name: Gitwilgyoots and Lelu Island (Lax U'u'la) vs proposed Petronas LNG export facility, Canada
headline:
Gitwilgyoots (Lax Kwalaams Tsimshian First Nation) vs Petronas (Malaysian fossil fuel company)_x000D_
occupation of traditional territories to block major $30 billion LNG export facility in critical salmon habitat of the Skeena River.

name: Stung Cheay Areng hydroelectric dam in Koh Kong, Cambodia
headline: Indigenous land for dubious dams? Activists, monks and villagers from Areng Valley fight against the construction of the Stung Cheay Areng hydroelectric dam.

name: Tia Maria, Peru
Cienaga Grande de Santa Marta, Colombia
Yelcho Watershed targeted by Ministry of Energy’s hydro plans, Chile
headline: This Study is threatening at least seven major watersheds with hydro development. If it is allowed to become national Energy policy, it will generate significant conflict in these "sacrifice watersheds"

name: Aswan High Dam, Egypt
headline: Fifty years after the course of the Nile River was diverted for the construction of the Aswan High Dam, the people of Nuba in southern Egypt are still demanding the right to return and resettle on the banks of Lake Nasser.

name: Thacker Pass lithium mine, Nevada, USA
headline: Proposed lithium mine threatens environment, health and cultural values of local  people Atsa koodakuh wyh Nuwu that are still occupying the site in order to protect both environment and culture.

name: Significant Maritime and Industrial Area in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, USA
headline: Sandy warns: cumulative impacts from industries and polluting activities can become extremly serious. Environmental justice organizations, community-based groups, labor unions unite for reclaiming reparation

name: Women’s war against Chevron in Escravos, Niger Delta, Nigeria
headline: Women activists in the Niger Delta banded together for a wave of naked protests against Chevron for destroying the environment and livelihoods of many local villagers. This movement gained international attention and inspired other naked protests.

name: Loncopué rechaza el Proyecto Lonco, Neuquén, Argentina.
Water Rights and Access in Detroit's Urban Areas, USA
headline: Citizens in Detroit are suffering from water shut offs due to unpaid bills, a practice that hits disproportionally African-American families in poorer neighbourhoods and violates the human right to water and sanitation.

name: Nuclear Power Station in Cofrents, Valencia, Spain
West Bank Cement Factory, Palestine
headline: Sanad Construction Industries is looking to build a cement factory in the Bethlehem Governorate, at the proximity of the traditionally agricultural village of Arab el-Rashaida. The villagers opposed the project, citing possible environmental burdens.

name: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited refinery at Tavsal, Maharastra, India
Kaliwa Dam – New Centennial Water Source Project (NCWS), Quezon, Philippines
headline: While urban Metro Manila demands more and more water, social and environmental costs are shifted to indigenous rural communities, who in turn demand to restore the true source of clean water: healthy forests and watersheds.

name: Minamata disease, Japan
headline: Minamata disease is caused by methylmercury poisoning.  The name comes from Minamata Bay in Kumamoto prefecture where the Chisso factory released industrial waste. During 1932-1968  local residents, especially fisher families, suffered the consequences.

name: Myotha Industrial Park Development in Mandalay, Myanmar
headline: More than 1,000 families have lost their land to the Myotha Industrial Park. The way the project has developed has spurred large concerns over human rights violations.

name: KXP AirportCity / Kulim Airport, Malaysia
headline: In February 2020 about 300 residents of Pantai Cicar village protested against land acquisition for KXP AirportCity - a new Kulim Airport and a logistics, aerospace and manufacturing hub. Livelihoods from oil palm and rubber tapping would be affected.

name: Cultivo de espárragos en Ica, Perú
headline: Un efecto del tratado de libre comercio entre Peru y EEUU es tambien la emergencia hídrica debido al cultivo de espárragos para exportación, mientras la población tiene agua por una hora la semana

name: Waste disposal and dioxin pollution in Qingpuling Village, Fujian, China
headline: Pollution victims in Fujian Province scored a rare victory over the polluting company after a long-running legal battle. However, not everybody agree on the compensation amount and many migrated out of the village

name: Lithium exploration in San Luis, Argentina
headline: Lithium exploration in San Luis province. Neighbors organization rejects the mining project, and demands from authorities the preservation of protected natural area and water sources.

name: Complex tourism investment in Moni Toplou (Kavo Sidero), Greece
headline: Promotion of investments and privatization of common goods in a NATURA 2000 site as a recipes to counter financial crise; read about touristic projects in Crete

name: Gorai-Manori-Uttan Recreation and Tourism Development Zone (RTDZ) in Mumbai, MH, India
Stringfellow Acid Pits, USA
headline: Labelled as the largest civil lawsuit in the nation’s history, pitting neighbours of the toxic site sued the companies that dumped there and the government agencies that allowed it

name: Jaitapur Nuclear Power Plant, Maharashtra, India
Sterlite copper smelter unit, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: After 20 years of complaints, thousands gathered  in Thoothukudi district in March, 2018 asking for  the smelter to be shut down. Police killed 13 demonstrators in May 2018. The project is currently suspended.

name: Ojibwe Nations Struggle to Protect Wild Rice from Oil Extraction Activities in the US and Canada
headline: Mines, pipelines, and mega waterway projects threaten Indigenous identity of wild rice cultivation. Ojibwe nations struggle to protect their cultural heritage for 150 years.

name: The People versus Arctic Oil litigation, Norway
headline: Norwegian youth and environmentalists sue the Norwegian government for granting licenses to drill for fossil fuels in the Arctic. They demand climate justice and their right to a healthy environment .

name: Niddodi Thermal Power Project, Karnataka, India
Fisherwomen's (perempuan nelayan) struggle for their recognition and rights, Indonesia
headline: Fisherwomen in Indonesia mobilise and establish networks like PPNI, collaborate with other fisheries justice networks and movements like KIARA and WFFP and demand recognition of their work, and their social, political and economic rights.

name: Coal Mining conflict in Hazaribagh with NTPC in Jharkhand, India
headline: Violence by police in October 2016 against protests by villagers of Badkagaon, Hazaribagh district in Jharkhand against the Pakri-Barwadih coal mining project by NTPC, a conflict that started with large scale land dispossesion back in 2004 .

name: Proyecto inmobiliario Bosque Diamante en Jilotzingo, México
headline: Los habitantes del municipio de Jilotzingo se oponen a al megaproyecto inmobiliario Bosque Diamante que consideran como un ecocidio para el Bosque de Agua, una zona gran valor ambiental y cultural.

name: Polska BNK Petroleum Fracking, Poland
Over a century of pollution from the Bor mines, Serbia
headline: Bor is one of the biggest copper mine in Europe and has been known as one of the environmental hotspots in Serbia for over a century.

name: Aurá dump and the struggle of Belém's informal wastepickers, Pará, Brazil
headline: The Lixão do Aurá has been one of Brazil’s most problematic open-air dumps, causing in particular air and water pollution.  It remains frequented by catadores who - amid Belém's ongoing waste crisis - continue struggling for their rights and dignity.

name: GMO Maize, Mexico
headline: Court has banned GMO maize in Mexico but remains to be seen whether the ruling will withstand the incursion of the biotech companies to defend the 20,000 local varieties of Maize.

name: Controversy on copper and molybdenum smelting in Shifang, Sichuan, China
headline: Hundreds of demonstrators including many students demonstrated in July 2012 in front of local government institutions against plans to build a molybdenum and copper smelter in Shifang city (Sichuan province). The project was stopped.

name: Land and human rights abuses in the jade industry, Myanmar
headline: Myanmar produces around 70 percent of the world’s jadeite, an industry causing environmental impacts under dire working conditions. Repeated landslides kill many people.  The industry seems to fuel the ethnic conflict in the region.

name: Biofuels plantation farming in Dakatcha, Kenya
Santa Clara de Uchunya against palm oil plantation, Peru
headline: In the territory of the Shipibo people of the Peruvian Amazon, the indigenous community of Santa Clara de Uchunya face the devastation of their ancestral forests and rivers. This is due to  expansion of a palm oil plantation belonging to the Melka Group.

name: Phondo mine in Lhundrub County and local protests, Tibet, China
headline: In April 2011 residents took to the streets in protest against the mining operation. Many people were beaten by the security forces and six Tibetans were  arrested.  On August 2014,  they have been confirmed to be in Drapchi prison, Lhasa.

name: Incinerator of urban solid waste in Barueri, São Paulo, Brazil
headline: Despite longstanding opposition from wastepicker movements and civil society, Brazil's first "waste-to-energy" plant is about to be installed in the municipality of Barueri (SP), jeopardizing recycling work in the name of sustainable development.

name: Opposition to PX plant in Zhangzhou and explosion accidents, Fujian, China
headline: Accidents in PX plants are frequent. In 2013 and then again in 2015 the plant in Zhangzhou caused emergency evacuations. There are many unreported protests by local inhabitants during planning, construction and operation periods.

name: Quilombola communities affected by wind power projects in Caetité region, Brazil
headline: Black communities of Caetité trying to certify their traditional lands to stop displacement and loss of livelihood triggered by large-scale wind farms.

name: Displacement of Gullah Islanders, USA
Coastal Communities in Louisiana, USA
headline: Global climate change is greatly impacting coastal communities in Louisiana. National Commission on Environmental Justice on the Gulf Coast was formed to address the impact of on minority and low-income communities

name: Zameen Samadhi Satyagraha against land acquisition in Neendar village, Jaipur, Rajasthan, India
headline: Villagers protest neck deep buried in mock burials to oppose forced acquisition of their land by the Jaipur Development Authority to build new housing.

name: Jiew Kang Jue Pattana oil palm company, Thailand
headline: Systematic pattern of targeting human rights defenders for their work in fighting against palm oil companies in Surat Thani province.

name: Dambulla Quartz Mining Case, Sri Lanka
headline: The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka stopped illegal quarry mining in Girithale-Minneriya National Reserve close to the Sigiriya archaeological area. Mining license were released thanks to the collusion of local authorities

name: Nanjing residents fight against removing signature plane trees for metro lines, Jiangsu, China
headline: Nostalgic residents in Nanjing are attempting to save the city's signature plane trees as online outcry slams local authorities for sacrificing the greenery to urban construction.

name: Ban on Cycling in Kolkata, West Bengal, India
Protest of unpaid coal workers at Longmay Group in Heilongjiang, China
headline: Over a thousand coal miners in Shuangyashan, Heilongjiang, China staged a protest in March 2016 in response to a provincial governor's mistaken claim about their labor situation in the coal sector and requested payment of delayed salary.

name: Costa Brava Landfill, Lebanon
headline: The Costa Brava Landfill is promoted as a temporary solution to the trash crisis that Lebanon suffered of in 2015. However, local residents and activists are against this landfill because it has many impacts on the environment and the aviation safety.

name: Desarrollo turístico Bahías de Huatulco y despojo de tierras comunales en Oaxaca, México
headline: El desarrollo turístico de gran escala impulsado por el gobierno con financiamiento del BID ha desplazado a las poblaciones locales y sus formas de vida.

name: Cuajone-Toquepala, Ilo, Peru
Land seizure and resistance by fish farmer Doan Van Vuon, Hai Phong, Vietnam
headline: Fish farmer Doan Van Vuon became a folk hero after defending his land with homemade weapons against seizure by local authorities.

name: Chamalapura Thermal Power Plant, Mysore district, Karnataka, India
headline: Karnataka government proposed a 1000 MW coal fired thermal power plant at Chamalapura, H.D.Kote taluk, Mysore district in early 2007. Local opposition stopped this project.

name: Golden Agri Resources/Golden Veroleum Palm Oil Plantations, Sinoe, Liberia
headline: Expansion of large Palm Oil Plantations in south-eastern  Liberian rainforest at the expense of livelihood, sacred sites of local communities, without their previous consent.

name: Manglares de Tumbes y langostineras, Peru
headline: A large mangrove forest in Peru, a unique ecosystem in this country. Must be protected for ecological values and for its role in local people's livelihood.

name: Xakriaba territorial struggle, Brazil
Pungesti's resistance to Chevron Gas Fracking, Romania
headline: Energy company Chevron has been forced to suspend its plans to drill an exploration well for shale gas in the village of Pungesti,  in eastern Romania, after the local community protested and blocked the company from entering the area for two months .

name: 'Let Banni Be' struggle to save the pastoralist livelihood and Banni grasslands, Gujarat, India
headline: The Maldharis (pastoralists) of Banni are fighting to preserve their historical rights over the Banni grassland commons, their traditional livelihoods and their indigenous cattle.

name: PCB contamination from GM and impacts to the Mohawk tribe at Turtle Cove, USA
Tozzi Green Ihorombe Agrofuels, Madagascar
Kuna Yala´s climate change refugees, Panama
headline: “Si  nosotros no somos los que alteramos el medio ambiente, por qué lo tenemos que pagar” Ariel González, secretario del Congreso Kuna.

name: The city of Pančevo-Serbia's black spot, Serbia
headline: Pančevo is known as center of Serbian chemical industry but also an environmental hotspot because of high concentration of air pollutants that makes life unbearable to its citizens.

name: Mina San Cristobal en Potosi y reubicación de la comunidad, Bolivia
headline: La explotación de la mina implicó la relocalización de la comunidad de San Cristóbal, existente desde tiempos coloniales, originando graves conflictos sociales

name: Pollution from the Topilnica smelter, Veles, Macedonia
headline: A 30-years-old closed zinc and lead smelting factory -one of the environmental hotspots in Macedonia- will finally stop polluting Veles.

name: Shell Spill in Otuasega Community, Nigeria
Drying up of Tuz Lake Closed Water Basin, Turkey
Vernamfield Aerotropolis, Jamaica
headline: Communities fear forcible land expropriation for development of Vernamfield Aerotropolis, a major air cargo project on 1,619 hectares of land that is part of a broader logistics hub initiative and linked with expansion of aluminium manufacturing

name: Hydro Alunorte alumina refinery in Barcarena, Pará, Brazil.
headline: Norsk Hydro’s Alunorte refinery in Barcarena accused by local authorities of contaminating the waters of communities with toxic waste overflowing from a holding basin.

name: Sierra Leone Agriculture (SIVA Group) biopalm project in Port Loko, Sierra Leone
Pesticide's contamination by cotton production in Tericatinga territory, Mato Grosso, Brazil
headline: The Tericatinga territory is heavily affected by the cotton industry: 88% of the living species show residues of pesticides, some of which are banned in Brazil.

name: Building and dismantling Ignalina nuclear power plant, Lithuania
headline: A referendum in 2012 ended plans for a new nuclear power plant after two large reactors at Ignalina (similar to  Chernobyl's) had been stopped in 2004 and 2009. There are now difficult issues regarding nuclear waste.

name: Fruta del Norte, Ecuador
Illegal gold mining in La Pampa and Tambopata National Reserve, Peru
headline: La Pampa has become one of Peru's most important gold rush areas, causing massive deforestation and environmental pollution but also an increase in organized crime and escalating violence particularly against women and environmental activists.

name: Beirut incinerators expansion plans and wastepickers struggle, Lebanon
headline: Since the Waste Crisis of July 2015, the Lebanese government has mainly focused on the establishment of incinerators. While the voices of environmental activists and the informal recycling sector, consisting of children and refugees, remain unheard.

name: Disputa por espacio marítimo entre industria petrolera y pesca, Sonda de Campeche, Mexico
headline: The Sonda de Campeche is an area of great ecological and economic values. However, it is also an area of oil extraction and spills by PEMEX, damaging the fishery.

name: Ivanpah Solar Electric Generating System (377 MW, CSP) - California, USA
headline: Environmental groups voiced concerns over wildlife and plants. This led to a temporary halt of the large Ivanpah Solar power project, the reduction of its size, and the development and installation of wildlife deterrents.

name: Community decries shoddy cleanup of oil pollution by PPMC Contractors, Nigeria
Geotérmico scansano
headline: En 2010, el Gobierno liberalizó el desarrollo de la actividad geotémica, a pesar de la resistencia de los comités locales interesados ​​sobre el riesgo de desfiguración de paisajes, contaminación por agua y agua y reversión de la economía local.

name: Castor Project Gas off-shore storage in Vinaròs, Spain
Shahuindo project in Cajabamba, Cajamarca, Peru
headline: Gold and silver mine destroy water sources and undermine livelihoods and natural environment in the territory.  Ronderos campesinos are kept in jail.

name: Nigeria-Morocco Offshore and Onshore Gas Pipeline
headline: Morocco and Nigeria sign partnership agreement in 2016 for a gas pipeline amid rejection by national, regional, and international NGOs and EJOs due to the environmental and socio-economic impacts of the project.

name: Sable Chemicals, Zimbabwe
Villagers resist displacement for Purandar Airport, Pune, India
headline: Landowners from seven villages have sustained resistance to loss of their homes and farmland for an airport in Purandar since the location of the project was announced. They have held many mass protests and refuse to cooperate with land acquisition.

name: Land-grabbing of communities' forest lands by Wilmar International in Cross River State, Nigeria
headline: Wilmar's concessions of Biase, Ibiae, Calaro and Obasanjo in Cross River State trigger deforestation, land grabs and threat the locals' livelihoods and culture.

name: Ojnare Forest Lime Stone Mine, Gotland, Sweden
Mirador, Cordillera del Condor, Ecuador
Exploracion Hidrocarburos en San Andres Islas, Colombia
Yamal Mega natural gas project, Arctic Russia
headline: Russia’s biggest gas field covers two-thirds of the peninsula which the Nenets people need for nomadic reindeer-herding. For protesting, Nenets activists are accused of preventing economic development.

name: DH Paper Mills’ Wastewater in East Ujimqin(Dongwu) Banner, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: Papermill wastewater impacts on marginalized nomad groups:  making a living with polluted water and earning justice through lawsuits.

name: Dicontent over land acquisition in Deocha-Pachhami Dewangani Harinsingha in West Bengal, largest coal block in India
headline: Largest coal block in India about to be operational in West Bengal. Discontent is brewing over inadequate compensation to tribal people.

name: Underregulated hazardous waste facility by Western Environmental in California, USA
Privatization of water in Tucuman province, Argentina
headline: Population's resistance led to the privatization reversal of water in Tucuman province. However, Vivendi brought the case to ICSID and Argentina was ordered to pay compensation to the company for loss of profit

name: Quang Ninh coal mines, flooding in 2015, Vietnam
headline: Heavy rainfall in northern Vietnam in 2015 killed at least 17 people, flooding major coal mines, causing tailings dam failure and pollution in inhabited areas, and risking damage to World Heritage-listed Ha Long Bay.

name: Plantation de Haut Penja, Cameroon
headline: Human and environmental rights violations in Njombe Penja by the company Plantation du Haut Penja.  Banana exports at the cost of corruption, workers' exploitation and pollution. Good documentary film is banned.

name: Quarry Nalježići, Montenegro
headline: The Quarry Nalježići was reopened in 2013 despite the opposition by the local people due to the negative effect stone exploitation had on the environment and human health, as well as cultural and historical monuments in the area.

name: Mi'kmaq Fisheries Dispute, Nova Scotia, Canada
headline: Mi'kmaq fishers face violence and vandalism as they strive to establish a lobster fishery that will support their livelihoods

name: Samokov Landfill Site
Illegal logging threatens isolated Pirititi indigenous group, Roraima, Brazil
headline: Loggers have increasingly invaded areas of isolated tribes in the south of Roraima and traded timber with fake documents. Such practices remain unpunished and could be further encouraged by Bolsonaro’s recent weakening of environmental law enforcement

name: Diwalwal Mineral Reservation on indigenous land in Monkayo, Compostela Valley, Philippines
headline: In 2004, indigenous groups successfully reclaimed their land from outside mining interests by forming their own mining corporation and securing ownership rights. Violence continues as local leaders are murdered to cause tension among the tribes.

name: L'Amassada Struggle (ZAD), Aveyron,  France
headline: Pas res nos arresta, rien ne nous arrètera ! Resistance by local farmers against a  transformer (for electricity from wind energy) was subject to harassment, arrests, police surveillance and eviction in October 2019.

name: Hidroeléctrica Changuinola I (CHAN-75), Bocas del Toro, Panamá
Fracking exploration in Matatiele, South Africa
headline: Since 2016 the rural communities of Matatiele have come together around a singular cause - keep fracking out of our region!

name: Mobilisation against Alexandrov landfill,  the height of a 10 storey building, Russia
headline: Landfill in Alexandrov the height of a 10 storey has illegally been accepting and storing solid municipal waste from Moscow.

name: Citinickel's Toronto Narra mine in Palawan, Philippines
headline: Tailing spills, environmental degradation and livelihood loss: Indigenous groups want to stop Citinickel mines in Palawan.

name: The failed fast breeder reactor, Monju, Japan
headline: In Sept. 2016 the government finally decided to cut its losses on the  plutonium fueled  fast-breeder reactor in Monju, Fukui Prefecture, pulling the plug on the project after years of mishaps, cover-ups and waste. Decommisioning becomes a new business.

name: Ekiti cargo Airport, Nigeria
headline: The state government of Ekiti sent in bulldozers to clear farmland for a cargo airport. Affected farmers secured a court victory which stalled the project. Imminent land clearance triggered protest by farmers appealing for time to harvest their produce.

name: Mining in Bakun and Royalco's withdrawal, Philippines
headline: While Royalco provoked community division to achieve a manipulated free prior informed consent to their mining explorations, villagers successfully united to resist, until the company withdrew the project.

name: Textile factories in Indonesia pollute water in Cikijing River, tributary of Citarum River, Indonesia
headline: Textile Manufacturies in Indonesia Pollute The Citarum River at the Expense of Fashion

name: Crude Fire Ravages Ubeji, Nigeria
Conflict involving miners of Juma river, Novo Aripuana/AM, Brazil
Untreated sewage discharge from the Jinlong Industrial Park of Hengshan County, Hunan, China
headline: Villagers nearby an industrial park in Hengshan of Hunan petitioned many times about the discharge of untreated or improperly treated wastewater.

name: The “Sea Gypsies” of Myeik archipelago threatened by Pearl cultivation, Myanmar
headline: Despite their timid behaviour, Salung people protest against Myanmar Tasaki Pearl Company's efforts to expand its operations on the islands of their last habitat in the Myeik archipelago.

name: Exploratory fracking in Balcombe, UK
Mamanwa Communities of Dinarawan and Bunga Asserting Ancestral Land Rights over MRL Agata Mining expansion, Philippines
headline: Mining sites encroach ancestral lands: The Mamanwa Communities of Dinarawan and Bunga assert their ancestral land rights over the further expansion of MRL mining activities

name: Land grabbing for human settlements in Wilpattu National Park, Sri Lanka
headline: Wilpattu National Park is under threat of land grabbing. Since 2012, environmentalists denounce the systematic deforestation for the construction of resettling sites for Muslims displaced during the civil war.

name: Complejo Industrial Petrolero José A. Anzoátegui, Venezuela
headline: A major oil industrial complex has generated  social and environmental impacts. Petroleum coke ("petcoke") is a major threat. Labour unions and environmentalists mobilize against pollution.

name: Allain Duhangan Hydropower project, India
headline: A first class candidate to CDM credits for India, the hydro scheme developed with Norwegian funds, WB and IFC causes opposition for disrupting local economies and water sources. But with little displacement, thus no compensation measures at sight.

name: Forceful takeover of forest land cultivated by tribespeople in Khammam, India
headline: In the garb of an afforestation scheme, Telangana forest department violates land rights of tribes people

name: Copper Smelting Project of Zijin Mining Group in Qiqihar, Heilongjiang, China
headline: Thousands of people took to the streets of Qiqihar in September 2016 to protest against a planned copper smelting plant near their homes.

name: DTZ OZGEO Gold Penhalonga, Zimbabwe
Ruchi Agri Soybean operation in Gambela, Ethiopia
Chevron port project in Tambon Klai, Thailand
headline: After five years of trying to bring the project about against the opposition from local residents, Chevron had to withdraw; the Tha Sa La community was named as the winner of the National Health Commission (NHC) award for 2013.

name: Destrucción ecosistema bioestratégico El Lipa, Arauca, Colombia
Eucalyptus Monoculture in Eunapolis, Bahia, Brazil
Agroindustry in Mato Grosso displaces the Guaraní-Kaiowá from their ancestral lands, Brazil
headline: Agroindusty in Mato Grosso has driven the Guaraní-Kaiowá from their ancestral lands. Armed attacks and evictions at gunpoint from lands regained by them, cause deaths and despair.

name: Conflicto forestal en la Reserva del Patrimonio Natural y Cultural del Copaibo de Concepción, Bolivia
headline: La reserva del patrimonio natural y cultural del copaibo de Concepción, bajo amenaza de deforestación y de avasallamiento.

name: Gowanus Canal Cleanup, New York state, USA
headline: The Gowanus Canal, one of the U.S.' most polluted waterways, is be cleaned-up after a century's worth of industrial contaminants and combined sewage overflows. Dredging, remediation, and neighborhood revitalization projects are underway.

name: Socfin Agricultural Company Sierra Leone Ltd Oil Palm Plantation in Malen Chiefdom, Pujeun District, Sierra Leone
Military Waste Destruction, Nikšić, Montenegro
headline: The local people and environment of the Montenegrin Mountain Golija experienced many negative effects of destruction of ammunition surplus conducted under the Montenegro Demilitarization (MONDEM) program.

name: Lake Bogoria Game Reserve evicts Endorois communities, Kenya
headline: African Commission on Human and Peoples’ Rights’ landmark decision declares illegal the eviction of indigenous Endorois communities for the establishment of a national park

name: Bajo la Alumbrera mine, Catamarca, Argentina
headline: First metalliferous mining project in Argentina. La Alumbrera was denounced for contamination by federal justice . After La Alumbrera started  operations, other mining projects were rejected in Catamarca.

name: Tanintharyi Nature Reserve conservation area funded by gas pipeline developers, Myanmar
headline: The conservation area claims to compensate for the impacts of three gas pipelines, excluding however   indigenous practices and failing to respect rights of  people to return to their homelands.

name: Lagos Explosion kills over 200
Karawang Airport  and Cilamaya Seaport on north coast of Java, Indonesia
