headline: Hundreds of farmers and fisherfolk (members of the Farmers Union of Karawang) contributed to stop the Karawang airport and Cimalaya seaport projects on the north coast of Java

name: Ankulapaturu thermal power plant, AP, India
Plantar CDM tree plantation project, Brazil
Hidroeléctrica Chicoasén II, Chiapas, México
headline: En el municipio de Chicoasén (Chiapas) la población local se opone a la construcción de la hidroeléctrica Chicoasén II después de haber sufridos los engaños e impactos de la hidroeléctrica Chicoasén I.

name: Uranium Mining and Nuclear Power Plant in Qusair Amra, Jordan
headline: In 2013, Jordan and Russia agreed on building a $10 billion nuclear power plant, leading to protests from activists, tribes, MPs and scientists in the country. Promises of high foreign investments drive forward Jordan's uranium mining and nuclear plans.

name: KDC International land grab conflict, Kampong Tralach district, Cambodia
headline: Cambodian farmers turn to prayers and curses to combat land grabbing by KDC International. Their resistance goes on for almost twenty years.

name: IFFCO Kisan SEZ in Nellore, AP, India
Mozambique Water Pollution from a dumpsite, Zimbabwe
International Airport in Kertajati or Bandara Internasional Jawa Barat (BIJB), Java, Indonesia
headline:
Residents of ten villages have been forcibly_x000D_
evicted from their homes for Kertajati Airport ( knowing as a Bandara Internasional Jawa Barat -BIJB-)near the northern coast of West Java, Indonesia.

name: Minería de oro en Segovia en Antioquia, Colombia
La Compañía Rio Tinto y la matanza de 1888, Andalucía, España
headline: La empresa Rio Tinto se formó en 1873. En febrero de 1888 una gran manifestación contra los gases sulfurosos producidos por la combustión de piritas de cobre derivó en una masacre llevada a cabo por el Ejército.

name: Proyecto eólico del Cerro de Hula, Honduras
headline: This is a large windmill park owned by foreign companies in indigenous Lenca territory which contains archeological remains.

name: Nitrates pollution in Osona, Catalonia
headline: The Grup de Defensa del Ter campaigns against the pork industry in this and other areas of Catalonia because it causes enormous concentration of nitrates in groundwater.

name: The avocado agribusiness and the water crisis in Petorca, Valparaiso Chile
headline: Petorca (Chile) has been covered with thousands of avocado trees which have aggravated a water crisis in the region causing negative impacts to the environment and to the lives of the inhabitants.

name: GMOs in Aragon, Spain
Illegal gold mining in indigenous Yanomami territory, Brazil
headline: Illegal gold miners threat Yanomami peoples' livelihood. The Federal State appetite for the Amazon resources  also places a constant burden on them.

name: Represa Benito Juárez, Oaxaca, Mexico
headline: A historical conflict in Mexico, going back to the 1960s. Another example of irreversible changes and damage caused by a dam.

name: Regional Landfill Lećevica, Croatia
headline: The plan of building a regional waste management center in Lećevica received a strong critique by eco-organisation, experts, and local politicians, as well as it had to be adjusted to the EU waste regulations.

name: Oil spills in Komi Republic, Russia
headline: One of the biggest fines ordered in Russia's history against an oil company but oil spills in the region are still widespread.  Investigation finds Russian oil spills six times the size of Deepwater Horizon.

name: Bangabandhu Airport, Arial Beel wetlands, Bangladesh
headline: In 2011 a proposal for a major airport in the Arial Beel wetlands was cancelled following protests by farmers and fisherfolk . Potential alternative sites would displace people and a recent proposal to locate the project in Char Janajat triggered protest.

name: Tigyit coal mine and power plant, Shan State, Myanmar
headline: Burma’s first coal power plant and mine were closed in 2014 following successful mobilizations by residents. The reopening of the power station has renewed the protests against the dirty energy provider.

name: Ocupa Mauá, São Paulo, Brazil
headline: Standing up against eviction. The successful story of the squat Ocupa Mauá in São Paulo between 2007 and 2017, against evictions, Brazil.

name: Outokumpu Mine, Finland
headline: The old Outokumpu copper mine is considered to be the root of the modern mining industry in Finland. Not only did it start a mining boom in the country, but it also created a bad reputation for this activity due to its high environmental damage.

name: Agro EcoEnergy land deal, Tanzania
headline: Resistance by local villagers who were to be evicted and concern for wildlife stopped the Swedish Agro EcoEnergy project for sugar and ethanol production in Tanzania.

name: Hidroituango hydroelectric dam, Colombia
headline: The largest dam in Colombia and the third in Latin America is being constructed in a highly conflictive territory. Extractivism is proposed as a way out of the armed conflict. Communities and opponents claim this is development-induced displacement.

name: Minería en Peñasquito por Goldcorp, Zacatecas, México
headline: Mineworkers and ejidatarios jointly complain against a very large gold mine,  Mexico's largest gold producer. It is alleged that land was acquired fraudulently.

name: Anangu Aboriginals stopped tourism expansion and the climb to the top of Uluru rock, Australia
headline: "Stepping on Urulu is considered as an offensive act". By arguing  their traditional relationship with  the Uluru rock for many years, the Anangu people officially ban massive tourist climbing on 26 of Oct, 2019.

name: Loei gold mine, Thailand
headline: Loei villagers fight to stop the operation of Tungkum Ltd. gold mine; they built walls to block the road and denounced the contamination of water and land with cyanide, arsenic, and mercury

name: Wastewater treatment collector in Botun, Montenegro
headline: The citizens of Botun have been opposing construction of a collector for wastewater from the Montenegrin capital Podgorica.

name: Contaminación masiva de la Cuenca del Lago Villarrica, Araucanía, Chile
headline: La contaminación en la Cuenca del Lago Villarrica está destruyendo un sistema único y muy valioso, que sostiene un sistema socio ecológico frágil, que depende de su estabilidad.

name: Dirty fishmeal production in Nouadhibou, Mauritania
headline: Stated by the Minister of Fishing as 'the price for development,' the city of Nouadhibou is experiencing grave health consequences from its fishmeal production.

name: Mapithel Dam, Manipur, India
Vung Ang 2 Thermal Power Plant, Ha Tinh province, Vietnam
headline: Although some investors withdraw from this large Japanese and Korean supported CFPP in Vietnam, the project seems to be going ahead.

name: White Quebrada White and Quebrada Phase 2 in Tarapaca, Chile
headline: Promoting green mining and copper as a strategic metal in the energy transition, TECK wants to expand the exploitation in the pit of the mine. Lack of consultations, water grabbing, pollution and diseases is what it leaves in the territory

name: Roma settlement next to the US Steel factory and with a segregation wall build by the local government, Slovakia
headline: Roma settlement of Vel'ka Ida in Slovakia is contaminated by the biggest steel producer in the region --- U.S. steel Košice and segregated by a physical discriminatory wall built by the local government.

name: Platinum mining in Eastern Shan State, Myanmar
headline: The Lahu Women Organization denounced the ‘grab for white gold’ in Eastern Shan State and called upon the government to stop the socially and environmentally destructive mining.

name: Taïba Phosphates Mine in the fertile gardening area of Niayes, Senegal
headline: Almost eighty years of phosphates' extraction in the rural community of Darou Khoudoss by ICS, pollutes de air, reduces water ressources and entails continuous land-grabbing and displacements.

name: Contamination of the River Palo and Agroindustry in Puerto Tejada, Colombia
headline: Liquid waste discharged from the Propal S.A company and the Cabaña mill and other polluting activities caused serious pollution of one of the most important water sources of the Cauca department

name: Ecuadors prior consult in the oil blocks 20 and 29, Ecuador
Gas grabs, Algeria
headline: By pushing for long-term exports of gas in a context where the Algerian public is excluded from decision-making and benefits are largely reserved for the regime’s elite, the EU is pursuing a gas grab.

name: Moratorium on Oil Exploration Harken Energy, Costa Rica
headline: After more than a decade of legal struggles coupled with the mobilization of the local population and the civil society, the sentence from late 2014 left Harken Energy with no compensation for the annulment of its oil concessions along Costa Rica coasts.

name: Human rigths and environmental defenders killed in 2017, Compostela Valley, Philippines
headline: Ramon Dagaas Pesadilla and Leonila Tapdasan Pesadilla were murdered  in March 2017. They  had  donated land to  a Lumad (indigenous) school. Active members of Compostela Valley Farmers' Association,  opposing mining projects.

name: Dow Chemicals R&D unit, Pune, India
E40 waterway and Save Polesia campaign, Poland
headline: An environmental catastrophe looms over Polesia, Europe’s largest wilderness. Governments want to create a 2,000 km long navigable waterway connecting the Black Sea and the Baltic, which will cut through the heart of the region

name: Planned open pit mine in Zloczew, Poland
headline: With the now-closed Belchatow mine, coal from the planned Zloczew open-pit mine will be fueling the Belchatow thermal power plant in the coal-hungry energy politics of the country

name: Karchham-Wangtoo hydel project, HP, India
headline: The biggest hydropower project in the private sector stuck in financial troubles since its start ignites stiff opposition from local tribal communities.

name: Pikitup’s Separation at Source Program and Waste Pickers' protests in Johannesburg, South Africa
headline: Since July 2017, waste pickers in Johannesburg protested against the separation at source program, which threatens their livelihoods by prioritizing the transfer of recyclable waste from households to private companies.

name: Cut flowers industry in Pedro Moncayo, Ecuador
Ecocidio del río Tula por el Túnel Emisor Oriente (TEO), México
headline: El TEO es un mega drenaje que reduce inundaciones en el Valle de México y traslada los costos socio ambientales hacia el  río Tula, una de las zonas más contaminadas del país

name: Preservation of Livelihood of Sarikecili Nomads, Turkey
Iron ore mining and mineroduct, Morro do Pilar, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: A major iron ore mining export venture in Minas Gerais threatens traditional communities and biodiversity, includes a 500 km pipeline transporting the ore to a port terminal in Espírito Santo.

name: Pande-Temane Natural Gas Pipeline, Mozambique&South Africa
El cultivo de concha abanico (Argopecten purpiratus) (Scallop), Perú
headline: The collection of naturally grown scallops has been replaced by aquaculture for export, and this creates conflicts because of pollution and occupation of common spaces used by artisanal fisherfolk.

name: Coca Cola plant and Groundwater Exploitation, India
Hidroelectrica Paso de la Reyna, Mexico
headline:
¡NO a los proyectos de muerte! ¡Al defender tierras y territorios, defendemos la vida!_x000D_
En contra de la expansión hidroelectrica en Oaxaca, las comunidades se suman a la CAMPAÑA en defensa de la MADRE TIERRA

name: Pollution from oil refinery in Sisak, Croatia
headline: Over the years, the local people appeals against the pollution from the refinery of Sisak was replaced by the workers protests protecting their jobs and the future of the state-owned Oil Company INA - crucial for Croatian economy.

name: Oil explosion in Baghjan, Tinsukia, Assam, India
headline: In May 2020, an oil and gas leak turned into fire close to a national park and wetland causing death and destruction of people, nature and culture.

name: Java 7 Coal-fired Power Plant, Indonesia
headline: The marine ecosystem and the livelihood of fishermen have been impacted in the neighborhood of the 2100MW Java-7 Coal-fired Power Plant that is in operation.

name: Alinta Northern Power Station in Port Augusta, South Australia
headline: After long standing concerns about people's health and the environment, the coal industry ends in Port Augusta, however justice issues continue as the local community loses jobs and fears for their future.

name: Hydraulic fracking, Egypt
Genetically Modified Organisms in Turkey
Pasta de Conchos - mine disaster (Mexico)
BGMEA Illegal Building, Bangladesh
headline: The BGMEA building has been declared illegal and directed to be removed by the Supreme Court of Bangladesh. This is a major victory against powerful environmental offenders and the culture of impunity.

name: Al Kumma Project tourism project, Lebanon
headline: The impact of eco-tourism on the environment and on rural communities has been a debate among conservationists and rural development practitioners. The Kumma Project has without a doubt grabbed the attention of many and created a huge debate among locals.

name: Kalsaka/Sega Gold Mines, Amara Mining plc/Perseus Ltd, Burkina Faso
headline: The industrial exploitation of Kalsaka/Sega gold deposits did not benefit the local populations, their living conditions were worsen. Now, the project is over and the open pits were left behind by the mining company, abandoned.

name: Trasvase Tajo-Segura (Spain)
Ashio Copper Mine, Japan
Idaho-Maryland Gold Mine in Grass Valley, California, USA
headline: The Nisenan have been struggling with injustices and violence related to the old Idaho-Maryland mine ever since the 1850's. Rise Gold Corp aims to reopen this mine without local consent or consideration of risks and rights violations.

name: Dust pollution from Long Thanh Airport construction, Vietnam
headline: High levels of dust pollution from levelling Long Thanh Airport construction site cause distress and pose health risks for neighbouring communities. People living several kilometres away are also affected. Dust mitigation measures have been introduced.

name: Carbon Black emission from Warri Refinery, Nigeria
Ancasti mobilizes against lithium mining, Catamarca, Argentina
headline: Opposition to lithium mining in Rock in Ancasti. Assemblies promote local productive alternatives and achieve the sanction of an ordinance that prohibits polluting extractive activities.

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Bonyic, Panamá
Tumring logging and rubber concessions, Kampong Thom province, Cambodia
headline: “From tapping resin to tapping rubber”: The Tumring rubber concession marked a new era of Cambodian land use policy. Under the guise of development, an agrarian transition was forced and a large-scale illegal logging operation was established.

name: Nuclear Waste Disposal at Trgovska gora, Croatia
headline: The Croatian government’s decision to store nuclear waste from the NPP “Krško” in Trgovska gora, at the border with Bosnia, has provoked strong opposition in both countries.

name: Takalar Fisherfolk against Sea Sand Mining, Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: Confrontations with local fisherfolk have derived from the mining of 1,000 hectares (3.86 square miles) of seafloor since 2017 in Takalar for the Reclamation of Centre Point of Indonesia Area in Makassar and the New Port of Makassar, South Sulawesi.

name: Rubber tree plantation in Kribi, Cameroon
headline: The rubber tree plantation of Hévéa was created by the State in 1975. From that moment and specially after the privatisation, different populations, including Bagyeli and Bulu people, have complained against land expropriation and deforestation.

name: Roma community living on an industrial site contaminated with mercury, Romania
headline: Roma families have no other place to live but on the former site of a chemicals factory that is contaminated with mercury. The Roma also have no access to basic utilities including water.

name: Lignite mining Cottbus Nord (Lakoma), Germany
Titanium mining project (Projeto Retiro) in São José do Norte, Rio Grande do Sul, Brasil
headline: Project stopped after an amendment to the Municipal Master Plan was presented by the movement "We do not want mining in São José do Norte",  and approved by the City Council and mayor in 2019.

name: Nevada-Semipalatinsk anti-nuclear movement, Kazakhstan
headline: This movement  in 1989-91 was crucial for the country's independence.  It put an end to nuclear tests at  Semipalatinsk helping to achieve a moratoria to nuclear  tests in the Soviet Union.

name: High mercury levels in skin whitening cosmetics, Sri Lanka
headline: Very high levels of Mercury have been found in skin whitening creams available in the Sri Lankan market. Local EJO's state that Health Authorities should ban those poisonous creams and suggest consumers to beware of those products

name: Proyecto Aratirí y mineria de hierro, Uruguay
headline: Uno de los conflictos ambientales más sonados del  Uruguay que ha mobilizado a cientos de uruguayas y uruguayos por el ambiente, el agua, la salud y el derecho a hacer un Plebiscito Nacional para decidir.

name: Sedano Fracking Project by BNK Petroleum in Burgos, Spain
Re-routing of the Toplodolska river, Serbia
headline: People of village Temska supported by local NGOs, professionals and municipality have opposed the project of re-routing Toplodolska River in order to bring additional water to the HPP Pirot.

name: KPL conflict, Karnataka, India
Partial Fauna Reserve of Pama and the access to sacred sites, Burkina Faso
headline: The access of the populations to their sacred places is restricted inside the Partial Pama Reserve. The prevention of poaching undermines their rights and considers only the interests of the tour operators.

name: Tourism expansion and dumped garbage fills the Mount Fuji, Japan
headline: Since hundreds of thousands of visitors climb Mount Fuji each year, pollution, caused primarily by tourism, has been an issue of great concern for the mountain's environmental and cultural values.

name: Lynas Advanced Materials Plant (LAMP) in Gebeng/Kuantan, Malaysia
headline: Prompting Malaysia’s biggest environmental campaign, Australian Lynas Corp’s large rare earth refinery, established in Gebeng, produces toxic waste close to 30,000 residents, peat land, a bio-rich estuary, floodplains, and marine and coastal ecosystems.

name: Quilomboas of Conceicao das Crioulass struggle for land and water in Salgueiro/PE, Brazil
Cargill Agricola port for soy export, Brazil
headline: Cargill's port ilegally operated until its closure in 2007, as the result of the peasants' and indigenous communties' fight for the forest preservation. Still after Cargill communicated its Environmental Impact Assessment, the port reopened in 2012.

name: Women activists in the forefront of resistance against Strongylos mine, South Mathiatis, Cyprus
headline: Mathiatis is a small village in the foothills of the Troodos mountain in Cyprus.  The project to reopen the Strongylos  gold mine has been successfully opposed by the local people and activists.

name: Timber Exploitation in Porto de Moz & Prainha, Brazil
headline: Timber exploitation, often illegal, has triggered violent land related conflicts between communities and companies. Between August 2014 and January 2015, the State of Para has lost at least 571km².

name: Munduruku indigenous resistance against illegal gold mining in Pará, Brazil
headline: A movement of the indigenous Munduruku group has been resisting illegal mining in their territory, which has become a new violent and lawless frontier of environmental and socio-cultural destruction.

name: Renewed Tribal Whaling by Makah Americans, Washington, USA
headline: The Makah Tribe have dealt with extreme backlash from continuing their tradition of whaling, despite having treaties with the US government and sustainable practices allowing whaling.

name: Nuclear waste dump in Międzyrzecz, Poland
headline: A historical anti-nuke movement in the Solidarność time managed to stop the project for a nuclear dumping site, despite repression and arrests.

name: Mainland Mine Analanjirofo, Madagascar
Pitinga cassiterite mine, Amazonas, Brazil
headline: The Pitinga mining complex is emblematic for Brazil’s historical injustice against indigenous population and the systematic downplaying of environmental pollution and the risks associated with tailings dams.

name: Nuclear power station in Tihange, Belgium
headline: Tihange has three reactors, often malfunctioning. There are concerns about their safety  expressed even by the official agency for nuclear security. There are also complaints from neighbouring coutries. It's time to close it down.

name: Dandora Landfill in Nairobi, Kenya
headline: One of the largest unregulated landfills causing serious health issues at few kms away from top international agencies like UNEP

name: Residencias de lujo en Milpa Alta, México
headline: Desde los 70' comuneros/as de Milpa Alta luchan contra la invasión e urbanización de sus tierras comunales y de conservación ambiental amenazadas ahora por el Proyecto del Programa General de Ordenamiento territorial de la Ciudad de México 2020 – 2035

name: Svydovets ski resort, Ukraine
headline: A proposal for an enormous ski resort, the largest in Ukraine complete with 60 hotels, 10 shopping malls and an airport, threatens large-scale deforestation in the Svydovets massif and severe disruption of hydrological systems throughout the wider region

name: Struggle for Socially Equitable Urban Transportation, Pune, India
headline: Cyclists in Pune are coming together to propose a cycle plan for the city. This case gives a brief account of the proposal and the process of negotiation between the citizen and the civic body.

name: Green Resources platantions, Tanzania
Pickering Wetland Development project, Ontario, Canada
headline: A massive building development project has been planned on the Lower Duffins Creek Wetland, including an Amazon warehouse. Residents are fighting back for the protection of this wetland and the termination of the project.

name: Comunidad de Huachon against Statkraft, Peru
headline: Dams for hydroelectrity for Lima owned by a Norwegian company cause protests by the indigenous community of Huachón because of damage to pastures.

name: Indramayu Coal Power Plant, West Java, Indonesia
headline: The operations of the government-owned coal power plant in Indramayu has caused severe livelihood losses to local communities. The government's plan to construct another plant in the area is met by local, national and international resistance.

name: Raid de Himalaya Rally, India
headline: One of the top ten toughest and most challenging car rallies around the world since 1999. A threat to Himalayan environment for the fun of rich racing cars, motorbikes and SUV owners

name: Kaiga Atomic Power Station, Karnataka, India
Pollution of Ergene River and Basin, Turkey
Innovative Waste Utilization unit in South Phoenix, USA
Traditional and indigenous groups against agribusiness expansion in the Matopiba region, Brazil
headline: With the increasing financialization of agribusiness in Matopiba, traditional community lands are being targeted by land grabbers and transnational investors, leading to human rights violations, ecological destruction, and expanding commodity frontiers.

name: Damodaram Sanjeevaiah Thermal Power Station, AP, India
Nathpa Jhakri Hydroelectric Project, HP, India
headline: (Over)work against the clock to complete the project and unsustainable labour conditions; workers raise their voice along with local inhabitants and prove connection between landslides, rockfalls and slope destabilisation with hydropower development

name: Guaraqueçaba Climate Action Project in traditional communities in Paraná, Brazil
headline: The Guaraqueçaba Climate Action Project restricts and discriminates the communities' traditional ways of life and causes social problems. However, an agroforestry movement has shown resistance and created a sustainable and socially just alternative.

name: Tata Steel Plant Kalinganagar, Orissa India
Israel uproots and confiscates Palestinian agricultural land, Occupied West Bank and Gaza
headline: Thousands of acres of Palestinian agricultural land have been razed and uprooted by Israeli occupation authorities. The One Million Tree Campaign replants trees and supports Palestinian farmers to maintain ownership of their land and livelihoods.

name: Small Scale Fisheries Movement against fishing quotas, South Africa
headline: The allocation of fishing rights in South Africa has led to controversies for more than a decade. The legislations have been favoring large-scale and commercial fishing sector, which has resulted in dispossession of small-scale fishers.

name: Warraq Island Evictions, Egypt
headline: Marginalized residents of Al-Warraq are under the threat of being evicted as development plans are projected for the Nile Island.

name: U.S. Steel's Clairton Coke Works in Pennsylvania, USA
headline: U.S. Steel’s Clairton Coke Works in Pittsburgh, PA lacks compliance with permits and failed to update outdated equipment, leading to two recent fires and continued emissions of sulfur dioxide, hydrogen sulfide, and benzene, placing residents at risk.

name: Lithium and uranium extraction at the Falchani and Macusani projects in Puno, Peru
headline: Lithium and uranium deposit generates social concern. The presence of uranium requires special legislation that Peru does not yet have, but the pressure to extract lithium is great.

name: Mediterraneo Hydroelectric plant and future exploitation plans of Puelo River, Chile
headline: Puelo basin is being targeted by national study for its massive exploitation. Mediterraneo S.A and Endesa own water rights and will benefit from it. Read about opposition on the transboundary basin and proposal of alternatives

name: Hydropower Plant Buk Bijela's impact on the Tara river canyon, Montenegro and B&H
headline: The idea of construction of the HPP “Buk Bijela” on the river Drina from the 1970s is still valid and could be realized in 2016, despite of years of strong opposition by local citizens, NGOs and experts.

name: Roma settlements adjacent to the industrial copper plant complex Krompachy, Kosice, Slovak Republic
headline: There is a Roma settlement adjacent to copper smelter Kovohuty Pribam, in Krompachy, Kosice. Pollution is likely to be more severe in this settlement than in the rest of the town.

name: Yiyang Xingwang Industries causing lead poisoning, Shangrao, Jiangxi, China
headline: Villagers complained about lead poisoning from the Yiyang Xingwang Industrial complex. In August 2014, protesters from Gankou township in Jiangxi province smashed up a new lead recycling plant which was about to start operations.

name: Potasas del Llobregat in Catalonia, Spain
Planta Tratadora de Aguas Residuales (PTAR) Atotonilco, Hidalgo, México.
headline: Campesinos y comunidades vecinas de la mega Planta Tratadora de Aguas Residuales Atotonilco son afectados por el drenaje profundo más grande de Latinoamérica, proyecto que las autoridades y empresas beneficiadas llaman Saneamiento para el Valle de México.

name: Coca-Cola botteling Plant in Dehradun, India
Pancheshwar Dam and impacts in Uttarakhand, Nepal and India
headline: The tallest dam in the world might come up on the  border between India and Nepal. More than 30,000 families would be affected. People protest in the Himalayan Day to denounce dam building in a seismic prone fragile zone.

name: Proyecto Pampa Colorada, Jaén, Peru
headline: Because of threat of exploration by copper mining company, local farmers and peasants ("ronderos") revolt in 2013 invading mining camp.

name: Wastepickers  (such as the Barbechas) struggle forth in post-revolution Tunisia
headline: National authorities, public-private partnerships and NGO's seemed eager to advance waste management in Tunis. But the marginalized informal recycling sector faces difficulties  in social recognition.

name: Soybean monoculture and land conflicts in the Chapadinha microregion, Maranhão, Brazil
headline: Soybean takes over the Brazilian Cerrado, it causes deforestation and environmental degradation. Local communities fight against land grabbing, pesticides used as chemical weapons, and food insecurity.

name: Operation Nemesis on Japanese illegal whale slaughters, Antarctica
headline: A successful direct action called Nemesis by the Sea Shepherd movement against illegal so-called scientific whale slaughters in the Antarctic.

name: Grasim Industries (Aditya Birla Group) Viscose Plant, Nagda in Madhya Pradesh, India
headline: The largest viscose fibre plant in India may be linked to crop damage, water scarcity, pollution, disease and severe occupational health hazards.

name: Exploratory fracking en ENARA, Spain
Oil drilling in Virunga National Park by SOCO International plc, DR of Congo
headline: Oil explorations threaten the Virunga National Park, being one of the oldest in the country. Activists face strong repression. In 2017, activist Rodrigue Katembo was awarded the Goldman Environmental Prize for denouncing illicit extractive activities.

name: New open coal pit project in Mencherep, Kemerovo, Russia
headline: Mencherep farmers in the Kuzbass successfully resisted a new open coal pit threatening their village. The Belovo regional court in 2018 said the goverment had no land rights.

name: Kodungiayur garbage dump site in Chennai, TN, India
headline: Landfills and uncontrolled dumping under mafia control

name: Lote Ocho -  El Estor, Lake Izabal, Guatemala
headline: After decades of resistance against HudBay minerals and other firms, including court cases in Guatemala and Canada, the local Mayan Q’eqchi’ community managed to stop nickel mining in 2020 officially. However, in 2022 the Guatemalan government granted per

name: Guatemala mass mobilisations win in defeating the “Monsanto Law” pushed by US
headline: Huge victory against GMOs and traditional knowledge loss in Guatemala, where mass mobilisation makes the Congress repealed the Monsanto Law

name: Rosia Montana, Romania
Zushi Green Movement against US military housing at Ikego Heights, Japan
headline: Residents of Zushi have been protesting the planning and construction of US military base family housing in Ikego forest for over 30 years in one of the longest ongoing cases of grassroots environmental movements in post-war Japan.

name: Comunidades pemón del río Carrao afectadas por minería ilegal en el P.N. Canaima, Venezuela
headline: Indigenous Pemon communities fight against illegal mining, which is practiced by a variety of actors including also indigenous people.

name: Construcción Tunel de La Línea, Colombia
headline: Socialization of costs of infrastructure and transportation. Here's a good example near Bogotá, where construction waste is diverted to water bodies, threatening this way public and ecosystem health

name: Rourkela Steel Plant, Orissa, India
Val Thorens ski resort in the natural park of La Vanoise and the FRAPNA, France
headline: One of the first activities of the Fédération Rhône-Alps de Protection de la Nature created at the end of the 1960s, was the defence of the natural parc of La Vanoise threatened by new ski resorts.

name: Bhavanapadu and Kakarapalli  ECEPL Coal Fired Power Plant, AP, India
headline: After a long struggle and some deaths, in 2017 it was announced that work had stopped at Kakarapalli CFPP. Like in Sompeta (also in coastal AP), a success for environmental justice.

name: Orchards affected by the Annexation Wall surrounding Qalqilya, West Bank
headline: Separation wall denies local population means of livelihood and access to natural resources.

name: Lefa Gold mine, cyanide lakes poisoning villagers' water and animals, by Nordgold, Guinea
headline: After years suffering cyanide pollution of their water, soil and air and asking to be resettled, the inhabitants of Fayalala-Carrefour will be finally displaced for the sake of the Lefa mine expansion.

name: Hydrocarbon extraction in Discovered Small Field (DSF) in Neduvasal, TN, india
headline: The villagers of Neduvasal are protesting a hydrocarbon extraction project proposed by the Centre. Neduvasal has a healthy multi-crop farm economy and farmers fear that the project will disturb the environment and their livelihoods.

name: Mina Cobre Las Cruces, Sevilla, Spain
headline: Executives of First Quantum, a Canadian firm, were sentenced to a short term in prison in 2016 for large scale damage to the Niebla-Posadas aquifer in Andalusia caused by  the Las Cruces Copper mine.

name: Total palm oil refinery in Marseille, France
headline: Large imports of palm oil by Total in La Mède refinery, contested by Greenpeace and others because of induced deforestation in Indonesia and other exporting countries.

name: Unrestricted charcoal production in Puntland, Somalia
headline: Unrestricted charcoal production skyrocketed after Somalia's governmental collapse in 1991, leading to mass deforestation. Fatima Jibrell fought against this with community-building projects and legislative action banning charcoal exports.

name: Mina Dolores, Chihuahua México
headline:
Minefinders illegally occupied and contaminated land; Pan American Silver buys the militarized project in the context of extreme violence. _x000D_
_x000D_
Minefinders illegally occupied and contaminated land; Pan American Silver buys the militarized project in t

name: Pesticide acute poisoning in tomatoes plantations  in Corrientes, Argentina
headline: In 2011, Nicolás Arévalo died from pesticide poisoning. Tomato plantations very near his home spread out endosulfan. This led to a first trial in Argentina for homicide because of agrochemicals use.

name: Rubber plantations in Weliya Forest, Sri Lanka
headline: Massive land grabbing has become a common problem in Sri Lanka. 3,000 acres belonging to Soragune "Kuda Katharagama Devalaya" have been illegally sold to rubber plantations, hurting local community and exacerbating conflict between human and elephants

name: Savannah’s lithium extraction conflict in Covas do Barroso, Portugal
headline: Covas do Barroso, a small rural village in northern Portugal, is the site of a fierce resistance against the projected lithium exploration in the area.

name: Mkuju River uranium mine, Tanzania
headline: Tanzanian government welcomed uranium mining as a solution to poverty and economic development, but the capacities to handle side effects like pollution or health risks in terms of laws and regulations are low.

name: Water conflict for intensive pistachio production and Golgohar iron mine in Sirjan, Iran
headline: While the two big industries have had the major impact on water shortage and issues, residents of Sirjan have been left behind and are "thirsty" for water justice.

name: Noyyal River Basin, a pollution cocktail from textile industry, TN, India
headline: Garments industries polluting river basins. A study at University of Madras showed that more than half of the people interviewed reported health problems such as diarrhoea and cholera, while more than 75 per cent said they suffered skin diseases

name: Daño ambiental en Sierra Minera y Bahía de Portmán, Murcia por  SMM Peñarroya, España
headline: La eliminación de alrededor de 60 millones de toneladas de relaves mineros ricos en metales entre 1957 y 1990 condujo al relleno de la mayor parte de la bahía. Intentos de reparación judicial y física.

name: Desviación Río Ranchería, La Guajira, Colombia
Yucca Mountain nuclear waste storage, USA
Monocultivo de Palma de Aceite en Meta, Colombia
headline: Intensive cultivation of oil palms for export, boosted by free trade agreement between Colombia and the US. Workers try to get better labour conditions but the activity is the only revenue source in the area and companies just fire and replace manwork

name: Residuos industriales en Nuevo Mercurio, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: A village that suffered from mercury mining until about 1980 then became a repository of toxic polychlorinated biphenyls (PCB)imported from the US. A criminal case against the importers failed.

name: Minera El Morro en Valles del Huasco, Chile
headline: La mina El Morro fue finalmente paralizada. GOLDCORP, junto a Teck Resources Limited,  fusionaran el proyecto El Morro y Relincho en un nuevo mega proyecto minero llamado NuevaUnión

name: Some Tibetans arrested  in mining conflict in Namling dzong, Tibet, China
headline: On May 21, 2010, Chinese authorities detained some 30 Tibetans in Wu Yug Sochen, subdistrict of Namling  in Shigates (TAR), after they attacked security vehicles brought in to quell protests over a mine

name: Oil Extraction at Numto Nature Preserve, Russia
headline: The heavenly lake of Numto is threatened by an oil company Surgutneftegas. Oil operations would wreck local communities and spell disaster for its wildlife and ecosystems.

name: Bosques de Bahia Solano, Colombia
Land grabs and criminalization by palm oil producer Astra Agro Lestari (AAL), Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: Three subsidiaries of AAL producing palm oil in Central and West Sulawesi have practised for decades land grabbing, criminalisation of farmers who defend their lands, as well as causing environmental degradation.

name: Relleno Sanitario Parque Industrial Santodomingo, Colombia
headline: Planta de manejo de residuos sin el consentimiento de la comunidad, se presenta como una amenaza las dinámicas sociales y a las fuentes de abastecimiento de la población, que pide Reducir, Reutilizar, Reciclar, Recuperar y Recapacitar!

name: Almond Leaf Scorch in Alicante, Spain
headline: The detection of the bacterium Xylella fastidiosa on Almonds sparked criticism toward phytosanitary policies

name: Oil Drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, Alaska, USA
headline: Oil drilling and extraction threaten the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge comprising 19, 000,000 acres in the north Alaskan coast.  Caribou and other wildlife is threatened , as also the local populations.

name: Sundarban Tiger Reserve, West Bengal, India
headline: Fishing struggles and conflict over the natural resource in one of the biggest mangrove forest  and tiger reserves in India and the world.

name: Gold mining Bomboré project by Orezone, Burkina Faso
headline: Bomboré project will become the 13th major scale open pit gold mining in Burkina Faso. In spite of the lack of inclusive consent from the population, the government and the company moved forward. Outmigration already started.

name: Rhino poaching in the Balule Nature Reserve in Greater Kruger National Park, South Africa
headline: The Black Mambas are a mostly-female task force of unarmed nonviolent local park rangers, successful in reducing rhino poaching amidst a climate of hostility and violence between classes, races, and genders.

name: Oil giants Shell and Chevron Canalization polluted Tsekelewu Community, Nigeria
headline: Oil extraction from the '80s have brought heavy pollution, now exacerbated by gas flaring stations and canals from the Atlantic Ocean by Shell and Chevron to access their oil facilities

name: Militarisation of LNG Gas Liquefaction plant, Yemen
headline: Yemen LNG gas liquefaction plant in Balhalf, Yemen, has been militarized by the Saudi Arabian government and used as a secret military base and prison during the Yemeni conflict. Foreign shareholders deny responsibility.

name: Gidawom quarrying case, Bhutan
headline: One of the few officially recorded environmental conflicts in Bhutan, and a partial victory in court for the protesting villagers.

name: ITER Reactor, France
Proyecto Minera Dominga, Coquimbo, Chile
headline: This large project threatens biodiversity at Punta de Choros and Humboldt Penguin Reserve. It includes open-pit mines for iron ore and copper, a harbor to load the mineral, desalinization, and processing plants.  There are allegations of corruption.

name: Multiple gas explosion in Egiland, Nigeria
Girye Ultra Mega Power Project, Maharashtra, India
Minería en Sierras de Tandil, Argentina
headline: En una región de explotación historica de material de construcción, finalmente en el 2010 las comunidades han logrado una ley de preservación del territorio, ante la explotación excesiva de canteras y el gran avance inmobiliario.

name: Vale's giant S11D iron ore project and Railroad Carajás, Pará, Brazil
headline: S11D is largest iron ore project in the world. Iron ore will be exported through a port located in Maranhão. Vale doubled the Carajás Railroad linking the mine and the port, affecting more than 100 communities in Pará and Maranhão.

name: Toxic Waste Incinerator in East Liverpool, Ohio, United States
headline: In 1992, WTI built a large toxic waste incinerator in the town of East Liverpool, Ohio. The TSEC (Tri-State Environmental Council) led by Terri Swearingen (Goldman prize 1997), uncovered many problems.

name: Usina Trapiche, Sirinhaém, Pernambuco, Brazil
headline: Usina Trapiche, a sugar and ethanol producer, evicts traditional fisherfolk, pollutes water, destroys mangroves. The alternative: a RESEX.

name: Swanson Salmon Fish Farm Occupation, British Colombia, Canada
headline: The longest running occupation of a salmon fish farm that threatens wild salmon in B.C.

name: Anglo American Platinum Mogalakwena Mine Tailings Dam in Limpopo, South Africa
headline: The company created a tailings dam on Sekuruwe community farmland in 2009 to accommodate waste at the cost of community's livelihood, ancestral gravesites, and health. The Sekuruwe were compensated in 2016.

name: Lago Lleu Lleu, Chile
headline:
La resistencia de las comunidades indigenas Mapuche determinó que la empresa finalmente desista de sus aspiraciones. Sin embargo un nuevo peligro _x000D_
relacionado con extracción de hierro podría levantar nuevas luchas

name: Proposed National Radioactive Waste Management Facility, South Australia
headline: The site-selection process for Australia's first centralised nuclear waste facility has been highly divisive. The final two shortlisted sites near Kimba, SA have faced much resistance from the Barngarla people, farmers, environmentalists and other actors.

name: Hotel La Tejita Beach Club Resort in Tenerife, Spain
headline: The construction of a hotel in La Tejita beach began in 2019. Since its construction occupies the limits of the terrestrial-maritime delimitation under review, is illegal. It also affects protected areas, and one of the largest natural beachs in Tenerife

name: Destrucción y cementación del bosque a Caprara Meadows.
headline: El conflicto en el procesamiento de Caprara Meadows: la movilización de los ciudadanos y los comités en defensa del parque.

name: Protest against high voltage transmission lines in Bhangar, West Bengal, India
headline: Violent protest against construction of a substation and high voltage transmission lines in West Bengal, along the lines of Singur and Nandigram.

name: Afectados por el Nemagón, Honduras
headline: Farms workers from Honduras bring the Dole company to court asking for an indemnity for damage to their health caused by the nematicide Nemagón. The case also reached the TPP in 2008 in Lima.

name: Lead poisoning by Melody Chemical plant in Hengdong, Hunan, China
headline: In 2014, more than 300 children in Hengdong County of Hunan Province were reported to have excessive/ poisoning blood lead levels. After a legal battle, some families finally achieved to receive compensation.

name: Alcoa Coal Closes in Anglesea, Australia
headline: Alcoa coal fired power station closes with the closure of the Alcoa aluminium smelter and Alcoa being unable to find a buyer. Community action demonstrated that the power station was uneconomic and had lost its social licence.

name: Conversión de carbono de la planta Enel en Rossano Calabro
Waste incineration fuelled cement plant in Montcada i Reixac, Spain
headline: Co-incineration of waste at cement plant allegedly causing air pollution and health problems for local inhabitants.

name: Agip Facilty Pollutes Kwale Community Ponds, Nigeria
Qaysamani Dam, Lebanon
headline: The “dam obsession” of the Lebanese government ignores the associated environmental risks, cheaper alternatives, and core issue behind water shortages, namely severe mismanagement of an otherwise abundant resource

name: Mineria de Oro Frisco, Puebla, México
headline: La resistencia de la población poblana detuvo la mina Frisco (propiedad de Carlos Slim) en Tetela de Ocampo, gracias a la "deliberación democrática" y alianzas entre las comunidades de la región.

name: Didipio Gold and Copper mine, Nueva Vizcaya, Philippines
headline: Aggressive mining development in the Philippines: the Didipio Gold and Copper mine, owned by OceanaGold Corporation, has caused large human rights violations and environmental destruction.

name: Sasol pollutes Sasolburg, Mpumalanga, the Vaal River and other areas, South Africa
headline: Significant air and water pollution in Vaal River, also from the region of Mpumalanga, the town of Sasolburg and elsewhere in the country, have been caused by  Sasol, a top-polluting company.

name: Chemical Industry in Flix, Tarragona, Spain
headline: More than 700,000 cubic meters of toxic waste containing substances such as mercury, cadmium and toxic organochlorine components were dumped for decades by the Ecros company in the Ebro river.

name: PDVSA y escasez de agua en la Faja Petrolífera del Orinoco, Venezuela
headline: La explotación de la Faja Petrolífera del Orinoco ha traído muy pocos beneficios y sí muchos males a la población de la zona. Por años la empresa no ha tenido la capacidad para contribuir a mejorar la provisión de servicios esenciales como el agua potable

name: Land grabbing and TIAA pension fund speculation in southern Maranhão and Piauí, Brazil
headline: US and EU pension funds such as those managed by TIAA have been increasingly investing in soy farms in Brazil's Matopiba region, where speculation with grabbed land has driven land conflict, deforestation, and threats against traditional communities.

name: Construcción de torres eléctricas en parques naturales Barbas Bremen y La Marcada, Colombia
headline: Transmission towers to be built in natural park at the centre of communities' protests for impacts on forests (deforestation) and on waters (disruption of forest ecosystems)

name: Jaypee Cement Plant in HP, India
headline: Among the main cement producers in India, Jaypee was found guilty of indulging in 'blatant falsehoods' in acquiring the requisite clearances, while people mobilize for heavy health impacts of the cement industry

name: Order 81's Effect on Iraqi Agriculture, Iraq
headline: Following the invasion of Iraq, the U.S. issued Order 81, prohibiting farmers from saving seeds. This devastated the agriculture sector by creating a reliance on corporations despite  financial, environmental, and socio-economic risks and consequences.

name: Azura-Edo Independent Power Project Impacts Community People in Edo State, Nigeria
Mina “El Arco” de Grupo México en El Valle de los Cirios, Baja California, México
headline: El Valle de los Cirios es un Área Natural Protegida. No obstante, Grupo México obtuvo concesiones  para su mega proyecto minero, que devastará el ambiente y medios de vida de miles de personas.

name: Stewart ANGB PFA contamination of City of Newburgh's primary drinking water source, NY, US
headline: PFA contamination was identified within the city’s primary drinking source (Lake Washington). Citizens claim stricter regulation of PFAS by the EPA and legislation to hold PFA manufacturers and consumers accountable.

name: Bhopal gas tragedy, India
headline: The biggest industrial disaster in the last 40 years in India, chronic diseases, malformations, death, severe contamination. Affected people only going to receive 500 dollars compensation from the Dow Chemical company.

name: Sompeta Coal Power Plant, AP, India
headline: The inspiring story of the anti-coal village in India and villagers defeating the logic that coal is a necessity to power their homes.

name: Illegal Sand Mining in the Chakki riverbed, Himachal Pradesh, India
headline: Illegal sand mining, ecological degradation, and the mining mafia in Himachal Pradesh.

name: Opposition to Keystone XL in Nebraska, United States
headline: In November 2017 Nebraska approves Keystone XL 'Alternative Mainland' Route despite 210,000 Gallon Oil Spill from the Keystone Pipeline In South Dakota days before.

name: Jalaur River Multi-Purpose Project (JRMPP) Phase II Dam, Iloilo, Philippines
headline: A “mega” dam in terms of economic costs, social and environmental impacts, but with few benefits, mainly for a small elite. Tumandok indigenous leaders and activists opposing the project are been killed.

name: Nemmeli Desalination Plant, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: 100 MLD Nemmeli Desalination plant  was introduced as solution to Chennai's drinking water shortage. Since its inauguration, fishers living close to the plant complained against environmental damage, coastal erosion and land use change.

name: Tau Taa Wana indigenous land grabbed by PT KSL, Central Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: The common lands of Tau Taa Wana, which constituted an important part of the people's livelihoods, was developed into plantations by PT KLS in 1997-1998. The company has not yet fulfilled promises of compensation to the community.

name: Atotonilco de Tula y la planta de Cemex, Mexico
headline: Incineraciones de residuos sólidos urbanos en la planta cementera de CEMEX provocan afectaciones socioambientales.

name: Linyuan Industrial Park, Kaohsiung, Taiwan
headline: In 1988, a pollution incident - also known as the Linyuan incident -  gave rise to a mass protest in which victims barricaded the industrial park for three weeks, practically shutting down Taiwan’s petrochemical supply.

name: Yaigojé, Apaporis minas de oro, Colombia
Las Vizcachitas Mining Project, Chile
headline: In the Putaendo Valley, the local population opposes the Vizcachitas mining project, of the Canadian company Los Andes Copper, due to the socio-environmental impacts it will cause.

name: Dojura, Chocó, Colombia
Toxic Waste dumping in Shingle Mountain, Dallas, Texas
headline: Shingle Mountain and the Struggle Against Environmental Racism and Illegal Dumping in Dallas

name: Reforestation project by Fondation Seguin in the Parc National La Visite, Haiti
headline: The reforestation project in the Parc National de La Visite in Haïti by the Fondation Seguin led to the bloody eviction of local communities

name: Struggle for community rights in the Protected Areas of Biligiri Ranganatha Swami Temple (BRT), India
headline: The Soligas tribes successfully fought for the recognition of their community rights within the BRT wildlife sanctuary. They have developed a collective management plan for the conservation of the BRT biodiversity.

name: Marmara Lake endangered ecosystem, Turkey
Minister of Hudbay in the Constancia Project, Peru
headline: The Hudbay company and the government promote 'green' mining for energy transition and electric cars. However, local villagers continue to live the patterns of dispossession, pollution, criminalization and lack of information.

name: Maniry graphite project in Ambohitsy Haut, Madagascar
headline: Villagers in the Maniry commune in Southern Madagascar risk being displaced because of graphite mining  by Australian company Evion. The region is rich in graphite flakes, but it suffers severe droughts and food insecurity.

name: Presa Las Cruces Nayarit, Mexico
headline: Las Cruces would be a large hydroelecric dam in the San Pedro River in Nayarit build by CFE and CONAGUA. There has been strong opposition. The project is stalled.

name: Oil, gas, jihadism and militarization in the Taoudeni Basin, Mali
headline: The ‘second front war on terror' in the Sahara is building alongside a growing number of multinationals hoping to extract oil and gas reserves of Mali and Mauritania, and strong French military presence.

name: Producción a larga escala de aguacates en Peribán, Michoacán, Mexico
headline: El cultivo del aguacate en Michoacán ha crecido de manera exponencial generando costos ambientales y de salud en las comunidades donde se instala. El uso deregulado de cañones antigranizo aleja la lluvia, afectando a los demás campaesinos y campesinas.

name: Refinaria Presidente Bernardes “Vale da Morte”, Cubatão, São Paulo, Brazil
headline: In the late 1950s, the Brazilian government created an industrial center. Companies were invited to build factories without environmental restrictions. Due to this, Cubatão became one of the most polluted areas in the world.

name: Planned Shell Ultra City in Johannesburg, South Africa
headline: Mariette Liefferink successfully won a campaign in 2002 shutting down Shell's attempt to build two petrol stations in her neighborhood of Bryanston, Johannesburg.

name: Giza North power plant, Egypt
Oil spill by ONGC , Kathiramnagalam,  Cauvery delta, TN, India
headline: Protests against ONGC, after groundwater was affected. There was police repression. Protest methods included a community kitchen and using firewood instead of the LPG supplied by ONGC.

name: The CAFO-like “farm of a thousand cows”, France
headline: The first hyper big farm is in project, in a single 1000 cow + 750 calf unit. Opposition from the Confédération Paysanne, Novissen, and other groups, was repressed and some activists brought to court. Stopped by 2021.

name: Proyecto turístico Nuevo Vallarta, México
headline: Durante cuatro décadas la implementación y expansión del proyecto turístico Nuevo Vallarta en las costas del pacífico, ha ocasionado despojo territorial y desplazamiento de poblaciones. La lucha por la justicia ambiental continúa.

name: Rancho Seco nuclear power station, closed down by referendum in 1989, California, United States
headline: Residents of Sacramento, California, voted in June 1989 to shut down a 913 MW nuclear power plant, the first time voters decided to close a working reactor. The reasons were economic and environmental.

name: Takovo Mora , Santa Cruz, Bolivia
headline: Oil exploration in Guarani indigenous territory without their consent, leading to a blockade of the road Santa Cruz - Camiri.

name: Hanhikivi Nuclear Power Plant, Pyhäjoki, Finland
headline: The Russian-built 1,200 MX project has suffered long delays. It threatens wildlife, it is politically divisive in Finland, and it is very expensive.

name: Minera de cobre Doña Inés de Collahuasi, Chile
Hul 1&2 small hydropower projects, HP, India
headline: Small but not so beautiful; stiff opposition to small hydelprojects in Western Himalayas bring plans to a halt. Are small size projects always less harmful than large ones?

name: El nudo de ferrocarril de alta velocidad en Florencia
headline: Un TAV subterráneo amenaza a Florencia que, en línea con las grandes obras italianas, tiene una parte de investigación de los fabricantes y crea un importante impacto ambiental.

name: Trasvase de agua desde el Lago de Valencia, Venezuela
headline: Water transfer from Lake Valencia that will pollute the reservoirs of several of the most populous cities of Venezuela. Potential consequences for millions of people.

name: Gazprom Neft in Halabja Block, Iraq
headline: "We don't give water for oil"; scientists and environmentalists state that “scientific evidence shows work conducted by this company is lethal and damages the environment, air, water wells and springs - and such changes are irreversible”

name: Namibia Agriculture and Renewables / CAPARO farming project in Caprivini, Namibia
Coal mining and livelihood impacts in Zhanggou Village, Xinzheng, Henan, China
headline: Coal mining and over-exploitation of deposits resulted in multiple social-political problems at Zhanggou Village of XinZheng City in Henan Province.

name: Offshore petroleum threatens fishing livelihoods and marine biodiversity in Mauritania
headline: Offshore oil and gas development is advancing as the result of autocratic governmental policies and in disregard for Mauritania’s biological marine ecosystems,  necessary to the country’s fishing trade.

name: Chicago recycling business General Iron to relocate to South East Side, USA
headline: A polluting facility is being sent to a low-income community of color to allow the construction of a development that will benefit an already affluent area

name: Local LGBTQI  struggles for post-disaster recovery turn into the Climate Change and Human Rights Inquiry against “Carbon Mayors”, The Philippines
headline: Typhoon Yolanda converted Arthur,  a transgender woman from Tocablan City (Leyte, Philippines) into an activist and a leader for human rights and environmental justice.

name: Sanitary sewage on Varna beach, Bulgaria
Welspun Energy Thermal Power Plant at Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh
Arctic Oil Spill in Norilsk, Russia
headline: Because of bad maintence and permafrost melting 20,000 tonnes of oil leaked into a river within the Arctic Circle  from an electric plant supplying the largest Russian mining company. Rivers may take a decade to clean.

name: Northwest Florida Beaches Airport, USA
headline: Construction of a new airport on wetlands, in spite of six environmental lawsuits, caused a decline in habitat and water quality. A private landowner stands to benefit from industrial, retail and hotel development on land its owns around the airport.

name: Contaminación por relleno sanitario en comunidad de Puerto Rico, Nueva Loja, Ecuador
headline: A waste dump near Lago Agrio in the Amazoon of Ecuador, accepting municipal waste and also industrial and oil residues. Neighbours complained and were repressed.

name: Roma eviction in Dublin, Ireland
headline: Approximately a hundred Roma had to settle in a flooding basin next to the M50 motorway in Dublin, Ireland back in 2007 and were later deported back to Romania since the Irish state did not provide any opportunities for them to stay.

name: East River Park, NY, USA
headline: Manhattan's Lower East Side community rejects the destruction of East River Park. "At a time when our community is faced with multiple threats unfolding daily from the climate emergency, it is delusional to believe that building a wall will save us."

name: Mina Pucamarca y riesgo de contaminación del Río Usuchuma, Perú
headline: Una mina de oro en la frontera chileno-peruana es reconocida por sus altos estandartes ambientales por las empresas. Pero según las poblaciones fronterizas, amenaza los recursos hídricos del rio.

name: Greenfield Cement Plant by Lafarge, HP, India
headline: The Indian subsidiary of the cement giant plans one more plant in Himachal Pradesh. But the area is already witnessing unaccountable hydropower development; the connection of frenzied growth-oriented sectors but also of local struggles and resistances

name: Tolda Fría gold mining, Colombia
headline: Exploited for gold extraction since last century by artisanal miners, the area is targeted by large mining companies. Local opposition is starting organizing

name: Förbifart Stockholm, Sweden
Subernarekha multipurpose Project (Icha Dam), Jharkhand, India
Naameh Landfill, Lebanon
headline: The Naameh landfill, which operated for around 20 years and served as a dumpsite for most of the trash produced in Beirut and Mount Lebanon, was forcefully shut down by activists, giving rise to the ongoing garbage crisis in Lebanon

name: Electrical Highway in Northeast Catalonia, Spain
Puente Vehicular Periférico Oriente in Xochimilco, Mexico
headline: Colectivos del pueblo originario de Xochimilco en defensa de un área natural protegida y Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad

name: Itai-Itai disease,  Toyama prefecture, Japan
headline: The outbreak of itai-itai disease, a painful chronic cadmium poisoning, took place along the Jinzū River for many decades. The cause of the disease was discharge from the Kamioka zinc mine belonging to Mitsui Mining and Smelting Co.

name: La Chureca dumpsite enclosure, Managua, Nicaragua
headline: Giant dump La Chureca -  historically serving as an urban commons and sustaining 2,000 families - became modernized in the name of sustainable development. Waste pickers since then struggle for inclusion in the recycling sector and against displacement.

name: Banqiao dam failure in 1975, Henan, China
headline: The Banqiao Reservoir Dam in Henan province failed in 1975 caused more casualties than any other dam failure in history at an estimated 230,000 deaths and 11 million displaced. The dam was later rebuilt.

name: Mossville, Louisiana: environmental racism in “cancer alley”, United States
headline: Mossville was one early settlement of free blacks since 1790. After the 1940s Mossville became surrounded by industrial plants, making it "the most polluted corner of the most polluted region in one of the most polluted states in the USA".

name: Shandong Silver Hawk Chemical Fiber Co., Ltd., Viscose Plant, China
headline: Viscose plant causes heavy air pollution; suspected of discharging untreated wastewater into nearby river. Local residents complain but continue to suffer from pollution for years.

name: Hidroeléctrica El Naranjal, Veracruz,  Mexico
headline: A 370 MW hydrolectric project is opposed by local inhabitants. A local leader, Noé Vázquez, was killed in 2013, when a MAPDER meeting was about to start.

name: Coal Fired Thermal Power Plant in Porto Romano, Albania
Bujagali hydropower project, Uganda
Acid Tar ponds in Incukalns, Latvia
headline: Two sulfuric acid-tar waste disposal pits located near to one of Latvia's largest rivers threatens the environment and people's health. A legacy from the Soviet industrialization, but now no one is made responsable for that

name: Reserva Forestal Imataca, Región Guayana de Venezuela
headline: Exploitation of gold, extraction of wood in indigenous terriories threaten since 1963 the Imataca Forest Reserve of 3.5 million hectares to the South of the Orinoco River delta.

name: Floricultura en la Sabana de Bogotá, Colombia
Proyecto Gramalote, Antioquia, Colombia
GMOs ban, Croatia
headline: Thanks to Zelena Akcija (Green Action- Friends of the Earth Croatia)  and other organizations, Croatia remains part of a group of the EU member states with stringent national policies against GMOs.

name: Indian Nations and Wolf Hunting, USA
headline: Citizens groups and tribes continue to fight against legislation that would allow a wolf hunting season in Michigan, citing both scientific and cultural reasons for their position.

name: Proyecto Central Hidroeléctrica Aguas Calientes, Chile
headline: La chilena Hydrochile, y sus sociedades de inversiones australianas, británicas, alemanas y estadounidenses, intentó ubicar dos centrales de paso en una zona protegida, lo que fue duramente criticado y parado por una larga coalición de organizaciones.

name: Friends of Nature sued State Grid for refusing to purchase clean energy in Gansu, China
headline: In August 2016, Friends of Nature (FON) sued State Grid Gansu Electric Power Co since the company refused to purchase the electricity produced from wind and solar.  The amount not produced with renewable was substituted by coal-fired power.

name: Proposed nuclear waste dump located on Indigenous territory, Saskatchewan, Canada
headline: A proposed nuclear waste dump on traditional Indigenous lands was successfully stopped due to collective efforts in mobilising against the project.

name: Quebrada la Lata, Magdalena, Colombia
Dragons Blood tree: biopiracy & shaman pharmaceuticals in the Amazon, Ecuador
Covanta Fairfax Trash Incinerator in Lorton, Virginia, USA
headline: Following a trend for the US trash incinerator industry, residents in Lorton, VA face the impacts of the Covanta Fairfax trash incinerator, located in a disproportionately low-income community of color.

name: Tortum Bagbasi Hydroelectric Power Plant, Turkey
Zwentendorf Nuclear Reactor, Austria
Minera Ternium vs comuneros, Aquila, Michoacan, Mexico
headline: Un tema son las regalías que la comunidad debe recibir de la empresa siderúrgica. Un tema relacionado es la represión contra los representantes de la comunidad por cargos falsos.

name: Thermal power plant oil spill in Baniyas, Syria
headline: In August 2021, a large oil spill in the size of New York City from the thermal power plant in Baniyas/ Syria threatened the marine ecosystems and livelihoods along the Mediterranean's eastern shores in Syria, Cyprus, and Turkey.

name: Lead poisoning and heavy metal pollution by Yunnan Jinding Zinc Corporation Ltd., Lanping, Nujiang, China
headline: Despite years of complaints, the full extent of heavy metal pollution at a Yunnan mine was only exposed after a crackdown on organised crime.  Most of the children in the surrounding area were found to have excessive blood lead levels.

name: Escalante Massacre over sugar plantations, Negros Occidental, the Philippines
headline: Activists and artists are being persecuted for commemorating the Escalante Massacre (1985), where 20 protesters demanding agrarian reform and land distribution for sugar cane workers were killed by paramilitary forces of the government of Philippines.

name: Firestone/Bridgestone Rubber Plantations, Liberia
TotalEnergies' offshore oil and gas extraction in Brulpadda and Luiperd fields, South Africa
headline: TotalEnergies plans to exploit a carbon bomb off the south african coast threatening the region's rich biodiversity and local fisherpeople livelihoods.

name: 'Blood sugar' land grab by Phnom Penh Sugar Company, Kampong Speu, Cambodia
headline: Economic Land Concessions, militarization, dirty finance and the ironic European agreement “Everything but Arms”; the recipe for forced evictions in Cambodia

name: First oil spill at Akipelai Community, Nigeria
Barakah Nuclear Power Plants, United Arab Emirates
headline: The final dome structure has been completed in 2018 at the United Arab Emirates' four-unit Barakah nuclear power plant, a key milestone for the giant project of 5,600 MW.

name: Jindal Steel Plant at Salboni, West Bengal, India
Afungi LNG airport and construction camps, Mozambique
headline: Afungi Airstrip and workers' camps, constructed to serve Mozambique LNG project, became the epicentre of the worst COVID-19 outbreak in the country. Gas development proceeds in the midst of violent insurgency and a worker building the airstrip was killed.

name: Capulalpam de Mendez contra Natividad, Oaxaca
Tomato farmworkers organizing to gain better working and living conditions in Immokalee, Florida, USA
headline: Intensive monoculture and low prices for tomatoes has led to a long history of exploitation for migrant farmworkers. The Coalition of Immokalee Workers has been fighting against this example of modern-day slavery in South Florida.

name: Doloo Tea Workers against Greenfield Airport, Assam, India
headline: The Government of Assam cleared tea plantation in Doloo Tea Estate near Silchar city for acquiring land to construct a Greenfield Airport. The acquisition has been strongly resisted by Tea Estate's workers.

name: Hidroeléctrica Palo Viejo, Guatemala
headline: Communities Mayan-Ixil are denied proper consultation in this ENEL-owned CDM registered project. They opposed construction and blocked the road.

name: Roma halted the demolition of their houses in Perpignan, France
headline: In already marginalised neighbourhood with poor health conditions, Roma people stopped Urban Renewal Plan, which otherwise would have end in their displacement, loss of history and cultural heritage of Roma people in the city.

name: Proposed High Grand Falls Multipurpose Dam, Kenya
Mersinli Wind Farm, Turkey
headline: Residents of some villages in western Turkey resist the implementation of a 55 MW wind farm project. They objected to the EIA. The project is proceeding.

name: Kushiro coal-fired power plant and coal mining,  Hokkaido, Japan
headline: Residents oppose the operation of the new coal-fired power plant and revival of coal mining in Hokkaido, Japan

name: Hambantota Port Development Project, Sri Lanka
headline: Police used water cannons in clashes between government supporters and villagers (and monks) who marched against the grabbing of private land for an industrial zone and port  supported by China.

name: Kayerekera Uranium Extraction, Malawi
Pollution from Nikšić Steel Factory , Montenegro
headline: The fourth attempt of privatization of the Nikšić Steel Factory resulted in technological improvements and pollution reduction, which was welcomed by the citizens. However, the few remaining factory workers are dissatisfied with poor working conditions.

name: Proposed copper mine on a land sacred to the indigenous Apache of Arizona, USA
headline: Environmentalists and Native American Apache group strongly oppose a massive Rio Tinto and BHP copper mine project on a land of environmental and cultural importance.

name: Nouveau Monde’s Matawinie graphite mine in Quebec, Canada
headline: In Matawinie in Quebec, a graphite mining project proposed by Nouveau Monde Graphite has sparked opposition from local citizen organizations and the Atikamekw First Nation for the socio-environmental impacts it could cause.

name: Itoiz dam, Spain
Tiradero Tetlama, Morelos, Mexico
headline: A waste dump in Tetlama, Milpilla received about 9 million tons of waste for 30 years until the local inhabitants blockaded the incoming trucks in 2006. Resistance in Alpuyeca continues still in 2017.

name: Ganeshpur Coal Mine, Jharkhand, India
Peaceful students march against copper mine in Dawu, TAP Golog, Qinghai, China
headline: On July 2011, over 400 students marched on a 60 km to the site of a copper mine in Dawu, and staged a sit-in at the county government offices to protest against environmental problems. The authorities declared the demonstration like a political act.

name: Tratamiento de Residuos Sólidos Urbanos y emergencia ambiental en Atitalaquia, México
headline: No Al Basurero combate la contaminación en Atitalaquia y exige justicia por el asesinato de su compañero “Chuy”, asesinado en junio 2022 durante una protesta pacifica.

name: Lut Lut / Than Phyo Thu coal power station, Myeik, Myanmar
headline: ‘Save our villages’. Residents from Lut Lut and Tamothe villages mobilize against the plans for a 50 MW coal-fired power plant to protect their farming and fishing-based livelihoods.

name: Maheshwar Dam - Narmada Valley, India
Proyectos mineros Condor de Oro en territorio Awajuns, Rio Chirinos, Perú
headline: "Ahora con la presencia de la empresa minera que ha venido a sacar oro ... se está envenenando el agua. Por eso la población no tiene donde ir a pescar. Estamos sufriendo porque no hay comida" Apu Awajun.

name: Chevron and Shell Ravage Escravos, Nigeria
Shrimp farms v. fishermen in Santa Rita, Brazil
Kajbar Dam hydropower scheme, Sudan
Kyaukphyu Port, Rakhine State, Myanmar
headline: Myanmar is planning to build its largest port, linked to China, in the restive area of Rakhine state. Thousands will be displaced to make room for the port.

name: Teshima island, waste dispute, Japan
headline: Over 700,000 tons of industrial waste, including heavy metals, PCB, oil and shredded material were illegally dumped on this tiny island. ShozoAki, a young resident, led a grassroots campaign after 1990 against the industrial waste disposal business.

name: MSPP Oil Palm plantation in Tanintharyi region, Myanmar
headline: Communities renounce through peaceful protest the MSPP Oil Palm Plantation that has encroached their indigenous lands

name: Playa Potrero, Costa Rica
Waterfront South as Environmental Sacrifice Zone in Camden, NJ, USA
headline: Dirty Jersey: The Camden Crisis. The Waterfront South Community experiences persistent toxic racism in the face of extreme industrial pollution including cement operations.

name: Uranium mining and tailings, Mailuu-Suu aka “Mailbox 200”, Kyrgyzstan
headline: Thousands of tonnes of radioactive waste accumulated in the town of Mailuu-Suu since the Soviet era,  upstream of the Syr Darya river basin.

name: Haida Gwaii Geo-engineering Planktos, BC, Canada
Nagan Raya Coal-fired Power Plant, Aceh Province, Indonesia
headline: The Nagan Raya/Meulaboh coal-fired power plant is building two new units, but has seen much opposition from the local population due to issues of land compensation and its effect on air and water quality in the area.

name: Opposition to reclamation projects in the city of Makassar, Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: The reclamation activities in 2015-17 for the Centre Point of Indonesia project and the Makassar new port development,  encountered fierce resistance from fisher people because of destruction of ecosystems and livelihoods

name: Shell Spills Bodo Community, Nigeria
Mountain Top Removal for Coal Production in Kanawha County, West Virginia, USA
headline: Residents roll back Keystone's Mountain Top Removal Plans in West Virginia in 2016. The fight against mountain top removal mining continues with great difficulty under the new Republican Administration.

name: Illegal logging in Sagaing region - Killing of journalist Soe Moe Tun, Myanmar
headline: Sagaing region has one of the highest deforestation rates in Myanmar. In December 2016, journalist Soe Moe Tun was found beaten to death while he was reporting on logging issues in Monywa, the area’s commercial hub

name: Elderly activist nun's civic actions exposing nuclear threats at Oak Ridge, Tennessee, USA
headline: Oak Ridge is a complex of government nuclear facilities. Sister Megan Rice and two other activists infiltrated one of the buildings to expose nuclear military threats, and went jail for it.

name: Coal mining project Mina Guaíba, Río Grande del Sul, Brazil
headline: The Guaíba Mine is a project that aims to extract 166 million tons of coal threatening nearby environmental reserves including the Jacuí River Delta and livelihoods of local farmers.

name: Trafigura's toxic waste scandal and the closure of Akouédo dump, Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire
headline: The 2019 closure of Abidjan's notorious Akouédo dump displaced numerous waste pickers. The site became internationally known in 2006 when the company Trafigura illegally dumped a shipload of toxic waste and harmed the health of over 100,000 people.

name: Wilmar in Jambi province, Indonesia
Puerto de Civitavecchia
headline: El primer puerto de crucero en Europa es una de las principales causas de contaminación del área de Civitavecchia.

name: Gambela agri-export land dispossessions, Ethiopia
Nuclear military testing accident, Severodvinsk, Arctic coast, Russia
headline: High levels of radiation near two abandoned barges, which were brought ashore after an explosion of military testing, and which  and reported by local residents of a nearby village at Russia’s Arctic coast .

name: Killing of anti-mining activists in Compostela, Mindanao, Philippines
headline: There is constant repression against farmers and indigenous populations complaining against large scale mining in Southern Midanao. Killings are on the rise.

name: Transnet dig-out port proposal in Durban, South Africa
headline: Transnet proposed to build an expansion for Durban Harbour. Activists and community members fought against it for a decade owing to the potential for significant social and ecological consequences.

name: Noordoostpolder Wind Farm, Netherlands
headline: In 2002 the plan to build the park was signed and approved unanimously by the Noordoostpolder municipal council. The largest local opposition group, the so-called 'Urk Briest,' wanted more influence over the project and in 2008 the conflict has begun.

name: Arco Sur Milpa Alta, Ciudad de Mexico
headline: A new project for a 235 km road to the south of Mexico City connecting with Morelos and Puebla was born in 2010, the so-called Arco Sur. It would be built on communal lands and protected natural areas. The opposition stopped the project.

name: Airport in Ebonyi State, Nigeria
headline: Allocation of a large area of land for a cargo airport triggered protests by people facing displacement from their ancestral homes and farmland. Bulldozers demolished homes and destroyed people's farmland and crops, leaving many without food and shelter.

name: Beaver Lake Cree Nation vs. Canada and Alberta, Canada
headline: The Beaver Lake Cree Nation are taking on the Alberta and Canadian governments in a ground breaking case against cumulative impacts from the Tar Sands.  They are fight the tar sands, exercising energy sovereignty and building alternatives.

name: Arctic Railway project to Norway through Sámi territory, Finland
headline: The Arctic Railway would run through traditional Sámi territory between Rovaniemi in Finland to Kirkenes in Norway. It is resisted by Sámi communities and Greenpeace.

name: Nuclear Weapons Test Site, Novaya Zemlya, Arctic Russia
headline: Novaya Zemlya was designated a nuclear weapons test site. Nenets Indigenous were forcibly resettled. Over the course of 40 years, 132 nuclear explosions took place the area.

name: Yes 2 Renewables campaign #VRET, Victoria, Australia
headline: Successful advocacy against coal, for a Renewable Energy Target by Yes 2 Renewables, securing jobs and investment in the renewable energy sector and supporting clean energy for current and future generations.

name: Tabacundo canal water conflict, Ecuador.
Lower Subansiri Hydroelectric Power Project, India
Dickson, Tennessee: the poster child for environmental racism and toxic dumping, USA
Children sickened by lead from Wugang Manganese Smelting Plant, Hunan, China
headline: More than 1,300 children who lived near a manganese processing plant in Wenping township in Hunan province were found to have excessive lead in their blood, which triggered protests by parents.

name: Plantacion de pino FACE, Profafor, Ecuador
Construction delay of the Flamanville Nuclear EPR, Normandy, France
headline: The expensive construction of Flamanville EPR (European Pressurized Reactor) began in 2007, to be added to two pressurized water reactors (PWRs).  The EPR is heavily contested by Greenpeace, Sortir du Nucléaire and local EJOs.

name: Exploración petrolera en corredor PuertoVega-Teteyé, Colombia
headline: Existe una relación inversamente proporcional entre la renta petrolera obtenida por las transnacionales y los padecimientos de las comunidades. El Putumayo es testigo de esa evidencia.

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Los Encinos, Honduras
headline: Not only Berta Cáceres and the Agua Zarca dam; more dams are planned and under construction in the Lenca indigenous land. Repression and deaths of environmental defenders go together with the sell off of natural resources by the illegitimate government.

name: Extracción de Petróleo en Laguna del Tigre, Petén, Guatemala
headline: Perenco, transnacional franco-británica explota petróleo en un área protegida de la Reserva de la Biosfera Maya  resguardada por el mismo ejército guatemalteco

name: Nuclear power station in Ferrel, Peniche, Portugal
headline: Campaign in Portugal "For Life and Against Nuclear" manages to halt nuclear power development. A national campaign claims that: "We are all residents of Ferrel" - and we are all impacted by nuclear energy.

name: Valle de Siria , Honduras
Bastar Forestry Project 1975, Chhattisgarh, India
headline: Bastar Forestry Project was jointly funded by the World Bank and the Indian Government in 1975. The objective was to "develop" this “backward” region through 40,000 ha of plantation of Caribbean pine.
