name: Nuclear Power Station in Almaraz, Spain
headline: The Almaraz nuclear power station (two reactors of over 1000 MW each) on the Tagus River, is getting old and dangerous. There are renewed protests both in Spain and Portugal.

name: Somalia toxic waste dumping, Somalia
PFAS pollution by Chemours/Dupont, Dordrecht, The Netherlands
headline: Chemours/Dupont released carcinogenic PFAS substances into the environment since the 1960s, endangering employees and local residents. Resistance to such "forever chemicals" has led to multiple lawsuits against the company.

name: Disposal of low-level nuclear waste at Sierra Blanca radioactive waste site, Texas USA
headline: Sierra Blanca was the proposed site for a nuclear waste landfill in a disenfranchised community in Texas, which would have endangered the environment and the water of the Juárez Valley.

name: Acacia Mining North Mara Gold Mine (former Barrick Gold), Tanzania
headline: The Mine opened in 2002, is owned by the UK public company Acacia Mining (formerly African Barrick Gold). Intead of bringing wealth for locals, the presence of the firm has provoked water contamination and human rights abuses

name: Mithivirdi nuclear power station, Bhavnagar, India
Contaminación atmosférica por la quema de ramas del espárrago en Caborca Sonora, Mexico
headline: La quema a cielo abierto de ramas del cultivo intensivo de espárrago perjudica al ambiente y la salud de las personas en el municipio de Caborca.

name: Land and livelihood conflicts in Bhitarkanika Wildlife Sanctuary and mangrove forest , Odisha, India
headline: A large mangrove forest with much biodiversity is the scene of a dispute between conservationists, small farmers and inland fisherfolks, and the illegal prawn industry.

name: Exploitation of Forests, Cameroon
headline: Since the 1950s, unsustainable logging in Cameroon has threatened rainforest biodiversity and the indigenous communities' survival.

name: British nuclear tests at Maralinga, Australia
headline: The environmental injustice of British Nuclear Tests at Maralinga between 1956 and 1963. Several nuclear tests took place with yields ranging from 1 to 27 kilotonnes of TNT. Persistent radioactive pollution.

name: Haida Gwai Forestry Conflicts
headline: Haida resistance to industrial logging in Haida Gwaii,  over the past 4 decades has transformed the political and environmental map of Canada.

name: Phosphate Mining on Nauru
headline: Over a century of phosphate mining has rendered most of the island of Nauru uninhabitable. Colonialism and extensive mining has resulted in a huge loss of traditional culture and the country becoming reliant on foreign aid.

name: Illegal logging in Snuol Wildlife Sanctuary, Cambodia
Pazardzhik Incinerator, Bulgaria
Bunkering related pollution, Gibraltar and Spain
headline: Refueling ships with oil in a low-tax area. Conservationism, ecology, workers and oil industry on a common ring.

name: Iron ore mining in Dantewada, Chhattisgarh, India
headline: Dantewada, one of the most iron ore rich districts in India faces the 'resource curse'. Indigenous adivasi communities are forced to live amidst violence, harrassment, and intimidation by police, heavy militarization, and Naxalite presence.

name: Samarco Tailings Dam Failure in Mariana, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: The tailing dams failure in the iron ore mine in Mariana (Minas Gerais) belonging to the Vale and BHP Billiton companies, caused outrage because of loss of human lives and heavy pollution in the Rio Doce.

name: Open-cast mining at Sefateng Chrome Mine in Limpopo, South Africa
headline: The mine has contributed to pollution, land dispossession, and mass unemployment for the  local farming villages. The company continues to ignore or commit violence against people protesting injustices.

name: Deadly mining of white clay, Bangladesh
headline: Mining of white clay (kaolin), used in ceramics, cosmetics, and other uses, has destroyed hills, forested areas, agricultural lands and wetlands and has killed and displaced tribals.

name: Oil Spill at Ikarama Community, Nigeria
Tolak Reklamasi movement against artificial islands (reclamation) project, Bali, Indonesia
headline: Since 2012 mass demonstrations have been occurring almost weekly in different parts of Bali against the reclamation project under the slogan "Tolak reklamasi" (Stop reclamation project).

name: Port Colborne Class Action Lawsuit Against Vale, Canada
headline: Largest class action lawsuit for environmental damage in the history of Canada was filed by residents of Port Colborne against Vale/Inco. In the end, the Supreme Court sided with Vale and denied the residents the awarded compensation.

name: Proyecto hidroeléctrico Xacbal, Guatemala
headline: El proyecto hidroeléctrico Xacbal, uno de los más grandes de Centroamérica bajo el Proyecto Mesoamérica, causó desplazamiento y ningún beneficio para la población local. A pesar de esto, está registrado bajo MDL y está en operación desde 2010.

name: Pollution of Veliki Backi kanal, Serbia
headline: Veliki backi kanal continues being an environmental black spot in Serbia given that the waste water treatment plant still has not started operating.

name: Humedal Tibanica  Bogotá, Colombia
headline: Los conflictos socioambientales del humedal Tibanica están relacionados con el recurso agua, narrativas de cuidado, protección y políticas que agudizan la situación. La disputa está centrada por el déficit de agua que trae perdida de la biodiversidad.

name: The Malagrotta landfill and speculation in the Galeria Valley, Italy
headline: The largest landfill in Europe shut down thanks to protesters and local residents; enough with unfortunate speculative waste management, it's time to go for "zero waste"

name: Dumpsite pollution and waste pickers struggle in Siem Reap, Cambodia
headline: In proximity to the world-famous Angkor temples, waste from tourism and the entire Siem Reap province is thrown to the Anlong Pi dump without any control. While residents demand its closure, hundreds of waste pickers survive by collecting recyclables.

name: Eucapacific eucalyptus plantations, Ecuador
Allouk Water Station Shutdown and Humanitarian crisis, Syria
headline: Activists launched a social media campaign, titled "Thirst suffocates al-Hasakah," to urge Turkey and its allied armed factions to restart the Alouk station and provide water to the city of al-Hasakah.

name: Israeli settlement industries polluting Tulkarem, Palestine
headline: Israeli chemical plant closed down by court order in Israel due to toxic emissions has now moved across the green line and continues to operate leading to serious health impacts.

name: Eucalyptus plantations in São Luiz do Paraitinga. “Deserto Verde” in  São Paulo, Brazil
headline: Pulp mill industries increased eucalyptus plantations for cellulose production. Strong reaction against three large production industries in the region – Votorantim, Suzano and Nobrecel.

name: Centromin´s San Luis Mine in El Carmen de Chucurí, Santander, Colombia
headline: Centromin´s San Luis Mine was suspended for breaking environmental regulations. After suspiciously reopening, environmental and social injustices continue with impunity, killing Fabiola Fajardo Ayala and threatening others.

name: Environmental Racism in Africville, Nova Scotia, Canada
headline: In this stark case of environmental racism, Africville residents were exposed to toxic waste while denied basic services like water and sewers. In the 1960s the town was bulldozed and residents evicted.

name: Unregulated tourism in eco-sensitive coral island, Bangladesh
headline: Despite categoric directions from the judiciary, unregulated tourism in the eco-sensitive and only coral island of Bangladesh is causing erosion, loss of biodiversity including 2 species of globally threatened turtles, scenic vistas, water  contamination.

name: Masacre en Totonicapán en protestas por el precio de la electricidad, Guatemala
headline: Killing by the army of at least eight Maya-k’ichés indigenous people in Guatemala in 2012 while complaining against the price of electricity

name: Qinhuangdao Western (Panguanying) waste incineration plant, Hebei, China
headline: Villagers in Panguanying protested against Qinhuangdao waste incineration plant through petitions, administrative lawsuits, and participation of elections, which resulted in halting the project.

name: Besqab and Uppsala Municipality Development Plans, Sweden
headline: The fight for Blodstensskogen! A battle between developers Besqab and the people of Eriksberg who want to preserve the forest for the important biodiversity under threat.

name: Pig iron industries in Piquiá de Baixo, Maranhão, Brazil
headline: After ten years of struggle, families affected by the pig iron industry in Piquiá de Baixo will be resettled to a new neighborhood without contamination. The name chosen for the neighborhood is Piquiá da Conquista (Piquiá of Conquest).

name: Manta-Manaus Multimodal Corridor, Ecuador/Peru/Brazil
headline: The titanic project belongs to IRSA plans and despite its numerous financial, environmental and social inadequacies, it is still backed by political elites and national and international companies

name: Holtec Nuclear Waste Disposal in Plymouth County, MA, US
headline: Residents and fishing communities in Cape Cod, Massachusetts, USA are fighting to protect the bay from Holtec International, who intends to dump radioactive wastewater from the decommissioned Pilgrim Nuclear Plant into the bay.

name: Invasive species in Lake Victoria, Kenya
Iron ore mining in Curral Novo, Piauí, Brazil
headline: Iron mining project and a new railway threaten rural communities in Piauí, in the semi-arid region of Brazil. Opposition strongly supported by  Catholic church.

name: Pakyong Airport, India
headline: Construction of Pakyong Airport, at high altitude on a steep mountainside, was delayed by the challenging terrain and protests by residents demanding fair compensation for loss of their homes and farmland, which continued after inauguration of the project

name: Cirebon I and II Coal Power Plants, West Java,  Indonesia
headline: Local, national and international mobilization is being seen against the already in operation coal-fired plant Cirebon I, as well as its extension Cirebon II, which is still under construction.

name: Floating nuclear power plant, Pevek, Arctic Russia
headline: A highly dangerous floating nuclear power plant is placed in the arctic town of Pevek despite the opposition from Greenpeace and other environmental groups.

name: Mining Project Warintza de Solaris ResSource Inc., Ecuador
headline: The Shuar Arutam people fight against the mining project of the Canadian company Solaris RevSources who threatens their territory.

name: Red Hill Underground Fuel Storage Facility - jet fuel leak, USA
headline: Red Hill Bulk Fuel Storage Facility is located directly above an aquifer that hundreds of thousands of Honolulu residents depend upon for drinking water. The inadequate response to a jet fuel leak in 2014 led to calls for the facility to be closed down.

name: Bergama Gold Mine, Turkey
Lignite mining Welzow-Sued II (Welzow, Proschim), Germany
Monocultivo de avellana en Tuscia
headline: El monocultivo de Ferrero en el Viterbo y los impactos en el lago Vico

name: Murta dam, MG, Brazil
Oil exploitation in Campo del Libertador, Ecuador
FFS Refiners chemical pollution in Durban, South Africa
headline: FFS Refiners has repeatedly polluted South Durban with fumes that smell strongly like cat urine. The refinery also had an oil spill in September 2012 mere months after a waste stream incident.

name: Jumbo Glacier Resort, Canada
headline: A long-standing conflict between Glacier Ski Resorts Ltd., the British Columbian Government, the Ktunaxa First Nation, conservationists and local communities.

name: Cerro Blanco, Guatemala
Alluvial gold mining affecting 4 Shor villages in Askizsky District, Khakassia, Russian Federation
headline: Alluvial gold mining is destroying Shorians environment, cultures, and traditions. Communities report the issues they face due to illegal gold mining in a joint report with national and international NGOs.

name: Kenney Dam, British Columbia, Canada
headline: Washed Away: Kenney Dam flooded Chelsetta lands and villages to produce hydropower for Alcan's (now Rio Tinto's) aluminium smelter. In 1950 the government invited Alcan to explore the potential of sites around the country for hydroelectricity.

name: San Jorge threatens Uspallata, Mendoza, Argentina
headline: The "asambleas autoconvocadas"  (self-summoned assemblies) manage to stop this gold and copper mining project, near the Aconcagua.

name: Orica (company) v. Botany (community), Australia
Myitsone dam on Irrawaddy river, Myanmar
Conflict over water distribution among local dwellers and Real State investors in Marbella, Guanacaste, Costa Rica
headline: In the driest province of Costa Rica, Real State investors are threatening the present and future access to freshwater to local communities.

name: Mina de oro y plata Cerro Vanguardia, Argentina
headline: First metalliferous mining project in argentinean Patagonia. Corporate social responsibility, suspicions of contamination and lack of socio-environmental mobilization.

name: Despojo por posesión ilegal de tierras en Cerro Prieto, Querétaro, Mexico
headline: Despojo de tierras ejidales para un desarrollo inmobiliario en el municipio de El Marqués, Querétaro

name: Law for the Protection of Iberian Wolves, Spain
Timber logging in the Dvinsky Forest, Russia
headline: Intact Forest Landscapes, very important biodiversity hot spots, in the Arkhangelsk Oblast of Russia are intensively logged via clear-cutting by the timber sector. There are demands to protect the Dvinsky Forest Reserve.

name: Jatropha plantation project in Patan district, Gujarat, India
Bumbuna II Dam, Sierra Leone
headline: The second phase of the Bumbuna Hydroelectric Project reaches out to construct another dam 32km upstream of Bumbuna I close to the village Yiben on the same river. The destruction of the wetland will cost the livelhood of the surrounded villages.

name: Wirikuta silver and gold mining, Mexico
headline: Silver and gold mining in sacred land belonging to the Wixárica people. Strong, peaceful successful resistance against foreign companies and local government.

name: Megaproyecto energético Proyecto Integral Morelos, México
headline: Lucha de los pueblos de Morelos, Puebla y Tlaxcala contra la implementación de un megaproyecto energético (gasoducto, termoeléctrica, acueducto y línea de transmisión) ligado al proceso de urbanización e industrialización en el centro del país.

name: The impacts of fishing agreements with Chinese investors in Madagascar
headline: The new fisheries investment agreement between Madagascar and China in September 2018 raises concerns of small-scale fisher communities wanting to avoid outside grabbing of their marine resources.

name: Vasove Vode Illegal Landfill, Montenegro
headline: The citizens of Berane managed to close the illegal landfill Vasove vode in 2014, however they are still waiting for remediation of the site.

name: Kusile coal-fired Power Station protest, South Africa
headline: One of the world's four largest coal-fired Power Stations, the Kusile Powerplant, sparks protests over its environmental impacts.

name: Proyecto minero Polimetálico Castellanos, Pinar del Río, Cuba
headline: Un plan de relanzamiento de la minería en Minas de Matahambre. Académicos advierten sobre altos impactos mientras voceros oficiales afirman que no habrá impactos socio-ambientales

name: La ampliación de la autopista Valle-Coche en Caracas, Venezuela
headline: A major highway in Caracas generates large deforestation. It covers the Valle river. Neighbors and organizations complain but the project was done. The green areas of the city are the target of new developments.

name: Dixie Meadows Geothermal Plant, Nevada, USA
headline: Construction of a geothermal plant on public lands in Nevada that have a history of white settlement and military operations threatens lands sacred to the Fallon Paiute-Shoshone Tribe and regional biodiversity.

name: Ikot Ado Udo Case, Nigeria
Oil pipeline and refinery in Balboa, Extremadura, Spain
Shougang, Marcona, Perú
The Dalieh of Raouche, Lebanon
headline: Development frenzy in Beirut has led to illegal privatization and fencing-off of the seashore from the public. Today, development plans threaten Dalieh, a prominent landmark in Beirut and one of the last remaining public spaces along Beirut's shoreline

name: Expansion of US Military base puts endangered Henoko Bay Dugong at risk on Okinawa, Japan
headline: Henoko Bay Dugong and rare corals are endangered by the expansion of a  U.S. Base in Okinawa. A coalition of environmentalist organizations oppose the plan.

name: Limits to lignite mining, Horní Jiřetín, Czech Republic
headline: “System change, not Climate Change”. Climate activists join in solidarity with other "blockadia" like movements and actions in Europe to say Leave the Coal in the Hole!"

name: Saugeen Ojibway Nation vote “no” against the building of nuclear waste storage, Lake Huron, Ontario, Canada
headline: The Saugeen Ojibway Nation in Ontario Canada successfully stopped the construction of a low to intermediate nuclear waste repository on their territories, due to a community referendum which produced a unanimous "no" vote.

name: Wadi Al Qamar residents and Alexandria portland cement, Egypt
headline: Residents of Wadi Al-Qamar area in Alexandria suffer from environmental pollution, and deterioration of health because of Alexandria Portland cement factory located next to their homes

name: Fighting to Protect Miccosukee Tribal Rights in the Everglades, Florida, US
headline: Miccosukee tribal lands and sovereignty are threatened by water pollution. The Miccosukee Tribe relies on the integrity of the Everglades ecosystem to support their religion, culture and economic propserity.

name: E-waste in Lagos, Nigeria
headline: The e-waste sector poses serious health and environmental risk for both the immediate neighbouring communities at the dumpsites and the workers. However, the latter are economically tied to continuing the occupation

name: Coal Run neighborhood in Zanesville, Ohio, USA
headline: 50 year-long battle to reclaim right to clean water and sanitation in Ohio; read about the successful achievement of a black community (despite the shamefully long time it took..)

name: Puerto Petaca Bahia de Taganga, Colombia
Amoco Cadiz oil spill in 1978 in Britanny, France.
headline: The Amoco Cadiz, transporting 223,000 tonnes of crude oil and 4,000 tonnes of bunker fuel, suffered a failure of her steering mechanism. It ran aground on Portsall Rockst  polluting 360 km of shoreline from Brest to Saint Brieuc.

name: Sirindhorn Dam, Thailand
Balog-Balog Multipurpose Dam Project, Tarlac, Luzon, The Philippines
headline: The Balog-Balog dam and irrigation project, proposed in the '90s is still under construction. It could displace at least 1,650 mostly indigenous Aeta families and aggravate flood risks.

name: Fuleni blockade and leave the coal in the hole campaign, South Africa
headline: The Fuleni proposed open cast coal mine in Kwa Zulu Natal stands very near the border of the very valuable Hluhluwe-iMfolozi Wilderness area. There is confluence of protests from conservationists and local people.

name: Proposed Dolphinarium in Pigeon Island, Saint Lucia
headline: Dolphin Fantaseas proposed a dolphinarium on Pigeon Island in 2003 that would have devastated the marine ecosystem. Jane Tipson started a movement against it but was assassinated for her activism.  The movement continues to fight dolphinariums today.

name: Roma were evicted twice from their settlement nearby Oslo, Norway
headline: In July 2012, a 200-people group composed mainly of Roma settled in an abandoned quarry nearby Oslo, in Norway, since they had been evicted or expulsed from other settling places.

name: Enel geothermal plants in Mt. Amiata, Italy
Czeczott coal power plant, Silesia, Poland
headline: In 2013 Kompania Węglowa signed an agreement with Mitsui to build a 1000 MW coal power plant in Wola, Silesia. Environmental and health NGOs and local citizens successfully opposed the project.

name: Sand mining project in  Pro Trach village, Thua Thien Hue, Vietnam
headline: This conflict centered on the operations of a sand mining company that affected local water supply, damaged burial grounds and destroyed a community's forest plantation. However, they were not able to get adequate compensation for their tree loss.

name: SOCAPALM conflicts, Cameroon
headline: One of the most (in)famous cases of high-profile slapp suits against journalists daring to explain social and environmental injustices in rubber and palm oil plantations and other business in the 'Françafrique'.

name: Oil exploitation conflict in Buliisa District, Uganda
headline: Conflicts between Tullow oil company and local people and pastoralists, near  Lake Albert. Involves land grabbing and population displacement. Threat to wildlife.

name: Gas Pipelines Urucu-Coari-Manaus & Urucu-Porto Velho - Petrobras, Brazil
headline: The 670km long pipeline between Urucu and Manaus fuels the industrialization of the Amazon and its transformation into a field for fossil fuels drilling, while the pipeline from Urucu to Porto Velho pushes further the rainforest frontier.

name: Severstals steel plant, Russia
Dexing copper mine and metals pollution, Jiangxi, China
headline: Mining and processing activities at the Dexing Copper mine caused soil contamination in the surrounding area and water pollution along the Le'an River, threatening the health of villagers. Dozens of residents suffered from cancer.

name: Fairy Creek Logging Conflict, British Columbia, Canada
headline: A conflict between land defenders and the Teal-Jones lumber company at Fairy Creek, Pacheedaht First Nation territory, on Vancouver Island, British Columbia

name: Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation Pipeline Pollutes Groundwater of Baruwa community, Abesan state, Nigeria
headline: In 1996, the Baruwa community in Lagos, Nigeria, found that more than 180 wells had become contaminated by petroleum products. Now  ¾ sectors of the Jakande estate are contaminated.

name: Mondi Merebank Multifuel Boiler in Durban, South Africa
headline: In 2002, the Mondi Paper Company received permits to build a new boiler for its waste incinerator. Protesters rallied and legally fought against the plan but could not stop it from being completed in 2006.

name: Installation of the pipeline of the company Ferrous Resources do Brasil S.A. in the municipality of Viçosa, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: Popular mobilisation against the land dispossession and water impacts of an iron ore pipeline force Ferrous company to withdraw and cancel its project in Minas Gerais.

name: Fracking among fruit trees in Allen, Río Negro, Argentina
headline: Tight gas exploitation by fracking the "Alto Valle del Río Negro", a fruit growing region (pears and apples). Small farmers, lacking State support  lease their land to oil and gas companies.

name: Hazardous e-waste recycling in Agbogbloshie, Accra, Ghana
headline: The slum of Agbogbloshie is the world’s largest e-waste dump. While pollution in land, air, waters and bodies has reached dramatic levels, the work of thousands of informal recyclers in dismantling and repairing electronics remains largely unacknowledged.

name: Norra Kärr near lake Vättern, Sweden
headline: The Norra Kärr mine project is located in Jönköping county. It contains rare earth minerals and a zirconium reserve. It threatens lake Vattern and surrounding natural areas. In 2016 the supreme administrative court of Sweden withdrew the concession.

name: Relleno sanitario (Landfill), El Carrasco, Bucaramanga, Colombia
Hacienda Bellacruz, Colombia
Farmers struggle to keep using traditional seeds varieties, Canada
headline: Canadian Government did not listen to farmer-s protests against Bill C-18: the Bill is now Law and will obstacle the use of traditional seeds varieties.

name: Rio Tinto's lawsuit, Bougainville, Papua New Guinea
headline: The reopening the controversial Panguna copper mine in Bougainville, an autonomous region of Papua New Guinea, is in doubt. The anti-mining movement led to a ten-year war in 1989. A court case against Rio Tinto failed.

name: A blockade on uranium exploration, Athabasca Basin, Saskatchewan, Canada
headline: Canada is a major producer of uranium, the main producing region is the Athabasca Basin. In this case, the Birch Narrows Dene Nation erected a blockade after the uranium exploration company entered its territory without consent.

name: Cerro Quema, Panama
headline: Este proyecto ha sido sistematicamente rechazado por diversos sectores de la comunidad. El movimiento organizado mas antiguo es el Frente Santeno contra la Mineria.

name: Dabar Hydro Power Plant, Bosnia and Herzegovina
headline: The HPP Dabar is under construction despite of irregularities in the project EIA study and active opposition by national and international NGOs and scientists.

name: Waste-to-energy project in Yunan of Yunfu City, Guangdong, China
headline: The government of Yunfu County in Guangdong province cancelled a waste-to-energy project after a mass protest in June 2019.

name: Greenpeace's resistance to deepwater drilling in Shetland Islands, United Kingdom
headline: Edimburgh court ordered Greenpeace to stop its direct action against the Chevron’s prospect for deepwater drilling. Greenpeace swimmers against a Chevron-chartered ship and expert climbers spent four days hanging off the ship.

name: IndoMet project, coal mining in East and Central Kalimantan, Indonesia
headline: Started by BHP Billiton and known as the "worst of worst coal projects", it threatens local indigenous peoples and Borneo's mega-diverse  forest ecosystems.

name: Gaoling waste incinerator in Xi’an, Shaanxi, China
headline: Thousands of Gaoling citizens took to the streets for a week in October 2016 to protest against a waste incinerator. Despite promises by local authorities, residents continued the protest risking police repression and arrests.

name: Minería de antimonio y tungsteno en San Ildefonso Ixtahuacán, Huehuetenango, Guatemala
headline: En 1977 se llevó a cabo en Guatemala la Gran Marcha de los Mineros de Ixtahuacán. En total participaron 15.000 personas que demandaban justicia social y justicia ambiental.

name: San Francisco first Critical Mass as a challenge to pro-automobile urban planning, USA
headline: Car and oil industries helped to shape the city of San Francisco around the private vehicles. Within this context, in the early 1990s a world famous form of cycling protests appeared: The “Critical Mass”.

name: Hoa Binh Hydropower Dam, Vietnam
Protest against heavy pollution from Russian nickel plant in Kirkenes, Norway
headline: Civil society groups protest for three decades against the smelter in Nikel, only a few kilometres from Russia's border to Norway.

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico La Aurora, Honduras
headline: En el municipio de San José,  se construye la  hidroeléctrica Aurora sin consulta previa de las comunidades indígenas Lenca.

name: Public Interest Litigation against Yannan Thermal Power Plant for excessive emissions in Inner Mongolia, China
headline: In 2016, All-China Environment Federation filed a PIL at the Hulunbuir Intermediate People’s Court, sueing the Yannan Thermal Power Plant of Dayan Mining Industry Group for excessive pollutant emissions.

name: Turismo en territorio Pemon en el Parque Nacional Canaima, Venezuela
headline: From the 1990s until today, the Pemon have faced the imposition of an electricity cable that crosses their territory, the threat to build a hotel complex named  Turisur, and mining in the Sierra de Imataca, their ancestral home.

name: Copper mining in Tamo, monks and citizens protest, Tibet, China
headline: On November 22, 2010 there was a protest to disrupt mining works from a government mining near Lingka Monastery in Tamo. Many Tibetans were beaten and 15 of them, including 5 monks, were arrested by the Chinese police and someone is still imprisoned.

name: Women against “green deserts” (eucalyptus monoculture), R.G. do Sul, Brazil
headline:
Mulheres Em Ação, Eucalipto No Chão! _x000D_
Direct actions against eucalyptus plantations on Women´s Day 2006. against the Aracruz company.

name: Barro Blanco dam, Panama
headline: Panamese government ordered a hold on the Dam project for violating the EIA on Feb 10th 2015  after many years of opposition by the Movimiento 10 de Abril and the Ngöbe-Bugle communities

name: Eti Silver Cyanide Mine, Turkey
Nuclear colonialism and French nuclear tests, Polynesia
headline: French Polynesia was used as a nuclear test territory for over 30 years affecting the environment and health of thousands for local dwellers. Up to 2019, struggles for compensations and reparations to the victims still continue.

name: Nairobi National Park and Southern bypass, Kenya
Siarzewo dam, Poland
headline: For years, false information has been disseminated about the need to build the barrage on the lower Vistula in Siarzewo, the purpose of which would be to 'support' the aging Włocławek dam. There is a chance that this monument to communism won't be created

name: The former airport of Hellinikon and the coastal front of Ag.Kosmas, Greece
headline: In March 2011 was created the movement named "Struggle Committee for the Metropolitan Park"  fighting for the creation of a metropolitan park following the ratification of the contract of the new airport at Spata in eastern Attica

name: Hydropower plants in Yich Ki'sis,  San Mateo Ixtatán, Guatemala
headline: In the northern lands of Huehuetenango, the defense of hydroelectric projects of transnational companies is again militarized and criminalized, while the population resists and has little access to electricity.

name: Estrazione di idrocarburi Total | Tempa Rossa, Italy
headline: Vent'anni di sfruttamento della Basilicata: quando il petrolio, anche se di scarsa qualità, è più importante della salute e dei cittadini

name: Tourism development in the Nature Park Stara planina, Serbia
headline: Serbian government modified national laws to allow for ski tourism development in the Stara planina nature park

name: Julius Nyerere International Airport, Tanzania
headline: Three settlements were demolished to make way for a 3rd terminal at Julius Nyerere International Airport. Resettlement areas lacked a clean water supply and people were at increased risk of homelessness, joblessness, food insecurity and loss of livelihood

name: West African Gas Pipeline, from Nigeria to Ghana
headline: Despite initial opposition to the construction of the WAGP and current operation problems and insufficiencies, the pipeline is in operation.

name: Coal Ash Dump Site in Bokoshe in OK, USA
headline: Having Fun, dumping ashes and still making money; residents in Oklahoma dealing with 80 truckloads of fly on a daily basis

name: Stepanovsky coal mine, Novokuznetsk, Russia
headline: Local residents collectively protest against the illegal coal mine. However, the governor gave a green light for mining activities to continue.

name: Sunoco’s Mariner East 2 pipeline in Pennsylvania, United States
headline: A "grandfathered" law enables pipeline expansion of highly volatile gas liquids  coming from Marcellus and Utica shale through high population areas on their way to Europe.

name: Aliaga Thermal Power Plants, Turkey
Highway killed old oak tree in Savinac, Serbia
headline: The 600 years old oak tree of religious importance to local people was cut down to give way to the highway Corridor XI.

name: Occupation of the Hainburger Au to resist unsustainable hydro-power development, Austria
headline: During the 1980s, the Hainburger Au was successfully defended against a proposed hydropower plant. This marked a turning point in Austrian democracy and environmental politics.

name: Chutka Nuclear Power Plant, India
Illegal plantations & logging in the Leuser Ecosystem in North Sumatra and Aceh, Indonesia
headline: The Leuser Ecosystem, the only region in the world where elephants, orangutans, tigers and rhinos co-exist, is threatened by accelerated expansion of oil palm plantations and logging.

name: Malonda Tree Farms in Niassa, Mozambique
Lower Martam Garbage Dump Ground, SK, India
Illegal mining and village protest in Caurem, Goa, India
headline: State violence in 2016 against tribal leaders in Caurem village in Goa who want to stop illegal iron ore mining and transport.

name: Oil spills, Rennell, Solomon Islands
headline: Three incidents related to bauxite mining on the island: two oil spills (about 300 tonnes) and one bauxite spill (5000 tonnes) threatening local communities' livelihood, food security and health.

name: LGV Bretagne train line, France
headline: New high-speed railroad in Brittany could not be prevented by local EJOs, that complained about noise pollution, vibration, cracked houses, stress at train passages, disturbed sleep, health risks, homes devaluation. At least compensations were granted.

name: Electrical Highway Sama - Velilla, Spain
Plan Especial Protección y Reforma Interior (PEPRI) en Valencia, Spain
headline: Introducidos cambios. Nuevos enlaces y estado del conflicto.

name: Macrogranja (CAFO) para la producción lechera en Noviercas, Soria, Spain
headline: Vecinos de Noviercas se oponen a la instalación de una de las mayores explotaciones ganaderas de Europa. Una macrogranja de 20.000 vacas para la producción de leche.

name: Midland Avenue Regional Treatment Facility in Southside Neighborhood of Syracuse, NY, USA
headline: Sewage treatment plant forced eviction of 35 African American families and polluted water and soil. But Ejos managed to close it and initiated a new political path towards more equitable policies and urban plans.

name: Manori to Marve Sea Link, Mumbai, India
headline: For the sake of tourism and higher speed, coastal habitats and fisherfolk's livelihood are put at risk

name: Prahovo pyrite cinder dump site, Serbia
headline: The historical and new pollution from production of phosphorous fertilizers in the Elixir Prahovo has resulted in the opposition by local people and NGOs. However the case is still far from being closed.

name: Guru Nanak Dev Thermal Plant, Bathinda, Punjab, India
Isiolo Airport, Kenya
headline: Expansion of Isiolo Airport failed to uphold human rights to information, housing, employment, education and provision of water. Land acquisition and resettlement were chaotic and some residents had yet to be compensated after completion of the project

name: Radiant Lagoon Sdn Bhd land grab near the Gunung Mulu National Park (UNESCO World Heritage Site), Sarawak, Malaysia
headline: Radiant Lagoon Sdn Bhd began clearing land for oil palm plantation on indigenous territory belonging to the ethnic groups of Penan, Berawan and Tering. Villagers protest and mobilize to bring the company to court.

name: Farmers protest against the changes in the Law on Agricultural Land, Serbia
headline: New amendments to the Law on Agricultural Land in Serbia allows leas of large portion of arable land to foreign investors, while weakening the positions of the small farmers.

name: Rampur Hydroelectric Project, HP, India
headline: The first WB project in its re-engagement in the hydropower sector in India after more than ten years of shying away from funding water infrastructure projects in the country, bringing alone international interests and local impacts

name: Desplazamiento de comunidad campesina en Puerto Cabuyal por proyecto hotelero, Ecuador
headline: A conflict on a touristic development in a beautiful beach in  Manabi, between a foreign family and the local population.

name: Gazoduq pipeline and Energie Saguenay terminal, Quebec, Canada
headline: Opposition builds across Quebec to the proposed Gazoduq natural gas pipeline and gas refinery plant.

name: Western Shoshone tribes Barrick Gold lawsuit, USA
Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Plant, USA
headline: Great success on the part of citizen activism has closed Vermont Yankee Nuclear Plant… but now how will the decommissioning of the plant's nuclear waste unfold?

name: Danish-Polish Baltic Pipe Fossil Gas Infrastructure Project, Denmark
headline: The Baltic Pipe Project is a large EU-funded fossil gas infrastructure project facing resistance from farmers, local residents and climate activists. It risks breaching Denmark’s climate goals.

name: Ban on iron mining in Goa, India
Proyecto Tren Maya en Calakmul, Campeche, México
headline: Aunque se plantea como un proyecto principalmente turístico, tendrá una importante función para el transporte de mercancías, particularmente de carga agroalimentaria. Indígenas de ascendencia maya se resisten a su construcción.

name: Dung Quat Economic Zone Authority (DEZA), Vietnam
headline: Where is the promised “better life”? Hundreds of households, displaced by the Dung Quat Economic Zone Authority (DEZA) project, have complained over post-resettlement issues and unfair compensation schemes.

name: Dhour Shweir Incinerator, Lebanon
headline: Incineration is a false solution to the waste crisis in Lebanon

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico El Diquís, Costa Rica
headline: After ten years of socio-environmental conflict and an alliance between conservationists and indigenous peoples, in November 2018 the big 646 MW project in El Diquís valley was discarded.

name: Uranio Samaná, Caldas, Colombia
Parque Temático de Flora y Fauna Bioparque Pereira, Colombia
Proyecto minero Achachucani, Challapata, Bolivia
headline: For over 20 years, successful resistance against mining by women and by communities holding water rights, and defending agriculture and husbandry activities in the region

name: Sagarmatha National Park, Nepal
headline: A national park was established in customary territories of the Sherpa community. They  reclaim their resource rights use on their collective managed land. This would be  an example of ICCAs management.

name: Niscota oil block in Boyacá and Casanare, Colombia
headline: The Niscota oil block is notorious for its history of extreme violence that thugs, military groups, and guerillas perpetrate against locals and activists. One prominent murdered activist was Rosa Helena Bernal Pinto, killed in December 2012.

name: La Zacatecana dam: the value of mine tailings, Mexico
headline: Numeorus conflictive attempts to profit from the toxic mine tailings (mercury, silver, gold)  in this dam in the Arroyo de la Plata downstream of Zacatecas, the ownership and safety of which is in dispute.

name: Prat airport expansion, Catalonia, Spain
headline: The latest in an endless series of proposed expansions of El Prat airport was paralyzed in September 2021, thanks to the mobilization of social organizations, environmentalists, peasants and neighborhood assemblies.

name: Taganito Mining Corporation’s Nickel Operations, Surigao del Norte,Philippines
headline: Militarization, environmental destruction of indigenous lands and unpaid royalties: the ingredients of Taganito Mining Corporation’s corporate success

name: Fumigación de nubes  para evitar lluvias en Tehuacán y su possible relación con granjas agroindustriales, Puebla, México
headline: En la region Mixteca de Puebla y Oaxaca, pobladores acusan a empresas avicolas y porcicolas de realizar sobrevuelos en avionetas para dispersar sustancias que impidan las lluvias en la region

name: Pande and Temene Gas Field, Mozambique
Khoikhoi and San peoples: Rooibos Access and Benefit-sharing Agreement, South Africa
headline: The South African indigenous Khoi Khoi and San communities in Cederberg region were recognized as traditional knowledge holders to the uses of Rooibos through an industry-wide Access and Benefit-sharing Agreement of novel extent.

name: Exploración y explotación de carbón en el páramo de Pisba en Boyacá, Colombia
Bumbuna Dam, Sierra Leone
headline: In a territory rich in diamonds, gold, iron, rutile and bauxite, the dam is feeding the mining industry rather than providing electricity to the population. The expression ‘When Bumbuna is completed’ become for Sierra Leone’s people a way to say ‘never’.

name: Deforestion and land confict in Gleba Nova Olinda, Para, Brazil
Sappi Saiccor pulp mill pollution, South Africa
Complejo turístico de Grupo Posadas en Bahía Chemuyil, México
headline: La cadena hotelera Grupo Posadas pone en peligro unas de las zonas más importantes al nivel nacional para reproducción de tortugas marinas, con la construcción de un complejo turístico de dos hoteles de lujo, en la bahía de Chemuyil.

name: Expansion of Salem Airport, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: Expansion of the Salem airport  and also the Chennai-Salem Expressway, requiring much fertile agricultural land, result in mass mobilization by the communities, and arrests of activists.

name: San Miguel Chimalapa, a Zoque population against a Canadian mining company.  Oaxaca, Mexico
headline: In 2018, representatives of Bienes Comunales, San Miguel Chimalapa, in Zoque territory, called on United Nations to prevent violation of human rights by the Canadian firm Minaurum Gold.

name: Rio Blanco Mine Majaz/Rio Blanco Copper S. A., Peru
headline: A copper mine in Piura, owned by British and later Chinese firms. Court case in London, and local successful referendum in 2007 against the project.

name: Chromite mining in Salcedo and killing of activist Francisco Canayoung, Philippines
headline: Philippine anti-mining activist Francisco Canayoung was murdered after opposing chromite mining in Salcedo, Eastern Samar, which drastically destroys the health of local communities and the environment.

name: Smurfit, Venezuela
Gullu Hydroelectric Project, Chhattisgarh, India
Oil exploration in Manipur, India
Soma Kyodo CFPP in the Soma Core Industrial Park, Fukushima, Japan
headline: A plan to build a small scale 112 MW coal-fired power plant in Fukushima industrial park was  cancelled in 2017.

name: Air pollution from Makstil AD, Skopje, Macedonia
headline: In 2014, iron smelting factory Makstil finally installed filters to reduce its air pollution, as it was demanded by the citizens of Skopje for several years.

name: Yadana Gas field and pipeline, Myanmar
headline: US oil giant Chevron and other companies and their business in Burma after a provision to stop operating was removed from the latest round of US sanctions on the country, aggravating the violence of Burmese regime

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Santo Domingo, Chiapas, Mexico
headline: The heart of the Lacandon Jungle threatened by a hydroelectric project. In August 2018 SEMARNAT finally did not grant construction permission. The people of Chiapas are still mobilized against that and  other megaprojects in the region

name: Map Ta Phut Industrial Area, Thailand
headline: Map Ta Phut industrial area is the largest petrochemical complex in Thailand. Its activities have been related to air and water pollution in the area. A new expansion is under way.

name: Chixoy Dam and Rio Negro massacre, Guatemala
headline: One of the saddest chapters of Guatemalan history is written in Rio Negro. Hundreds of people murdered for criminal development plans. In 2014 the recognition of the violence by the state and 2015 first compensation checks given to the Mayan families

name: Shandong CHTC Helon Co., Ltd., Viscose Factory, China
headline: Viscose plant is linked to heavy air pollution, groundwater pollution and (unproven) deaths of factory workers due to chemical poisoning.

name: Desviacion rio Calenturitas, Cesar, Colombia
Kerr-McGee Cimarron Nuclear Fuel Fabrication Site in Oklahoma, USA
headline: The Cimarron Fuel Fabrication Site broke federal nuclear regulations for a long time. Laboratory worker and union leader Karen Silkwood investigated such violations and allegedly was murdered for it. The site shut down in 1976.

name: Leeds Bradford Airport expansion, UK
headline: A Victory of the environmental justice movement and communities. The multiple strategies and resistance during 2022 stopped the expansion of Leeds Bradford Airport

name: West Bengal  eucalyptus conflict, India
Coal power plant in Narra, Palawan, the Philippines
headline: After three relocation  attempts due to community and environmentalists' opposition, a 15 MW coal plant would be built by DMCI Power, in agreement with  Palawan Electric Cooperative

name: Stung Meanchey landfill and waste pickers struggle in Phnom Penh, Cambodia
headline: Waste management strategies in Phnom Penh challenge the work of waste pickers, who struggle for inclusion and recognition. In municipal attempts of ‘city beautification’, waste pickers are being denied access to waste and their livelihoods are at risk.

name: PFOA Contamination in Bennington, Vermont, USA
headline: Residents combat PFOA contamination after ChemFab, owned by Saint-Gobain Performance Plastics, fouled community soil, air, and water. Residents have faced contaminated drinking water and soils, leading to various deadly health threats.

name: Uranium mining in Caetite, Brazil
Tanjung Awar-Awar power plant, East Java, Indonesia
headline: A 700 MW coal-fired power plant PLTU Tanjung Awar Awar has encountered conflicts with local residents at Wadung village in East Java over the past years due to labor and environmental issues.

name: In Roma quarter Fakulteta waste collection denied. Separation wall proposed, Sofia, Bulgaria
headline: 70 years of denial of waste collection, potable water and sanitation in the Roma settlement Fakulteta, in Sofia. A segregation wall under consideration to "protect" railways from the accumulated waste.

name: Coal fired power plant near conservation areas in Pacitan, East Java, Indonesia
headline: Complaints about decline of fisheries, coal dust and killing of turtles around the 630 MW Chinese financed power plant in Pacitan.

name: Narcotics plantations on indigenous Nasa territory in Caldono, Cauca, Colombia
headline: The indigenous Nasa people have long been struggling against criminal encroachment on their territory for narcotrafficking plantations, mining, and other injustices. This has led to widespread violence and environmental degradation with impunity.

name: Brandix India Apparel City (BIAC), AP, India
Louisiana's Bayou Bridge Pipeline Project, United States
headline: With the easy compliance of Louisiana's Governor, Energy Transfer Partners is building the Bayou Bridge Pipeline that will cross key bodies of water in Louisiana despite property rights challenge.

name: Efemçukuru Gold Mine, Turkey
headline: Efemçukuru Gold Mine, an underground gold mine and related plants and facilities, is located in Aegean Region of Turkey, 20 km to İzmir city and 14 km to Menderes province. The mine is located inside the strict preservation zone of the rivers and streams.

name: Groningen Gas, Netherlands
headline: The biggest gas field in Europe has caused more than 1000 earthquakes. The houses of up to 100,000 people have been damaged, some of them beyond repair. Shell, Exxon and the Dutch state owned company EBN refuse to fully compensate

name: J R Thermal Power Plant, Orissa, India
Icefish Operation on Illegal Fishing, Banzare Bank, Antarctica
headline: A successful "Icefish" operation performed by international direct-action movement "Sea Shepherd"  stopped six  illegal, unregulated, unreported (IUU) fishing vessels in Antarctic waters.

name: Water and Sewerage Anti-Privatization movement in Thessaloniki, Greece
Illegal Diversion of Grazing Lands for Nuclear-Military-Science Projects, Karnataka, India
headline: Illegal Diversion of Amrit Mahal Kaval Grazing Lands. Kavals are common pasture lands now being enclosed. A great wall for a proposed nuclear and scientific complex causes distress in the villages.

name: Kakinada Special Economic Zone, AP, India
Hidroelectrica Miel I, Caldas, Colombia
Roma evicted from their homes due to a Black Sea holiday resort, Romania
headline: In 2013 local government forcibly evicted Roma communities to provisional shelters and industrial sites for the benefit of a tourist resort. A favourable court decision in 2016 ended multiple evictions of the Roma.

name: ENAYAM International Container Transshipment Terminal (PMAEICTT), India
headline: Peoples' Movement Against Enayam ICTT has been mobilising with other EJOs against the Enayam port project in Tamil Nadu, India to avoid that around 50,000 fisher families in the region face displacement, loss of jobs and livelihood and marginalisation.

name: Government placed Roma refugees from Kosovo next to the country's largest landfill, Montenegro
headline: Roma had fled the Kosovo conflict in 1999 and became refugees in Podgorica but Montenegrin government placed them to live in barracks surrounded by a landfill for 19 years.

name: Lex Izera for electric car factories and logging, Poland
headline: In a country with an area of 312,000 square kilometers, the authorities are devoting forests to investment areas for electromobility. Should an industry conducive to the energy transformation develop at the expense of the environment?

name: Waste incineration project in Jiujiang, Jiangxi, China
headline: Villagers camp in the paddy fields for nearly 6 months to stop the construction of a waste-to-energy project that threatens their homes and the habitat of migratory birds.

name: Offshore oil bonanza poses existential threat for coastal communities, Suriname
headline: TotalEnergies wants to extract oil offshore Suriname and pay to greenwash their operation with a dubious forest protection scheme. Local and international organisations want to keep the oil in the ground.

name: Ring of Fire, Ontario Canada
headline: "The Ring of Fire, a 5,000-square-kilometre area in the James Bay Lowlandsin Ontario, holds a potentially massive chromite deposit. It lies on traditional First Nations territory"

name: Road construction through TI Waimiri Atroari, Amazonas - Roraima, Brazil
headline: The construction of the BR-174 road by the Brazilian military in the 1970s has caused violent conflict with the Waimiri Atroari group. A historical legal process could lead to an official recognition of the state’s atrocities against indigenous peoples.

name: Extracción de petróleo en La Macarena, Meta, Colombia
headline: Proyecto de perforación exploratoria en territorio campesino donde confluyen Amazonía, Andes y Orinoquía. ANLA primero otorga licencia, luego la retira al cabo de un mes bajo las presiones sociales y argumentos técnicos.

name: Enel Federico II Central Thermoelectric Station of Brindisi
headline: El Centrale Federico II sigue activo y contaminó, a pesar de las protestas de la población local. Si bien muchos estudios demuestran impactos negativos en la salud y el medio ambiente y algunos ejecutivos de Enel están bajo proceso.

name: Onca Puma nickel mining project in Ourilândia do Norte, Pará, Brazil
headline: Indigenous communities denounce the contamination of the Cateté River by Vale, which produces nickel a few kilometers from the Xikrin do Cateté Indigenous Land in Pará. The Justice has ordered the interruption of operations in Onça Puma several times.

name: Agrounia farmers' protest movement, Poland
headline: Agrounia is in favor of defending the domestic market and family farms against i.a. foreign discount retail chains. In addition, it wants Polish farmers to provide the country with food security and healthy food.

name: Tokwe - Mukorsi dam, Zimbabwe
headline: Towke-Mukosi dam is under completion under a veil of corruption, stepping on human rights of about 20,000 left without proper home, land and livelihoods after an human-made flood event

name: Moserbaer thermal power plant at Anuppur, Madhya Pradesh, India
The struggle for resource use leds to Farmer- Pastoralists conflict in Plateau state, Nigeria
headline: In Plateau state, a city in Northern Nigeria, the conflict over resource use has led to a deadly conflict between farmers and herders. The conflicts have caused deaths and displacements with no resolutions

name: Forced eviction, mining and dams inside Panna Tiger Reserve, Madhya Pradesh, India
headline: Struggle against multiple evictions and resistance movement against mining and a water linking project within the Panna Tiger Reserve.

name: Geotube Construction in Pentha, Odisha, India
Amchang Wildlife Sanctuary and violent eviction, Assam, India
headline: In 2017, violent eviction with bulldozers and elephants destroyed houses and lives of more than 700 families in the name of conservation.

name: Hydroelectric plant in Maraba, Pará, Brazil
headline: Local communities in Marabá fear to be displaced again by a hydroelectric dam project.  If built the project will displace around 40 thousand people.

name: Illegal fishing, Madagascar
headline: Chinese, Thai and South-Korean vessels, bring down illegal fishing nets fitted with deep hooks to trap high-value fish at night

name: Quifel’s Hoyo Hoyo agriculture project in Lioma, Zambezia Region, Mozambique
Cerro San Pedro mine, San Luis Potosi, Mexico
headline: The Federal government gave a concession for open-pit mining to New Gold (Mineria San Xavier). The people started acts of resistance when the EIA was approved. Relying on legal action the project was stopped but only for a short time.

name: Alviela river pollution by tanning industry and other activities, Portugal
headline: The increase in industrialization in the region, the shoe factories’ growing demand for leather, and the lack of treatment of industrial waste linked to it led to very high levels of pollution

name: Tolupanes en contra de mineria de antimonio y talas ilegales son asesinados, Honduras
headline: María Enriqueta Matute, Ricardo Soto Fúnez, Armando Fúnez Medina and Erasio Vieda Ponce were killed in defence of community rights and the rights of mother earth.

name: Anglo American  Platinum Modikwa Mine in Maandagshoek, Limpopo, South Africa
headline: Anglo Platinum and African Rainbow Minerals took land from the Matimatsasi people in Maandagshoek to build the Modikwa mine. Continued protests and litigation against environmental, social, and economic harms.

name: Permanent Poison: France's Nuclear Testing Program in Reggane, and In Ekker, Algeria
headline: On February 13, 1960, France conducted its first nuclear test in Reggane, Algeria, called Gerboise Bleue. The test contaminated the Saharan desert with plutonium, as well as exposed French soldiers and the local Tuareg population to radioactive fallout.

name: UPM (Ex-Botnia), Uruguay
Kwale-Okpai CDM Project, Nigeria
Nice - OIN plaine du Var, France
Native Hawaiians and Local Residents Protest Na Pua Makani Wind Project, Hawai'i, USA
headline: Native Hawaiians and local residents protest construction of a large-scale wind power project in Kahuku village. Protesters were met with police violence and arrests and the wind project was ultimately completed.

name: Sumsel-8 coal-fired power plant, South Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: Sumsel-8 coal-fired power plant, the largest mine-mouth CFPP in Indonesia that is expected to be in operation in 2022, raises environmental, social, and health concerns among local communities and environmental organization AEER.

name: Sinti settled to chemically contaminated area, Heidelberg, Germany
headline: A Sinti community was settled across the Henkel company in Heidelberg, Germany, on a highly polluted plot of land due to the chemical production of the industry, which contaminated both soil and water.

name: Botum Sakor coal plant in Koh Kong, Cambodia
headline: Farmers and fishers fear jeopardising their basis of livelihood due to the pollution caused by the power plant. Activists are also criminalised in Cambodia

name: Seyfe Lake Drought, Turkey
Paramo El Almorzadero, Colombia
Cotton production at Aral Sea, Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan
headline: The Aral Sea dries up due to irrigation for increased cotton production to feed the textile industry.

name: Amin Bazar landfill threatens wetlands and farmers, Dhaka, Bangladesh
headline: Since 2005, the city of Dhaka has been using a wetland area for waste dumping, supported by international cooperation. This has violated environmental laws and caused damages to the ecosystem and agriculture. Lately a waste-to-energy plant was proposed.

name: Agip Spills in Apoi community, Nigeria
Ancestral Acholi land rights conflicts in Amuru, Uganda
headline: The Acholi indigenous people struggled against land-grabbing since the LRA rebellion in 2006. Elderly women protestors managed to cancel a game park project with naked cursing, but the community continues to fight and delay a sugarcane plantation.

name: Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated (IUU) fishing in Sherbro river, Sierra Leone
GENESIS Matsushima Plan, Japan
headline: In Japan, citizens are opposing the plan to "upcycle" inefficient retiring coal fire power plants, calling them coal-fired Zombies

name: Lower Omo Valley irrigated agriculture development, Ethiopia
headline: State-run sugar plantations and commercially leased land for the Lower Omo Valley. These plans are linked to the controversial Gibe III dam development upstream.

name: Uranium mining in the Havasupai Nation's territory, Arizona, USA
headline: The Havasupai Tribe is currently threatened by the development of uranium mines upstream from the village that the Tribe worries will lead to groundwater contamination and negatively impact tourism in the area.

name: Kawthaung coal power plant, Tanintharyi, Myanmar
headline: ‘No to the Coal Power Plant’. ‘Bring Us Sustainable Energy’. Placards and protests against one of the first coal power plants in Myanmar make it clear: the country needs clean energy

name: Illegal Toxic Waste Dumping in Bosaso, Somalia
headline: Ilaria Alpi was investigating the illegal waste dumping and weapons trade in Bosaso for the Italian RAI when she was murdered  in 1993 before being able to submit a report exposing the crimes.

name: Chiawelo, Soweto, electricity struggles, South Africa
Hidroñuble Hydroelectric dam, Chile
headline: In the hometown of Violeta Parra, one more hydropower plant is coming up in the Ñuble region, amid irregularities, pollution, illegal deforestation and land acquisition

name: Vertedero de residuos en Cayambe, Ecuador
headline: In the rural parish of  Cangahua, southwest of caton Cayambe, north of Quito, there was resistance against a waste dump that contaminated soils and water courses.

name: Arsenic poisoning causing cancer around Hunan Realgar Mine in Shimen, Changde, China
headline: Realgar mining and arsenic refining have wreaked havoc in central Hunan Province's Shimen County, causing hundreds of mine workers and residents to die from cancer.

name: Hutan Harapan Forest conflict in Jambi, Indonesia
headline: Set up by international NGO’s to serve REDD+ and forest conservation, the Hutan Harapan forest has provoked conflicts over access to land with local indigenous small-holders. Tensions between conservation NGOs and peasant movements have emerged.

name: Henchir Jemna oasis, Tunisia
headline: During the 2011 Revolution, the Association for the Protection of Jemna's Oases took over the Henchir Jemna oasis following a sit-in led by  residents. Over 5 years, the harvest doubled but the state now claims ownership of the land.

name: Sentani Airport, Papua, Indonesia
headline: Communal landowners from four villages whose land was taken for Sentani Airport disrupted airport operations on several occasions, blocking the runway and taxiway. This action helped secure compensation and recognition of their customary land rights.

name: Fundicion de cobre Paipote (Videla Lira), Chile
Sapta Kosi High Dam Multipurpose Project, Nepal
Matuba Farm, Emvest’s land fund in Limpopo/ Chokwe, Gaza Province, Mozambique
Proyecto Minero El Pavón en Municipio Rancho Grande, Nicaragua
Use of Endosulphan in Kasaragod distric, Kerala, India
headline: Kasargod District is famous for its cashew plantations. The Plantation Corporation of Kerala, a state enterprise, cultivates vast areas. To protect this crop, the pesticide endosulfan was used with heavy damage to human health.

name: Impactos de las obras asociadas del proyecto de Nuevo Aeropuerto de la Ciudad de México (NAICM), México
headline: Las obras asociadas al proyecto de Nuevo Aeropuertos de la Ciudad de México han generado un conjunto de afectaciones socioambientales muy graves sobre la región que no se resuelven con la cancelación del proyecto.

name: Proyecto Pachuca y jales mineros tóxicos en Epazoyucan, Hidalgo, México
headline: La comunidad de Epazoyucan se opone al Proyecto Pachuca (empresa AHMSA) que consiste en el traslado de los jales mineros de la ciudad de Pachuca  para depositarlos al lado de su comunidad amenazando gravemente el medio ambiente y la salud de la población.

name: Bisasar Rd Landfill Site, South Africa
Hybrid rice in the Office du Niger, Mali
IOI palm oil operations destroy Ketapang Peat Landscape, Indonesia
headline: IOI Destruction of Ketapang Peat Landscape, Indonesia. International campaing against deforestation, peatland fires and using of child labour by Greenpeace.

name: Mercury dumping in Abu Kammash's water, Libya
headline: For more than 30 years GCCI has been dumping mercury in the waters of Abu Kammash. Latest studies has shown that the water across Libya's coast is highly contaminated with Mercury and 75% of marine plants and fish can cause poisoning to humans.

name: Tiradero de lodos tóxicos de la empresa Quidesa, Salamanca, Mexico
headline: QUIDESA tiró sus deshechos industriales tóxicos en socavones de un cerro, afectando la salud de la población que vive en la colonia vecina. Evadió sus responsabilidades declarando la quiebra. El caso queda impune.

name: The anti-nuclear protest movement in Switzerland
headline: Anti-nuclear movement achieved mixed success:  moratorium of new plant construction and promise of an early phase out, while protests continue for an early end to nuclear power.

name: Farmers defend their rights against a new seed law, Sri Lanka
headline: Sri Lankan farmers on the streets fighting to preserve their traditional knowledge and against seed restrictions promoted new law

name: Huanuni, Bolivia
headline: La mina funciona desde inicios del siglo pasado y a través del tiempo ha generado múltiples impactos ambientales. Las comunidades se movilizan hace años denunciando que las aguas del rio contaminan su salud,  tierras y producción.

name: Ywathit dam on the Salween River, Karenni state, Myanmar
headline: The plans for the mainstream Ywathit dam on the Salween river threaten the existence of the ethnic Yintale, the stability in the region and the return of internally displaced people to their homelands.

name: Eucalyptus plantations in Huangmian, Liuzhou, Guangxi, China
headline: Villagers pulled out eucalyptus saplings planted near a reservoir fearing for the safety of drinking water. Some  were arrested in criminal detention.

name: Oil drilling stopped, Lofoten islands, Norway
headline: For many years there was a debate on whether to  get oil from the biodiversity-rich Lofoten islands.  By 2019 the question is settled, not least because  of climate change.. A blow to Norway's oil industry.

name: Roma families in Kochani at risk of displacement due to housing development projects, Macedonia
headline: More than hundred people are threatened by displacement due to housing development projects of a private university. They now live in precarious conditions with no sufficient access to water. Children in particular are exposed to infectious diseases.

name: Sugarcane cultivation and oil palm plantation in Polochic valley, Guatemala
headline: The Q’eqchi’ population has struggled since the colony period for the access to the land from which they were deprived, but they have always been severely repressed. Conflicts have been aggravated due to the oil palm and sugarcane accelerated expansion.

name: Boeung Kak Lake Evictions in Phnom Penh, Cambodia
headline: In 2007, a property development company started to fill the lake with sand with the aim to “make land” for luxury property development in central urban Phnom Penh. Evictions of at least nine villages were completed by 2017.

name: Kavuthi-Vediyappan Hills, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: 11 year struggle to protect Kavuthi-Vediappanmalai Hills from iron ore mining. The hills hold religious significance, serve as the source of various springs, and support local livelihoods of 51 villages were allocated for Iron ore mining in 2005.

name: Qilu Tianhe Pharmaceutical, Licheng, Shandong, China
headline: Frequent accidents and pollution occurred in the Qilu Tianhe Pharmaceutical in recent years, students and staff from the nearby high school suffer and complain about the odor air and the health impacts.

name: Upper Yeywa dam on the Namtu River, Shan State, Myanmar
headline: The Upper Yeywa dam will flood traditional Shan villages and irreversibly change the unique characteristics of the Namtu River. Farmers, environmentalists and human rights organizations mobilize against the dam project.

name: Bomuruella Mini Hydro Power Plant, Sri Lanka
headline: Amazing falls in the Seetha Eliya Forest Reserve under threat for a small hydro plant. EFL filed a case for the irregularities in the Environmental Impact Assessment

name: Bantar Gebang Jakarta landfill, Indonesia
headline: As a solution to the waste crisis in Jakarta, officials plan the construction of 5 incinerators, a move to further jeopardize the health and source of income of local residents and waste pickers.

name: Mina Sierra Grande, Río Negro, Argentina
headline: Chinese mining company generates environmental and social impacts in Sierra Grande, Río Negro, Argentina, caused by iron ore exports.

name: Hidroeléctrica Maqueo, Chile
headline: Puel Wiyi Mapu Sin Represa. La campaña en contra de la central de 400MW, un complejo de explotación de ocho ríos, por la empresa noruega SN Power

name: Gas fracking en la Huasteca y Totonacapan. Resistencia de la coordinadora Corason, Mexico
headline: Resistance to gas fracking projects from Pemex and other companies in Veracruz, Puebla, Hidalgo, San Luis Potosi, centered in first meeting of CORASON in June 2015 in Papantla, Veracruz.

name: PCB Polluted Rhône, France
headline:
France's Rhone River polluted by PCB Chemical Waste: _x000D_
Fishing ban destroys livelihoods of local fishermen and destroys staple diet of poor.

name: Coastal Development and Land Reclamation, Bahrain
headline: Bahrain's massive land reclamation projects have placed huge pressure on the country's fishing industry and the livelihoods of traditional fishing communities.

name: La Fundación  Apaxtle y Prosalud Apaxco-Atotonilco contra planta Ecoltec de Holcim. Mexico.
headline: The cement industry (Holcim/Ecoltec) has not really faced justice despite the environmental disasters amd the damage against the local population's health.

name: Polepally Special Economic Zone, Telangana, India
Shell refuses to clean up spill at Ikata community, Nigeria
Paramo de Guacheneque, Colombia
Vratsa Landfill Fire, Bulgaria
APECO Special Economic Zone on ancestral lands and fishing grounds, Aurora, Philippines
headline: Development for whom? The APECO special economic zone, promoted to bring progress and jobs, faces strong opposition by locals who fear irreversible loss of livelihood and culture due to dispossession of their ancestral lands.

name: New aviation fuel delivery system to serve Vancouver Airport, Canada
headline: A new fuel supply system for Vancouver Airport, comprising a marine jet fuel facility, 80 million litre fuel tank farm and pipeline, is under construction in spite of local opposition including from VAPOR, a society supported by several organizations

name: Chinchaycocha, Junin, Peru
Tres hidroelectricas y tres asesinatos de activistas en el Corredor Seco, Guatemala
headline: Tres hidroeléctricas en el río Grande de Jocotán en su paso por Chiquimula y Zacapa. Estos proyectos arrastran consigo tres asesinatos y más de 80 denuncias de violencia y criminalización por la población local y organizaciones sociales.

name: Dirty and dangerous shipbreaking in Chittagong, Bangladesh
headline: Chittagong is one of the largest shipbreaking yards in the world. The industry has been criticized for contaminating the environment and exposing low-paid workers to high risks.

name: Water Disparities in Texas Colonias, USA
Represa Milpillas, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: A new hydraulic project trying to mislead "ejidatarios" (communities owning the land). Increasing resistance with support from the observatory OCMZac and the networks of REMA and MAPDER .

name: Emprendimientos urbanos Colony Park, Arroyo Anguila - La Paloma, Delta de Tigre, Argentina
headline: In the Islands of Paraná Delta (Tigre), around 20 families and their allies managed to stop a mega gated-community urbanization project. Alternative community-based initiatives and a conservation program were born.

name: Abant Lake Nature Park, Turkey
Markala Sugar Project: SoSuMar/Illovo sugar refinery in Cercle de Segou, Mali
Achuar and Shuar against oil extraction, Ecuador
Serranía de San Lucas gold mining, Colombia
Bikita Minerals Lithium mine in the Masvingo Province, Zimbabwe
headline: Bikita Minerals has been running since 1950 one of the largest lithium mines in Zimbabwe, profiting local and international elites at the expanse of the local communities and the government through pollutions, women abuse and illicit financial flows

name: The Soulaliyate Women's Land-Use Rights Movement, Morocco
headline: The Soulaliyate Women of Morocco are claiming their rightful compensation from the sale or rent of collective land to private entities, demanding that they should benefit from the same rights as men in the face of loss of their homes and livelihood.

name: Shell Pollutes Owerewer Community, Nigeria
Mining-metallurgical complex in Corumbá, Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil
headline: The attempt to set up a mining-mettalurgical pole in Corumbá increased deforestation for charcoal, impacting indigenous communities. The failure of the complex reduced the extraction of charcoal, but not the mining and its impacts to local communities.

name: Proyecto Minero El Escobal, Guatemala
headline: The Xinka Indigenous and campesino populations in the Guatemalan departments of Santa Rosa, Jalapa and Jutiapa in resistance to the Escobal mine.

name: Water Privatisation-Guayaquil, Ecuador
Waste pickers of Mbeubeuss landfill fight against exclusion, Dakar, Senegal
headline: Mbeubeuss landfill illustrates the tensions between a top-down imposed perspective on waste management for the sake of private profits, and a grassroots perspective from informal waste pickers defending their source of livelihood.

name: Vallfosca Mountain Resort, Catalonia, Spain
Dannenrod forest occupation against highway construction, Germany
headline: The forest “Dannenröder Forst” was occupied by environmental activists to protest against its deforestation for the construction of the highway A49.

name: Jim Corbett National Park and Tiger Reserve, Uttarakhand, India
headline: Corbett National Park was established in 1936, the first to be established in Asia. Van Gujjars struggle for the recognition of their forest rights around the Corbett forest protected area.

name: Fisherfolk against reclamations in Jakarta Bay, Indonesia
headline: The north bay of Jakarta has been a source of livelihood for the fisherfolk around the area. Reclamation plans have caused the loss of livelihood for them. This is related to the Giant Sea Wall, or National Capital Integrated Coastal Development.

name: Gbaraun community and Agip, Nigeria
Industrial Zoning in Austin, USA
headline: Mandated racial segregation, historic zoning patterns and changing economies have created many of the environmental justice problems in East Austin. Read about successful mobilization of the social collective PODER

name: Sun Peaks Resort & 2010 Olympics, BC, Canada
The struggle for land in the New Clark City project, Luzon, The Philippines
headline: In the shadow of the New Clark City mega-project is the struggle for indigenous land rights and recognition of the Aeta people.

name: Persistent contamination with PCBs in New Bedford Harbor, Massachusetts, The US
headline: Since 1979, fishing has been banned in New Bedford Harbor itself as a result of PCB contamination. The local community, and EJ community based on MA standards, has suffered negative health and socio-economic impacts.

name: La Vega I & II Hydroelectric projects, Nebaj, Guatemala
headline: Conflict over construction of the La Vega I and La Vega II hydroelectric projects in the municipality of Nebaj, El Quiché, Guatemala. Without prior consultation to the local communities. Affecting directly more than ten indigenous communities.

name: Textile and Paper Mill Industry polluting Nashua River, USA
headline: The case of how textile and paper mill industries polluted The Nashua River, USA

name: Zvecan waste storage, Kosovo
headline: EuropeAid constructs an unnecessary landfill in an untouched valley. The area has the third highest biodiversity in Kosovo. At the construction site are several springs, creating continously a problem to the landfill.

name: Illegal dumping of toxic waste in the Kim Kim River, Pasir Gudang, Malaysia
headline: Tons of toxic substances were illegally dumped into the Kim Kim river in Pasir Gudang, Malaysia in March 2019. Local dwellers including children were seriously affected

name: São Luiz do Tapajós hydroelectric dam, Brazil
headline: Strong opposition, legal flaws and demarcation of land by indigenous communities led to the cancellation of the first of the dam projects on the Tapajós river. Big victory for environmental justice now challenges the future of other projects.

name: Harmful wastes threaten residents of Akpayak community, Nigeria
Roma blamed for water misuse and disconnection of water supply, Ózd, Hungary
headline: Local authority disconnects public water supplies in a heat wave in 2013 while accusing Roma community of water misuse. The pattern of discrimination continues in later years.

name: Inti Raymi contamina Rio Desaguadero in Oruro, Bolivia
Drying out of Burdur Lake, Turkey
Kishanganga Hydro Electric Power Project (KHEP), India
Rajaji National Park and Tiger Reserve, Uttarakhand, India
headline: Tha pastoralist Van Gujjars struggle for forest rights and for just rehabilitation measures. They follow Islam, have their own clans, practising transhumance.

name: Pollutants  from Hubei Shuanghuan Science and Technology massive killing of fish in Fuhe River, Hubei, China
headline:
Large amount of dead fish were spotted in _x000D_
sections of the Fuhe River in Sept. 2013 due to excessive ammonia nitrogen mainly from a chemical company that polluted the water.

name: Mallampet village and Peri-urban to Urban Water transfers, India
Horsh Beirut urban park, Lebanon
headline: Horsh Beirut, the largest park of the capital, is threatened today by the ungoing construction of a field hospital inside the park. Works are totally illegal as laws and zoning regulations strictly prohibit any kind of construction.

name: Project Fortress mega-solar plant, Kent, UK
headline: The local community in Kent is facing off against the largest photovoltaic power plant in the UK less than a decade after fighting the country's largest offshore wind project. The government approves the project to pursue its climate strategy.

name: Represa del Bajo Anchicayá, Colombia
Romaine Hydroelectric Complex, Quebec, Canada
headline: The Romaine Complex is a hydroelectric generation project nearing completion in North East Quebec. The project has several environmental and social repercussions on local indigenous and non-indigenous communities in the region.

name: Nibutani Dam on Ainu homeland, Japan
headline: Ainu communities were recognized as "indigenous groups" by the Sapporo District Court during their mobilization against a water diversion project; read here about an historical case in the country

name: Veladero mine, San Juan, Argentina
headline:
Con su inversión inicial de 540 millones de dólares, se convirtió en 2005 en la inversión privada más importante del país desde la crisis argentina de 2001. _x000D_
En 2017, la mitad del proyecto fue vendido a la empresa china Shandong Gold.

name: Deviation of the Sao Francisco River, Brazil
headline: In spite of local population opposition and years of pharaonic works, the deviation of the Sao Francisco River is about to be completed by the end of 2016.

name: Health impact of substandard living conditions on Roma in a settlement separated by wall, Sliven, Bulgaria
headline: Romani families in Sliven in a settlement separated from non-Roma living area suffer a high level of pollution.  Substandard living conditions have negative impact on Roma health and life expectancy.

name: Proyecto La Ensenada en Holbox, México
headline: The Natural Protected area, Holdbox island, has been threatened by tourist development projects. This tourist model development is based on building luxury hotels and golf courses at the cost of the nature and dispossessing local ejidatarios.

name: La Vega-Mocoa Project, Colombia
headline: F

name: Potasio Rio Colorado, Mendoza, Argentina
headline: Social opposition to Potasio Rio Colorado potash project in Malargue, Mendoza, Argentina, owned by the Brazilian Vale company. Vale cancelled the project in 2013, causing unemployment of thousands people.

name: Waste-to-energy incineration plant by Veolia in Mexico City, Mexico
headline: The threat of a waste incinerator in Mexico City put wastepickers’ livelihoods at risk. The informal recyclers complained. The project was discardeded because of alleged corruption and excessive costs.

name: Amravati Thermal Power Project, Maharashtra, India
Diamer Bhasha Dam, Pakistan
Remunicipalisation Energy Hamburg, Germany
Coal Fired Power Plants in Chicago, USA
headline: In August of 2012, the Fisk and Crawford Power Plants  closed their doors after the "marriage" of community/grassroots organizations and larger "big green" organizations and their campaign against coal.

name: Ward Valley Nuclear Dump in California Mojave Desert, USA
Isahaya Bay, fill in of the tidal flats, Japan
headline: For over 20 years an ill-conceived sea wall has left locals and conservationists angry over loss of fisheries, seaweed catches and migratory birds, while farmers worry over damage to their reclaimed farmland if the gates are opened.

name: La Colosa mining project, Cajamarca, Tolima, Colombia
headline: After many years of struggle, in March 2017 a popular consultation was held in Cajamarca, and the Anglo Gold Ashanti  company seems to have been definitively kicked out.

name: BP Exploration Company, Colombia
Conflict between Indians and miners in the Cinta Larga lands in Rondonia, Brazil
Pangkalan Susu Coal-fired Power Plant, North Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: The Pangkalan Susu coal-fired power plant, constructed in two phases, continues to negatively affect the local environment and population in multiple ways, despite persistent opposition over the years.

name: Chikweti plantations, Mozambique
Total S.A.´s Anzarane Offshore Western Sahara Oil Exploitation
headline: Political injustice compounded by environmental injustice: French oil company Total in  Illegal Anzarane Offshore Western Sahara Oil Exploitation

name: DOSAB Lignite Fired Power Plant, Turkey
