headline: There is a plan for construction of a coal-fired power plant called “Steam and Energy Production Facility” in the central part of the city of Bursa. The Platform against Thermal Plant in DOSAB opposes the project.

name: Construction of the Baltic Nuclear Power Plant, Russia
Stop de kindermoord  - against children deaths caused by motor vehicles, The Netherlands
headline: In The Netherlands, by 1971 deaths by motor vehicles were 3,300, of which 500 were children. A campaign in favour of pedestrians and bicycles started in different locations. It was called "stop children's murders".

name: Bui Dam in the Black Volta River, Ghana
headline:
The recently Chinese-built Bui Dam was planned since _x000D_
the 1920s as part of the  Volta River Project for  producing  electricity  fby  processing  the  country’s bauxite.

name: Iamgold and INV Metals in Kimsacocha, Azuay, Ecuador
headline: In March 2019, after many years of struggle, a popular consultation in the Giron district voted with a large majority against mining.

name: Hidrovía amazónica, Ucayali, Peru
headline: The indigenous people of  Atalaya in Ucayali went on strike in August 2018 against damage from extractivist projects, a new waterway, the arrival of settlers and land grabbing. and lack of title to their own lands.

name: Punta Alcalde power plant, Huasco, Chile
Cana Brava Amianto´s Mining in Minaçu, Goiás, Brazil
headline: Despite its relation to health damage, Brazil still is the third largest producer of amianto (pr asbestos).  Cana Brava is the only mine of amianto in Brazil.

name: Hidroeléctrica Santa Rita S.A. in Monte Olivo, Guatemala
headline: Otro proyecto es aprobado bajo el MDL, a pesar de toda la violencia y muertes y fuertes protestas de los habitantes locales.

name: Ken-Betwa river linking, India
headline: The Ken-Betwa link project envisages diversion of  waters from Ken basin to Betwa basin affecting wildlife biodiversity, migration paths and a land loss of a bigger national reserve.

name: Almstriden, Stockholm, Sweden
Contaminación del río Tula en Hidalgo, México
headline: La alta contaminación por metales tóxicos y la mala gestión de aguas residuales afectan la salud de la población. En diciembre 2021, una inundación dejó 31 mil viviendas dañadas, y más de 70 mil personas damnificadas

name: Fessenheim nuclear power station stopped, France
headline: In 2017 it has been announced that the oldest nuclear power plant in France, Fessenheim, built in 1977, will be finally  closed down. It is alleged that previous accidents have been downplayed.

name: Coal mining operation without permit at Dananhu, Hami led to public interest litigation in Xinjiang, China
headline: The illegal construction of the Dananhu No.2 coal mine project started without official permit in September 2013, which led to administrative penalties and an environmental public interest litigation filed by two NGOs in China.

name: Waste Pickers in Cape Coast Face Repressive Treatment and Unsafe Working Conditions, Ghana
headline: Waste pickers in Ghana's Cape Coast struggle to access recyclable materials due to privatization by waste management companies and district assemblies that deem waste picking theft. Waste pickers work in unregulated conditions with little protective gear.

name: S'Albufera des Grau, Menorca. Spain
headline: Successful  struggle since 1974-75 to today for the preservation of a unique wetland and natural space against threats from tourism and the building industry.  Intervention of the GOB (an environmental group).

name: Iron ore mining project Pedra de Ferro in Caetité, BA, Brazil
headline: BAMIN, controlled by ERG, gets into conflicts over water. The first major iron ore project in Bahia, a new mining frontier in Brazil, threatens the way of life of small farmers and traditional communities.

name: Daewoo Maize and Biofuel Project, Madagascar
El Baguazo, Peru
headline: On 5 June 2009, the police and army attacked a road blockade by Awajún and Wampi people complaining against land privatization, oil and mining investments. There were many victims on both sides.

name: Shell oil spills affecting the Joinkrama 4 community (JK4), Taylor Creek, Nigeria
headline: The community has to keep fighting for Shell to cleaning-up the recurrent spills from its Adibawa Flow Station. The authorities do not properly comply Shell to its responsibilities and ERA denounces inadequate methods of environmental restoration.

name: Rosebank Oilfield, Sheltland, Scotland
headline: In 2023, the UK Government approved the controversial Equinor-owned Rosebank Oil Field despite huge resistance from scientists, politicians, activists and communities across the world.

name: Daya Bay Nuclear Power Plant, Guangdong, China
headline: In 1986 after Chernobyl, there was an Anti-Daya Bay Nuclear Plant Campaign developed under the shadow of political uncertainty over Hong Kong’s Future and coincided with the drafting process of the Basic Law of the Hong Kong SAR.

name: Al Tamimi Khaled attempts crop farming in Dosso, Niger
Istranca/Yildiz Mountains Mines and Quarries, Turkey
Intex's Mindoro Nickel Project, Philippines
headline: Intex Resources pushes its Nickel mining project in spite of a lack of a free prior informed consent by local indigenous. The anti-mining struggle of the mangyans of Mindoro continues.

name: Mining in Macizo Colombiano, and the death of Adelinda Gómez, Colombia
headline: Many peasant activists oppose the development of gold mining by both multinational companies and small private mining. One of them, Adelinda Gómez Gaviria from Almaguer, tried to stop the damage to the environment and to livelihooods.

name: Solid waste dumpsite in Sulaymaniyah, Kurdistan Region of Iraq
headline: Neglect and toxic waste made the uncontrolled dumpsite in Sulaymaniyah a ticking bomb. Yet, authorities have proved to be unwilling or unable to defuse it, casting a bleak shadow on the affected population.

name: Ofunato Port Biomass/Coal-Fired Power Plant, Iwate Prefecture,  Japan
headline: Residents of Ofunato City, Japan, disapprove of building more power plants. Biomass Power Plant suspended even after switching from co-firing Biomass and Coal to only Biomass.

name: Comunidad indigena Tres Islas, mineria ilegal, exploración petrolera en Madre de Dios, Peru
headline: A conflict on illegal mining, mercury contamination and oil exploration. This indigenous community led by Juana Payaba achieved a landmark court decision in 2012 in defence of its territorial rights, and also CIDH's protection in 2017.

name: Minera Macocozac, Concepción del Oro, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: In 2009, the mining company Macocozac was fined by the Federal Attorney for Environmental Protection for contaminating soil and air in the municipality of Concepción del Oro, Zacatecas.

name: Attempting Social Responsibility at Iamgold's mine, Burkina Faso
headline: So called "socially responsible mining" only temporarily covers up elite capture of profits made possible by Burkina’s neo-liberal mining laws, leading to unrest in mining towns.

name: Neltume hydroelectric project in Panguipulli, Chile
Beach sand mining for ilmenite, garnet and other minerals in Tamil Nadu, India
headline: In 2017,  Sandhya Ravishankar, a journalist based in Chennai, was threatened for her reports  on beach mining in Tamil Nadu. This is a lucrative business because of the minerals which are extracted and exported.

name: Thepha Coal Power Plant, Thailand
headline: Strong local opposition by local inhabitants and by academics to a  2,200-megawatt coal-fired power station in Songkhla province, Thailand

name: Rampal Thermal Power Plant at Sundarbans, Bangladesh
headline: Despite the long protest march earlier this year to stop the plant and protecting the Sundarbans forest, on July 12, 2016, a contract was signed to finally install the plant.

name: Hahotoé-Kpogamé-Kpémé Phosphates Mines & Facilities, SNPT, Togo
headline: Hahotoé and Kpogamé phosphates mines and Kpémé  processing plant pollute the local environment and threatens human health while the company SNPT does not respect its workers' rights.

name: Fisher folks, environmentalists and religious leaders against the Colombo Port City, Sri Lanka
headline: The Colombo Port City Project is one of the most controversial infrastructure projects in Sri Lanka contested by the People’s Movement Against the Port City.

name: The Orano Malvési nuclear plant near Narbonne, France
headline: Controversy over the nuclear waste treatment at the Orano Malvési site in Narbonne. Residents and activists are concerned about the impacts of this site on health, safety and environment, raising debates and protests.

name: Koel-Karo project, India
COFCO Joycome pig farms in Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: Local herders protested in different waves against intensive hog production project with pollution of untreated sewage discharge to grazing land and careless disposal of dead pigs.

name: Open pit coal mining and underground fires in Kiselevsk, Kemerovo, Russia
headline: Local resistance against the effects of coal mines, toxic underground fires and violation of the 1000 m. safety distance.  Locals, activists, journalists under oppression because of protests.

name: Parque eólico en Kimbilá, Yucatán, Mexico
headline: En 2016, la empresa española ELECNOR intentó sin éxito obtener el acuerdo de los habitantes locales para un gran parque de molinos de viento en Kimbilá, Yucatán.

name: Pirin National Park illegal ski resort, Bulgaria
Anti-privatization struggle and remunicipalization of water service in Lagos, Nigeria
headline: Anti-privatization and remunicipalisation struggle in Lagos - The struggle of a local movement to implement a efficient and democratic, public water supply system that is adequate for the challenges of an growing African megacity

name: Batang coal fired power plant, Central Java, Indonesia
headline: Batang district, on the northeastern coast of Java, might soon be home to what has been billed as Southeast Asia’s largest ever coal-fired power plant, despite many protests.

name: Contaminación en Faja del Orinoco, Anzoátegui, Venezuela
headline: Instances of contamination of water courses and aquifers by the oil industry in municipio Moragas in the Faja Petrolífera del Orinoco, Venezuela.

name: Niigata Minamata: mercury poisoning by Showa Denko, Japan
headline: Mercury poisoning was discovered in Niigata some years after the Minamata disease in Kumamoto. The source was methylmercury from the Showa Denko factory, located upstream of the Agano River. One of the Four Big Pollution Disease cases in Japan.

name: Skåne mining project, Sweden
headline: In 2018 the Mining Inspectorate of Sweden granted Scandivandium Ltd  exploration permits in 11 areas covering a total of 22 000 hectares to mine vanadium in the middle of some of the best agricultural land in Europe concerning more than 4000 landowners.

name: Tiger Leaping Gorge dam, Yunnan, China
headline: A successful campaign to protect the Tiger Leaping Gorge ran from 2004 to 2006. In 2007 campaigners managed to stop the dam project, saving a magnificent landscape and also the homes of ethnic minority peoples.

name: Deforestation in Pará and the death of Sister Dorothy Stang, Brazil
headline: Anapu was the place that Dorothy Stang called home for over 30 years, where she is buried, and where she  tried to protect the forest and its people from illegal exploitation by loggers and ranchers.

name: Minería de Oro en el Ejido el Bajío en Caborca, Sonora, México.
headline: El poder judicial en México determinó la restitución ecológica de un territorio dañado por Industrias Peñoles, el consorcio minero más poderoso del país. Peñoles responde con el desacato, la mentira y la criminalización.

name: Quarries and Land Overexploitation in the Baix Camp region, Catalonia, Spain
Ennsnahe Trasse road extension project during the 1990s, Styria, Austria
headline: Fierce grassroots resistance, recourse to legal frameworks and the unexpected support of a corncrake marked the mobilizations against this controversial road extension project.

name: Agip pipeline leaks gas in Ebocha community, Nigeria
Lesotho Highlands Water Project, Lesotho
headline: Phase II of the project is starting and there is no certainty that concerns of the affected population will be taken into account. Failures of phase I risk to be repeated.

name: Dawang Coffee Plantation on Indigenous Territory in South Cotabato, Mindanao, Philippines
headline: Eight members of TAMASCO, including their leader, were killed in a military operation in 2017. The massacre was over a land struggle between indigenous peoples and the Dawang Coffee Plantation. Litigation is still ongoing for the crimes.

name: Cluster of Gas-Fired Power Plants in Brandywine, Maryland, USA
headline: With two power plants already existing in the Brandywine area, three more are proposed to be built with many associated health risks and socio- economic impacts involved, which disproportionately impacts the residents in this area.

name: Megarepresas sobre el Marañon, Chadin 2 y Rio Grande 1 y 2, Perú
headline: “Yo no soy como aquellas autoridades que han sido, que siguen siendo de los que se venden por la plata. Aquella gente que está traicionando al pueblo, se está traicionando a sí mismo y no tiene pena desus hijos, de sus padres, ni de su pueblo” H. Rojas

name: Sugarcane and Gold Mining in Lomitas, Colombia
headline: The dispossession of the traditional farms by the expansion of the sugarcane cultivations and the environmental and health impacts of the gold mining in the Rural Settlement of Lomitas

name: Destruction of Adloun Port, Lebanon
headline: The coast of Adloun, one of the few remaining beaches in Lebanon that have not yet been privatised, is being demolished by the government to build Nabih Berri Fishermen's  Port.

name: Dimna reservoir, Jamshedpur, Jharkhand, India
Dayuma Oil extraction, Ecuador
Gitxsan First Nation Chiefs Prohibit Pipelines in Territory, Canada
Water Management in Flint, Michigan, USA
headline: Thousands of Flint’s residents  have  been exposed since 2014 to lead and other pollutants in their drinking water.

name: Represa El Comedero y el “Ecocidio en Sinaloa” por minería, Mexico
headline: Los pescadores luchan contra la contaminación de la presa El Comedero causado por la mina del Grupo Bacis que ha llevado a mortalidad de peces y peligros de salud a las comunidades debido a la contaminación de agua con arsénico y metales pesados.

name: Eucalyptus plantations in Tumkur district, Karnataka, India
headline: A mass movement took place in 1983 in Tumkur district. In the villages of Barka and Holatalli, the peasants marched to the local nursery and pulled out eucalypt seedlings and planted tamarind seeds in their place

name: Explotación maderera en los Bosques de San Ignacio, Peru
headline: The successful struggle to defend the Podocarpus cloud forest in northern Peru involved local mobilisation, criminalization and torture of activists, in a particularly dark period in the history of the country.

name: Sabah conflict, Malaysia
Explotación de niobio en los municipios de Catalao y Ouvidor, Goiás, Brasil
headline: Extracción de niobio en la mina Boa Vista de Catalao y transformación en hierro-niobio para exportación en el complejo industrial de Ouvidor, generando desplazamiento de las comunidades rurales y tradicionales afectadas, graves impactos en la salud y en los territorios de extracción

name: Oil palm expansion in the protected area Tesso Nilo, Indonesia
headline: Illegal oil palm plantations and palm oil mills are expanding over the protected area: Tesso Nilo, Indonesia. International NGOs trying to protect the forest, elephants and tigers.

name: Asbestos legacy, South Africa
Illegal logging and displacement and killing of landless peasants in Colniza, Mato Grosso, Brazil
headline: The deforestation cycle ‘timber-cattle-soy’ reaches northwest Mato Grosso. Landless peasants are pushed to the margins, threatened by land grabbers and loggers. While killings of peasants remain unpunished, timber exports continue.

name: Despojo de agua potable en Zona Conurbada Zacatecas-Guadalupe, en México
headline: Complaints against Jiapaz (the local water authority) because of the high price of water and its scarcity (water was supplied only two days per week). Street protests in 2018-21.

name: Uprooting and Damaging Olive Trees, Palestine
headline: Israeli settlers continue to burn olive trees on Palestinian lands affecting Palestinian farmers' livelihoods and driving them out of their land.

name: Hundreds of Roma forced to live in chemical laboratory of the CUPROM copper factory, Baia Mare, Romania
headline: In Craica, Baia Mare, in 2012 local authorities forcibly displaced Roma community to live n a disued  toxic chemical factory after their homes had been demolished.

name: Green Isan & Khor Jor Kor projects (and other state plantations), Thailand
Nuclear waste storage and mining near the Spanish frontier, Portugal
headline: "We don’t want to be Europe’s nuclear waste dump" - Border communities resist being burdened with toxic waste with a half-life of of 50.000-500.000 years.

name: Rice cultivation and processing by Agrogeba, Guinea Bissau
Disappearing Canals of Dhaka City, Bangladesh
headline: In last 30 years, the mega City of Dhaka, the most populated Capital of the world, has lost 50 canals due to encroachments that have resulted in collapse of the natural drainage system leading to catastrophic urban flooding in normal monsoon.

name: Interoceanic Grand Canal project, Nicaragua
headline: Strong social and political opposition to the Gran Canal to be built across Nicaragua. Indigenous territories, natural resources and the Nicaragua Lake would be affected. Movement initially led by peasants (Francisca Ramírez).

name: Eucalyptus plantation in Soriano department, Uruguay
Claiming against “black powder” at Tubarão Port in Vitória, Brazil
headline: A combination of iron ore and others pollutants in the air around the Tubarão Port is affecting local population. Vale, Arcellor Mital and Samarco are the companies responsible for the emissions

name: Disaster of Seveso, Italy
headline: North Italy, 1976; chemical industry leaks dangerous substances and Italy learns how pollution kills.

name: Laos-China Railway, Lao PDR
headline: As part of its Kunming-Singapore line, China is building a 410-kilometer railway line in Laos that will displace more than 4,400 families. Activists have raised concerns also regarding the debt burden and the lack of proper compensation.

name: Jacksons Airport and evictions from land claimed by National Airports Corporation, PNG
headline: The National Airports Corporation's claim of ownership of land around Jacksons Airport is contested by traditional landowners and settler communities. The latest in a series of forced eviction exercises, in Saiwara and Erima, was announced in January 2022

name: Tanintharyi National Park (proposed) on Karen indigenous lands, Tanintharyi region, Myanmar
headline: “Conservation organizations […] have so far failed to acknowledge the importance of Karen communities as forest defenders in protecting forest resources from outside incursions" [1]

name: Conversión de biomasa de la planta de Mercure
headline: ¿Está Enel's en el valle de Mercure, dentro del Parque Nacional Pollino, es realmente un trabajo necesario?

name: Kobe City Fight Against Coal, Japan
headline: The Kobe 1,300 MW project is one of many new power stations burning coal being planned or built. It is challenged by lawsuits. One alternative is to increase the use of LNG or solar electricity.

name: Telkwa Coal Mine, British Columbia, Canada
headline: More extractivism proposed on Wet'suwet'en territory. Bulkley Valley residents oppose Telkwa Coal Mine over concerns of air and water pollution and climate impacts.

name: Hulene Dump Site and waste-pickers protests, Mozambique
headline: In 2018, after a deadly garbage landslide at Hulene Dump in Maputo Mozambique, wastepicker residents protested for more safe and secure livelihoods. For years, the government has delayed relocating families and has yet to formally recognize their work.

name: North River Sewage Treatment Plant, USA
headline: A case of environmental justice success in the USA; the campaign WE ACT forced the US government to address the issue of water treatment in the North River in Manhattan.

name: Pollution by export oriented tannery industries, Bangladesh
headline: Government fails to regulate polluting tanneries causing miseries to millions

name: Murders of UMAN leaders over mining, logging, and plantations near Butuan City, Agusan del Norte, Philippines
headline: In Caraga region, police and military commit widespread violence against lumad and peasant leaders moblizing against mining, logging, and plantations under the guise of a war on communism.

name: Northern Access Pipeline, Pennsylvania and New York, USA
headline: Indigenous groups and local EJOs fight the proposed Northern Access Pipeline (NAPL) by National Fuel Gas Supply Corporation & Empire Pipeline, from Pennsylvania to New York state and Canada.

name: Mineria Ilegal Santander de Quilichao, Colombia
Termoeléctricas de Iberdrola en Tamazunchale, San Luis Potosí, México
headline: Una central de ciclo combinado promovida por la empresa española Iberdrola ha generado multiples impactos durante su fase de planeación, construcción y operación en el municipio de Tamazunchale en la huasteca potosina.

name: Dadri Power Project, UP, India
Controversy over planned paraxylene (PX) plant construction in Jiujiang, Jiangxi, China
headline: Despite escalation of protests on many other sites of PX production, people in Jiujiang were targeted with an information campaign by the government that smoothed away opposition.

name: Petrochemical industrial park in Hoima, Uganda
headline: 7,118 people were evicted for a petrochemical industrial park in the Hoima District and struggles for fair compensation and rehabilitation continue. An airport is under construction, in the first phase freighters will deliver equipment for an oil refinery

name: Nawalgarh Special Economic Zone, RJ, India
Niyamgiri-Vedanta Bauxite Mining, India
headline: Adivasi communities in Orissa push back one of the world mining giants in an historical struggle. In 2017, Prafulla Samantara, one of the social activists in the area and born in a family of farmers, was granted the Goldman Environmental Prize

name: Extraccion de oro por la Minera TROY S.A.C. en Cajamarca, Peru
headline: Minera Troy, a small company, illegally obtained permission for water use. There were complaints, a court case, and the company was fined. It is uncertain whether the project is going ahead.

name: Matsés indigenous resistance to oil exploration in Amazon, Peru&Brazil
Lakshadweep islands residents complain against a “political-corporate” nexus, India
headline: Lakshadweep residents are in conflict with BJP authorities on  the impact of large development tourist projects which may undermine marine biology and the  livelihood of the fishing communities.

name: Pondoland Wild Coast Xolobeni mining threat, South Africa
headline: The Xolobeni titanium mining project by Australian company Mineral Commodities (MRC) was opposed by the Amadiba Crisis Committee since 2005. In 2016, ACC leader "Bazooka" Rhadebe, was assassinated. The conflict continues as the state presses ahead.

name: Nautical tourism in the Lastovo Islands Nature Park, Croatia
headline: Lastovo archipelago in Croatia declared Nature Park opposing uncontrolled development of nautical  tourism by the effort of local inhabitants, the Sunce association, the WWF for Nature, and Ministry of Culture.

name: Caramanta, Antioquia, Colombia
Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve, Maharastra, India
headline: Villagers protest against relocation and for the recognition of their forest rights. Mining activities and other projects threaten biodiversity in the TR.

name: Fire in Biosphere Reserve Sian Ka'an, Quintana Roo, Mexico
headline: Regular fires in Sian Ka'an - it is alleged that local inhabitants burn the savannah to hunt species that flee from the fire. Once burnt, sprouts appear, animals come to feed and they are captured.

name: King-King copper and gold mine in Pantukan, Compostela, Mindanao, Philippines
headline: In January 2016, 60 years old Teresita Navacilla was killed. She was a member of the Save Pantukan Movement, a network of indigenous peoples  fighting for the right to their ancestral lands and opposing large-scale open pit mining.

name: Cancer Village Qiugang and Jiucailuo Chemical plant in Anhui, China
headline: Haihua Chemical Products Corporation polluting waters and causing an unprecedent rate of cancer at Anhui Province

name: Karayan Dam in Chico River, Lucog, Kalinga, The Philippines
headline: The Indigenous Peoples of the Philippine Cordillera have resisted against large-scale hydro projects since 1970. In 2007, Karayan Dam is planned in the ancestral domain of the Dallac tribe in Lucog, Kalinga.

name: Dadhocha dam, Punjab, Pakistan
headline: Public meetings by displaced by the Dadhocha dam near Rawat. Many villagers are facing eviction without resettlement through imposition of the colonial Land Acquisition Act.

name: Videocon SEZ, Wagholi, MH, India
Ratnagiri Oil Refinery in Nanar, Maharashtra, India
headline: Constant protests by local residents - farmers, fishermen and neighbours in Ratnagiri, led to the successful cancelling of the proposed oil refinery, planned to be the world's largest.

name: Vale company’s tailings dam failure in Brumadinho, MG, Brazil
headline: "Não foi acidente. Foi crime". In the foretold failure of this tailings dam on 25/1/ 2019 in Minas Gerais, there were over 350 people killed, many of them employees of the company. "Choramos com a Mãe Terra lágrimas de lama e sangue. "

name: Lignite mining in Lampang, Thailand
headline: Villagers from Ban Haeng petitioned and litigated against Green Yellow Co. Ltd which was granted concessions for lignite mining without local consent. They successfully  challenged the project in court.

name: Gold mining and mercury pollution, Suriname
headline: Large scale and small-scale (illegal) gold mining is booming, causing deforestation and criminal activity. Mercury from the mining process pollutes soil and waters, threatening public health and biodiversity.

name: Asbestos removal from the built environment, Portugal
headline: A long battle against the harmful material finally brought in Oct 2017 to the Portuguese parliament's order of asbestos removal from private buildings and facilities (approximately 4,200 interventions), including housing.

name: Europa city, triangle of Gonesse, France
headline: Farmers and environmentalists have been against this mega-project of urban development near Paris, supported by Auchan and the Chinese investor Wanda.

name: Proyecto Andacollo, Neuquen, Argentina
headline: Gold and silver mining in Andacollo Neuquén. Uncertainly regarding health impacts. The Minera Andacollo Gold (MAGSA) left. Now,  there is a new contract with Trident  Mining Explorations.

name: Koidu diamond mining conflict, Sierra Leone
Urbanistic Plan in Valdevaqueros, Tarifa, Spain
Extracción ilegal de algas marinas en la región Ica, Perú
headline: La colecta y acopio de algas marinas en el litoral peruano sustenta al rededor de 1,900 familias, siendo esta la principal fuente de ingreso económico.  Sin embargo, la presión extractiva ilegal ha generado conflictos y agotamiento del recurso.

name: Waste dump in Montchanin, France
headline: At the heart of Montchanin (Saône-et-Loire) a class 1 landfill for hazardous waste caused a major ecological scandal in France and rotted for ten years the lives of  2,000 people.

name: Waste Transfer Station in Eykarpia, Greece
headline: Residents and stakeholders are opposing the construction of a Waste Transfer Station and co-incineration technology close to the city of Efkarpia, promoting recycling and composting and not huge infrastructure that requires large amounts of garbage

name: Colombo-Matara highway and land dispossession, Sri Lanka
headline: Weak public consultation process and inadequate resettlement; ADB faces stiff opposition to a highway construction from multiple communities affected at various stages of project development

name: Illegal gold mining and poaching in Vale do Javari Indigenous Territory, Amazonas, Brazil
headline: With the politically motivated stoppage of monitoring and rights protection, extractive invasions in Vale do Javari are on the rise leading to killings of indigenous isolated communities and environmental defenders.

name: Cyclone Aila affected people demand adequate disaster relief, Bangladesh
headline: Thousands of people affected by cyclone Aila in 2009 are yet to be rehabilitated. How will Bangladesh deal with more of such events due to climatic change? Which rights of the disaster affected people should be recognised and protected?

name: “Franken” shipwreck from WWII threatens Baltic Sea near Gdańsk, Poland
headline: Fundacja Mare and the Baltic Sea Conservation Foundation propose and demand that the Polish Government take action to prevent an oil spill from a WWII oil tanker wreckage.

name: Coal mining in Dehing Patkai, Assam, India
headline: Granting coal mining permission during the 2020 pandemic in a region marred with illegal coal mining, rich biodiversity and indigenous communities in Assam is met with strong protests.

name: Eviction from Kanha Tiger Reserve, MP, India
headline: Mass eviction from Kanha Tiger Reserve and violation of forest rights to the traditional indigenous Baiga community living in the park.

name: African Minerals Ltd’s Tonkolili Iron Ore Mine in Bumbuna, Sierra Leone
headline: In 2010, African Minerals Ltd. forcibly relocated hundreds of villagers to establish the Tonkolili mine. Police brutality against female and male protestors continued with impunity.

name: Resistance to coal stockpiling leads to Gloria Capitan's murder, Bataan, Philippines
headline: She opposed the construction of coal stockpile facilities as leader of the local anti-coal movement, member of the Philippine Movement for Climate Justice. She was shot in July 2016.

name: Torrevaliga central de carbono al norte de Civitavecchia
Yasuoka Offshore Wind Power Generation, Japan
headline: A movement against offshore wind power generation spread rapidly in Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, led by residents and fishermen fearing health hazards and defending livelihoods.

name: Dublin Airport expansion, Ireland
headline: Pollution and noise from Dublin Airport operations and construction work has exacted a heavy toll on nearby communities. Expansion, including a new runway, is imminent and will make nearby homes uninhabitable and many households have moved away.

name: Luksic's investment damages Ramsar site of Pantanos de Villa, Lima, Peru
headline: A Ramsar site in suburban Lima was threatened by industrial developments - the main one, a large pasta factory belonging to the Chilean Luksic group.

name: Wind Power Plants in occupied territories of Western Sahara
headline: Saharaui people mobilize against several wind power projects in the occupied area by Morocco. Projects are seen as reinforcing the illegal occupation and exploitation of local resources.

name: Lliquimuni,  Bolivia
headline: Oil exploration in Moseten territory by YPFB without proper consultation, and dividing the community.

name: Waste incineration fuelled cement plant in Toral de los Vados, León, Spain
headline: Opponents to co-incineration for health impacts managed to withdraw the permission to burn waste, but company appeal to Supreme Tribunal

name: Haw River and Jordan Lake water contamination, NC, US
headline: The Haw River Contamination Crisis: Exploring the causes, effects, and responses to the 80 years toxic pollution of a major water source by "forever chemicals" PFAS.

name: Tiradero al cielo abierto San Jose Huilango, México
headline: Tiradero de basura al cielo abierto, Ejido San José Huilango, Cuautitlán Izcallí, Estado de México, operado por el Ayuntamiento de Cuautitlán Izcallí.

name: Conflicto por la presión inmobiliaria y el estatus de protección de la Peña Colorada , Querétaro, México
headline: La Peña Colorada, esencial para la vida en el valle de Querétaro, se encuentra vulnerada desde los años 2000's por el crecimiento urbano descontrolado y el ineficiente ordenamiento territorial. Desde hace años, se busca convertirla en Área Protegida.

name: Bhakra Nangal Project, India
headline: One of the earliest river valley development schemes undertaken by India after independence, it never met its original goals. After 50 years, affected villagers still waiting for reparations

name: Detroit's Waste Incinerator, USA
headline: The  Detroit Renewable Power is the largest solid waste incinerator in the United States, representing one  iconic environmental and social justice fight. It is, also deeply implicated in Detroit's budget crisis.

name: Proyecto Inmobiliario City Center y el Humedal del Parque Los Cárcamos en León, Guanajuato, México
headline: En la ciudad de Léon, organizaciones locales, cuidadanas y cuidadanos se oponen al proyecto inmobiliario City Center por sus afectaciones al humedal del Parque Los Cárcamos

name: Pesticides and Childhood Cancer, California, USA
Nam Ma coal mines, Shan state, Myanmar
headline: Shan farmers call on the government to “immediately stop the mining operations, which are damaging their farming livelihoods, environment and health” [1].

name: Rio Tinto proposed lithium mine in Jadar Valley, Serbia
headline: Local residents and allies defend the right to say NO, denounce the lack of participation and information, and resist the proposed lithium-borates mine by Rio Tinto, and backed by the Serbian government, in a farming villages and rich cultural area.

name: Tesla battery metals from Nornickel, Talnakh, Arctic Russia
headline: An open letter from Indigenous Peoples of Russia urging Tesla company to respect them and not to associate with nickel producer Nornickel, a company with an extensive record of  socio-environmental devastation in the Arctic.

name: Highway, Part of Scan Link, Ljungskile, Sweden
Kidapawan massacre  in 2016 over hungry farmers protest, North Cotabato, the Philippines
headline: A group of protesting farmers that were just demanding 15,000 sacks of rice as drought-relief were shot by the security forces in Kidapawan City.

name: Enbridge Pipelines Inc. - Line 9B Reversal and Line 9 Capacity Expansion Project, Canada
headline: "Aboriginal rights have once again been stepped on," said  Chippewas of the Thames First Nation chief after Canada's highest court ruling.

name: Bhogapuram Airport and Aerotropolis, India
headline: Villagers’ resistance to loss of farmland and livelihoods for Bhogapuram Aerotropolis resulted in a reduction of the land area allocated to the project, and court victories stalled land acquisition and secured higher compensation for a group of farmers

name: Artvin Cerattepe and Genya Mine, Turkey
headline: Residents of Artvin, a small town in the North-eastern Black Sea region in Turkey continue to resist the opening of a dangerous gold and copper mine in the Cerattepe area since more than 20 years. After years of resistance, the conflict is still ongoing

name: Successful Janakalyan Community Forest User Group, Nawalparasi, Nepal
headline: Conflict between forest authority and landless in the management and use of forest land and resources in Janakalyan, Nawalparasi.

name: Roma protest against wall built by authorities to “protect them from heavy traffic”, Beja, Portugal
headline: The municipality of Beja, Portugal, housed 50 Roma in an area with water drainage complications and erected a wall to "protect them from heavy traffic". After years of protests the Roma residents tore down the wall.

name: Yuvarlakcay water movement, Turkey
Stuttgart 21 Project, Germany
Shaanxi Dongling (Lead and Zinc) Smelting Co., Fengxiang, China
headline: In August 2009, villagers of Fengxiang County, Shaanxi Province protested the lead poisoning of more than 600 children by Dongling Smelting Co.

name: Maradykovsky chemical weapon facility, Russia
headline: Maradykovsky Chemical Weapons Storage and Disposal Facility is in Mirniy village in Kirov Oblast. Between 1953 and 2005 it stored 6928 tonnes of chemical waste. There are protests in 2019, 2020.

name: Richards Bay Minerals dune mining, South Africa
NSukala Sugar plantation and refinery in Cercle de Segou, Mali
Marmato mines, Colombia
Oil spill of ExxonMobil in Ibeno Community, Nigeria
Cruise Ships impacting Venetian Lagoon, Italy
Panyu waste incineration project, Guangzhou, China
headline: In 2009, a conflict on a waste incineration plant between local inhabitants and government in Panyu attracted massive attention. The project was moved to Dagang Town, in Nansha District, the whole Xinlian'ercun village will be demolished.

name: Uranium Mining in the Southwest in Navajo Nation, USA
headline: As of 2005, the Navajo Nation has banned uranium mining on their land. However, due to the large supply of uranium under the Navajo Reservation companies have been trying to re-open mines. Liabilities remain.

name: Sport and Recreation Center 'Svetice' Zagreb, Croatia
headline: The recreational and professional users of the public SRC ‘Svetice’ in Zagreb oppose its demolition to give way to a commercial sports center.

name: Contaminación de industria porcícola PRONACA  en Tsáchilas, Ecuador
headline: Intensive pork production has contaminated the soils and the water, and allegedly causes infectious diseases to local population.

name: Minera Invierno de carbón en Isla Riesco, Chile
headline: One coal mining project in Chile against which there was environmental opposition by conservationist groups. Finally discarded in 2019 through the courts. An environmental success.

name: Parque Eólico Dzilam Bravo, Yucatán, México
headline: Primer parque eólico construido en península de Yucatán después de un largo proceso de casi diez años, en un contexto de desconocimiento sobre sus impactos en una zona marginada, de alta importancia y fragilidad ambiental.

name: Nuclear storage facilities in Gorleben, and Castor transport. Germany
headline: Gorleben is known as the site of a radioactive waste disposal facility. Once reprocessed, waste comes back to Germany from La Hague (France) in the controversial Castor convoys attracting tens of thousands of demonstrators.

name: Illegal road construction inside Sinharaja WHS, Sri Lanka
headline: A World Bank funded road is meant to attract more tourism in the area but causes huge damage to flora and fauna in the UNESCO World Heritage Site and Man and Biosphere Reserve

name: Unidad Minera Huarón de Pan American Silver, Huayllay, Pasco, Peru
headline: The operation of Huarón unit by Canadian company Pan American Silver generated a conflict with the peasant community due to environmental effects and land use, and multiple strikes by mining workers.

name: Indígenas wayúu del Socuy defienden sus territorios ante extracción de carbón y otros proyectos, Venezuela
headline: Indigenous Wayuu  from Socuy resist the expansion of coal mining and infrastructure projects in northern Zulia. Intense disputes over territories occur with Carbozulia and other actors involved.

name: Villagers engage in turtle conservation against sand mining, northern Kerala, India
headline: This is a well documented case of grassroots conservation of Olive Ridley turtles by local fishermen fighting against the sand mining industry in Kolavipalam beach in northern Kerala.

name: Derrames del oleoducto de Petroperú en la Amazonia, Perú
headline: Continuous oil spills in the  Peruvian Amazon and down to the coast to Piura, along the country's ill maintained forty years old pipeline belonging to Petroperu.

name: Protesters in Quezon City, resist planned incinerators despite national ban, Philippines
headline: Environmental groups, waste pickers and residents protest as Quezon City's government is pursuing the construction of incinerators despite a national ban against incinerators and over the objections of local citizens.

name: Hassi Messaoud oil field, Algeria
headline: Located in the center of Algeria, the Hassi Messaoud oil field  is operated by the state-owned company Sonatrach and is the largest oil field in Algeria.

slug: Lithium Mining Exploration in the Serra d'Arga
name: Lithium Mining Exploration in the Serra d'Arga
headline: Local communities from Alto Minho in Portugal are mobilizing against the exploration of lithium mining in the Serra d'Arga. Civil society movements and environmental associations warn for the harmful impact of mineral extraction to the region.

name: Stoca Mine Waste, Wittelsheim, France
headline: At the heart of the battle between local and environmental associations and the government is StocaMine, a storage site for non-radioactive toxic waste. 42.000 tons of this waste, buried 500 meters underground, are awaiting the final verdict.

name: Kárahnjúkar dam, Iceland
Toxic and Abandoned Formerly Used Defense Sites (FUDS) on St. Lawrence Island, Alaska
headline: The profound implications of pollution and toxins from the Formerly Used Defense Sites (FUDS) on St. Lawrence Island, Alaska U.S. on local Indigenous Tribes living on the island.

name: Gold mining in Orton, Ilynka, Uchas, and Trekhrechye (Mezhdurechensky), Kemerovo, Russia
headline: Alluvial mining polluting Indigenous Shor's rivers, meadows and traditional land management.  In an effort with national and international NGOs, the peoples express concerns in a collectively written report.

name: Ethanol Fuel Plant Land Conflict, Zimbabwe
Cauldhall Open Cast Coal Mine in Midlothian, Scotland, UK
New Phnom Penh Airport and Airport City, Kandal province, Cambodia
headline: Hundreds of families are resisting displacement for New Phnom Penh Airport. Mass protests led to clashes with police and nine charged with violence were acquitted. Excavators have been deployed to clear rice fields and people’s crops have been destroyed.

name: Roma community evicted because of water purification issue, Roma, Italy
headline: After the failure of the Camping River camp sewage and water purification systems due to negligence, the local government issued the eviction of the 400 Roma in it failing to meet the European Court for Human Rights' demand for a postponement.

name: ILVA industry in Taranto, Italy
headline: Save jobs or the environment? The false dilemma of environmental justice struggle: it is simply impossible to separate or to alienate life from work

name: Life after the uranium mines in Buhovo, Bulgaria
Drinking Water Supply and Agroindustry in Villagorgona, Colombia
headline: The contamination of rivers by agroindustry of sugarcane and the lack of groundwater because of intensive agricultural activities have affected the town of Villagorgona since its foundation

name: Siberut Oil Palm conflict, West Sumatra, Indonesia
Bhobodoho Water Logging in Jessore, Bangladesh
headline: Devastating water logging in southern Bangladesh keeps at least one million people under water for years. Due to hydrological complexities, the problem, caused by structural interventions funded by ADB and USAID, remains unresolved.

name: Rio Guabas, Valle del Cauca, Colombia
Aquaculture in Kolleru Wildlife Sanctuary and pollution, AP, India
headline: What hides behind the beloved seasonal fish salad in our plates? The RAMSAR site of the Kolleru sanctuary is facing pollution and degradation due to large scale shrimp farming for export.

name: Tierraviva urban project in the vicinity of the Rio Blanco Forest Reserve, Manizales
headline: Urban project underway in the buffer zone of the Río Blanco Protective Forest Reserve in Manizales, Colombia.

name: Shicaohe coal mining conflict, Yunnan, China
headline: Mining at Shicaohe coal mine led to violent conflict with local residents in Luliang, Qujing, Yunnan Province, China. The villagers demand appropiate compensation for the farmland lost to the mine.

name: Water pumping dispute against gold mining corporations in Klerksdorp, North West Province, South Africa
headline: Carin Bosman and supporters succeeded in filing legal action against mining companies to get them to pay for water pumping preventing further acid mine drainage.

name: Mavoor Gwalior Rayon Factory, Calicut, Kerala, India
headline: Struggle against water and air pollution and workers' rights violations against the Grasim wood pulp factory belonging to the Aditya Birla Group in the village of Mavoor, from 1963 till 1999.

name: Private development in Kiambu Forest near Nairobi, Kenya
headline: Business developers have been illegally lang-grabbing parts of the Kiambu Forest while terrorizing any opposition. Joannah Stutchbury was likely killed for winning a court case evicting one of the developers, Agropack Limited

name: GMR Chhattisgarh Energy Limited, India
Proyecto Hidroeléctrico San Rafael, Costa Rica
headline: Rural communities oppose the building of the hydroelectric project of San Rafael in San Jose province because of risks to wildlife and to local water availability.

name: Represa Santa Teresa II, Cusco, Perú
headline: Hydropower plants often are proposed to be extended to increase their capacity. Second phase of Santa Teresa dam implies deviation of the river and extension of the power house to reach a total of 280MW. In the protests, a young student was shot dead

name: Protests in Nyarong district for mining exploitation, Ganzi TAP, Sichuan, China
headline: On 8 April 2010, a monk of Kardze Monastery  organized a local manifestation against the mining exploitation in the  Nyarong. He was  arbitrary arrested and detained  by Police. His exact whereabouts wasn’t ascertained.

name: Protests against Suixi GCL Solar Power Plant Project in Zhanjiang, Guangdong, China
headline: Villagers in Suixi of Guangdong protested against a photovoltaic project due to health concerns and the way how the project was implemented.

name: Bahia Malaga, Colombia
Songjiang battery project, Shanghai, China
headline: Plans for a lithium battery plant in Songjiang in the outskirts of Shanghai were cancelled following the protests of concerned residents

name: Chandrapur Super Thermal Power Station, India
NO-TAV movement against High Speed Train, Val di Susa, Italy
Oil & gas extraction on Bioko Island, Equatorial Guinea
headline: The Bioko Island is progressively being turned into a petrochemical complex, threatening the local population Bubi people livelihoods.

name: Kori Kollo mine, Bolivia
headline: In spite of decades of local farmers' and inhabitants' mobilization, their claims have been barely satisfied while the pollution provoked by the mine remains problematical.

name: Waste pickers fight exclusion at Santiago's “Eco-Park Rafey”, Dominican Republic
headline: Initially started as a socially inclusive development project, recycling at Rafey landfill became controversially privatized after 2010. Hundreds of waste pickers became violently displaced from the new eco-park and remain without perspective.

name: Gorilla Poaching in Virunga Mountains, Rwanda
headline: Many extractivist companies (mining, oil, agribusiness, etc) have led to increased gorilla poaching because of the land grabbing and habitat destruction they cause. Dian Fossey was a gorilla conservationist fighting against poaching before her murder.

name: Transporte de cobre en Antofagasta y movimiento Este Polvo te Mata, Chile
headline: In Antofagasta, strong complaints against black dust from transport of exported copper concentrates. More cancers in proportion than any other city in Chile. Hence a direct action movement, with the slogan "Este Polvo te Mata"- this dust kills you.

name: Class action lawsuit against gold companies from miners with silicosis, South Africa
headline: Silicosis is a deadly respiratory disease  disproportionately affecting black mineworkers in South Africa. After long legal battles and protests, February 2020 marked a victory for justice for miners through compensation.

name: Spill in Agip's Brass River Terminal affecting fishing communities, Nigeria
headline: In November 2013, AGIP/NAOC Brass River terminal spilled more than 550,000 liters of crude oil, disrupting marine life and putting under threat the surrounding fishing communities' livelihoods.

name: Deocha-Pachami-Dewanganj-Harinsingha, Birbhum Coalfield, India
Passante de Mestre
Niafourang opposing sand mining for zircon, Casamance coastline, Senegal
headline: Zircon mining in Casamance is contested by the locals  defending their sustainable and traditional livelihoods against the mining and weakening of the Niafourang dune. The exploitation is expected to start by October 2017.

name: Quifel Agribusiness agrofuels or foodcrop projects in Port Loko, Sierra Leone
Los impactos socioambientales del Complejo Refinador Paraguaná, Venezuela
headline: One of the largest refinery facilities of the world has affected for several decades the surrounding communities with gas flaring and accumulation of pet coke.

name: Kangaluwi Copper Mine in the Lower Zambezi National Park, Zambia
headline: Twenty years after granting an exploration licence, the Zambian government has accepted the proposal for an open pit copper mine – the Kangaluwi project - in the heart of the Lower Zambezi National Park.

name: Huadian Pingjiang coal-fired power station, Hunan, China
headline: More than 10,000 people demonstrate against a large coal-fired power plant at Pingjiang, holding banners with remarks of “President Xi: We do not want the short-term development at the cost of ecological environment“

name: No QuakeLab Center, Ascoli Piceno, Italy
headline: "After the earthquake, the cement" is the slogan of the local committees that oppose to the construction of a multifunctional pole in Capodipiano di Venarotta. The project is considered unnecessary, out of context and aimed at cementing the mountain.

name: Steppe Gold’s ATO Mine in Tsagaan-Ovoo Soum, Dornod, Mongolia
headline: Since 2017, Steppe Gold has been mining gold on land belonging to a local pastoral community without their consent. The company violently represses protestors with impunity.

name: Regasifier de Medgas LNG
headline: Terminal para el rechazo de GNL en la llanura de Gioia Tauro

name: Cutting down of the Zlatibor park forest, Serbia
headline: Despite opposition by the local civil association, Zlatibor park forest -consisted of pine trees aged from 50-100 years- was cut to give way to touristic infrastructure.

name: Urban housing project on the Ohlone peoples' Shellmound and Village Site,  Berkeley, California, US
headline: A coalition of Ohlone people, Native organizations, citizens and individuals for in historic preservation, social justice, and cultural diversity oppose housing development project on 5000 year old Ohlone Sacred land.

name: Hydrocarbons exploitation off-shore by Kosmos Energy, along Grande-Côte, Senegal
headline: Kayar's fishermen are worried concerning the upcoming exploitation of hydrocarbons along their coast. They  are not well informed.

name: Mudumalai Tiger Reserve and disputes over land, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: Conflicts over land acquisition within and around Madumalai Tiger Reserve in violation of the Forest Rights Act.

name: Destrucción del sitio sagrado Tacushcalco y contaminación del río Ceniza, El Salvador
headline: Tacushcalco es un lugar sagrado náhuat en El Salvador que ha resistido al saqueo cultural y ambiental. Es atacado por inmobiliarias y por la industria cañera.

name: Mega Housing Project declared Illegal, Bangladesh
headline: The Supreme Court finally directed to abandon an illegal mega housing project in Dhaka city and restore a flood flow zone

name: Coal power plant in Bargny, Senegal
headline: Strong opposition to the new coal power plant in the already polluted city of Bargny. People ask to the government to invest in renewable energy to increase national production.

name: Black Earth Farming/massive AgroInvest farming operation, Russia
Roma living next to a landfill under constant threat of eviction in Aspropyrgos, Greece
headline: Roma are reportedly living in conditions of great negligence by the authorities and environmental harms; with a lack of water and electricity, as well as the constant threat of eviction and the presence of a landfill next to settlement.

name: Petrobras oil exploration and illegal logging in Murunahua indigenous reserve, Ucayali, Peru
headline: Petrobras acquired a concession in the middle of the Peruvian Amazon but after critique abandoned the project for the moment. Meanwhile, isolated communities face existential threats from illegal loggers who invade their territories.

name: Water pollution from acid drainage due to coal mining in Carolina, Mpumalanga, South Africa
headline: Carolina has long suffered from water pollution owing mainly to acid drainage from coal mining. Women are particularly damaged. The local community  protested and pursued legal action.

name: Daryan Dam and its transboundary impacts, Iran
headline:
"Water is a resource that does not belong to any particular nation or sect. Instead of being used_x000D_
as a tool in a nationalist conflict, water could – and should – be utilized as a means of_x000D_
cooperation and a tool for coexistence."

name: Delta & Pine's toxic waste in Paraguay
headline: In 1998 the Delta & Pine company dumped 660 tons of expired cottonseed treated with agrotoxics in Rincón-i-Ybycuí, a rural community located 120 kilometres south from Asuncion. This action lead to environmental and health damage.

name: Minería de carbón en La Jagua de Ibirico (Cesar), Colombia
headline: Un municipio con su riqueza carbonífera que desde 1985 se explota a través de la minería a cielo abierto por muchas empresas, sufre impactos elevados sobre salud y su economía

name: Sardar Sarovar Dam, India
headline: One of the most controversial dam projects in the world is at the core of a 30 year old resistance in Central India. Despite clear unviability of the project, the Indian government turns its back on its people

name: Incineration and hazardous informal recycling in Hanoi, Vietnam
headline: With the construction of new waste-to-energy plants, Hanoi is rapidly moving towards technology-based solutions to its growing waste problems, 'wasting' the recycling potential of over 20,000 waste pickers whose livelihoods are increasingly under threat.

name: Hoa Mac Industrial Park Land Disputes, Duy Tien District, Vietnam
headline: From agriculture to industry: land grabs, lack of participation and low compensations mark the process of industrialization in Duy Tien District.

name: Minería ilegal y la contaminación por mercurio en El Callao, Venezuela
headline: Terrible social and environmental consequences left by the current use of mercury in illegal mining in El Callao. There is a potential conflict at larger scale, in a town with mining vocation.

name: Guiyu National Circular Economy Industrial Park, Guangdong, China
headline: E-waste formalization in Guiyu: National Circular Economy Industrial Park. Guiyu is a lesson that a 'war on pollution' is best fought through preventing the pollution in the first place.

name: Dairi Lead-Zinc Project in Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: Dairi Prima Mineral is planning to build an underground mine to extract zinc, lead and silver ore that will create millions of cubic meters of toxic tailings in one of the world’s highest earthquake risk zones in Sumatra.

name: Wind farm licensing cases, Hungary
headline: In December 2016, the Hungarian parliament passed a law that bans wind turbines within a 12-kilometer radius of populated areas. There were a number of conflicts regarding wind farms in Hungary.

name: Christopher Columbus Landing Resort in Playuela, Puerto Rico
headline: Puerto Rico's biodiversity and the small amount of unspoiled undeveloped land need to be protected. Locals, professors, and surfers alike oppose to mega tourism facilities

name: Jubail plant and Desalination, Saudi Arabia
headline: As Saudi Arabia suffers from water scarcity, the country developed desalination plants to supply its citizens with fresh water. However, this operation impacts air quality and marine life.

name: Crisis del agua en la Zona Metropolitana de Aguascalientes, México
headline: Over one million people in Aguascalientes are about to suffer from lack of water because of the priority to the transnational Veolia and to the soft drinks, textile and motor car industries.

name: Ghaghoo mine diamond extraction in the Central Kalahari Game Reserve, Botswana
headline: After years of bushmen's struggle to defend the access to their territory, an open diamond pit opened in 2014, theatening their traditional livelihoods.

name: Rio Tinto’s Kennecott Copper Mine near Salt Lake City, Utah, USA
headline: Rio Tinto´s Kennecott copper mine in Bingham Canyon has been conflictive for many decades with impunity, with scandals including worker mistreatment, environmental violations, and sponsoring the 2012 London Olympics.

name: Coal mining in Barangay Ned, Lake Sebu, South Cotabato, Philippines
headline: Indigenous people were killed by the Army in 2017, in a pattern of land grabbing and displacement by plantations and also, recently, by coal mining. In 2018 local authorities stopped the mining project.

name: Huaraz climate litigation against RWE, Peru
headline: In an unprecedented legal battle for climate justice, a Peruvian farmer is suing German energy company RWE. Responsible for 0.5% of historic emissions, they should share financial responsibility for building defences against the melting Andean glaciers.

name: Consulta Popular en Piedras, Tolima, Colombia
Water mega-basins in the Deux-Sèvres county, France
headline: The French state wants to build several water retention basins to favour irrigation for intensive farming. Local collectives join in order to prevent the construction of the basins.

name: Porgera Joint Venture (PJV) gold mine, Papua New Guinea
headline: The cost of gold: extrajudicial killings, gang rapes and other depressing human rights abuses have marked the development of the Porgera Joint Venture (PJV) gold mine in Papua New Guinea

name: Dakatcha Woodland biofuel project, Kenya
Nickel ore exploration in Mokra Gora region, Serbia
Land Grabbing by Farm Land of Guinea, Inc. in Faranah Region, Guinea
headline: Land grabbing by US companies for export products and land use change in West Africa; a deadly cocktail for Ebola disease spread, inequality, and social injustices

name: Shwe Taung Cement Factory, Mandalay, Myanmar
headline: Dirty coal fuels a controversial cement factory in Mandalay, financed by World Bank's IFC. A large civil society coalition has denounced it as irresponsible investment.

name: Iron mining in the Penokee Hills, USA
headline: What to expect from an openpit mine and the "Bad River Watershed Destruction Act"? Nothing good. Native tribes and other citizens united, forced the company to cancel the project, and boosted debate around mining in the county

name: Hazards from Sarez Lake, an  issue still unsolved in Central Asia, Tajikistan
headline: Lake Sarez, deep in the Pamir mountains of Tajikistan, was created 100 years ago when a strong earthquake triggered a massive landslide that, in turn, became a huge dam along the Murghob River, now called the Usoi Dam or Sarez Lake.

name: Kaolin mining by Mibal company, Braga, Portugal
headline: The 'endless controversy' and serious divergences between the company and local residents over kaolin mining since the '60s, as their wells dried up and due to the lack of maintenance of the craters opened up by the mine.

name: Lignite mining Jaenschwalde-Nord (Kerkwitz, Grabko, Atterwasch), Germany
Panchet Dam and the Damodar Valley Project, Jharkhand, India
Proyecto Minero Cerro del Gallo, Guanajuato, México
headline: En la cuenca de la Independencia, en el estado de Guanajuato, comunidades se oponen al proyecto minero a tajo abierto Cerro de Gallo de Argonaut Gold por las afectaciones sociales y ambientales que generará.

name: Coal power plant Sostanj - TES 6, Slovenia
One million tonnes of nuclear wastewater from Fukushima Prefecture to Chinese and South Korean waters, Japan
headline: Permission has been granted to release one million tonnes of contaminated water from the ruined Fukushima Daiichi NPP into the ocean, causing  protests from citizens & the fishing industry in neighbouring countries.

name: Oil and Gas Exploration in the Kavango region threatens San People and Endangered Wildlife, Botswana-Namibia
headline: Plans for oil exploration and drilling in the Kavango region of Namibia and Botwana by Canadian company ReconAfrica threaten Okavango Delta, endangered species and sacred land for the San people.

name: Mont Saint-Michel, against wind turbines, France
headline: This conflict on wind turbines ended with a court case decision in August 2013 against bulding a wind farm that would spoil the view and might make UNESCO withdraw  Mont Saint Michel from the list of historical monuments.

name: Parque Solar Nueva Xcala, Tlaxcala, México
headline: Ganaderos, ejidatarios y pobladores de la zona de Calpulalpan (Tlaxcala) se oponen a la construcción de un parque solar por las afectaciones a las zonas de pastoreo, cultivos de agaves, bosque y tierras agrícolas.

name: AZF fertiliser plant blast in Toulouse, France
headline: The AZF fertiliser plant exploded in 2001 following the negligent mixing of ammonium nitrate and a chlorinated product leading to 31 deaths and more than 20000 injured. Total, the owner of the company, has not been held liable for its actions to date.

name: Pollution from hog farming in Leiria, Portugal
headline: Pig farming leads to troubling levels of pollution in the Lis basin. Hog farming activities are still ongoing and the solution for the pollution has not yet been implemented.

name: São Manoel Hydroelectric Dam, Mato Grosso - Pará, Brazil
headline: São Manoel Dam has irreversibly altered the livelihoods of local communities. Its controversial construction at all cost now boosts energy supply along the extractive frontier but violates indigenous rights to self-determination and an intact environment.

name: Statoil Deep Sea Oil Drilling, Aotearoa/New Zealand
headline: Statoil ignores Indigenous entitlement/opinion and continues to unlawfully pursue Deep Sea Drilling in the Te Reinga Basin within the EEZ of Aotearoa/New Zealand

name: Waste pickers' livelihoods threatened by continued waste imports, Thailand
headline: Hundreds of waste pickers from Thailand's Saleng and Recycle Trader Association (SRTA) gathered in Bangkok during September 2021 to protest outside government offices for the continuous import of foreign waste threatening their livelihoods.

name: Conflict in the Horto, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
headline: Greener or richer? Resistance to "green gentrification" in the low-income neighborhood closed to the upper middle class area of the hill sides of the Serra da Carioca

name: Peasants of Gleba Tauá resist land grabbing and soy expansion, Tocantins, Brazil
headline: In a region increasingly dominated by export-orientated industrial agriculture, the community of Tauá looks back on a 30-year long conflict with land grabbers but has been organizing against threats and evictions and to build more sustainable livelihoods.

name: Polish farmers protest, Poland
headline: The EU regulations threatening to eradicate small-scale farming tradition faces an opposition from the Polish farmers.

name: Land grabbing for agro-business by Senegindia SARL, community of Diokoul, Senegal
headline: Peasants are mobilising against land dispossession by the Indian company Senegindia SARL. They accuse the enterprise and local authorities to give away their lands without their consent, and oppose to the agro-business project.

name: Kumtor gold mine, Krygyzstan
Ooi (Ōi) nuclear power units temporarily stopped, Japan
headline: Kansai Electric Power Company’s application to resume operation of two nuclear energy units met strong protests and a court granted injunction against the operation in 2014. However, permission was granted in July 2018.

name: Represa Inambari, Peru
headline: Peru is still talking with Brazilian firms about resuming construction plans on this gigantic $4 billion hydroelectric plant that has been stalled since 2011 because of local opposition.

name: Acid “Green Snow” due to chemical contamination in Pervoluralsk, Russia
headline: The phenomenon of green snow in Pervouralsk sparked a series of protests and demonstrations all around Siberia. An incident occurred in Feb 2019 in the "Russian Chrome Chemicals 1915" industry caused water contamination, provoking severe health problems

name: Wastepickers mobilization against the carbonization of solid waste, Rondônia, Brazil
headline: While promoted as a modern, ecofriendly solution to Brazil’s waste management problems, incinerator projects such as the one currently developed in Cacoal face broad civil society opposition, particularly from wastepicker groups and recycling initiatives.

name: Empresa minera Kumurama y el Ingenio Andacaba, Bolivia
headline: Los costos ambientales de la minería en la producción agrícola y pecuaria en Potosí, Bolivia

name: Udupi Power Corporation, Karnataka, India
Buon Kuop Hydroelectric Project, Vietnam
headline: "We, the 11,000 villagers living along the Srepok River have been facing negative impacts and are seriously concerned about the hydropower development for the Srepok River basin in Vietnam." (Villager statement regarding the dams’ impacts) [1].

name: The illegal logging of the Maydanki lake forest by the Turkish-backed forces in Afrin, Syria
headline: Large-scale deforestation at Maydanki Lake in northern Syria highlights the impact of conflict on environment and local communities. The incident has caused widespread grief and concern among activists and locals.

name: Enel coal power plant in La Spezia, Italy
Modhupur Sal forest and the Protection of Forest Rights, Bangladesh
headline: Denial of rights of the forest dwelling tribal communities, use of forest land for non-forest purposes, and commercial plantation in the natural Sal Forest have given rise to deadly conflicts

name: Belinga iron ore mine and Belinga dam, Gabon
headline: Large iron ore mine and related dams and railway in Gabon, to be developed by Chinese company. Opposition from Brainforest  and activist Marc Ona Essangui

name: International cooperation improves wastepickers' conditions, North-Eastern Jordan
headline: Growing population caused difficulties for waste management in last 10 years. Foreign NGOs give better conditions to the informal sector but  urban street wastepickers, still not fully recognized.

name: Omai gold mine tailings dam, Guyana
Hamlet of Clyde River v. Petroleum Geo-Services Inc., Nunavut, Canada
headline: Canada's National Energy Board approved seismic testing near Baffin Island, Nunavut, which can alter the migration routes of marine mammals. The Inuit people of the nearby hamlet Clyde River were not properly consulted.

name: Suzano biomass plantations, Brazil
Comunidad de Catacaos vs. Sodalicio. Peru.
headline: The comuneros of Catacaos appeal to the Vatican against land grabbing by the Asociación San Juan Bautista, whose president is the Archbishop of Piura, a top member of the Sodalicio.

name: Save Akamas, Cyprus
headline: The historical struggle to Save Akamas Natura 2000 area in Cyprus from touristic projects and quarries continues with a range of judicial activism and protests and with a common message raised by various groups: "Hands off Akamas!"

name: Sivens Dam on Tescou river, France
Banana plantations and logging in Mount Apo Natural Park near Magpet, Cotabato, Mindanao, The Philippines
headline: Indigenous peoples have long been struggling against logging and agribusiness on their ancestral lands in Mount Apo Natural Park. On August 23, 2020, a Manobo Dulangan woman leader named Bae Merlin Ansabu Celis was murdered for her activism.

name: Hartford Trash-to-Energy Incinerator, USA
headline: In 2017 the Connecticut Hartford Trash-to-Energy Incinerator was approved for “Phase II” upgrades and a renewed operating permit. Community EJ orgs. and City officials have fought to close the facility due to health impacts and lack of tax revenues.

name: Deforestación en la Reserva de la Biosfera Bosawas, Nicaragua
headline: Indígenas Mayangna  y Miskito se están viendo afectadas por  la destrucción de la Reserva de la Biosfera Bosawás. 42 mil hectáreas se talan ilegalmente cada año.

name: Roma communities had their access to water shut down during heatwave in Gulács and in Nyíregyháza, Hungary
headline: Roma saw the closure of  the public water wells and private water access in households during a summer heatwave. Access to water remains volatile.

name: Ageing  Bugey NPP threatens Geneva from France
headline: Some 70 kms Geneva, Bugey is one of France’s oldest NPPs. It came into service in 1972 producing about 4.5 percent of France's electricity using PWR.  The Geneva authorities sued in France to stop this NPP.

name: Massacre in Kilwa facilitated by Anvil Mining, operating Dikulushi open pit, Katanga province,  DR Congo
headline: The Kilwa incident (2004) implied the use by the Congolese military of Anvil Mining’s logistic and personnel to crush armed rebels in the town, killing about 100 people – the majority of them civilians.

name: DBCP and male infertility in Lathrop, California, United States
headline: Lathrop became known as the first major episode of worker infertility related to occupational exposure to DBCP. In 1977, workers at a production plant noticed that they were unable to father children.

name: Expansion of the Liège airport, Belgium
headline: The airport of Liège is one of the fast-growing airports of Europe. It is focused on cargo flights and wants to grow at an exponential pace. One step is the agreement with Alibaba, that wants to start its first European distribution hub in Liège.

name: Kanyika Niobium Project, Malawi
headline: The Kanyika community lives in uncertainty ever since Globe Metals & Mining announced plans for a niobium and tantalum mine in 2012. Their lands and homes are degraded, and they have not yet been fully compensated or relocated.

name: Illegal waste dump at a Roma community in Markusovce, Slovakia
headline: Over decades, a waste dump piles up in the middle of the Roma settlement in the village of Markusovce. The neighborhood is not served by any waste collection service.  Only when local activists speak up, the illegal dump gets removed.

name: Valle de Elqui - Teck, Pan Pacific
Belgrade Waterfront project, Serbia
headline: The government ignored citizens' complaints and changed existing legislation to facilitate controversial “Belgrade Waterfront” that would transform Belgrade's neighborhood Savamala into a luxury district.

name: Baram Dam Blockade, Malaysia
Akita coal-fired power project, Japan
headline: Japanese corporations cancel plans for some coal-fired power plants while the grassroots continue to campaign against them.

name: Principal explotación de niobio de Brasil y del mundo, en Araxá, Minas Gerais, Brasil
headline: Grandes costes humanos y ambientales tras más de 50 años de extracción de niobio en Araxá a través de operaciones de minería a cielo abierto a cargo de la CBMM, y actualmente con la participación de capital privado chino

name: Shrimp Farming in Muisne, Ecuador
headline: The longstanding local mobilization of Muisne, supported by a rich woven network, couldn't prevent the destruction of the mangroves their livelihood relies on.

name: Deforestation by Grupo Romero in Amazonia with oil palm plantations, Peru
headline: The Romero Group in Peru is a powerful economic conglomerate which invested heavily since 1979 in palm oil plantations in Amazonia, causing deforestation.

name: Strateco Resources Inc. Uranium Mine in The Matoush Project, Canada
headline: Northern Quebec Uranium Mine put on hold after 2013 Government Moratorium and First Nations Cree opposition.

name: Baleia Wind Power Complex in Ceará, Brazil
headline: Traditional communities of Ceara's coastline receive widespread support to stop a wind power complex in their territory. Despite public hearings, Ceara's environment agencies approve the project.

name: Hidroaysén hydroelectric project, Chile
headline: Hydroaysen dam project was finally cancelled by the Chilean governement on 10th June 2014, after 8 years of the campaign under the slogan "Patagonia Sin Represas"

name: Atlantic Coast Natural Gas Pipeline. Virginia, USA
headline: Proposed pipeline through historic Shenandoah Valley meets civil disobedience by local landowners and grassroots climate activists

name: Land grabbing and disputed cattle ranch in Pau-d'Arco, Pará, Brazil
headline: In the absence of agrarian reform, eleven landless peasants of the occupied Santa Lúcia ranch were assassinated in 2017 - a crime that remains unpunished and emblematic for numerous conflicts between landholders and landless movements in Southern Pará.

name: Thabametsi coal-fired power plant stopped, Limpopo province, South Africa
headline: In 2020, after years of legal struggles, including South Africa's first climate litigation, the Thabametsi coal-fired power plant project was finally cancelled.

name: Hilco distribution facility replaces coal-fired generating station, Little Village, Chicago, US
headline: Former Crawford Generating Station turns into a Target retail distribution centre, polluting locate communities during the station's demolition and causing future risk from diesel fumes.

name: Protest against the sale of 75% state-owned land to oil and gas corporations, Croatia
headline: Confidential gas and oil concessions  have been granted in much of Croatia's territory.  Activists protest against this mega project and its devastating consequences for local people, the environment, and the global climate.

name: Granting legal right to the River Ganga as a 'living entity', India
headline: River Ganga was legally recognised as a 'living entity' on 20th March, 2017. However, the order has been challenged in Supreme Court on the basis that the order is 'in-implementable'. This case briefly documents the events and chronology.

name: Oji paper mill's sewage project in Qidong, Jiangsu, China
headline: Following massive protests in the Chinese city of Qidong against the planned discharge of wastewater into the sea from Oji Paper's Nantong fine paper mill, Chinese officials canceled the construction of the industrial project.

name: Essar Pellet Plant,Paradeep, Odisha, India
headline: Hundreds of villagers and workers staged protests asking for fulfilment of their demands, mainly on compensation, rehabilitation and employment.

name: Shrinkage  and slow restoration of Lake Urmia, Iran
headline: The shrinking of the great Lake Urmia after dam building and groundwater pumping reduced water inflow turning the lake into an immense desert of salt.

name: East Africa Crude Oil Pipeline (EACOP), Uganda and Tanzania
headline: Total promotes a 200,000 barrels per day, 1445 km pipeline from Lake Albert in Uganda to Tanga in Tanzania, for oil exports. Opposition for human rights (displacement of populations) and environment.

name: Illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing (IUU) by Chinese fleet in Galapagos Islands, Ecuador.
headline:
A major conflict in 2020 with the Chinese trawlers fleet _x000D_
in Ecuador's territorial waters. Behind this ecological-geopolitical conflict on marine biodiversity conservation, there is a long history.

name: Mahindra's SEZ at Karla, Maharashtra, India
Rio Tinto/QMM Ilmenite Mine, Madagascar
headline: QMM, 80% owned by Rio Tinto and 20% by Government of Madagascar, built a mineral sands mining operation near Taolagnaro supported by the World Bank. QMM extracts ilmenite and zircon.

name: Ban on animal-drawn carts jeopardizes wastepickers’ livelihoods in Montevideo, Uruguay
headline: A substitution of motor cars for animal-drawn wastepickers' carts seems to have been a solution both for wastepickers' livelihoods and for the complaints of  "animalists" groups.

name: Palm oil and rubber plantation deforestation, Gabon
Desastre Ambiental en planta de almacenamiento de gas, San Juan Ixhuatepec, México
headline: During the early morning of  November 19th, 1984, one of the largest disasters in industrial history occurred in a gas deposit plant in San Juanico, Mexico City Area. It left around 800 deaths and 2,000 injured.

name: Gabès Phosphate Fertilizers Plants of the Tunisian Chemical Group, Tunisia
headline: Mine to coast; the journey of Tunisian phosphate from Gafsa to the fertilezers production plants on the coastal area of Gabés.

name: Sinop Nuclear Power Plant, Turkey
headline: The Sinop (İnceburun) Nuclear Power Plant is a planned nuclear plant located at Sinop in northern Turkey. It will be the country's second nuclear power plant after Akkuyu

name: Área natural protegida amenazada por la depredación inmobiliaria en Jurica Poniente, México
headline: La zona natural de Jurica Poniente en la delegación Félix Osores Sotomayor, es importante para la mitigación de los efectos de cambio climático para Querétaro. Sin embargo, está amenazada por la expansión urbana.

name: Paredones Amarillos/Mina Concordia/Los Cardones, México
Solidarność Transport Hub (CPK), Poland
headline: In a local referendum residents of Baranów voted against construction of a multi-modal transport hub on over 66 square kilometers of villages and farmland. Plans for the Central Transport Hub include an airport, airport city, road and rail infrastructure.

name: Lead poisoning in multi-sites of Chenzhou, Hunan, China
headline: Hundreds of children in Chenzhou City, Hunan Province were found with excessive blood lead levels. Officials blocked the bus carrying people to do tests outside Chenzhou and detained several villagers.

name: Simpang Belimbing power plant, South Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: PLTU Simpang Belimbing, the first mine-mouth coal-fired power plant in Indonesia, has exposed local residents to environmental and health impacts. Local NGO AEER raised proposal for alternatives such as the development of renewable energy in view of such.

name: Mahuide Bell (Popular Consultation), Loncoopué, Neuquén, Argentina
headline: Loncopué rejects copper mining project in indigenous territory through a community consultation. Chinese mining company tried to explore copper  in Campana Mahuida.

name: Great Pacific Garbage Patch, North Pacific Ocean
headline: The Great Pacific Garbage Patch located between Hawaii and California is the largest accumulation of ocean plastic in the world

name: Soga coal power plant, Chiba, Japan
headline: Citizens worried that living conditions get worse if a new CFPP was built in an already polluted area. Strong support from groups in Japan  concerned with climate change.  Cancelled in 2018.

name: Uma Oya Multi-Purpose Development Project, Sri Lanka
headline: Uma Oya Multi-Purpose Project aims to generate hydropower and water for industrial activities. However, it is affecting the right to water of the local communities and thanks to the protests it has been temporary suspended

name: Land dispute Fibria and quilombolas, Brazil
Exploración sísmica para la Línea Transandina en la Laguna de Los Ortices, Colombia
Corredor Eólico en el Istmo de Tehuantepec, Oaxaca, México
