headline: En los últimos 15 años, México ha registrado un rápido desarrollo de parques eólicos a gran escala en el Istmo de Tehuantepec, ubicado en el suroeste del estado de Oaxaca que han generado graves conflictos al nivel local.

name: Koroama Women Stage Protest against Shell Neglect
Huelva industrial-chemical complex, Spain
Chunar Cement Factory in Mirzapur, UP, India
Monsanto and soy monocultures, Argentina
headline: GM soy monocultures ravages on health and biodiversity mobilize numerous semi-rural communities but this harmful production, at the core of Argentinean economy, remains hard to challenge.

name: Proyecto Nueva Unión en Vallenar, Chile
headline: Proyecto NuevaUnión surge de la fusión de Minera El Morro (GoldCorp) y Minera La Fortuna (Teck), ubicados en la Provincia de Huasco, Región de Atacama. Es un mega proyecto minero de cobre-oro-molibdeno. Sus operaciones comienzan el 2023.

name: Bordeaux–Toulouse High Speed Rail
headline: Further high speed railway plans and further ZAD contesting reckless development plans

name: Toliara sand mining  for metals, Ranobe, Madagascar
headline: Initiated by the company World Titanium resources and bought back by Base Resources,  ilmenite, zircon and rutile mining would start in 2019 displacing population, burying tombs, consuming water, causing  pollution.

name: Proyecto Minero Los Chocoyos en Sipakapa, Guatemala
headline: El pueblo maya eb Sipakapa se opone a la ampliación de la Mina Marlin I propiedad de Gold Corp y instituye un Tribunal de la Salud para denunciar enfermedades debidas a la mineria

name: Bajoli Holi Hydroelectric dam, HP, India
headline: One of the "50000 MW hydro power initiative" projects by GMR Energy Limited. After receiving clearances, the company illegally changes construction plans for improving generation capacity, but affecting a largely populated river bank

name: Vertedero de residuos tóxicos y peligrosos en Nerva, Andalusia, España
headline: Un gran vertedero de residuos industriales en la localidad de Nerva en las proximidades de las minas de Riotinto. Fuerte oposición local a fines de la década de 1990, continúa en 2021.

name: Pasivos Ambientales en Hualgayoc, Peru
headline: After many decades of mining (first underground, later open cast) there remain many environmental liabilities (pasivos ambientales) from damage to water and human health.

name: Comunidad Wayuu, Guajira, resistiendo la desviación del Arroyo Bruno por la empresa El Cerrejón, Colombia
headline: Cerrejón plans to change the course of the Arroyo Bruno, one remaining water source in La Guajira,  to increase coal extraction and export. This threatens the Wayuu people and several Afro communities.

name: Kuznetsky Yuzhny coal mine, Cheremza, Russia
headline: Shors indigenous people and residents of Cheremza achieved the cancellation of the construction of a coal loading station in South Siberia

name: Southeastern Anatolia Project (GAP), Turkey
Permanent repository for LILW Nuclear Waste, Slovenia
headline: Nuclear waste from Krsko nuclear power plant has it hard to find a storage location; state agency still struggles to get all permits and get people's consensus

name: Mavallipura Landfill Site at Bangalore, Karnataka, India
An-naka zinc refinery and cadmium pollution, Japan
headline: Cadmium contamination in An-naka since 1937. Lawsuit in 1969 and first court injunction in Japan against polluting metal refineries affecting agriculture and ecosystems caused by the Toho Zinc Co., Ltd.

name: Shell Oil Spill at Nembe Creeks, Nigeria
Lead smelter in Zajača, Serbia
headline: The pollution from mine and smelter Zajača have been reduced because the owner went bankrupt. The historical dump site should be remediated by the government. Local people still have health problems after nine years of pollution.

name: Srinagar Hydroelectric Project on Alaknanda river, UK, India
headline: The first order by National Green Tribunal in hydropower projects has finally come and held the GVK company responsible. The verdict proved that rapid dam construction is the major reason for 2013 disaster.

name: ExxonMobil oil explorations in  Shawre Valley, Kurdistan Region of Iraq
headline: “Our ancestors have lived here and worked on this land for centuries but now we are afraid that our water sources will soon be destroyed and we will have to leave this place.” Finally, the project was stopped.

name: Sewa Paper Mill in Gangapur, Orissa, India
Grassy Narrows logging conflict, Ont., Canada
Porto Alegre's urban mobility and the Critical Mass, Brazil
headline: On 25 February  2011, an automobile driver ran over the Critical Mass of Porto Alegre. He left behind 17 cyclists injured. As a response, a  Foro Mundial de la Bicicleta was created,

name: Proyecto minero Huambo amenaza laguna Conococha, Perú
headline: 2010: suspendido después de las protestas de la población, ante esto el gobierno aplicó la ley sobre prohibición de exploración minera en zonas cercanas a fuentes de agua.

name: Matola Gas Company CDM project, Mozambique
Mini hydropower project in Athwelthota waterfall, Sri Lanka
headline: Despite being small, a mini hydro power project is threatening the Athwelthota waterfall. Local communities and environmentalists protest for its conservation

name: NTPC Thermal Power Plant at Lara in Chhattisgarh, India
Xayaburi mainstream dam on the Lower Mekong River, Lao PDR
headline: Xayaburi - a battery for Asia?  The Xayaburi dam irreversibly destroys livelihoods and ecosystems along the Mekong River, a life-giving vein of Southeast Asia.

name: Bioethanol plantation and plant conflict in Isabela, The Philippines
headline: In 2006, in Isabela, a biofuel production unit was established by a domestic company—Ecofuel Land Development Inc. Despite numerous denounces of workers rights violations the plantation is still working with seasonal workers.

name: Jiaozishan landfill site and incineration plant near Doucun Village in Nanjing, Jiangsu, China
headline: Years after suffering from air and water pollution from  a landfill site and incineration plant nearby, thousands of villagers publicly protested against such waste disposal and treatment facilities.

name: Chinese Azelik uranium mine in Ingall, Niger
headline: Chinese uranium mine invaded Niger’s traditional pastoral territory. China's CNNC, through its local subsidiary Sino-Uranium, hoped to be able to break Areva's monopoly and exploit a new uranium deposit.

name: Sesa Goa coke plant pollution, India
The collapse of Xe-Pian Xe-Namnoy hydropower project, Lao PDR
headline: The development of hydropower in Lao PDR has been very contentious. In this  area a dam started to be built in February 2013 and was expected to be completed in 2019. One of the subsidiary dams failed on 23 July 2018 causing a major disaster.

name: Land grabbing and forced evictions by Koh Kong's sugar industry, Cambodia
headline: How bitter can sugar be: bulldozers clearing lands for giving it away to agrobusiness companies, with the support of the European agreement “Everything but Arms” (EBA)

name: Celukan Bawang Coal Power Station, North Bali, Indonesia
headline: Residents suffer severe livelihood losses and health impacts as a result of the operations of the coal powered plant. In 2018, legal action to stop its expansion was rejected by the Supreme Court.

name: Tuivai Hydro Electric Project, Mizoram, India
Aerial fumigations and Plan Colombia, Ecuador
headline: Thanks to the agreement reached between Colombia and Ecuador the aerial fumigations near Ecuadorian borders stopped in 2008, although the local population has not been properly compensated for the damages caused.

name: Posco steel plant in Odisha, India
headline: A ten years struggle defending the land against a steel plant project by South Korean POSCO company pays off. On 8/4/2016 the company announced the end of the project for its long environmental litigation in the NGT and for the people's opposition.

name: Acaparamiento de agua por parte de FEMSA Coca Cola en San Cristóbal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico
headline: La extracción de agua por parte de Coca-Cola Femsa en San Felipe Ecatepec, Chiapas, provoca la falta de agua, debido a la sobre explotación de este recurso natural y vital.

name: Deep-sea mining of rare earth minerals in the Svalbard Archipelago, Norway
headline: A proposal for deep-sea Arctic Ocean mining to extract metals needed for emerging green technologies encounter opposition and joint action by national and international environmental groups in Norway.

name: Machhakund Hydro Electric Project, Orissa, India
Raffineria di Roma, Italy
headline: La raffineria di Roma, di proprietà della TotalErg, completa il disastroso quadro sanitario dell'area di Malagrotta. Chiusa dal 2012, continua a richiamare l'attenzione su di sé a causa del rischio di incidenti

name: Villeranges Gold Mine, France
headline: Local ejos fought a mine project in the center of France, in the Creuse region after the French government granted a research permit in 2013.

name: Bodega Aurrerá-Walmart en Cuetzalan, Puebla, México
headline: El ayuntamiento y pobladores de Cuetzalan rechazaron la instalación de una Bodega Aurrerá -tienda de la cadena Wal Mart, bajo el argumento del daño económico, cultural y medioambiental que traería consigo.

name: Cape Boujdour (Offshore Block) oil and gas exploration, Western Sahara
headline: Kosmos Energy from Texas wants to explore for oil and gas. There are geopolitical implications because of Western Sahara status under Moroccan domination.

name: Trasvase río Guarinó, Colombia
Athena power plant by ACPL, Chhattisgarh, India
Karachi Port Trust (KPT) Keamari Coal Terminal, Pakistan
headline: Heavy pollution of fishermen communities and neighborhoods around the Karachi Port by the Coal Terminal.

name: Lake Turkana Wind Power Project, Kenya
Jaldapara National Park, West Bengal, India
headline: Since 2009, within and around the protected area of Jaldapara National Park, twelve villages of about 2,150 households have been fighting for the recognition of  Community Forest Rights.

name: Agips Pipeline at Ikeinghenbiri spills on farmlands and fish ponds, Nigeria
Semiconductor pollution Gihueng City Samsung plant, South Korea
A polluted stream and a landfill as racial segregation of Roma communities, in Jarovnice, Slovak Republic
headline: Roma settlement in Jarovnice segregated by  a polluted water stream. Waste collection services are denied for the Roma. Moreover,  there is also a municipal waste disposal site close by.

name: Moshoeshoe Airport upgrade reopens dispute over forced relocation, Lesotho
headline: Residents of 15 villages surrounding Moshoeshoe Airport have banded together to protect their interests as the government plans to upgrade the facility. In 1982 villagers were forcibly evicted from their homes and fields to make way for the airport.

name: Puerto Bahia Malaga, Colombia
KEPCO’s Bylong Valley coal mine, NSW, Australia
headline: In September 2019, a proposed South Korean-owned coal mine in the Bylong Valley, NSW was rejected by the NSW Independent Planning Commission in part due to its long-term environmental, agricultural and heritage impact on future generations [1].

name: Philipino Farmers Uproot GMO “Golden” Rice, Philippines
headline: "Golden Rice" doesn´t shine for farmers who oppose corporate control of seeds

name: Roadside Tree Felling in  Sheffield, UK
headline: Since Sheffield County Council contracted the private company Amey to maintain the city's streets, approximately 5,500 trees have been felled. Residents have campaigned to protect their trees, and are concerned by the lack of democratic process.

name: Large-scale industrial fishing,  Chukchi Sea, the Central Arctic Ocean. Russia
headline: An international agreement was reached to protect the Central Arctic Ocean against commercial fishing due to international EJO and scientific community efforts.

name: Friends of Nature (FoN) sued State Grid for refusing to purchase clean energy in Ningxia, China
headline: In August 2016, Friends of Nature (FON) sued State Grid Ningxia Electric Power Co since the company refused to purchase all of the electricity produced from wind and solar and the amount not produced with renewable was substituted with coal-fired power.

name: Meridian Gold Mine in Esquel, Argentina
headline: Read about the first town in Argentina whose inhabitants' strong mobilization forced a municipal plebiscite that stopped a mining project and fostered regulatory changes in the municipality and province. This is a key EJ struggle in Argentina.

name: Ada Tepe Gold Mine, Bulgaria
Waste treatment plant in Sacabamba, Cochabamba, Bolivia
headline: The Sacabamba project was a proposal to treat the waste accumulated in the K'ara K'ara dump. Local communities opposed the project until the company in charge abandoned it, as it did not comply with the Bolivian environmental regulation.

name: Puerto de Tribugá, Choco, Colombia
Guadalcazar, hazardous waste dumping by USA firm Metalclad. Mexico.
headline: This “model investment”  for disposal of dangerous residues under the North American Free Trade Agreement ended up being the first case against Mexico before a NAFTA panel  to get compensation for foreign investors.

name: Deforestation in the Congo River basin, DR of Congo
headline: Congolese tropical forest devastated and in some cases transformed into cash crops plantations by greedy logging companies.

name: New Prosperity Goldmine Fish Lake, BC, Canada
Landless peasants of 'KM Mil' against land grabbers in Novo Progresso, Pará, Brazil
headline: The struggle of landless peasants against powerful grileiros at Pará's Amazonian agricultural frontier uncovers current patterns of uncontrolled deforestation and land grabbing and their link to expanding meat production and unsolved land questions.

name: Pacific Rim at El Dorado mine, El Salvador
headline: Human rights violations, killing of men and women activists, arbitration at World Bank's CIADI; finally the company had to leave.

name: Snowbowl project made of wastewater on Indigenous sacred lands, San Francisco Peaks, Arizona, US
headline: Snowbowl project make use of treated wastewater for artificial snowmaking, which Indigenous people highly oppose because it contaminates and desecrates the sacred peaks.

name: Mining of Rare Earths and Niobium in Mrima Hill, Kwale, Kenya
Zama zama gold mining in Durban Deep, Gauteng, South Africa
headline: Zama zamas or informal miners operate in former mining site Durban Deep at great risk to their lives owing to lack of safety precautions and criminal, police, and other violence.

name: World heritage at risk in the Palestinian village of Battir, Palestine
headline: Battir listed as World Heritage Site in danger due to  separation wall impacts that threaten ancient agricultural oil and vine terraces

name: Economic woes,  plastic packaging and children wastepickers in Tehran's “Dirt Gold Mafia”, Iran
headline: Tehran is currently facing the rise of an underground operation referred to as the “dirt gold mafia”,  employing children and  Afghan refugees for the collection of recyclable waste before legal collectors do.

name: Roma relocated to an area with electromagnetic radiation, Tvarditsa , Bulgaria
headline: Roma relocated to an area with electromagnetic radiation, in Tvarditsa. The area is also full of domestic waste. There is some local support for the Roma inhabitants, and support also from ROMACT.

name: Shell Must Fall campaign, The Netherlands
headline: Dutch activists are campaigning against oil giant Shell under the slogan 'Shell Must Fall!'. Motivated particularly by the damages from oil spills in the Niger Delta, the campaign aims at dismantling Shell.

name: Listvyazhnaya coal mine disaster, Kuzbass, Russia
headline: Kuzbass' Listvyazhnaya coal mine suffered an explosion in 2021 due to safety violations and neglect including falsification of methane levels. 46 miners and 5 rescuers were killed in the explosion.

name: A wall around Roma settlement  “to protect from noise”, Krusevac, Serbia
headline: A segregation wall built around Roma settlement under the excuse of "protecting" residents from noise.  Women, other citizens and the settlement residents protested openly against the wall.

name: San Vicente silver mine by Pan American Silver, Bolivia
headline: Pan American Silver's San Vicente mine in Bolivia has a history of labor conflict in which leaders have expressed concern about the health and safety of workers. This conflict has the potential to reignite as production comes to an end.

name: Black Sea Coastal Highway Project, Turkey
Kilosa and Lindi Pilot REDD projects, Tanzania
Desalojo de comunidad ancestral El Verdún por empresa camaronera, Ecuador
headline: In El Verdun, Chone, a community led by women fights in defence of mangrove forests against the shrimp industry.

name: Multiple oil spills by Agip/ENI's Ogboinbiri-Tebidaba pipeline in Niger Delta, Nigeria
headline: Spills along the Ogboinbiri-Tebidaba pipeline have been so numerous. They heavily affect the communities' livelihoods living along it. It is all the more revolting these people have to fight for the company to take responsibility and clean-up the areas.

name: Controversy over planned paraxylene (PX) plant expansion in Ningbo, Zhejiang, China
headline: Demonstrations in Ningbo began on 24 October 2012, when villagers petitioned over environmental concerns because of a PX plant and blocked traffic in the streets.

name: Transboundary Montara Oil Spill, Australia
headline: The Montara Oil Spill in Timor Sea highlighted the controversies of fossil fuel extration and legislative weaknesses in Australia dealing with transboundary issues.  Indonesian seaweed farmers embark on class action law suit to claim for damages.

name: Tehri Hydropower Plant, UK, India
headline: On the confluence of the Ganga and the Bhagirati river, Tehri dam is displacing 100,000 people and splitting up communities to bring water and electricity to bigger cities, including Delhi

name: Indigenous people's resistance against Cellophil Resource Corporation
headline: In the 1970s, a historical act of resistance from the people of the Cordillera region resulted in a landmark struggle for indigenous rights in the Philippines.

name: Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar International Airport MIHAN Project, MH, India
headline: An expansion plan on a total area of about 1,295 hectares was proposed  in 2005 by the Government of Maharashtra. A Special Economic Zone (SEZ) has been developed along with the airport.

name: Opposing paraxylene (PX) plant in the PetroChina 10 Million tons/year Refinery, Kunming, Yunnan, China
headline: Large, peaceful civic demonstration in May 2013 against a potentially polluting PX chemical plant slated for construction in Kunming.

name: Zhetim-Too mine in Naryn region, Kyrgystan
headline: Pressed by external debt payments, Kyrgyzstan appears to be ready in 2022 to develop a large long-contested iron ore deposit, shrugging off environmental and economic concerns. Glacier melting is a threat.

name: Corporate Wind Farms in Ixtepec vs community's inititiative, Oaxaca, Mexico
headline: Ixtepec community take position against private wind farms and propose their own wind farm cooperative. They denounce government favoring big companies and claim energy sovereignty for their territory

name: Achuar y Shuar en contra de exploración petrolera de lote 64, Perú
headline: Explotación petrolera en la Amazonia peruana afecta a poblaciones indígenas Achuar y Shuar; exploraciones se actúan sin consulta previa y generando conflictos entre las comunidades

name: Kevitsa Mine, Finland
headline: The Kevitsa mine has been considered to be well accepted. However, local residents have expressed their concerns regarding the limits of environmental pollution since the beginning, and they mostly think that the mine is not benefiting them enough.

name: Comunidades yanomami de la cuenca del río Ocamo afectadas por minería ilegal, Venezuela
headline: Resistance by indigenous Yanomami organizations has failed to stop illegal mining with mercury which impacts on  their waters, ecosystems and produces high levels of violence.

name: Extracción de Gas y Petróleo en el Rio Pilcomayo, Bolivia
headline: Las repercusiones del progreso industrial en territorio indigena y el medio ambiente aumentan considerablemente teniendo un impacto negativo

name: Coal spill near Pelabuhan Ratu Coal-fired Power Plant, West Java, Indonesia
headline: Recurrent coal spill from coal barges near Pelabuhan Ratu Coal-fired Power Plant led to marine ecosystem damage and disruption for local fishermen. Clean-up initiative by local environmental group manifested anti-coal momentum among local residents.

name: Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary. Non settlement of resource use, access and governance rights, a slowdown to conservation and livelihoods, India
headline: Bhimashankar has been home to eight villages. In 1985, when its forests were declared 'Wildlife Sanctuary', the inhabitants lost access to their livelihood resources. Since then the Forest Department and villagers have been in conflict.

name: Loma Miranda ferronickel mine, Dominican Republic
Soc-fin KCD conflict, Cambodia
Deterioro ambiental y socioeconómico por industrialización en Felipe Carrillo Puerto, México
headline: El municipio de Felipe Carrillo Puerto experimenta transformaciones a partir de la llegada de la Industria no regulada, resultando en una degradación considerable al medio ambiente, las zonas habitaciones y por lo tanto su población.

name: Land grabbing in Nilgala Forest, Sri Lanka
headline: The first Tree Ordination Ceremony took place in the Nilgala Forest, organized by local communities and environmental associations to highlight and fight forest destruction.

name: Gas Wellhead Explosion in Koluama, Nigeria
Indonesia Weda Bay Industrial Park (IWIP), North Maluku, Indonesia
headline: Th IWIP has raised environmental, social and health concerns, including the displacement of indigenous communities, and faced a number of protests related to nickel mining, processing and captive CFPP activities.

name: Ambatovy Mining Project, Madagascar
Roma evicted due to the 22@ project in Poblenou, Barcelona, Spain
headline: A plot housing a Roma settlement in the Poblenou of Barcelona was evicted in 2004 due to the planned redevelopment of the area, which would turn out to be the 22@.

name: GMOs and Crop Biodiversity Loss in Washington State, USA
Ecological and sanitary disaster in the cobalt mines of Kolwezi, DR Congo
headline: The cobalt extraction keeps increasing at great human and environmental costs. Kolwezi is the capital city of Lualaba Province,  an important mining centre for copper, cobalt and other minerals.

name: Vienna Third Runway Airport Expansion, Austria
headline: Planned expansion of Vienna International Airport with a third runway. Opposed by local citizens' initiatives as well as climate justice group, and to a lesser extend environmental NGOs. Groundbreaking judicial decision has been turned over.

name: Pollution from hog farming (CAFOs), USA
Construction of Ringaskiddy Waste Incinerator, Cork, Ireland
headline: Building of 240,000 tonnes per annum controversial municipal and hazardous waste incinerator at Ringaskiddy, Co. Cork. Permission has been denied nine times by planning board. Still undecided in 2018.

name: Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant, India
headline: The construction of the Kudankulam nuclear plant in Tamil Nadu has been very contentious, particularly after the Fukushima disaster of 2011. Main protagonists have been the local fisherfolk.

name: Daimiel Natural Park and Agriculture, Spain
Shangba Village Cadmium and Lead Pollution in Wengyuan, Guangdong, China
headline: As early as the 1970s, Shangba villagers were already aware that pollution was affecting the village. As pollution worsened cancer deaths rose. In 2005 villagers eventually secured a 14 million Yuan reservoir funded by the government.

name: Procter and Gamble’s Buckeye Paper Mill pollutes the Fenholloway River in Taylor Co., Florida, USA
headline: For over 50 years, the Buckeye Paper MIll, now the Foley Cellulose Mill, has been polluting the "industrial" Fenholloway River with impunity for attacks against activists.

name: Dudhwa National Park and the fight for forest rights, UP, India
headline: Struggle of indigenous communities for recognition of Forest Rights.  People launched a non-violent struggle against eviction. Women formed the Tharu Adivasi Mahila Mazdoor Kisan Manch to lead the agitation.

name: Abadoned Shell pipeline Spills crude in K-Dere Community, Nigeria
Durinis Ecoforest 2000, Ecuador
PGG's coal mine in Imielin, Poland
headline: In 2018, the Polish Mining Group was authorized by the regional authorities to launch coal mining from the Imielin-Północ deposit. Citizen protest, supported by the local authorities, managed to overturn the plan by addressing the national level in 2020.

name: Josemaria proyecto minería, San Juan, Argentina
headline:
Josemaría es un proyecto de cobre, oro y plata, localizado en el noroeste de la provincia de San Juan, en el departamento Iglesia, a 4.230 m.s.n.m. _x000D_
_x000D_
En abril de 2022, el Gobierno de San Juan aprobó el Informe de Impacto Ambiental. Actualmente,

name: Razlog Regional Landfill, Bulgaria
Kamuthi Solar Power Project, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: Predominantly women protest to protect drinking water sources and ask for employment in exchange for the farmland lost to the Adani Group's 648MW power plant. The company so far failed to react the emerging injustices.

name: Privatización del agua en La Pradera, ciudad de Querétaro, México
headline: Habitantes del fraccionamiento la Pradera, en el municipio El Marqués en Querétaro, denuncian  problemas de acceso al agua, ligados a su gestión privada, y reclaman que este servicio sea proporcionado por un organismo público.

name: Tourism in Marsa Alam and Disenfranchisement of Indigenous Community, Egypt
headline: Marsa Alam's Ababda struggle against environmental stressors and tourist development that is driving their disenfranchisement, loss of traditional way of living and livelihoods.

name: Spektra Energy's Fracked Gas “Bridge to Nowhere”, USA
headline: The movement against Spektra Energy's fracked gas pipeline expansion gains momentum in New England.

name: Finike marble and stone quarries, Turkey
headline: An activist couple resists a local quarry and gets it legally shut down. Yet this starts a series of unfortunate events culminating in their murder in May 2017.

name: Polluting industries in Cataño and Conservation of Las Cucharillas Marsh, Puerto Rico
headline: The highest rate of respiratory diseases and cancer incidence in Puerto Rico due to air pollution from nearby oil-powered electric power and polluting industries. Now the area is under a conservation program

name: Local women clean up polluted Isipingo River in Durban, South Africa
headline: In 2009, women banded together to clean up the Isipingo River. The government recognized their actions and collaborated with them to set up the Adopt-a-River project. However, industrial pollution still plagues the local community.

name: Hydro Power Plant Lukovo Pole, National Park Mavrovo, Macedonia
headline: HPP Lukovo Pole was planned to be constructed in National Park Mavrovo until the World Bank -under the pressure by the environmental CSOs- withdraw its financial support to the project.

name: Ipilan and MacroAsia nickel mines in Brooke's point, Palawan, Philippines
headline: 15,000 trees were felled  before the mining company was stopped by local inhabitatnts, local government, and also by the DERN.  Bishop's intervention.

name: Kolmozero lithium mining, Kola peninsula, Russia
headline: Lithium mining on Kola peninsula for green industry and apparently refining lithium-6 for thermonuclear weapons, have been highly opposed by Indigenous Sami peoples.

name: Plantas de Alutrint y Alcoa, Trinidad and Tobago
Tectona monoculture tree plantations, Mozambique
Movement against the location of the Vasco da Gama bridge in Lisboa, Portugal
headline: Environmental movements presented data in favor of alternative routes to build the bridge. The debate around the use of public transport and railways expanded.

name: Fishmeal Pollution in Chimbote, Peru
headline: Chimbote, Peru is the world's top producer of fishmeal, an industry devastating the fish population and contributing to widespread pollution. Maria Elena Foronda was one of the first to act.

name: Proposed Coal Mine in Pont Valley, UK
headline: Local residents and anti-coal activists are calling for the planning permission for a new open pit coal mine to be revoked, in line with the UK's commitment to coal phase-out by 2025.

name: Chudnoe gold deposit in Yugyd Va National Park, Komi Republic, Russia
headline: Yugyd Va National Park's boundaries threatened for the 11th time since its establishment in 1994. There has been an ongoing attempt to exclude Chudnoe gold deposit from its territory so that it could be mined. It is  again under threat from a new bill.

name: Solar power plant in Mikir Bamuni Grant, Assam, India
headline: 1500 families affected by the construction of a solar power plant. Protest repressed by violent means. No consent was given by the tribal community owning the agricultural land. Land Acquisition suspended by the court on March 1st.

name: Demolition and evictions of Makoko's community, Nigeria
Kyshtym Disaster and the Mayak plutonium plant, Russia
headline: Nuclear waste tank explosion in 1957 and decades-long radioactive contamination made Mayak one of the most radioactive places on Earth.

name: Terra Mitica, parque diversión en Benidorm, Spain
headline: Una atracción para turismo de diversión se convierte en escándalo de corrupción y "símbolo del derroche de la Generalitat Valenciana".

name: Shoal Lake 40 aqueduct, Canada
headline: Shoal Lake 40 First Nations reserve, has not officially had a reliable drinking water source since 1997, which was when the state imposed a boil water advisory for the area.

name: Harris superquarry, Scotland, UK
headline: In April 2004 the Lafarge company  abandoned its plans for a very large stone quarry at Lingerbay in Harris, Scotland, after a twelve year social and legal battle. A great triumph for environmentalists such as Friends of the Earth Scotland.

name: Pata Rat landfill, Cluj Napoca, Romania
headline: Environmental racism at work: the making of precarious living and working conditions on the Pata Rat landfill. This is the largest waste-related ghetto in Europe located in Cluj Napoca, Romania.

name: Israeli navy's violent repression on Palestinian fisher people, Palestine
headline: Palestinian fisher people are losing their livelihood due to continued Israeli attacks against them, including shooting, arresting and chasing them, and limiting the area allowed for sailing and fishing, which even led in 2018 to deaths of fishermen[1,6].

name: Syliva Creek Court Case to Prevent Logging in Toolangi State Forest, Victoria, Australia
headline: "Please consider the environment before printing this case"; because that ultra white high quality Reflex paper has a cost for Australian forests and their people.

name: Olive plantation on Krk Island, Croatia
headline: The project of drainage of the marshland for planting olive trees at the island Krk was criticized by local NGOs, because the area is a habitat to protected and endangered animal and plant species and a source of drinking water.

name: Lead pollution in Callao, Peru
headline: In El Callao, near Lima, there are large deposition sites where mineral dust from mines is stockpiled on an intermediate basis prior to further transportation for loading on board ships.

name: MOPCO fertilizer factory environmental conflict, Egypt
Oil and Gas Exploration in Coari, Brazil
Incinerator in Zubieta, Gipuzkoa, Spain
headline: After being temporarily cancelled, the plant was resumed in May 2017. Environmentalists, neighbors and political parties say "Erraustegirik ez, ez gure izenean" (no to the incinerator, not in my name)

name: Enstedsværket in Aabenraa, Denmark
headline: Activists occupy coal harbor for 30 hours two years in a row: creating awareness about the fossil fuel industry both locally and globally.

name: Explosion at nuclear facility, Seversk (Tomsk-7), Russia
headline: The explosion of a nuclear reprocessing facility in Tomsk-7 exposed 177,000 people to high levels of radiation. Still today, the facility is contaminating with radioactive waste due to uranium enrichment.

name: Incinerator Construction and Landfill Closures in Qalyubia, Egypt
headline: The planned construction of a waste incineration plant in Qalyubia, Egypt and the planned closure and relocation of the region's dumpsites signals further hardship for wastepickers, whose livelihoods depend on access to recyclable materials.

name: Iron Ore mining in Baffin island, Nunavut territory, Canada
headline: In Baffin island, the Inuit council agree to iron ore extraction (about 6 million tons per year) against the recommendations of the Nunavut Impact Review Board. Meanwhile, building of a railway is in dispute.

name: Peel Watershed Regional Land Use Planning Conflict, Canada
headline: After the Supreme Court ruled in favour of First Nations in the Peel Watershed Region, the Land Use Planning Commission, Yukon government and First Nations groups are heading back to the drawing board to ensure environmental protection!

name: Mining in Las Coloradas (Las Nenas y La Voluntad), Neuquén, Argentina
headline: This is a conflict on copper and gold mining in Neuquén. Resistance of "self-organized" neighbours' assemblies and also of Mapuche communities. Consolidation of a network of environmental justice organizations.

name: Biopalma  against indigenous Tembé in the Amazon, Brazil
headline: The indigenous Tembé denounce the mining company VALE and Biopalma, for contaminating the water sources with agrotoxics (such as endosulfan) in the new large oil palm plantations in Pará.

name: Harvard timber plantations, Argentina
Aquaculture conflict in Golfo de Fonseca, Honduras, Nicaragua
Alberta Tar Sands, Canada
Kilmore East–Kinglake Bushfire (Black Saturday) Class Action: SP AusNet (power distribution company), Kilmore East-Kinglake (community), Australia
Inn Din (Andin) Coal power plant cancelled following protests, Mon State, Myanmar
headline: A strong grassroots coalition against the 1,280 MW coal power plant achieved to halt the “silent killer”

name: La Oroya, Perú
headline: This smelter that belonged to Doe Run processes risky metals,  transforming La Oroya into one of the world's ten most polluted places.

name: Upper Paunglaung Dam, Shan State, Myanmar
headline: A Chinese-backed dam submerged more than 20 villages at the cost of life. Suicide and depression have marked the development of the controversial Upper Paunglaung dam

name: Pierina, Jangas, Perú
Bhadreshwar Thermal Power Plant, Gujarat, India
Kisladag Gold Mine, Turkey
Ecological bomb Port Milena, Montenegro
headline: Channel Port Milena is severely polluted by the sewage discharge and waiting to be cleaned as demanded by the local civil society group.

name: Polish-Belarusian border wall, Białowieża Forest, Poland
headline: One of Europe’s most important nature reserves is being destroyed due to Poland’s racist border policies. Is the wall on the border with Belarus a Polish example of catastrophic capitalism?

name: Metallic mining moratorium in Romblon, Tablas Island, Philippines
headline: Canadian-owned Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. proposed a mining exploration project covering most of Tablas Island. Sheryll Mindo-Fetalvero and fellow local and indigenous supporters stopped the project. Mining was banned in Romblon.

name: Oil palm expansion on Tripa swamp forest, South Aceh, Indonesia
Garifuna resistance in Vallecito against land grabbing for palm oil plantations and drug trade, Honduras
Uranium Mining in Meghalaya, India
Lake Turkana Project in Indigenous Territories, Kenya
headline: Africa's largest windfarm to be deployed along indigenous communities' territories in Kenya. Local organization is against illegal land purchases and violation of indigenous rights.

name: Barapukuria underground coal mine and open-pit coal mining project, Bangladesh
headline: The first and only operating coal mine in Bangladesh, amidst reactions and repression, unmet promises and opposition by local people

name: GACH black sand mining in Sanyang, The Gambia
headline: In 2018, GACH Mining started extracting black sand in Sanyang and nearby villages without local consent. Women farmers lost their livelihoods, but their complaints to the government have so far been unresolved and denied.

name: The use of fire at the Canaima National Park, Venezuela
headline: There is a controversy on the use of fire by Pemon indigenous peoples in Canaima National Park which spreads over 3 million ha in south-eastern Venezuela,   with remarkable tepui formations.

name: Women's cycling team challenged several social norms and taboos in Afghanistan
headline: The bicycle creates struggles in a culture where the conceived role of women is  motherhood and housekeeping, and where roads and streets are dominated by men.

name: African Wildlife Foundation REDD project, Kondoa Irangi Hills, Tanzania
Garoña nuclear power station, Spain
headline: Garoña is a controversial  boiling water reactor (similar to Fukushima 1) in the upper Ebro river valley. Environmentalists and regional authorities want it definitively stopped.

name: Medical Waste Incinerator, Bielsko-Biała, Silesia, Poland
headline: In 2015, the work of the waste incinerator at the Provincial Hospital in Bielsko-Biała was suspended. This is the first case of this type in Poland. The suspension is the result of strong mobilization by well-organized residents.

name: Struggle for fishing right within the Pench Tiger Reserve, Maharastra, India
headline: Struggle for the recognition of fishing rights inside the reservoir of Pench Tiger Reserve, and protest against the illegal relocation plan.

name: Proyecto Lagunas Norte, Barrick Gold, Peru
headline: Lagunas Norte is a gold mine owned by Barrick in Quiruvilca district, La Libertad. The mine’s activities  generated high levels of violence since it opened in 2005. The mining operation is being expanded.

name: Greenham Common Women’s Peace Camp eliminates Nuclear Missiles in Berkshire, England
headline: Spanning 19 years, the Greenham Common Women’s Peace Camp is one of the most famous examples of feminist protest in history. The movement successfully removed 96 missiles from the base which was turned into a park.

name: Proposed Mega Dam on River Ewaso Ng’iro, Kenya
Shell Neglects Court Orders in Umuorie Isimiri Community, Nigeria
Represa Itzantún, Chiapas, Mexico
headline: A successful resistance in Chiapas, where communities learnt from other nearby experience what the state company did not inform them about. After 40 years from its first proposal, the project was cancelled in 2004

name: Proyecto de Tendido Eléctrico en el Parque Nacional Canaima, Venezuela
headline: La exportación de hidroelectricidad a Brasil y la extensión de la mineria de oro y diamante: un conflicto que tiene que ver con ideas de desarrollo contrapuestas en el Parque Nacional Canaima y la Reserva Forestal de Imataca

name: Gyama Mine and Landslide accident, Tibet, China
headline: Destroying the landscape, polluting the rivers, taking away pasture land, and causing deaths to its mine workers. Read about mining expansion in occupied Tibet by Chinese companies.

name: PT SPN Oil Palm Company in Lee Village, Central Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: PT SPN applied for and was granted a land use permit over Lee Village territory in 2009 without prior and informed consent having been obtained from the villagers or the Village Government.

name: Partial destruction of the Jardins Ouvriers d'Aubervilliers, France
headline: Just two kilometers out of Paris, the swimming pool Olympic Games, related leisure facilities plus property developments threaten historic workers’ food gardens in Aubervilliers (Saint-Denis), a poor area with little green space.

name: Mining and transportation of uranium and working conditions at Port Radium, NW Territories, Arctic Canada
headline: Impacts of uranium and radium mining at Port Radium from the 1930s to 60s are still being felt by members of the local Déline Dene First Nation community that actively raise awareness of environmental and health damages caused by the project.

name: Kivalina climate change court case, Alaska, USA
headline: An emblematic climate justice case. An Alaskan village vs ExxonMobil Energy et. al. 2008-2012. The case was dismissed. Environmental liability was not recognized. The community suffers displacement, appeals to UN.

name: ERIKA Shipwreck and Oil Spill , Britanny, France
headline: Erika's oil spill disaster hit the French coast in 1999, spilling 20,000 tons of crude oil, killing many thousands of sea birds and soiling 400km of coastline. This was one major ecological disaster in France.

name: Paiton Baru Coal-fired Power Plant, East Java, Indonesia
headline: The 660MW PLTU Paiton Unit 9 (also known as PLN Paiton Baru) is part of the 4,945MW Paiton Power Complex. The coal-fired power plant has raised concerns regarding the impact of air pollution and hazardous and toxic waste on local communities.

name: X-Press Pearl Container Ship Fire and Spill, Sri Lanka
headline: X-Press Pearl Container Ship Fire and Sinkage: Oil Spill and Hazardous Material Release in Coastal Waters of Sri Linka. Affected still Seek Compensation.

name: Ciudad Real airport, Spain
headline: In April 2012, the Ciudad Real airport (central Spain) was closed after just three years in operation, its management company having gone into receivership. It had not received scheduled flights since December 2011.

name: Shell plantation, Thailand
Adipala coal-fired power plant, Bunton, Central Java, Indonesia
headline: The 660MW Adipala coal-fired power plant (also known as PLTU Bunton) at Bunton village in Cilacap has led to environmental, social and health concerns among residents and fishermen groups, resulting in blockades and demonstrations in the past 10+ years.

name: Contaminación del Rio Guarapiche por PDVSA, Venezuela
headline: En 2012 un derrame de petróleo en Monagas, al Este de Venezuela, llega al Rio Guarapiche y recorre cientos de kilómetros, contaminando parte de la cuenca, así como plantas de tratamiento de agua para el consumo humano, afectando a más de 500 mil personas

name: Yusho disease: Kanemi rice oil contaminated with PCB, Japan
headline: A world famous case. In 1968 "Kanemi rice oil" was contaminated with PCB, which was used for heating and circulated through a coil. Somehow, cracks in the coil appeared and PCBs leaked out, contaminating the cooking oil. There were over 14,000 victims.

name: The Park is Ours, Banja Luka, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Illegal Waste Dumping in the Muthurajewela Wetlands, Sri Lanka
headline: Illegal Waste Dumping Continues to Occur in Muthurajawela Wetlands Due to Lack of Governmental Regulation.

name: Ronderos de Pulán contra minera la Zanja, Perú
New Pokhara International Airport, Nepal
headline: In 1975 1,500 households were displaced for a new airport in Pokhara. The project lay dormant until it was revived in 2013. Additional land acquisition met with many protests and a violent clash that led to at least six people suffering injuries

name: “La Criticona”, cyclists yearly “critical masses”, Spain
headline: Cyclists "critical masses" in Spain have a general joint meeting every year in a different locality. In 2017 it was in Ibiza.  The intention is to destroy the myth of a car-centered civilization.

name: Save Yamuna Protest March, Delhi, India
Cinkarna Celje, Slovenia
Road M-501, Madrid, Spain
headline: Successful opposition to a new road in the protected Alberche and Cofío natural area near Madrid which was to be built for access to new urban settlements.

name: Wastepickers against privatization in the City of Tshwane, South Africa
headline: Wastepickers in the City of Tshwane (Pretoria) face displacement and the loss of their livelihoods as a result of landfill closures and evictions in settlements like Mushroomville.

name: Tahltan Nation v. Fortune Minerals, BC, Canada
Alta River Hydro Power Plant, Norway
headline: A very violent conflict, the state of Norway against local Sami people and supporters. The dam was finally built.  However, Norway was led to ratify Convention 169 of  ILO.

name: Dairy Aerobic Digesters for “Renewable Natural Gas” (RNG), USA
headline: Dairy anaerobic digesters are operating in 43 states across the USA. They promise to replace fossil fuels with a "renewable natural gas" produced from methane, but what are the deeper environmental and societal impacts?

name: Bioshape Kilwa Jatropha Project, Tanzania
Housing project in Doi Suthep mountains, Thailand
headline: Local organizations reacted to the building of a housing complex in a protected area in Doi Suthep (Chiang Mai), north of Thailand. The conflict ended with the government returning the land and starting a reforestation program.

name: Hambach forest occupation against brown coal mining, Germany
Hydro Power Plant Medna on Sana River, BiH
headline: Hydro power plant Medna is planned close to the springs of Sana River, area that is planned to be Park of Nature. Coalition for Sana River is for more than six year fighting against this plant.

name: Khudoni Dam, Georgia
headline: Public costs and private gains in hydro construction in Georgia. Local inhabitants oppose the project, propose small scale alternatives and rehabilitation of existing infrastructure

name: Campaign Against Coal, Egypt
headline: In the wake of the 2011 revolution, electricity shortages prompted President Morsi to overturn a ban on coal imports in July 2013, prompting the ire of environmentalists and health professionals.

name: Brewery project destroying Jhinkargadi forest in Balarampur village, Odisha, India
headline: Victory for villagers of Balarampur village against a brewery project set to uproot the old sal forest of Jhinkargadi, by women using Chipko tactics, and massive media outreach.

name: Mining Project at Marlapadu village, India
Zhuxi Industrial Park in Huaxi, Dongyang, Zhejiang, China
headline: In April 2005, thousands of people rioted in a village in southeastern China, overturning police cars and driving away officers who had tried to stop elderly villagers protesting against pollution from nearby factories in a chemical park.

name: Pigneto Lake in Rome, Italy
Widespread conflicts over sand mining in rivers in Tamil Nadu, India
headline: An insight into the large-scale illegal sand mining trade in Tamil Nadu for the building industry, with complex dynamics between the state, the sand mining mafia, the bureaucrats and the local people, and with many victims.

name: Sizewell B nuclear power station in Suffolk, England
headline: Hilda Murrell was a British botanist and campaigner against nuclear power and nuclear weapons. She was abducted and found murdered ten kilometers from her home.

name: Expanded Nuclear energy, South Africa
headline: The government proposed plans to build 8 new nuclear reactors. Duynefontein was chosen to be the next site for one of the reactors, though many continue to protest against its development.

name: Radiation and sheep: Sellafield (formerly Windscale), Cumbria, UK
headline: Sellafield (formerly Windscale) is a nuclear fuel reprocessing and nuclear decommissioning site, on the coast of Cumbria, England. It suffered a fire in 1957. It is a very hazardous site.

name: Monocultivo de Soya en Santa Cruz, Bolivia
headline: The Central de Pueblos y Comunidades Indígenas del Oriente Boliviano (CIDOB) complains about the deforestation and the large scale cultivation of transgenic soybeans for export by foreign and national planters in indigenous territories.

name: Banten Labuan coal-fired power plant, Banten, Indonesia
headline: Banten Labuan coal-fired power plant has led to fishermen and civil society resistance due to its negative impacts on the coastal ecosystem and local community's livelihood.

name: Referendum to end Bird Hunting in Spring, Malta
headline: Upcoming referendum on 11th April 2015 against bird hunting in Spring season

name: Iron ore mining in Saranda forest, JH, India
headline: Iron ore mining causes devastation of pristine Saranda forests which are home to over 36,000 adivasis (tribals), dense sal forests. The forests also house a large number of flora and fauna, and serve as an important elephant corridor.

name: Soy Cultivation - Caaguazu and San Pedro, Paraguay
headline: GM soy monoculture expansion remains the Paraguayan government line of sight.

name: Shell, Rumuekpe Clan Soaked in Crude Oil, Nigeria
Erdeven Nuclear Power Plant, France
headline: The Erdeven nuclear power plant is a former project to build a nuclear power plant in the town of Erdeven in Morbihan department, Brittany region, France. It was announced in 1974 but abandoned in 1975 after strong local opposition.

name: Rihand Dam, UP, India
Residents and monks of Lhamo Mountain affected by Ganhetan Industrial District Park pollution, Qinghai, China
headline: The Ganhetan Industrial District, near the Kumbum Monastery, pollutes the land and the water by the processing of lead, putting in danger the children's life. The residents wrote a letter appeal for action to  be taken by governmental authorities.

name: Chenjiachong landfill site and the proposed waste-to-energy plant in Yangluo, Wuhan, Hubei, China
headline: Days of turbulent street protests against an incinerator project in Wuhan have prompted the local government to assure residents it has no plans to build the facility any time soon.

name: Jericó, Antioquia, Colombia
Agricultural land investment deal in Djidja, Benin
Whanganui River legally recognized as living entity, New Zealand
headline: A new legal framework called Te Pā Auroa legally recognizes Te Awa Tupua as a being consisting of the river "from the mountains to the sea, its tributaries, and all physical and metaphysical elements, as an indivisible and living whole

name: Roma exposed to dislocation due to road construction, Strumica, Macedonia
headline: Already impoverished Roma settlement exposed to flooding when there is heavy rains. There is no garbage containers. Now, the Roma are exposed to dislocation due to road construction as well.

name: Al-Khorayef Group plans for Soy in Chaco, Argentina
Nam Theun 2 hydropower dam, Lao PDR
Quebradeiras de coco babaçu against agribusiness and the enclosure of their lands, Maranhão, Brazil
headline: For over thirty years, the women movement of babassu coconut breakers has struggled for recognition and access to communal resources,  facing pressures by ever-expanding soy, eucalyptus and cattle business.

name: Manis Mata conflict (PT HSL) in Kalimantan, Indonesia
Center of the reprocessing of nuclear waste, La Hague, France
headline: The nuclear waste treatment center at La Hague is lacking storage to stock the fuel and releases toxic particles. Pollution and serious diseases are allegedly the consequences faced by citizens. Some movements complain.

name: Coal Pollution from Eskom in Emalahleni, Mpumalanga, South Africa
headline: Eskom's coal power operations are responsible for severe pollution. The government continues to invest in Eskom and deregulate the already-weak legislation in the face of the coronavirus epidemic despite environmental groups' legal efforts.

name: CAFO pollution in Lenawee County, Michigan, USA
headline: Concentrated animal feeding operations (CAFOs) polluted rural Michigan since the 1990s helped by weak regulation and government subsidies. Lynn Henning (Goldman Prize) exposed their socio-environmental injustices through successful activism.

name: Cement factory around Madang Township, Gansu province, China
headline: The pollution damaged a White Pagoda, livelihood and farming. The villagers protested by petitions or pacific protests; but the authorities responded by violence.

name: Minera Los Pelambres, Los Vilos, Coquimbo, Chile
headline: In Caimanes, Coquimbo, copper mine belonging to Luksic group. Conflicts on the use of water, and threats from a very large talings dam (El Mauro) continue after many years.

name: Chevron Refinery in Richmond, CA, USA
Mina Gualcamayo, San Juan, Argentina
headline: Open pit and underground gold mine in San Juan, Argentina next to  Guandacol,  a town in La Rioja where some neighbours have complained. Some resistance from conservationist and archeological groups.

name: Bashkir Nuclear Power Plant, Russia
headline: The idea of building the Bashkir NPP in Agidel was revived 30 year after being stopped by Russian anti-nuclear movement.

name: Panantza - San Carlos, Ecuador
Nijgadh Airport and Airport City, Nepal
headline: Over 2.4 million trees, a vast swath of the last remaining forest in the eastern Tarai, could be felled for a mega-airport, with an adjoining Airport City, in Nijgadh. The site includes the Tangiya Basti settlement and 7,500 people face displacement.

name: Ralco HEP and Bio Bio Watershed hydro plans, Chile
headline: The Biobio region is sadly known for heavy impacts on health of local Pehuenche people and to their territory. A new study for hydro in the basin could increase conflicts in these "sacrifice watershed"

name: Gold mining in Corcoesto, Galicia, Spain
Mahan Coal Limited, India
Minera Autlán en Hidalgo, Mexico
headline: Repeated complaints over the years due to water pollution and severe damages to human health against the Autlan mining company which extracts manganese in  Molango and communities of Nonoalco, Malila, Otongo, Naopa, Xochicoatlan ...

name: Dead pigs dumping in Jiaxing of Zhejiang causing water pollution in Huangpu River, Shanghai, China
headline: Over 16,000 dead pigs, mainly dumped by farmers in neighbouring Jiaxing, Zhejiang province, were found in the Shanghai Songjiang section of the Huangpu River, which supplies the city of Shanghai with drinking water.

name: Mining project MARA, Argentina
headline: Civic resistance (neighbours assemblies, road blockades) lasting many years against mining projects owned by Xstrata-Glencore, meant to substitute the  production from La Alumbrera.

name: Hidroelectrica Hidrotambo, Ecuador
headline: Small doesn't always mean beautiful and sustainable; a 8MW hydro dam by a private company leads to severe conflicts with the local villagers. Construction work led by the army fuels repression and opposition

name: Kryktytau Mountain Range,  Bashkortostan, threatened by Copper Company. Russia.
headline: Successful resistance  at the foot of the Kryktytau mountain range in 2019 against the Russian Copper Company which was granted a 25 year license on the Salavat deposit.

name: Messer`s Super Bricks Threatens Orchards of Farmers, Bangladesh
headline: Threats posed by a traditional Brick Kiln is opposed by local farmers who fear loss of their orchards and other agricultural products.

name: Klabin plantations, Brazil
Gas exploitation in the Urubamba valley Camisea, Peru
headline: In spite of the locals' opposition, a foreign companies' consortium obtained a 40 years license for gas exploitation in Camisea.

name: Waste Gas-based Cogeneration Project, Egypt
Transporte de carbón de Drummond en la Bahia de Santa Marta, Colombia
Metsamor Nuclear Power Plant, Armenia
headline: The Armenian Nuclear Power Plant (ANPP), also known as the Metsamor Nuclear Power Plant, is the only nuclear power plant in Armenia. Its aging design and proximity to earthquake-prone areas make it among the most dangerous nuclear plants in the world.

name: Shell's Quest Hydrogen-CCS in Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta, Canada
headline: Large tar sands processing plant that includes a CCS facility plans even greater expansion, further threatening the health of the local people as well as the environment. There have been occupations and peaceful protests held to counter expansion.

name: Pinpet iron mine and steel factory, Shan State, Myanmar
headline: Mt. Pinpet was transformed into the country’s largest iron mine. Rumors of uranium mining surrounded the project. Severe impacts on local ethnic Pa-O provoked social mobilizations to stop the mine and factory.

name: South Taranaki Bight seabed iron sand extraction and processing project, New Zealand
headline: A coalition of protesters including indigenous people are trying to stop a seabed mining project for 50 million tons per year of iron sands, titanium and other minerals.

name: Bovanenkovo – Ukhta 2 undersea gas pipeline incident, Baydaratskaya Bay, Arctic Russia
headline: Part of the Gazprom pipeline placed undersea has broken. Negative environmental impacts of the incident on reindeer herders (Nenets) are kept away from the public.

name: Environmental lawyer killed in Bohol, Visayas Islands, The Philippines
headline: Mia Manuelita Mascarinas-Green, environmental, women’s and children’s rights lawyer was killed in her car in Tagbilaran City Feb 17, 2017. She was Philippine lawyer who specialized in investigating crimes against the environment.

name: Norilsk pollution, Russia
headline: Norilsk is one of the 10 most polluted cities in the world and "Norilsk Nickel", a big mining and the metallurgical complex, is to blame for that.

name: Mustika Sembuluh, oil palm plantations in Central Kalimantan, Indonesia
headline: Two decades after palm oil arrived in Danau Sembuluh, conflicts are still in place. Despite the owner of the plantation area changed in 2007, the situation has not improved. Local communities continue to strugglefor justice.

name: Vajont Dam disaster, Italy
headline: Technology and impunity; Vajont as the symbol of "failure of engineers and geologists to understand the nature of the problem they were trying to deal with"

name: The “black tide” of the Torrey Canyon oil spill, UK
headline: The  Torrey Canyon travelled from Kuwait to Milford Haven with 120 000 tons of oil shipped by BP. It ran aground on a reef between the Scilly Islands and Land’s End.   This was perhaps the largest vessel to be wrecked, the biggest oil spill until then.

name: Mina de oro El Porvenir, Colombia
headline: La origen y el verdadero "porvenir" de la minería en Tolima: fallos en los estudios ambientales, contaminación de cianuro, desplazamiento forzados, y afectación irreversible de las fuentes hídricas. Los campesinos gritan: ¡Agua y mina no combinan!

name: Bruce Power Nuclear Power Plant Project abandoned in Lac Cardinal and Peace river, Alberta, Canada
headline: Communities around Lac Cardinal and Peace river successfully protested against a very large nuclear power plant on their lands. Given their efforts, the project was finally cancelled.

name: Goi Case against Shell, Nigeria
Baixo Acaraú irrigation project threatens Tremembé indigenous people, Brazil
headline: The expansion of monoculture in Ceará is leading to the expansion of water infrastructure projects such as the Baixo Acaraú irrigation project that threatens the land of indigenous Tremembé.

name: Represa Los Pilares (o Bicentenario), Sonora, Mexico
headline: Construcción de una presa en el Río Mayo, zona que es sitio sagrado y centro del hábitat de la población de los Guarijíos entre las laderas de la Sierra Madre Occidental.

name: Maidan gold mine, Batken district, Kyrgyzstan
headline: In 2013, around 200 protesters attacked the offices of Z-Explorer, the local subsidiary of Australian Manas Resources at the Shambesai gold field in Batken Oblast. This is one of several mining conflicts in the country.

name: Prohibition of animal and human drawn vehicles in Porto Alegre, Brazil
headline: A municipal law established a deadline for the animal and human drawn vehicles to be banned for circulation. The National Movement of Recyclable Material Collectors complains that the law has a clear hygienist bias and serves economic interests.

name: Formosa Toxic Waste Spill and Plastic Pollution in Lavaca Bay, Texas, United States
headline: Formosa Plastics Group is a repeat offender of environmental violations that has illegally dumped waste, violated health and safety codes for workers and plant infrastructure,  over 30 years.

name: Nam Mang 3 hydropower dam, Lao PDR
headline: The comparatively small Nam Mang 3 hydropower and irrigation dam caused the first villager-led protests against the rapidly growing hydropower sector in Lao PDR

name: Mopa International airport (North Goa), India
headline: A new international airport at Mopa in North Goa is going to be developed. Locals of Mopa are against the proposed project, claiming that they would lose their homes, plantations and their livelihood.

name: Mendiola massacre against farmers demanding genuine land reform, Manila, The Philippines
headline: On Jan. 22, 1987, 10,000 farmers and peasants led by the  Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) were gunned down in the city of Manila by police and the military when they asked for a genuine land reform.

name: Rowghat Iron ore mines, CG, India
headline: Suppression of an environmental justice movement by adivasis through police brutality, and militarization in Chhattisgarh in order to maintain supply of iron ore to the Bhilai Steel Plant.

name: Asbestos Mine in Bom Jesus da Serra and Eternit Factory in Simoes Filho, Brazil
headline: The mine Sao Felix do Amianto was opened between 1939 and 1967 in Bom Jesus da Serra and Poçoes in Bahia. The company Eternit  belonged to Stephen Schmidheiny.

name: Biomass power plant, Pécs, Hungary
Noor solar power complex, Morocco
headline: Ouarzazate hosts the world's newest and largest solar power plant. Yet, this case of land grabbing challenges us to remain critical of the claim that any move toward renewable energy, regardless of how it is carried out, is to be welcomed.

name: Environmental defenders against Gmelina Tree plantations, Costa Rica
headline: In the early 1990s environmental defenders opposed Stone Container's plans for Melina tree plantations, defending one of the most biodiverse zones of the country. This conflict is related to the death of four young activists.

name: Elsipogtog First Nation v. Fracking, NB, Canada
Bulacan Aerotropolis threatens fishing livelihoods, Philippines
headline: Proposed construction of Bulacan Aerotropolis in Manila Bay threatens 700 families in the town on Taliptip with displacement and loss of their fishing livelihoods. Thousands more fisherfolk and salt-makers would be affected by land reclamation.

name: Área Natural Protegida y deforestación en el Nevado de Toluca, México
headline: El Nevado de Toluca ha cambiado de categoría de Área Protegida pasando de Parque Nacional a Área de Protección de la Flora y la Fauna, lo que permite la tala comercial y la llegada de actores e intereses ajenos a las comunidades locales.

name: Represa La Salvajina, Colombia
Illegal falcon hunting crisis, Syria
headline: Illegal falcon trade booms in Syria amid war, economic hardship and lack of law enforcement

name: Māori resistance results in Te Urewera gaining legal personality, New Zealand
headline: Decades of resistance led by Tūhoe Maori has resulted in their ancestral land, Te Urewera, being granted legal personality and Tūhoe reclamation of management rights.

name: Paz del Río, Boyacá, Colombia
Certej gold mining, Romania
headline: Eldorado Gold, a low cost Canadian gold mining company, intends to open Romania’s first cyanide based open-pit gold mine. The proposal is facing both strong national and international opposition.

name: Large-scale Wind Farm in Sami reindeer land, Sweden
headline: More than 1,000 turbines (4,000 MW) are being constructed in Sami herding lands.  The UN and ONGs press the Swedish government and private financial institutions to respect Sami land and human rights.

name: Proyecto turístico Île à Vache, Haití
headline: El desarrollo turístico en esta pequeña isla de Haiti implica el desalojo de sus pobladores o por lo menos su reubicación, y el fin de sus fuentes de subsistencia.

name: Shell spill and pollution in the Bunu-Tai community, Ogoni land, Nigeria
headline: Bunu-Tai community, their farmlands, and other small villages were polluted by Shell's spills who is not being held accountable

name: Toxic undeground burning of coal tailings in and around Apanas, Kemerovo,  Russia
headline: Residents successfully resisted plans to destroy the only road leading to their village for mining. However, they continue suffering from toxic fumes of smoldering abandoned coal tailings.

name: Uranium mining in Kakadu National Park, Australia
headline: The injustice of uranium mining in Kakadu National Park is not the only one in Australia against aboriginal communities. By 2019, the Ranger uranium mine is facing enormous rehabilitation costs.

name: Harris Superquarry, ÉcoSse, Royaume-Uni
headline: En Avril 2004, La Société Lafarge en Abandonné Ses Proyectos Pour Une Très Grande Carrière de Pierre à Lingerbay à Harris, En Écosse, Après Une Social Bataille et Juridique de Douce Ans. Un Grand Triomphe pour Les Environnementalistes Tels Que des Amis de la Terre Escocia.

name: Kintyre Uranium Mine, Australia
headline: Members of the Martu community embarked on a week-long march to protest against Kintyre uranium mine, walking 110 kms to the site.

name: Hidroeléctricas Renace y Oxec , empresa de Florentino Pérez, Guatemala
headline: Five hydroelectric plants in the Cahabón River, in Q'eqchi' territory, bringing violence, loss of water for the communities, loss of biodiversity and means of livelihood.  Three plants operative, two suspended.

name: Gorongosa and carbon market, Mozambique
Gold mining in Indawgyi Lake, Myanmar
headline: Despite being recognized by the UNESCO as an area of high conservation value, gold mining is happening in the surroundings of the Indawgyi Lake, contaminating the waters with mercury and cyanide and increasing the sedimentation in the lake.

name: Braslovce Highway plan, Slovenia
Oil Spillage Ethiope River, Nigeria
Construction of a highway over a radioactive waste disposal site, Moscow, Russia
headline: A strong opposition by local and international activists against the construction of a highway over a radioactive waste disposal site in a southern region of Moscow.

name: Elk Valley Coal Mines Selenium Pollution in BC, Canada
headline: Teck Resources coal mines are producing hazardous levels of selenium and endangering local wildlife and livelihoods in the Elk Valley Region.

name: Prey Lang forest movement against deforestation, mining and agro-industries, Cambodia
Hidroeléctrica Sallca Pucará, Perú
headline: Desvío del río afectará a 19.000 familias pertenecientes a comunidades campesinas que dependen de la agricultura. La empresa busca consenso en la comunidad creando divisiones y conflictos

name: Yambol Landfill Site, Bulgaria
Parque eólico Jepirachi, Colombia
Mining limestone at 'Sacred' Kushtau Hill, Russia
headline: Mining at 'Sacred' Kushtau hill in the Southern Ural was successfully stoped after collective action protests. The site is designated as a protected area.

name: Imphal Airport Expansion, Manipur, India
headline: The state Government of Manipur planned to expand its airport, that will become the first international airport of the North East. The government notified to acquire land from land currently allocated to agriculture.

name: Ramlet el Bayda, Lebanon
headline: The Ramlet el Bayda beach located on the seashore of Lebanon’s capital, Beirut, is threatened by the ongoing privatization of most of the capital’s publicly used spaces, started during the chaos of the Lebanese Civil War.

name: Kalkar's sodium-cooled fast breeder reactor prototype, Germany
headline: The SNR-300, a prototype fast breeder reactor to be built at Kalkar, near the Rhine, was not put into operation because of strong protests. The site and some buildings were turned into Wunderland Kalkar, an amusement park.

name: Navi Mumbai Airport, Panvel, India
headline: About 3,500 families residing in 10 villages  are being displaced to make way for Navi Mumbai Airport. Their long struggle for fair rehabilitation began in 2010 and pre-construction work began in 2017 with many villagers still living on the site.

name: Sierra de la Ventana, Argentina
Represa El Cercado en el río Ranchería, La Guajira, Colombia
headline: El río Ranchería ha sido represado para abastecer cultivos de arroz, palma y  minería, dejando sin agua a miles de indígenas que están muriendo de sed. El caso ahora a la CIDH, la comunidad Wayúu espera su pronunciamiento

name: Mining company Cerro Colorado, Chile
headline: Currently (2020) several judicial processes are still open between the communities and the company BHP-Billiton, the largest private mining actor in Chile

name: Novi Han nuclear waste storage, Bulgaria
Xiegou coal mine, Lvliang, Shanxi, China
headline: Xiegou coal mine faces public interest litigation from Friends of Nature (FON). FON volunteer faced violence from the coal mine during site visit and investigation.

name: Oil Spillage in Nagaland, India
Planta de licuefacción de gas de Sempra Energy en Ensenada, Baja California, México
headline: En Ensenada la población local se opone al proyecto de la empresa Sempra Energy de ampliación de su planta regasificadora para añadir la capacidad de licuefacción con el objetivo de exportar gas proveniente de Estados-Unidos hacia Asia.

name: Coal mining led to land subsidence in Guqiao, Fengtai County, Anhui Province, China
headline: Gubei and Guqiao coal mine, have led to significant land subsidence issues and resistance by local communities over the years due to land disputes, relocation issues and environmental pollution.

name: Corib Gas in Rossport, Ireland
Southwood Timber Corporation’s logging activities on ancestral lands, Misamis Oriental, Philippines
headline: Against deforestation and rising calamities: Indigenous groups opposing logging concession on their ancestral lands face deadly repression.

name: Luxury residential units in Bayview-Hunters Point, California, USA
headline: Air Quality Standards Violations and Gentrification in San Francisco’s Bayview Hunters Point from India Basin Mix Use Development Project

name: Citadel Capital/Concord Irrigated Crops in Unity State, South Sudan
Melghat Tiger Reserve, Maharastra, India
headline: Forced relocation of tribal communities from the inviolate Tiger Reserve area.

name: Loharinag Pala hydel power project, India
UAM Unidad Lerma, expropiation of ejido land, Mexico
headline: Complaints against expropiation in 2009 of 44 ha of communal land (ejido land) in Amomolulco to build a new university campus in a protected natural area.

name: Forest Plantation by Green Resources in Bukaleba, Uganda
headline: “No places to pray to our gods”; displacement and eviction while "carbon violence" displays at forest plantations in Uganda

name: Illegal dumping sites, Slovenia
Controversy over the development of the Nujiang Dams, China
headline: A  government and private industry plan for building two reservoirs and thirteen dams along the middle and lower reaches of the Nujiang River was stopped by persistent civil society movements at the end of 2016.

name: Community activism around Diamond Alkali Superfund Site leads to strong EJ legislation, NJ, US
headline: Passaic River Pollution in Newark New Jersey; 40 years of contamination

name: Xiantao Waste-to-Energy Plant, Hubei, China
headline: In 2016, Xiantao Government temporarily suspended a waste incineration project following mass protests over environmental and health concerns. The project recommenced in 2017 and was put in operation during 2018.

name: Land-grabbing in Kajászó, Hungary
Rio Branco-Jauaperi Extractive Reserve, Brazil
Tribals and  wealthy residents against Cape Wind Farm, Massachusetts, USA
headline: A wind farm in Nantucket Sound is delayed for years because of opposition by the wealthy and by the Wampanoag tribe in alliance with birders, boaters, fishermen and beachcombers, arguing that turbines would disturb biological and cultural heritage.

name: Kirtland Air Force Base jet fuel leak, USA
headline: A decades-old jet fuel spill contaminated soil and groundwater beneath Kirtland Air Force Base, moving towards wells supplying drinking water to Albuquerque. The spill, estimated at 24 million gallons, was the largest underground toxic spill in US history

name: Forests of Matebeleland North Province, Zimbabwe
Shrinking of the Świętokrzyski National Park for new annexes of a monastery, Poland
headline: Despite the almost three-year-long struggle of environmentalists, the Świętokrzyski National Park lost a small, but naturally valuable fragment. This is a dangerous legal precedent! From now on, other Polish protected areas are under threat!

name: Hotamis Marshes, Turkey
Governmental corruption in sand mining for metals in Kartung, The Gambia
headline: Illegal sand mining endagers villagers's lives in Kartung, Batukunku, Sanyang. The Gambia suffers governmental corruption. Companies such as Carnegie, Gamico, APAM, export to China and do not restore the damaged areas.

name: Sayona Mining’s Authier Lithium Project in Québec, Canada
headline: Various local organizations from the Regional County Municipality (MRC) of Abitibi in Quebec oppose the lithium mine project of Sayona Mining company for its possible socio-environmental impacts.

name: Crude Oil Pipeline pollutes Oho communitys farmlands, Nigeria
Erdeneburen hydropower plant project, Mongolia
headline: A BRI-funded hydropower plan threatens the livelihoods and water sources of pastoralist people in name of energy independence from Russia and China and of the energy transition.

name: Rapu Rapu polymetallic mine, Philippines
headline: Supposed to be a showcase mine after the Philippine Mining Act of 1995, the Rapu Rapu polymetallic mine, located on Rapu Rapu Island in Southeastern Luzon, has turned an island paradise into a wasteland.

name: Smurfit-Kappa Carton de Colombia en Sevilla
Tamalout Dam, Morocco
headline: In 2009, Morocco developed a new water strategy aimed to support the water needs for its economic development plan until 2030. The dam is part of this plan but will eventually flood the surrounding villages

name: East St. Louis Chemical Plants and Waste Incinerators, USA
The Sorgenfri Camp case: Roma community evicted from a former industrial land in Malmö, Sweden
headline: Two hundred Roma were evicted from their settlement in Malmö (Sweden) for alleged health and safety reasons, as well as a possible redevelopment plan of the formerly industrialized area, which is still heavily contaminated.

name: Wastepickers and residents of Sarzedo struggle against incinerators, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: Wastepickers of Minas Gerais have achieved a ban on solid waste incineration. Still the struggle continues and is now directed against Ecovital’s hazardous waste incineration in Sarzedo, which has impaired the local community and provoked protests.

name: River Ethiope Polluted by massive oil spill, Nigeria
Contaminación de la bahía de Chipriona por la industria ronera, Mayabeque, Cuba
headline: Cuba Ron SA, la principal destiladora y productora de rones finos de Cuba ha contaminado por décadas la Bahía de Chipriona, en el municipio Santa Cruz del Norte

name: Kanhar Dam, UP, India
Crecimiento urbano amenaza los Humedales de Bahía, Panamá
headline: Activistas ambientales en la ciudad de Panamá piden la protección del Humedad Bahía de Panamá el cual está amenazado por la construcción de proyectos inmobiliarios, por desechos sólidos y líquidos de la zona urbana.

name: Eco Golf Resort Project in Soragune Forest, Sri Lanka
headline: Forest land grabbed for a golf resort and a hotel. EJOs and monks join hands and celebrate ordination of trees to save the forest and stop destructive touristic projects

name: Husky Energy pipeline spill in Saskatchewan, Canada
headline: The 2016 Husky Energy pipeline oil spill leaked up to 250,000 litres of oil in the West of Saskatchewan. While Husky was charged on 3 counts and made to pay a fine, the management of the spill and subsequent cleanup has been heavily criticized.

name: Nile Trading and Development / Kinyeti Mysterious Land Deals in Mukaya Payam, Central Equatoria State, South Sudan
GENED-1 Hydroelectric Power Plant in Apayao-Abulug River, Cordillera Region, The Philippines
headline: After strong opposition from Isnag community to the Gened dam project, the National Commission on Indigenous People (NCIP) approved the Certificate of Precondition (CP) violating the people of Apayao’s right to Free, Prior, and Informed Consent.

name: Export of Bauxite from Katougouma and Dapilon harbours by Société Minière de Boké, Guinea
headline: Transportation of bauxite in Boké has severe social and environmental impacts. Despite of locals' and employees' denunces, no sufficient measures were taken and violent tensions are mounting

name: Reserva Natural Santa Catalina, Buenos Aires, Argentina
headline: La Reserva Natural Santa Catalina se localiza en Lomas de Zamora, provincia de Buenos Aires. Posee una superficie de 700 hectáreas conteniendo los últimos humedales naturales remanentes de la ribera sur de la Cuenca Matanza-Riachuelo.

name: APP on Sumatra, Indonesia
Shiyes Landfill in Arkhangelsk region, Russia
headline: Authorities are building a landfill at Shiyes in Arkhangelsk region to permanently deposit waste from Moscow. Local citizens, excluded from decision making,  fear health risks and environmental degradation.

name: Ban on animal-drawn carts in Berazategui, Argentina
headline: On March 21st of 2019, the district of Berazategui passed an ordinance through which they would ban any animal-draught carts in the whole district. Mainly affecting waste pickers and putting their livelihoods at risk.

name: Monywa Letpadaung copper mine, Sagaing, Myanmar
headline: Violent repression, incendiary phosphorus and the killing of a woman protester mark the development of this large copper mine. Affected people, activists and international organisations mobilize for an immediate halt of operations.

name: Minera Aruntani-Arasi y contaminación de ríos en Puno, Peru
headline: The mining company Aruntani  belongs to one of Peru's wealthiest families.  It pollutes rivers in the south of the country. The company expands its operations to other regions of Peru.

name: Mapuche communities resisting land grabbing by Benetton, Argentina
headline: Mapuches communities in Santa Rosa Leleque fighting for decades to regain their ancestral lands, under the Benetton's brothers property.

name: Lomada de Leiva, Santa Cruz, Argentina
headline: Lomada de Leiva is a gold and silver mine in Perito Moreno, close to archeologically  important rock art.  The firm Patagonia Gold has started another new mining project nearby.

name: Quellaveco copper mine, Peru
headline: Despite the public consultation rejecting the project, Anglo-American has finally received all permits and favors from governments and plans to start extraction in 2022.

name: Rasi Salai Dam, Thailand
Amarapura Urban Development Project (Shankalay Kyun island), Myanmar
headline: The Amarapura Urban Development Project is a development plan for the Shankalay Kyun island, where a Myanmar traditional village is located. The project will build hotels, shopping malls, and apartment buildings but will displace the original population.

name: Sand and gravel mine, Huris-tak (Juristac), California, USA
