headline: Environmental groups have come out against the proposed mine because of the adverse impact it would likely have on local environment and culture related to the site.

name: Gaziemir Lead Factory and nuclear storage, Turkey
headline: The abandoned industrial site in Gaziemir, Izmir poses a radioactive threat to the environment. Scientists and activists warn about the danger, after the Housing Development Administration announced mass housing project on the site

name: Cassuruba Reserve in Caravelas, Bahia, Brazil
Protest against plywood units, India
Mina Calica de Vulcan Materials Company en Playa del Carmen, México
headline: Cerca de Playa del Carmen, una mina de la empresa Calica destruye desde hace 30 años zonas vírgenes  de selva para extraer caliza destinada a ser exportada hacia los Estados Unido de América.

name: Idku local residents against BP project, Egypt
headline: Graffiti, chants and social network; local protests and international environmental awareness have forced BP to to re-route its proposed pipeline and processing plant.

name: Bokaro Steel Plant, Jharkhand, India
Unlawful removal of olive trees and wind energy project in Karaburun, Turkey
headline: The construction of 120 MW wind energy and transformer station was being carried out in Karaburun Municipality; it entails the removal of 2,080 olive trees from a zone designated as a protected olive grove.

name: Opposition to Primorsk Transshiping Complex, Leningrad Oblast, Russia
headline: Opposition against the building of the first deep-water universal sea port in the Baltic sea 'Primorsk Universal Transshipment Complex'.

name: Nishiyodogawa in Osaka, air pollution court cases, Japan
headline: Nishiyodogawa ward is an industrial area located in Osaka with businesses  and adjacent  housing,  as  well  as  highways. Air  pollution  victims  filed  lawsuits  against industrial companies and the Hanshin Expressway Public Corporation.

name: Dewayne Johnson against Monsanto, glyphosate exposure, California, USA
headline: Dewayne Johnson vrs. Monsanto Company is the first Roundup cancer lawsuit to proceed to trial. Dewayne is also the first to win.

name: Criminalización de 11 defensoras del territorio resistiendo la privatización de tierras y aguas, Querétaro, México
headline: Derivado de conflicto por despojo de manantiales comunitarios el estado incurrió en uso indebido y excesivo de la fuerza pública contra las personas defensoras

name: Cheddi Jagan International Airport, Guayana
headline: Timehri residents were pressured to relocate for expansion of Cheddi Jagan International Airport. Homes and farmland were bulldozed and crops destroyed. Sand mining for construction caused dust pollution, damaged farmland and left large, dangerous pits.

name: Mina Los Filos - El Bermejal, Carrizalillo, Guerrero, Mexico
headline: A community in the state of Guerrero suffers an extremely high degree of violence as a consequence of gold mining first by the Canadian firm Goldcorp, and now by LeaGold Mining. The mine is expected to expand.

name: Fishworkers struggle in Kerala, India
headline: A strong fishworkers movement, the  Kerala Swathantra Malsya Thozhilali Federation ,  complained against mechanized trawlers, achieving many successes. A well known leader was Thomas Kocherry.

name: Baiga women’s mobilization to protect forests from Forest Department intervention in Pondi, India
headline: In 2011, seven Baiga women in Pondi, Central India, fought the Forest Department to protect their forest from being cut down. Their fought encourage the rest of the community to join the cause and defend the intrusive practices from the Forest Department.

name: Heathrow Third Runway Airport Expansion, UK
headline: Many local and national groups had been campaigning since 2002 against the Heathrow airport expansion.

name: Lamu Cordisons Wind Power Project, Kenya
headline: Disputes over land for wind power farms between several companies, officials and local populations, in the vicinity of Lamu.

name: Navidad mining project of Pan American Silver, Chubut, Argentina
headline: For nearly 20 years, people in Chubut, have fought to stop the Navidad silver project, passing a law prohibiting open pit mining and use of cyanide in 2003. Today, residents denounce Pan American Silver's attempts to pressure lawmakers to reverse the law.

name: Lafarge cement Trbovlje, Slovenia
headline: In 2017 farmer Uroš Macerl  founder of the environmental group Eco krog got a Goldman Prize for managing to close down a cement factory from Lafargue to save his community.

name: Palm oil plantation in South-West Cameroon
Hydro Power Plant Boguchanskaya, Russia
headline: The 3000 MW hydropower plant construction began  in 1980 and resumed in 2006.  It is located on the river Angara near Kodinsk. It was carried out by the companies “RusHydro” and “Rusal”, for aluminium smelting

name: Findikli Pasalar Regulator and Hydroelectric Power Plant, Turkey
Carmichael Coal Mine and Rail Project, Queensland, Australia
headline: Australia's largest coal mine has been approved. It is being contested by environment groups and the Wangan and Jagalingou People for its impacts to cultural heritage, land, water, vulnerable species, climate change and the Great Barrier Reef.

name: Eviction of Kalahari Bushmen for Conservation and Mining Interests, Botswana
headline: The Kalahari Bushmen have been pushed out of their traditional territory of the Central Kalahari Game Reserve for diamond extraction and conservation interests. Those who return or try to practice traditional hunting are killed or tortured by eco-guards.

name: Antamine Copper Mine, Peru
headline: One of the most important projects in the country. Long Data Conflict that affects inhabitants and the environment from its open pit in the Andes, along the mineway to the coast and even the fishermen of Huarmey port.

name: Plantations and Land conflict with PT WKS, Indonesia
Sindh Engro Coal Mining and Power Plant Project, Thar Desert, Pakistan
headline: In the thirsty Thar desert, Pakistan has begun to dig up one of the world’s largest deposits of low-grade, brown, dirty coal to fuel new power stations, with Chinese investments.

name: Palma africana, Kukra Hill, Nicaragua
Muelle de Pie de la Cuesta y muerte de Fabiola Osorio por defender el manglar, Guerrero, Mexico
headline: En 2012 Fabiola Osorio, de Guerreros Verdes, fue asesinada al oponerse a la construcción del muelle de Pie de la Cuesta, destrucción de manglares y ecocidio de la laguna de Coyuca de Benítez.

name: Business park on farmland next to Cardiff Airport, UK
headline: Planning permission for an aerospace business park on farmland next to Cardiff Airport was granted despite +1,000 objections. Following action by Vale Communities Unite, the group opposing the development, the decision is now subject to judicial review.

name: Kundil Sponge Iron Limited, Londa, India
Gosowong Gold Mine on indigenous Pagu territory in North Halmahera, Maluku,  Indonesia
headline: Since 1999, the Gosowong Gold Mine operated on indigenous Pagu land without consent and despite key litigation making it illegal. The Pagu continue fighting for compensation and land rights recognition.

name: Explotación de gas en Picún Leufú, Neuquén, Argentina
headline: Successful Mapuche resistance to a gas project in Neuquén. The Mapuche community demanded the respect for their indigenous rights, suffered violence perpetrated by the state and the company, and, finally, obtained a judicial ruling, stopping the project.

name: Zurawlow shalegas field and Chevron withdrawal, Poland
headline: On 3 June 2013 a small village in Poland began an occupation of a field for around 400 days, to avoid that Chevron fenced the area to fracking. The villagers won this fight and Chevron withdrew

name: El Pacto Ribereño en contra de la explotación petrolera en Tabasco, Mexico
headline: El “Pacto Ribereño” fue el primer caso del siglo XX en México en el cual una problemática ambiental generó una acción política masiva, con amplia participación campesina e indígena.

name: Opposition to oil&gas exploitation, New Zealand
headline: Workers and environmentalists ally to oppose prospections and deep shore drilling by oil giants Chevron, Statoil and Shell. They reject use of national resources for private profits

name: Barnawapara wildlife sanctuary, Chattisgarh, India
headline: Protest and struggle against the relocation plan and the use of violence and criminalization against local indigenous people.

name: Niobium mining project extraction in Raposa Serra do Sol, Roraima, Brazil
headline: Indigenous groups from Raposa Serra do Sol threatened by Jair Bolsonaro's and the world market's interest in niobium extraction.

name: Carondelet community against the oil palm company Palmeras del Pacfico, Ecuador
Gold mining in Paracatu, Minas Gerais, Brazil
Castle residential building in Stobnica, Poland
headline: The castle in Stobnica in the Natura 2000 area is a symbol of insufficient state capacity to protect nature. Using of legal loopholes, the investor avoided assessing the cumulative impact of this scaled-up residential (tourist?) project on the environment

name: Lead acid batteries recycling factory in Mombasa, Kenya
headline: A lead-acid battery recycling factory impacted human and environmental health in Mombasa, Kenya. For forcing its closure, Phyllis Omido won the Goldman Environmental Prize in 2015.

name: HIMA REDD projects in Zanzibar, Tanzania
Proyecto hidroeléctrico Corpus Christi, Argentina-Paraguay
headline: Conflict over the Corpus Christi dam in the Paraná river betwen Argentina and Paraguay. In Misiones (Argentina),  the project was rejected in 1996 and 2014 in two  social consultations driven by EJ movements.

name: PT Ledo Lestari (LL) conflict, Kalimantan, Indonesia
Na Pua Makani Wind Project, Hawaii, USA
headline: In pursuit of reaching  “100 percent renewable energy generation by 2045", the Na Pua Makani Project creates environmental injustice in Kahuku community that do not even get to use most of the clean energy that they are producing

name: Resistance against diamond mines, Sakha, Russia
headline: An environmental justice struggle since 1950 when diamonds were first extracted in the region, to 1990 protests, until present resistance. Sakha people defend their land, waters and traditional practices from destructive mining.

name: Lower Suktel Irrigation Project, Orissa, India
Open-pit coal mine, Kostenkovo, Russia
headline: People of the rural settlement came together, protested and questioned local authorities why their land has been handed to coal mining companies.

name: Millennium Challenge Account irrigation projects, Mali
Shell ignites new gas flare at Gbarantoru, Nigeria
Trans-Sibirskaya HPP, Russia
headline: NGOs and committees opposed the project and made alliance with scientists to denounce the impacts. The plant was scrapped and a National Park was established.

name: Adani Power Plant in Chhindwara, MP, India
Bayovar mining by Vale - Miski Mayo, Peru
headline: The project stated by Vale (with the name Miski-Mayo) is meant to reach exports of phosphates of 5 m tons per year, from  Sechura, Piura. It started in 2010.  Other shareholders have come into the project.

name: Cancer-related deaths due to air pollution in Dilovasi Industrial Zone, Turkey
Manso dam, Brazil
Creación del Área Reserva de Biosfera Visis Cabá, Chajul, Guatemala
headline: Indígenas Ixil rechazan la creación del Área Protegida Visis Cabá, temen ser despojados de sus tierras y no comprenden el por qué las prohibiciones para extraer recursos del bosque.

name: Climate litigation by Milieudefensie v.s. Shell, The Netherlands
headline: The Dutch environmental group Milieudefensie is suing the Royal Dutch Shell for failing to play its part in the fight against climate change, thereby breaching its duty of care under Dutch law and human rights obligations.

name: Tesoro Savage Oil Terminal, Washington State, United States
headline: Tesoro Savage was planned as the largest oil terminal in North America, but it was successfully prevented by the work of local activists, including Linda Garcia (a Goldman prize).

name: Sateri (Jiangxi) Chemical Fibre Co., Ltd., Viscose Plant, China
headline: Viscose plant causes heavy pollution of the air and nearby waters through untreated wastewater discharge, possibly linked to cancer in local residents.

name: Deep sea mining project Solwara 1 in the Bismarck Sea, Papua New Guinea
headline: The first deep-sea mining project at the international level was approved but failed before the extraction phase. The Solwara 1 project planned to mine mineral-rich hydrothermal vents in the Bismark Sea.

name: Yali Falls Hydropower Dam, Vietnam
La Colorada mining project, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: The expansion of La Colorada mine increases air and water pollution and risk of diseases. Families are forced under threats of violence to move to a colony built by the company.

name: Mining projects in Intag, Junin, Ecuador
headline: Community mobilization stops since 1991 the mining exploitation in the Intag Valley but the progress and threats continue. Environmental impacts on ecosystem, water and the community are already seen.

name: Cementos Progreso - San Juan Sacatepéquez, Guatemala
International airport and port near Mawlamyine, Myanmar
headline: Myanmar military seized 1872 hectares of land for the construction of an Airport and Port incurring alleged corruption and human right abuses. It was reported that people with ties to the military council were selling land near the project.

name: Waste transfer station in Jing'an District, Shanghai, China
headline: Residents protest against the largest planned underground waste transfer station in Jing'an District of Shanghai.

name: Haerwusu coal mine, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: Haerwusu coal mine, the largest open-pite coal mine in China, was accused of unlicensed land use. Its operations also faced challenges due to delay in land acquisition.

name: Severe Water Pollution by Meiko Electronics plant in Wuhan, China
headline: "Our generation will be drinking polluted water, but the next generation will be drinking poisoned water." - Wan Zhengyou, Nantaizi Lake fish farmer

name: Venezuela Refinery Explosion in Amuay, Venezuela
headline: A terrible explosion rocked the Amuay oil refinery in the state of Falcon in  Venezuela, killing tens of people in August, 2012.

name: Newtown Creek: Disproportionate Effects of Oil Spills on Communities In Brooklyn and Queens, New York, USA
headline: One of the most polluted waterways in the United States. Impacts of Greenpoint Oil Spill on Newtown Creek/Brooklyn, NY; and rise of environmental gentrification.

name: Four Major Rivers Restoration Project, South Korea
Gold Mining, Sudan
headline: There are more than 40,000 gold mining sites in Sudan. About 60 gold processing companies are operating in 13 states of the country.

name: Proyecto hidroeléctrico Rositas, Santa Cruz, Bolivia
headline: One Chinese backed  hydroelectric megaproject prioritized in Bolvia (a country seen as an energy hub for South America) was suspended in October 2018 because of local opposition and excessive costs.

name: Open-pit gold mine in Conglomerate Mesa, California, USA
headline: Friends of the Inyo together with a coalition of tribal representatives conservation groups, individuals, and  recreators have organized against the K2's Cyanide heap leach mining project in Conglomerate Mesa

name: Eastgate Air Cargo Facility , USA
headline: San Bernardino suffers high levels of pollution from the logistics industry which a proposed air cargo facility would make even worse. A local coalition is calling for a ‘community benefits agreement’ to ensure good jobs and protection from air pollution

name: Goa against Mormugao Port Trust coal projects, India
headline: Unprecedented public hearings by the people of Goa (82 hours over 8 days) against turning it into a coal corridor by systemic expansion of its Mormugao Port Trust and highway construction to import and transport coal.

name: Oil and gas spills by AGIP and ENI pipelines in Taylor Creek in Kalaba Community, Nigeria
headline: AGIP/ENI spills have been heavily affecting the Kalaba community's source of livelihood and potable water. They have to fight for the company taking responsibility and stopping the leaks, all the more for cleaning-up the environment and compensating them.

name: Pujada-Hallmark nickel mine on ancestral lands, Oriental Davao, Philippines
Coca Cola plant in Plachimada, Kerala, India
headline: Bottling plant shut down due to drought and pollution, after year-long people's protests and their wells being contaminated and dried up. What justice can be paid after such ecological disruption?

name: Woodside's Burrup gas hub threatens ancient aboriginal sacred art, Western Australia
headline: The Woodside-led Burrup Hub is a gigantic gas project with a humongous climate wreaking tag. It  also threatens to destroy the 50,000 year old rock art carrying aboriginal people's uninterrupted traditional culture in Murujuga.

name: Khibiny Mountains - Fyodorova Tundra platinum and palladium mining, Kola peninsula, Russia
headline: Another palladium and platinum development project is taking place on Sami lands without any consultations nor their consent.

name: Bulakati Airstrip lands (Lukaya Airfield), Uganda
headline: Residents living on the disused Bulakati Airstrip are protesting Uganda People’s Defence Force (UPDF) moves to repossess the land. A leader of residents’ struggle against eviction was murdered.An industrial park on part of the land has been proposed.

name: Río Tunjuelo, Bogotá, Colombia
Public Interest Litigation against Guizhou Qiangui Tianneng Coking Co. in Liupanshui, Guizhou, China
headline: In 2016, All-China Environment Federation (ACEF), an environmental NGO in China, filed a PIL against Tianeng Coking Co. on an air pollution responsibility dispute.

name: Tovlan Landfill serves illegal Israeli settlements at the expense of Palestinian communities, West Bank
headline: The Tovlan landfill which receives over 600,000 tons of solid waste from Israeli municipalities and illegal settlements contaminates air and poses health risks to Palestinian farming communities in the Jordan Valley.

name: Sugarcane plantation in Mabira Forest Reserve, Uganda
Serengeti National Park and its Highway, Tanzania
headline: The government proposed a 480 km tarmac road to connect Arusha to Musoma, passing through Serengeti National Park. The ANAW opposed it, the East African Court of Justice ruled against it in 2014.

name: Small-scale fisher people against contaminating industries in Valparaiso, Chile
headline: The ongoing contamination in the "Sacrifice Zone" of Quintero and Puchuncavi and the lack of measures against contamination and to protect environmental defenders led to the assassination of artisanal fisherman and fisher union leader Alejandro Castro.

name: Complaints against Holcim-Lafarge quarries and cement factories in France and Switzerland
headline: In the last years (2021, 2022, 2023) a series of actions of civil disobedience and boycotts have taken place in France and Switzerland against Holcim-Lafarge, the transnational cement firm.

name: Coal Power Plant Karlsruhe, Germany
headline: In different waves of activism, local NGOs, parties and citizen's initiatives in Karlsruhe have protested against the coal power plant and fossil fuels in general and continue their protest for climate justice until today.

name: Subernarekha Multipurpose project (Chandil Dam), Jharkhand, India
Oil exploration in the Galilea Forest (Tolima, Colombia)
headline: As a result of citizen mobilization, oil exploration was expelled from the Galilea Forest thanks to the declaration of a Regional Natural Park by the Tolima Environmental Authority.

name: Coastal fisher people disagree with government policies in favor of trawl fishing, Greece
headline: Coastal fishers' demand to "Save our seas" in Greece  engaging in repeated hunger strikes and demonstrations against trawlers

name: Elefsina Bay industrial activities, Greece
headline: In Elefsina city (Attica region) several industries are in operation. Environmental degradation is a major problem, as law enforcement is very low. Citizens commitees are struggling for respect of environmenal laws and a healthier environment

name: Mag-lev conflict in Shanghai, China
Gemini Solar Project, California, USA
headline: The planning and development of the largest mega solar project in the USA catalysed opposition from organisations such as environmental conservation, Native American, and union groups who wished to protect environmental and cultural resources.

name: Acaparamiento de agua de la empresa Bonafont del Grupo Danone, Puebla, Mexico
headline: El la zona del valle de Atlixco-Puebla, los pueblos se han unido para comenzar a defender el agua contra empresas embotelladoras.

name: Rotura de la presa de Aznalcollar, España
Mékin Hydroelectric Dam, Cameroon
headline: The Mékin Hydroelectric Dam is about to start producing energy in 2018, but there have been  floods. IUCN/UNESCO point to the construction as one of the threats to wildlife in the Dja Reserve.

name: Water crisis and privatization in Mexico City, Mexico
headline: In the capital of Mexico, poorly operating, privatized services and a lack of infrastructure investment created a highly unequal situation of water distribution. The most vulnerable in the city are exposed to frequent shortages and public health risks.

name: Quezon coal fired power plant in Atimonan, Philippines
headline: Protesters demand that governments and energy producers respect the fundamental right to breathe clean air.  Moreover, “coal-fired power plants speed up global warming,” the protesters said.

name: Protecting Tongpo sacred mountain from coal coking mill,  Qinghai province, China
headline: Qinghai Qinghua Coal Chemical coking plant was built at the foot of Mount Tongpo, a sacred mountain for local Mongols, despite resistance. Cultural values and livelihood are sacrificed. The company kept operating with environmental violations.

name: ProCana Sugar Plantation, Limpopo, Mozambique
Foxconn's pollutional activities in Taiyuan, Shanxi, China
headline: Residents of the Hengda Oasis community in Taiyuan, Shanxi are exposed to toxic gases emitted by the Foxconn factory, a manufacturer for global brands such as Apple. Their protest against the factory in 2011 included roadblocks.

name: Heavy Metal Pollution in Qujing, Yunnan, China
headline: Villagers found out about the toxic waste dumping along water bodies, blocked the company's trucks and forced authorities to act.

name: Minera San Martín de Grupo México, Sombrerete, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: In 2006 an eleven year long strike began in this mine  belonging to  Grupo México for recognition of the union's right to a collective agreement and  asking for  better security and  health conditions

name: Diavik Diamond mine by Rio Tinto and kimberlite waste issue, Northwest Territories, Canada
headline: The mine is placed on First Nations' territories, but now the proposal is to dump mine waste kimberlite and other tailings into their waters and land. The Environmental Board approved the project in January 2020.

name: Mount Coffee (Rehabilitation) Hydropower Project , Liberia
headline: After its abortive rehabilitation phase the renewed Mount Coffee Hydropower Project triggers violent protests against the failure in providing electricity to the local towns between the capital Monrovia and the plant.

name: PT South Pacific Viscose (SPV) Plant, Indonesia
headline: Despite gaining a high ranking on forest issues, investigations show that PT South Pacific Viscose might be linked to poisoning of villagers as well as air and water pollution.

name: Protest in Khagra Joydev coal block, Birbhum, West Bengal , India
headline: Conflicts over land, water and inadequate compensation in the Khagra Joydev coal block in Birbhum, West Bengal leading to violent altercation between police and locals.

name: Cement factory in Kendeng Karst Mountains, Indonesia
headline: Women have taken the lead in a grassroots campaign to save the Kendeng karst mountains in Central Java from environmental destruction brought upon by a new  cement factory in Indonesia.

name: New Suez Canal and Displacement, Egypt
Landfill of Chiaiano, Italy
headline: Waste struggles in Campania are not only against the landfill, but against the entire undemocratic and imposed waste management model

name: Pebble Mine in Bristol Bay Alaska, USA
headline: For over a decade, environmentalists and indigenous  local residents fought to protect the salmon runs of Bristol Bay from the proposed Pebble gold and copper mine.

name: STOP Gdansk LNG terminal, Poland
headline: The Polish government plans to build a new LNG terminal to diversify its fossil gas imports away from Russia. Local activist resist an infrastructure that would lock in decades of CO2 and methane emissions, and diverts funds from a just energy transition.

name: Brookhaven Landfill impacts on the North Bellport Community, NY, US
headline: Pollution from the Brookhaven Landfill has affected North Bellport for decades, and community members are calling for the landfill to be closed and remediated.

name: Protests in 1970 against ALCOA, Costa Rica
headline: In April 1970 university students successfully led civil society groups in the opposition to bauxite mining in Valle del General. Seen today as the fist manifestation of environmentalism in Costa Rica.

name: Gamella struggle against land grabbing, Maranhão, Brazil
headline: After decades of public inaction, the Akroá-Gamella community in 2013 decided to organize and occupy farms located on grabbed ancestral territory. While this allowed them to revive their indigenous identity, they also encountered threats and violence.

name: Tanker oil spill in the Bohai bay near Tianjin, China
headline: Collision of two vessels caused a massive oil spill in the Bohai sea leading to heavy pollution of the maritime ecological system. The following lawsuit served as a landmark for similar cases in China.

name: Lead mining and processing, Primorye, Russia
headline: People, workers and children are exposed, even today , to lead poisoning. The smelter was closed in 2006 when  blood lead levels were made public by international NGOs and local residents.

name: Harbor Station 5 Power Plant, Connecticut, USA
headline: Opening of Gas Fired Power Plant will Worsen Existing Air Quality Issue for Minority Community in Bridgeport, Connecticut: Lasting Effects of Former Coal Fired Plant to be Exacerbated

name: Rare Earth Mining of Chalco, Yulin, Guangxi, China
headline: Villagers protests against rare earth exploitation by Chalco Guangxi for fearing of pollution through soil and water.

name: Chevron-Texaco oil extraction and legal case, Ecuador
headline: Over 60 billion liters of toxic waste and 650,000 barrels of oil spilled in the Amazon forest; the company facing international trial and EJOs advocating for "Leave Oil in the Soil" and for abandoning extractivism

name: Envira Amazônia REDD+ project in Acre, Brazil
headline: Traditional communities became incorporated into new REDD+ carbon offset projects that left them with empty promises and severe restrictions of their livelihood while U.S. companies can buy 'emission credits' to continue polluting.

name: Línea de Alta Tensión y subestación eléctrica en Cuetzalan, Puebla, México
headline: Pueblos Masewal, Tutunakú y Mestizo en resistencia contra la subestación eléctrica de CFE, que viola derechos indígenas y genera violencia en la Sierra Norte de Puebla. Pueblos también en construcción de soberanías en su territorios.

name: Children poisoned by lead leaking from battery factories in Huaining, Anhui, China
headline: In 2010-2011, more than 100 children in Huaining County of Anhui Province were found to have excessive levels of lead in their blood. Two nearby battery factories were blamed as the source of lead poisoning.

name: Wildhorses and Burros versus government economic interests, Nevada, USA
headline: Should wild horses and burros be removed from federal land because they are are damaging it? Opponents claim the opposite and say that the BLM is motivated by economic profit making.

name: Upper Karnali hydroelectricity project, Nepal
Pollution of Begejac channel, Kula, Serbia
headline: The Begejac channel is heavily polluted due to discharge of untreated communal waste waters and makes life impossible for people of the town of Kula.

name: Sonargaon Economic Zone grabs villagers' farmlands, Bangladesh
headline: The legal challenge against land grabbing in six villages by an influential industrialist goes on.

name: Shenzhou Mining / Claver Mineral Development Corporation Nickel mining in Claver, Philippines
headline: Few royalties, few local jobs, but large environmental destruction: that’s what nickel company Shenzhou Mining Corporation brought to the indigenous communities of Claver, Surigao del Norte.

name: Yala Swamp, Large scale farming, Kenya
Gold mining in Montagne d'Or, French Guyana
headline: The Montagne d'Or mine is one of the largest open cast gold mine projects in the French Guiana and in the world. There is a strong dispute on this project, with President Macron in favour of it.

name: Chalillo Dam, Belize
headline: The first environmental case to be brought to the highest court of appeal of Belize: the 5 MW dam is a small project but brought about severe environmental damages in a "biogem" of Mesoamerica.

name: Miryang electricity transmission lines, South Korea
Lead poisoning by Zeliang Battery Manufacturer in Qingyuan, Guangdong, China
headline: Since 2008, 44 children living near Guangdong Zeliang Battery Manufacturer were detected with excessive blood lead levels. The company was temporarily suspended before reopening under another name.

name: Cerro de Pasco, Perú
Vidin air pollution, Bulgaria
Destruction of the sweetgum forests, Turkey
Anti-GMO Struggle, Portugal
headline: A Monsanto plantation in the Algarve region triggered protests against GMOs in Portugal, which finally stopped the project and declared an official GMO-free zone. However, in the rest of the country GMOs are still allowed.

name: Akosombo Hydroelectric Project, Ghana
headline: The biggest hydroelectricity project in West Africa  from the 1960s, for aluminum exports, created the Volta lake displacing 80,000 farmers to build a national idea of "development"

name: Unauthorized Condominium Complexes, Sri Lanka
headline: Court Case to safeguard the rights and well-being of the residents of Mount Lavinia who are affected by large scale unplanned, unauthorized and unlawful construction activities in the area and the negative impacts thereof.

name: CEAMSE y gestión de los residuos en Buenos Aires, Argentina
headline: Many conflicts over waste management in Buenos Aires since 1977. Contaminated neighbourhoods reject new waste disposal sites.

name: Co-incineration in Cimpor and Secil cement kilns, Portugal
headline: Air pollution and high rates of cancer found around cement plants burning waste for powering the industry. Protests in several places in portugal since the '90s

name: Osorno water crisis and anti-privatization struggle, Chile
headline: After being disconnected from water supply for ten days, the citizens of Osorno, Chile are demanding compensation and to end the concession to a private supplier.

name: Waste incineration plant in Yuhang district, Hangzhou, China
headline: Protests are met with violence and repression which led to allegedly three people dead. But Chinese civil society seems to become more and more aware about pollution and reclaim the streets.

name: Industrial wind energy project by Valeco in Péret-Bel-Air and Davignac, France
headline: Between Péret-Bel-Air and Davignac (Corrèze, France), the multinational group Valeco promotes one more industrial wind turbine project which triggers a new wave of local and regional protests.

name: ZAD at Notre-Dame-des-Landes, Aeroport du Grand Ouest, France
headline: A Zone to Defend, the controversial airport project in Western France became a symbol of resistance and alternative proposals. On 17 January 2018 the French government gave up, the Zadistes won.

name: Gold mining in the Ulindi River by Kun Hou Mining, Shabunda, RDC
headline: Numerous corruption scancals between different state agencies and collusion of interests between Kun Hou Mining with the rebel group Raia Mutomboki in the exploitation of gold in Ulindi river's banks.

name: Lithium mining in Salar del Hombre Muerto, Argentina
headline: The SHM is one of the largest lithium mines in the world. Since the beginning of the exploitation, in 1997, the scarcity of water and the mobilization of communities have increased. Currently, there are more than 8 companies

name: Seed Privatization, Ghana
headline: Students and trade unions join farmers to oppose a restrictive seed law

name: Hassi R'Mel gas field, Algeria
headline: Workers and unemployed youth have been largely unsatisfied with the working conditions and practices of Sonatrach in Hassi R'Mel.

name: MIDROC Gold Mine, Lege Dembi, Ethiopia
headline: Demonstrators protested again in Oromia region in April 2018 against the government’s renewal of the license for this Saudi-owned mine jeopardizing local residents’ health. Several protestors were killed.

name: Basuro de Navarro, Cali, Colombia
“Nuclear Colonialism”  (US atomic bomb tests in Bikini and Enewetak Atolls), Marshall Islands
headline: Sixty years after the last nuclear weapons tests in the Marshall Islands, their legacy reverberates in the form of health problems and people living in exile due to the radioactive contamination of their islands.

name: Amritsar- Delhi-Kolkata Industrial Corridor, India
headline: ADKIC set to grab land, land use changes, loss of livelihood, unemployment, and larger resource grab from commons. Growing inequality and distress as per the corporate agenda. Blooming threat to democratic rights of people in states covered by ADKIC.

name: Octopus traps endanger whales in False Bay, South Africa
headline: In 1998, South African Sensational Seafoods (Sasen) was awarded an exploratory octopus fishing permit. However, the company's traps were involved in the deaths of numerous whales. Activists and the City of Cape Town mobilized to temporarily suspend it.

name: Msunduzi New England Road Landfill and Construction of a Materials Recovery Facility, South Africa
headline: For over 10 years,  Pietermaritzburg waste pickers   struggled for access to the Msunduzi New England Road confronting abusive security guards and city officials refusing to build a materials recovery facility.

name: Nam Ngum 2 dam displaced over 6,000 ethnic minorities in Vientiane, Lao PDR
headline: An award-winning dam for sustainable energy production? Over 6,000 ethnic minorities were displaced to construct the Nam Ngum 2 hydroelectric power plant

name: Oil Vessel Explosion, Nigeria
Proyecto de Tierras Raras en Ciudad Real
headline: Vecinos y organizaciones detienen el proyecto de explotación de tierras raras por su impacto en áreas protegidas, corredores ecológicos y diversas especies protegidas, así como actividades agrícolas de la zona.

name: Water conflict: Nestlé Waters in Vittel, France
headline: Nestlé’s overexploitation of Vittel’s water supply raises questions on ethics and morality vs. corporation profit. A civil society organization is seeking to stop this.

name: Las luchas contra el mega-proyecto del Arco Minero del Orinoco, Venezuela
headline: The national government is promoting a mega-mining project unprecedented in the history of Venezuela. The socio-environmental, economic and cultural impacts would be enormous. An interesting campaign is growing in the country.

name: Al Rajhi / TADCO of Saudi Arabia Purchases Land in Boghe, Brakna, Mauritania
MOSE project in Venetian Lagoon, Italy
Indigenous tribe battle Crow Butte Uranium Mine, Nebraska, USA
headline: The Oglala Sioux Tribe are against extension of the  mine's licence because the in-situ leach mine would pollute the nearby White Lake, and damage the glacial aquifers from which water is extracted for the mines operation.

name: Logging of natural forests in Dege and Baiyu County, Sichuan, China
headline: Villagers protest rampant logging activities and timber extraction in Sichuan's Dege county as part of the "Tibet Herdmen's Resettlement Plan". Eventually villagers occupied the loggers camp and prevented further extraction.

name: Electric crematorium at Siliguri, West Bengal, India
Hassad Food Landgrabs for Sheep and Wheat, Australia
Road widening at Vilcabamba River and recognition of rights of nature, Ecuador
headline: A 2011 ruling by a provincial court in Ecuador recognizing the Vilcabamba River's rights were violated by road construction became the first legal ruling in favour of Rights of Nature in the world.

name: Carretera Mulaló-Loboguerrero en el Valle, Colombia
Triangulo del Feldespato y minería a cielo abierto en Ávila, Spain
headline: Las Sierras y Valles abulenses, después de décadas de exclusión social, económica, territorial y política, se convierten en una nueva frontera del  extractivismo minero.

name: Ärna Airport, Uppsala, Sweden
headline: Ärna Airport in Uppsala was inaugurated as a military airport in 1943. In 2008 was planned to expand the military airport to become a civil airport. Four parties in the municipality and EJOs are against the project.

name: Aimorés Hydroelectric Power Plant, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: Communities in Aimorés were still demanding compensation for the construction of Aliança's hydroelectric plant (controlled by Vale), when the tailing dams failure of Samarco (also controlled by Vale) destroyed the river impacted by the hydroelectric dam.

name: Radioactive mine waste pollution at Tudor Shaft informal settlement, Krugersdorp, South Africa
headline: Residents of Tudor Shaft, an informal settlement on top of an abandoned mine waste dump, have suffered from social, health, and environmental consequences for decades. Efforts to relocate the residents have been slow and controversial.

name: Unsanitary landfill Vrtijeljka, Montenegro
headline: Due to protest by the local residents, the authorities closed the unsanitary landfill Vrtijeljka and promised the full rehabilitation of the site.

name: Parque Eólico PIER de Iberdrola en Puebla, México
headline: Comunidades del valle de Tehuacán (Puebla) en México denuncian los impactos e irregularidades de la construcción de parques eólicos de la empresa Iberdrola.

name: Oka Crisis, Quebec, Canada
Urban waste incinerator of Acerra, Italy
headline: A lead struggle in Italy against waste management model which destroys life, environment, democracy

name: Hydro Development in Northern Manitoba, Canada
headline: Massive historical and ongoing hydro development in Northern Manitoba has led to ecological and social devastation in Cree territories. Benefits are accruing to southern Manitobans while the costs are being born by the Cree communities in the north.

name: Waste dump, Gameleiro in Olho Dagua das Flores, Brazil
TIPNIS, Bolivia
headline: Road construction in the TIPNIS National Park Bolivia, for oil exploration and coca plantations.  Indigenous peoples against the project.

name: Karuturi Global plants Sugar and Other Crops in Gambela, Ethiopia
Vistula spit canal, Poland
headline: Poland will dig a waterway across a narrow strip of land that separates its eastern coastline from Baltic Sea with great damage to wildlife and disregarding reasons from the EU  and internal opposition.

name: Cabinda Gulf oil&gas exploitation, Angola
headline: In June 2002  Angola  imposed a fine for causing environmental damage  on Chevron operating in waters of Cabinda Gulf because  spill from poorly maintained pipes, polluted beaches and forced fishermen to stop work. Chevron has denied any responsibility.

name: Bissa-Bouly Gold Mine, Burkina Faso
headline: Dispossessed populations feel duped by gold mining companies and begin to raise their voices alongside a wider social justice movement in Burkina Faso.

name: Another resource curse? Black Granite from Mutoko, Zimbabwe
headline: Granite rock has been mined by foreign companies, a curse more than a blessing. Resistance led by Dolorosa Mubvumbi of Budja Environmental Conservation Trust.

name: Waste management at Uruli Devachi in Pune, MH, India
headline: Residents of Uruli Devachi and Phursungi have been constantly protesting the landfill in their area and especially its ill-management, resorting in 2017 to a blockade to incoming trucks .

name: Exploración petrolera en Pozo exploratorio Lorito 1, río Humadea en Meta, Colombia
Yawal Wildlife Sanctuary, Maharastra, India
headline: Struggle for forest use resource rights and positive example of forest community management approach with the indigenous community of Yawal.

name: Resistance to fracking in Chihuahua, Mexico
Acueducto II: agravante del conflicto hídrico en Querétaro, México
headline: El Acueducto II, Querétaro, es una obra de infraestructura hídrica de trasvase, que ha generado más problemas por la distribución del agua potable en el valle de Querétaro, lejos de aportar una solución al estrés hídrico de la zona

name: Large-scale Mining in South Gobi Desert, Mongolia
headline: Mining threatened snow leopard and local nomadic tribe populations in the Tost Mountains before Bayarjargal Agvaantseren organized legal action to declare the region as a State Nature Reserve, revoking all mining licenses in the area.

name: Riverside Park, Detroit MI, USA
Bourj Hammoud Garbage Mountain, Lebanon
headline: The Bourj Hammoud Landfill, which started as an uncontrolled dumpsite during the Lebanese Civil War, persists to this day without rehabilitation, spreading its smells and harmful effects over tens of thousands of citizens and non-citizens living nearby.

name: Suai Supply Base and airport as a part of Tasi Mane Project (TMP), Timor-Leste
headline: Suai Supply Base and Suai Airport are the first components of a planned oil infrastructure corridor. The Environmental Impact Assessment was inadequate and many people who lost their homes and farming livelihoods for the project have not been compensated.

name: San Roque Multipurpose Project, Philippines
headline: The largest dam in the country left thousands of farmers without land and irrigation and brought violence and extrajudiciary killings. Read here the story of the project and courageus defenders like Apo Jose

name: Save Alappad, Stop Sand Mining, Kerala, India
headline: Save Alappad, Stop Mining is a protest by the people of Alappad fighting against the decades-long mining practices of two public sector companies mining sand for ilmenite, rutile, zircon, monazite (rare earths)....

name: Gidderbaha thermal power project, Punjab, India
Murder of Yolanda Maturana and illegal mining in Pueblo Rico, Risaralda, Colombia
headline: Yolanda Maturana was an environmental activist protecting local wildlife and ecosystems from illegal mining in afro-indigenous land. She was murdered for her activism on February 2, 2018.

name: Mambilla Hydropower Station Project funded by Chinese lenders, Nigeria
headline: The four-dam hydro plant is the largest in the country and known as the African Three Gorges Dam. It will displace more than 100,000 people. International organizations fear increase in corruption

name: Puerto Brisa S.A., Colombia
Anti-mining protests and controversies around the “Law with the Long Name”, Mongolia
headline: The rise of the Mongolian mining sector, driven by international capital but facilitated by the government, has led to continuous protests to defend citizens rights during the last decade.

name: Shwe gas field and pipeline, Myanmar
headline: Criminalisation and repression of activists in Myanmar campaigning against the Shwe gas and oil pipeline to China.

name: Desplazamiento forzado por la conservación de áreas protegidas: Comunidad de Laguna Larga. Reserva de la Biosfera Maya, Guatemala
headline: Viviendas incendiadas, cultivos de subsistencia arrasados, instalación de puesto militar en lo que solía ser la escuela infantil y desplazamiento de 450 personas fue el saldo del operativo militar ejecutado por el Ejército, la Policía Nacional y el CONAP.

name: Massive Oil Spill at Ilaje Communities, Nigeria
PRODESIS Project in Chiapas, Mexico
headline: EU and Mexican governments' suspicious goals in the PRODESIS project: the dictame under the bilateral free trade agreement opposed by local communities and organizations

name: Community Resistance to Archer Solar Project and Sand Bluff Solar Project in Florida, USA
headline: Two solar projects were proposed in Historically African American neighborhoods in Archer, Florida in 2020 and 2021. Both projects were cancelled after organized resistance from residents on racial justice grounds.

name: Violent protests against planned paraxylene (PX) plant in Maoming, Guangdong, China
headline: Industrial conflicts and pollution while the local government allegedly seeks a balance between "development and stability"

name: Plogoff nuclear power plant, Britanny, France
headline: Tough blockades in a small fisherfolk village prevent the opening of nuclear plant; the French state was confronted by its citizens in one of the best known successes in environmental struggles in France.

name: Collum Coal Mine, Zambia
headline: Working class environmentalism by Zambian coal miners meets with violence to protect the activity of a Chinese company

name: Wastepickers against pollution and public policy in Federal District, Brazil
headline: The Federal District Government and World Bank-backed project “Sustainable Brasilia” caused stir among the families of Cidade Estrutural, the second most populated favela of Brasil’s Federal District

name: Palawan Oil Palm Plantations and Land Grabbing , Philippines
headline: In the island of Palawan, oil palm plantations displace  indigenous people who lose their livelihood. This in a Biosphere Reserve.  Local support from Catholic Church.

name: Red Dog mine toxic tailings to Kotzebue and Kivalina, Alaska, USA
headline: Red Dog Mine belonging to the Teck corporation  released millions of pounds of toxic chemicals, and residents in native villages of Kotzeube and Kivalina have been contaminated.

name: Expansion of cattle industry of Agropecuária Santa Bárbara Xinguara  in Pará, Brazil
headline: Around 500.000  acquired legally and illegally by Agro Santa Barbara to increase cattle production.  The land occupation by landless peasants provoked several episodes of violence in Pará.

name: Landázuri, Santander, Colombia
Coal Ash Deposits in Peñuelas, Puerto Rico
headline: Applied Energy Systems (AES), an electrical energy production company, is producing large amounts of toxic coal ashes. People complain and demonstrate.

name: Laiban Dam - New Centennial Water Source Project (NCWS), Quezon, Philippines
headline: Since more than 30 years, thousands of indigenous, threatened to be displaced from their ancestral lands, are resisting the Laiban dam project, planned to solve a corporate water crisis created by urban Metro Manila

name: Plomin Power Station Unit C, Croatia
headline: National and international NGOs and local citizens said NO to construction of the new coal power plant Plomin C and demanded from the Croatian Government to invest in renewable energy sources instead.

name: Plutonium Production at Hanford near Native American Reservations, USA
Genesis Landfill Privatization by Averda in Johannesburg, South Africa
headline: In June 2018, waste pickers at Genesis landfill were attacked by the Red Ants, a private security company. This follows the Averda company's privatization of the landfill and its campaign to evict local waste pickers

name: Cancellation of Landfill in FujimaeTidal Flat, Aichi, Japan
headline: A plan to fill 105 ha of Fujimae tidal flat for the construction of a landfill in Nagoya City was cancelled after resistances from an expanded "Sympathy" circle protecting  the habitat of migratory birds.

name: Zortman-Landusky Gold Mine, Montana, USA
Land conflict from tourism development in East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia
headline: In 2018, a man from Patiala Bawa village and againsts the hotel/resort project was shot down and died during protests on the land-marking activity in West Sumba, Indonesia.

name: Cotui contra Pueblo Viejo/Barrick Gold, Dominican Republic
Sokli Mine, Finland
headline: The Sokli mining project includes rare earth elements manganese, vermiculite, niobium and copper. Some of its potential environmental effects are river pollution, disruption of reindeer herds, and significant carbon emissions.

name: Dismantling the “planta asfaltica” and building the Ateneo Popular, Nou Barris, Barcelona, Spain
headline: The Ateneu Nou Barris occupied the space of a former asphalt plant (owned by the City Council)  dismantled in 1977 by direct action by neighbours carryng banners: “Save our lungs - Get the asphaltic plant out”.

name: Linden trees in Nikšić, Montenegro
Guadalito y Chiquita against oil palm companies, Ecuador
Kali Gandaki Hydroelectric Project A, Nepal
Illegal rosewood logging in the Cardamom Mountains and killing of forest activist Chut Wutty, Cambodia
Gold mining San Andres in Copan, Honduras
Waste incinerator, Bielsko-Biała, Silesia, Poland
headline: The authorities of Bielsko-Biała insist that the incinerator on the outskirts of the city is a key element of regional closed-loop waste management. Admittedly, public consultations do take place, but not with the inhabitants of the surrounding communes.

name: Nuclear Testing in Newe Segobia, Western Shoshone Lands, Nevada, US
headline: The United States tested nuclear weapons on the traditional homelands of the Western Shoshone from 1951 to 1992. Nuclear weapons testing is particularly destructive because of the resulting proliferation of nuclear fallout.

name: Transport Corridor Vc - LOT 3, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Lhara Village's community stopped a gold mine project,Tibet, China
headline: In the Spring 2009, the community of Lhara Village began a very strong protest to protect an holy mountain, against a gold mine project by Chinese mining firm, Zhongkai Co. After months of standoff  both sides agreed that the mine would cease operations.

name: Megaproyectos solares en Carmen y Afectación a Área Natural Protegida, Campeche, México
headline: La possible instalación de 4 proyectos solares en la zona de influencia del Área de Protección de Flora y Fauna “Laguna de Términos amenaza la riqueza biocultural y los ecosistemas sensibles de esta región.

name: Illegal disposal of dead pigs in Huzhou, Zhejiang, China
headline: Villagers near illegal burial site for dead pigs in Huzhou, Zhejiang had complained for years of a terrible stench around their homes and it has been heard only until a nationwide environmental clean-up campaign.

name: Water privatization conflict in Stockton, CA, USA
headline: Stockton's water wars end with victory for publicly owned water

name: Comunidad indígena de Santo Tomás vs. Agrícola Superior de Jacona, Michoacán, Mexico
headline: The indigenous community Santo Tomás affected by intensive strawberry and blueberry production for export, blames the firm Agrícola Superior de Jacona for pollution, waste and exploitation.

name: Opencast coal mine in Douglas Valley, Scotland, UK
Pre-Harvest Sugarcane Burning in western Palm Beach County, Florida, USA
headline: The outdated practice of pre-harvest sugarcane burning in Florida compromises the health and safety of local communities and the environment in Palm Beach County and the Everglades Agricultural Area.

name: Cananea mine, Mexico
Coal mining in Arctic's natural reserve, Taymyr, Russia
headline: The coal mine is illegal according to local activists. The company continues with the extraction activities, mainly for export to India, putting one of the world's biggest natural reserve under threat.

name: Love Canal dump site at Niagara Falls, USA
headline: One of the best known cases of environmental injustice in the US: houses and schools built upon a dump site and heavy incidence of diseases and respiratory illnesses take residents to reclaim justice

name: Kattupalli port expansion, Chennai, India
headline: Locals protest against the Kattupalli Port expansion by Adani in Tamil Nadu which would severely destroy land, livelihoods and traditions of the region, were finally successful.

name: Collapse of wastewater treatment poses a threat to lives and livelihoods, Yemen
headline: The destruction of a critical wastewater treatment facilities, coupled with a devastating blockade, has risked the lives of millions.

name: Línea 12 del Metro de Ciudad de México, México
headline: En 2007 se presenta el proyecto de la Línea 12 del metro, como parte de un proyecto de urbanización de la delegación de Tláhuac en el Distrito Federal; ejidatarios fueron despojados de sus terrenos. En mayo 2021, decenas de personas perdieron la vida.

name: Heinda tin mine, Dawei, Myanmar
headline: While affected villagers lost the legal battle against one of the oldest tin mines in the country due to ‘procedural issues’, the controversies around the case have contributed to increased awareness and stricter mining supervision in Tanintharyi region.

name: Concesiones a CEMEX amenazan Parque Nacional Chagres, Panamá
headline: El gobierno de Panamá otorgó cuatro licencias mineras a la empresa CEMEX afectando así al Parque Nacional Chagres y amenazando la principal fuente de agua potable para 1,600,000 panameños

name: Iron sand mining in Watu Pecak Beach, Indonesia
headline: Envrionmental activist killed for protesting against the iron sand mining in the coast of Selok Awar-Awar Village, Lumajang Regency, East Java. This is the first case of an environmental activist being murdered in East Java.

name: Lenya National Park (proposed) on Karen indigenous lands, Tanintharyi region, Myanmar
headline: The planned Lenya National Park threatens Karen communities and internally displaced people, civil society groups say. Biodiversity conservation must be based on indigenous practices.

name: Bauxite mining and deforestation in Oriximina (Para), Brazil
headline: Quilombola communities fighting against logging and mining to defend the integrity of their territories in Pará, Brazil

name: Privatización de playas y criminalización de activistas indígenas en la Sierra Sur de  Oaxaca, México
headline: El Comité de Defensa de los Pueblos Indígenas (CODEDI) de Huatulco sufre criminalización, hostigamiento y asesinato de algunos de sus integrantes.

name: Tarbela Dam, Pakistan
Hydroelectric projects on Vrbas River, BiH
headline: The biggest successful environmental campaign in Bosnia and Herzegovina to date. Started in late 2004 and was active until late 2005, when campaign was backed up by local parliament decision.

name: Novatek's two gas fields in Yamalsky nature reserve, Yamal, Russia
headline: Novatek obtained Arkticheskoye and Neytinskoye field for exploration which are a protected Arctic tundra and Indigenous lands. Chemical processing is part of the bigger project on the peninsula, including the Ob river case.

name: Liquefied Natural Gas Project, Papua New Guinea
headline: Landowners decry ExxonMobil's PNG LNG botched promises to share benefits leading to violent protests. In 2022, TotalEnergies' Papua LNG is set to repeat the mantra: benefits for multinationals and national elites, and impacts for local communities.

name: Pueblos indígenas arawaks del sur afectados por minería ilegal en la cuenca del río Atabapo, Venezuela
headline: South Arawaks suffer from illegal mining and mercury pollution in a hot frontier zone disputed by armed groups, miners, smuggling networks and military forces. They are supported by some Amazonian organizations.

name: Merowe Dam, Sudan
headline: A huge plant on the Nile river for massive energy generation and a criminal complaint against Lahmeyer International for corruption. Read the story of the largest dam in North Sudan

name: San Roque Metals Inc. Nickel mining in Tubay, Agusan del Norte, Philippines
headline: Environmental destruction, militarization and arbitrary bombings: the ‘new’ modus operandi of how some mining companies establish large-scale operations in the Philippines.

name: Violent protests over development of the Pubugou Dam, China
Land and resource use conflicts on the Island of Karimunjawa, Indonesia
Jasodharpur Industrial Area, Uttarakhand, India
Excessive forest logging, Lithuania
headline: In mid-2018 a so-called Peasant and Green government approves high logging rates in the next 5 years to the benefit of IKEA and other commercial interest. A civil society movement arises against this decision, including a famous film-maker.

name: Aeropuerto internacional de Santa Lucía, México
headline: Pueblos originarios de la cuenca de México en contra del aeropuerto internacional de Santa Lucía

name: Cava Campo Galeota
headline: El fuego del Cava Campo Galeota y la acción del Comité de Salud Pública de Tufino.

name: Ecological Reserve Cayapas Mataje (REMACAM), Ecuador
Dam in the Bergantes River, Teruel, Spain
Lignite mining Garzweiler I, Germany
Minería de oro en San Juan de la Maguana, República Dominicana
headline: Los ambientalistas, los agricultores y la iglesia católica local se oponen a los planes de extracción de oro y cobre de GoldQuest, un proyecto fuertemente respaldado por la embajada de Canadá.

name: Hanyang Guodingshan Incinerator in Wuhan, China
headline: Residents complained about the location and harmful gases, which can lead to secondary pollution; they are also concerned about the air and water pollution

name: Expansion of intensive aquaculture in Ria de Arousa, Spain
headline: In 2015, the Xunta de Galicia enacted a new  legislation aiming to expand aquaculture. However,  strong mobilization and demonstrations of the Galician fishing and seafood sector, managed to stop this legislation.

name: Asbestos factory Muzaffarpur, BH, India
headline: Asbestos factory forced to stop construction thanks to school children mobilization

name: Strict property and marketing laws imposed on seeds in France
headline: French farmers stop seed law that would brand farm-saved seed as ‘counterfeit’.

name: Kurram Tangi Dam, Pakistan
headline: Presented as development aid for the agricultural sector and for electricity generation, the dam is being completed with USAID and Italian government cooperation funds. Tribal communities denounce irreversible impacts on their culture and territory

name: Industrial Wastes in Bou Ismail, Algeria
headline: Since 2005, Bou Ismail has been suffering from the consequences of industrial waste water discharge from the nearby industrial zone.

name: The Gibraltar-San Roque refinery, Spain
headline: The largest refinery in the Iberian Peninsula, with a crude oil daily processing capacity of 240,000 barrels per day, is a source of environmental and health issues regularly reported to the relevant European Union institutions.

name: Visakhapatnam Port, India
King Mswati III International Airport, Swaziland
headline: Residents demanding compensation for damage to their houses caused by blasting works for construction of King Mswati III International Airport, and the road serving the airport, have held repeated protests and blocked trucks from entering the quarry

name: Eviction of Roma and electricity cut-off, Cañada Real Galiana, Madrid, Spain
headline: Families from Cañada Real, close to Valdemingomez landfill and incinerator, wait for relocation after house demolition. Electricity was cut-off in the midst of a winter storm.

name: Hpa-An coal plant, Karen state, Myanmar
headline: A project for a coal plant was proposed in a war-ravaged area in Eastern Myanmar. The project has been temporarily suspended by the central government due to the local rejection but the local government is still supporting it.

name: Extracción total de hidrocarburos | Temperatura roja
headline: Veinte años de explotación de basilicata: cuando el aceite, aunque de mala calidad, es más importante que la salud y los ciudadanos

name: Tunnel through the Gorica Hill, Podgorica, Montenegro
headline: The NGOs managed to stop the idea of building a tunnel through the Gorica Hill. However, another conflict is emerging with the idea for commercial exploitation of the park forest through adventure tourism.

name: Sudecors’ corporate logging activities and illegal logging in Mindanao, Philippines
headline: Legal and illegal logging, environmental destruction, attacks and extrajudicial killings: Social tensions increase over the use of natural resources within Sudecor’s forest concession.

name: Minería en Tambogrande, Perú
Marange diamond mines pollute rivers, Zimbabwe
Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary, a struggle to save green belt of Pune city, India
headline: Citizens of Pune came together to save the Salim Ali Bird sanctuary from the construction of road and metro passing through it.  Many trees were cut down. The sanctuary is already damaged as a dump site.

name: Opposition to  Small Modular Reactor (SMR) nuclear  development, Canada
headline: Opposition to Small Modular Reactor (SMR) technology increases from environmental associations, NGOs, women in leadership roles and political parties as the government continues to fund SMR research and development.

name: Acueducto La Joya para el megaproyecto “Conjunto Estadio Azteca”, México
headline: Vecinos de las alcadías de Tlalpan y Coyoacán se oponen a las obras de acueducto para abastecer en agua al proyecto Conjunto Estadio Azteca (CEA) relacionado con el mundial de futbol del 2026.

name: Eni Company's 'Food Plus Biodiesel' Palm Oil project in Niari, Congo
Embalse La Punilla, Ñuble, Chile
headline: Forced displacement and destruction of homes of neighbors for acquisition of land with no resettlement plan, in the name of allegedly improvement in agriculture and water provision for farmers

name: Oil refinery in Hoima district and evictions, Uganda
Danger of extinction of endemic pearl mullets in Van Lake, Turkey
Combatting deforestation in Palawan, Philippines
headline: Illegal deforestation leads to murders of forest protectors in 2017 and to calls for the "militarization of conservation". The EJO Kalikasan disputes this view.

name: Jispa Hydroelectricity Project, HP, India
headline: Village communities in Lahaul-Spiti join hands in rejecting the proposed HEP. The state government shifted its location but its opponents do not give up and also start a discussion on what local sustainable development they want

name: Hurricane Sandy and Low Income Residents, USA
Popular and institutional opposition to the Serra Morena and La Maçana 100 MW wind farms in l'Anoia, Spain
headline: In central Catalonia, the announcement of 36 macro-projects has sparked much debate. The Serra Morena and La Maçana wind farms are two of these initiatives. Although their future is currently uncertain, they propose the construction of 19 wind turbines.

name: Long Teran Kanan communities against palm oil expansion,  Sarawak, Malaysia
headline: After 20 years of struggle, indigenous communities in Tinjar have not yet reached  justice against the palm oil company IOI Pelita.

name: Pipeline Eastern Siberia - Pacific Ocean and Baikal lake, Russia
Contaminación por producción de cal en Nobsa, Colombia
headline: Establecimiento de transnacionales, productores artesanales y falta de aplicación de la normatividad ambiental; así han aumentado los niveles de contaminación haciendo que esta sea considerada como la zona con mayor contaminación del aire de Colombia.

name: Incinerator in Son Reus, Mallorca, Spain
Exploracion de oro y otros minerales en Quindio, Colombia
Gerze coal-fired Thermal Power Plant, Turkey
Exploración petrolera en el alto Ariari, Meta, Colombia
Quevedo-Vinces multi-purpose project, Ecuador
Bauxite mining in Juruti, Para, Brazil
Silvertown Tunnel, London, UK
headline: A new road tunnel underneath the river Thames is being constructed between Greenwich and Silvertown. The proposed route starts in Newham, a London borough with high proportion of ethnic minorities and the worst pollution levels in the whole UK.

name: Thermal Power Plant Tuzla, Bosnia and Herzegovina
headline: Thermal Power Plant Tuzla represents a serious threat to lives of the local people of Tuzla canton because it is unwilling to implement environmental measures but it has been expanding its capacities.

name: Loma de La Lata y Vaca Muerta en Neuquen, Argentina
headline: In Loma de la Lata and Loma Campana (Vaca Muerta) there have been conflicts over twenty years first with YPF, Repsol, Petrobras  and then with Chevron, other companies, and local and regional authorites on oil and gas extraction, and fracking.

name: Abandoned uranium mines, Portugal
headline: Uranium mined in Portugal since 1913 leaves a legacy of diseases, radioactivity and environmental contamination. Struggles and reclamations continue til today

name: Hydraulic fracking in the Karoo, South Africa
Toroku mine, arsenic pollution, Miyazaki prefecture, Japan
headline: In the mountain hamlet of Toroku, Miyazaki prefecture,  there was arsenic pollution for many decades.  After years of complaints and a court case, those plaintiffs who were still alive got a small compensation agreement in 1990.

name: Water contamination and environmental liabilities from chemical companies, Woburn (Mass), USA
headline: A  Superfund (CERCLA) case involving Grace and other chemical companies which polluted drinking water. Reported as the nation’s most expensive toxic cleanup, with cost well over USD 68 million.

name: Paramo Rabanal, Colombia
Nickel Mine in Loma de Hierro, Venezuela
headline: The nickel mine exploited by Anglo American was taken over by Venezuela in 2012. There are environmental liabilities.

name: Companhia Brasileira de Alumínio (CBA) in Miradouro, Serra do Brigadeiro, MG, Brazil
headline: Miradouro and other municipalities in  Serra do Brigadeiro resist against extraction of bauxite deposits by CBA, a company belonging to the Votorantim Group.

name: Chlordecone poisoning by the banana industry in the French West Indies, Martinique and Guadeloupe
headline: Almost all citizens from Guadeloupe and Martinique are contaminated by Chlordecone, a toxic pesticide used from 1972 to 1993 in the banana plantations. Today people are still asking for justice.

name: Nakthan Hydroelectricity Project, HP, India
headline: Communities have experienced the ecological drawbacks of  the downstream Parbati II project and decided to oppose 520 MW Nakthan. They want to act as guardians of local forests and the spiritually revered Rudernag waterfall

name: Minería Ilegal Farallones de Cali, Colombia
headline: En un area de grande biodiversidad, la minería ilegal de oro amenaza a especies y fuentes de sobrevivencia de su población.

name: Defending forests, risking death in San Juan Atzingo, Mexico
headline: Aldo Zamora was killed by "talamontes" in 2007. His father, Ildefonso Zamora, an indigenous leader who stood up to illegal loggers for decades, was arbitrarily imprisoned in November 2015 for nine months.

name: Trans-Pyrenean Central Corridor, Spain - France
Coal power plants in Ban Krut and Bo Nok,  Prachuab Khirikhan, Thailand
headline: Jintana Kaewkao mobilized against two proposed CFPP in Prachuab Khirikhan. Her colleague  Charoen Wataksorn was killed. Collective pressure and legal action led to successfully blocking their construction.

name: Lorena, Santa Cruz, Costa Rica
headline: Los vecinos de la comunidad de Lorena recriminan a los Diputados el favorecer los intereses de los desarrolladores turísticos, que quieren llevarse el agua del acuífero Nimboyores.

name: Kanpur (Panki) coal-fired power plant, Uttar Pradesh, India
headline: India's air pollution problem extends far beyond Delhi. The industrial hub of Kanpur, home to 3 million people, is perhaps the worst place, aggravated by coal fired power plants.

name: Mina Escondida en el Salar de Punta Negra,  Chile
headline: La extracción de agua en el Salar de Punta Negra para abastecer a la mina Escondida de BHP Billiton ha provocados severos impactos en el salar y movilizaciones locales para parar la extracción y pedir medidas de reparación.

name: Øyfjellet Wind Farm, Norway
headline: Øyfjellet Wind Farm disrupting Saami livelihood in Norway. The wind farm is a 400MW  power generation facility.

name: Ashaninka people against dams, Peru
EU Fishing activities, Madagascar
Cervecera Constellation Brands, Mexicali, Baja California, Mexico
headline: Complaints from residents of Mexicali against the US company Constellation Brands in order to stop building of a brewery, because of impacts on availability and human right to water in the region.

name: Karo Airstrip, Kenya
headline: Plans for a new airport in Mandera have met with opposition from residents since 2013. A number of project sites have been proposed, the most recent  would restrict access to a water catchment area that pastoralists depend upon to sustain livestock

name: LNG Shannon terminal, Ireland
headline: The Shannon LNG terminal aims to facilitate the import of gas to Ireland, the UK and the rest of Europe. Opponents argue that building new fossil fuel infrastructure is not in line with COP21 commitments and directly pushes Europe into a carbon lock-in.

name: Mega puerto de Chancay, Peru
headline: The Chancay Multipurpose Port Terminal is the largest Chinese port investment in Latin America. It is part of the Belt and Road Initiative, also called the New Silk Road, one of the largest commercial projects in China.

name: San Glorio Ski Complex, Spain
Aranmula greenfield Airport (AGA) project, Kerala, India
headline: In 2016, the Aranmula airport was scrapped after local villagers as well as representatives from the temple protested against it, and the project was unable to get environmental clearances even after multiple tries.

name: Valle de Lurín contra constructoras, Lima, Peru
headline: The last agricultural valley next to the conurbation of Lima is threatened by building interests. It is defended by agroecologists and archeologists.

name: Coal mining fires and many other conflicts in coal fields of Dhanbad, Jharkhand, India
headline: Excessive coal mining and fires in the Dhanbad and Jharia area are seriously violating ecological as well as human rights. This case tries to give a brief overlook at full range of the coal mining conflicts.

name: Loc Valley Cide hydroelectric power plant, Turkey
Chennai's seashore beautification and fisherfolk resistance, India
headline: Fisherfolk mobilize against gentrification of the beaches of Chennai. An expressway project  was scrapped but private interests threaten people's livelihood.

name: Parque Eólico Tizimín, Yucatán, México
headline: Un parque eólico empezó a operar en la zona costera de Yucatán a pesar de irregularidades en el proceso de evaluación del proyecto y de los impactos que genera en una Área de Importancia para las Aves

name: The Campaign Against FreshDirect: Bronx New York, USA
headline: FreshDirect, a food delivery company based in Mott Haven in the South Bronx, is responsible for increased emissions and poor air quality in an already at-risk community.

name: Areva Uranium Mines in Agadez, Niger
Copper mining in Canaã dos Carajás and Marabá, Pará, Brazil
headline: Sossego copper mine is criticized for having irregularly purchased lands, while in Marabá, Vale operations met with strong opposition by the Xikrin indigenous groups.

name: La Parota Dam, Mexico
headline: The hydroelectric project is finally aborted, after more than ten years of mobilization and judicial battles, criminalization of opponents and violation of human rights.

name: Lucha de los pueblos laguneros contra la planta de cianuro de Chemours en Durango, México
headline: Lucha de los pueblos de la comarca lagunera, en el estado de Durango, contra la instalación de una planta planta química de la empresa Chemours para producir cianuro de sodio.

name: Mega proyectos turísticos amenazan arqueología Maya, El Petén, Guatemala
headline: Interamerican Development Bank, Global Heritage Fund and Fundación Patrimonio Cultural y Natural Maya among the supporters of a large touristic plan in a Reserve of the Biosphere. Communities have successfully rejected the project.

name: FACE Project: Rehabilitation of Mt. Elgon and Kibale National Park, Uganda
Protests against floating LNG terminal, Krk island, Croatia
headline: The LNG terminal features as a Project of Common Interest at European level, despite continuing controversies on its environmental impacts and economic feasibility  - as argued by environmentalists and civil society.

name: Teak forest exploitation, South Sudan
Coca-Cola Bottling Plant in Mehdiganj, UP, India
Fracking in California, USA
headline: The four year fight in California by many environmentalist groups asking for a moratorium on fracking, still withough success

name: Sarawak forest department acacia plantation project, Malaysia
Nuclear power plant in Tudela, Spain
headline: A demonstration in 1979 against several nuclear power stations to be built in the Basque country and against the Bardenas military camp was violently repressed by the Civil Guard, who also shot dead activist Gladys del Estal

name: Teck Frontier oilsands mine in Alberta, Canada
headline: The Teck Frontier oilsands mine was a proposed oil extraction project that would have been the largest project ever developed in the controversial Alberta oilsands patch. The project was withdrawn prior to a pending federal decision in February 2020.

name: Xiangjiaba Hydropower Plant in Yunnan and Sichuan, southwest China
headline: Thousands of residents displaced by the Xiangjiaba hydropower plant protested against the local resettlement policies.

name: Namibian Custom Smelter, Tsumeb, Namibia
headline: NCS is one of the few copper smelter in the world whose highly polluting process is not monitored and puts at high risk water resources, workers and residents' lives and the area's biodiversity.

name: Creys-Malville, fast breeder reactor stopped, France
headline: A fast-breeder reactor, stopped in 1997. A total failure. Demonstrations against it in 1977 were met with repression. Vital Michalon was killed by police.

name: Olive Quick Decline Syndrome in Apulia, Italy
headline: The detection of the quarantine plant pathogen Xylella fastidiosa on centuries-old Olive Tree In Apulia sparked a socio-environmental conflict among different actors.

name: El pueblo Zoque contra bloques de hidrocaburos en el norte de Chiapas, México
headline: En la zona norte del estado de Chiapas, los pueblos indígenas zoques se oponen a las rondas petroleras, derivadas del proceso de Reforma Energética, y a otros megaproyectos que amenazan sus territorios y modos de vidas.

name: Chinchero Airport, Peru
headline: A long-delayed airport project has stoked divisions between indigenous Chinchero communities. Critics raise concerns over environmental, economic and cultural impacts and the project has been mired in financial controversy over the construction contract

name: Iranian tanker disaster and oil spill in East China Sea, China
headline: On January 6, 2018, the oil tanker SANCHI coming from Iran collided with the Chinese Hong Kong bulk carrier CF CRYSTAL in the East China Sea. The tanker caught fire and sank, with 32 deaths or missing and 130,000 tons of condensate oil spill.

name: Contamination of Hutchinson River, Mt. Vernon, New York, USA
headline: Mt. Vernon New York's improper waste and sewage management, contaminating the Hutchinson River, stinking up low income minority communities, and befouling downstream beaches and wildlife habitat.

name: Sabodala Gold Operations mining, Senegal
headline: Land-grabbing, displacement and heavy metals contamination; inhabitants have been loosing their sources of livelihoods since the start of mining in March 2009. The food security of the area is put at risk.

name: Grassy Narrows and Whitedog First Nations Mercury Poisoning, Ont., Canada
Cañaverales, La Guajira, Colombia
Farmers Strike for Food Sovereignty, Colombia
headline: Farmers revolted against control over their seed and agricultural tyranny of Ley 970 and corporate-government abuse

name: Offshore Oil drilling, Belize
headline: In reaction to the government stubbornness, in 2012 a Popular Referendum in Belice said No to the offshore oil drilling!

name: Farmers Struggle Against Solar Developers, Connecticut, USA
headline: Connecticut farms and forestlands are increasingly converted to utility scale solar development, threatening local food systems and livelihoods.

name: Fandora Gold: Tofino-Tranquil (Onadsilth-Eelsukis) Tribal Park VS Imperial Metals, Canada
Oil extraction forces Ogoni to consume benzene water for survival, Nigeria
Botrosa logging company in El Pambilar, Ecuador
Formosa Toxic Waste Spill and Marine Life Disaster in Central Vietnam
headline: Taiwanese company Formosa Plastics Group dumped waste from their steel plant into the open ocean  devastating local fish populations and leaving villages with no income. Activists were brutally attacked.

name: Industrial sea overfishing, Mauritania
headline: Mauritania's 750-km rich coastline hosts an exclusive economic zone, exploited by many actors engaging in legal and illegal fishing practices. Overfishing is supported by EU neocolonial policies and a new Chinese presence.

name: Vista Coal Mine expansion, Alberta, Canada
headline: After resistance from various EJOs and Indigenous nations in Canada, the Vista coal mine expansion was redesignated and became subject to a federal environmental assessment.

name: Nam Ngiep I Hydropower Dam, Lao PDR
headline: The Nam Ngiep I Dam is a 290-MW hydropower facility which epitomizes the type of infrastructure project that the Asian Development Bank ensured would have pulled Lao PDR out of poverty.

name: Citadel Capital / Sabina and Al Nahda for Integrated Solution’s Irrigated Crops in White Nile State, Sudan
Phosboucraa and phosphate production in Western Sahara
headline: The conflict currently playing out between the Moroccan state and the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic (SADR) also involves resource extraction such as phosphates that fuel industrial agriculture

name: Achuar against Oxy,  Peru
headline: Pollution on the banks of the Corrientes river in the ancestral territory of the Achuar people

name: El Pachón copper mine, San Juan, Argentina
headline: Big  copper mining project in San Juan, Argentina, it was denounced for the possibility that its operation will impact on glaciers.

name: Rhéébù Nùù group and Vale mining, New Caledonia
headline: A refinery in New Caledonia is using acid to extract nickel and cobalt, polluting the air with mercury and contaminating the seafood upon which local Indigenous communities rely for sustenance.

name: DuPont C8 Contamination in Parkersburg, West Virginia and Ohio, USA
headline: Chemical company, DuPont, disposes of highly toxic PFOA (C8) waste from Teflon products into the Parkersburg, WV area and surrounding water districts; poisoning residents, wildlife, land, and water supplies.

name: Nickel mining in Manicani Island, The Philippines
headline: After more than 15 years of mining ban, residents' claims for rehabilitation and permanent closure of  operations, Hinatuan Mining Corporation ( subsidiary of Nickel Asia) gains in 2022 permits for mining and transport.

name: West Roxbury Lateral Pipeline and Metering and Regulating Station, MA, USA
