headline: Proposed and completed West Roxbury Pipeline extends Spectra Energy's massive AIM project despite protests from local officials and residents. The pipeline threatens public health and safety and exacerbates climate change

name: Iñupiat people resist offshore oil drilling and gas development plans in Point Hope, Alaska, USA
headline: When oil prices went up, the federal government proposed the 2007-2012 offshore oil and gas plan, with hundreds of leases pending for approval.  Caroline Cannon pursued legal action and canceled all but one lease in the Arctic.

name: Ida Mountain (Kazdagi) Prospecting for Gold, Turkey
headline: Alamos Gold from Canada (since 2010) and other companies prospect for gold, against local opposition. The project stopped in 2013. Attempts to renew it have encountered this time nation-wide opposition in 2019.

name: Iron ore mining in Nova Lima, MG, Brazil
headline: Movements fight for the preservation of the environment and the public water supply sources in the urban region of Minas Gerais, where Vale operates and expands iron ore mines.

name: Pavlovsky zinc and lead extraction, Novaya Zemlya, Russia
headline: New zinc and lead mine is under construction on strickly militarised Novaya Zemlya, where nuclear tests have been preformed and Indigenous Nenets displaced. WWF and local resident have expressed concerns regarding pollution and natural reserve boundaries.

name: Algonquins of Barriere Lake Logging Conflict, Quebec, Canada
Żarnowiec Nuclear Power Plant, Pomerania, Poland
headline: The biggest success of EJ in Poland during the political transformation. The apogee of opposition to the construction of Żarnowiec NPP was the blocking of the container terminal in Gdynia. The communist militia often used force against protesting youth.

name: Thermal power plant Ugljevik 3, BiH
headline: Russian investments on coal-fired power plants in Bosnia i Herzegovina; EJOS respond with the campaign "Stop Dirty Energy, Future is Renewable"

name: Chicomuselo contra Blackfire, Chiapas
Katni Power Station, Madhya Pradesh, India
Rokkasho Reprocessing Plant and Nuclear Complex, Aomori, Japan
headline: After over 20 years of safety concerns, project delays and huge costs, the controversial Rokkasho nuclear reprocessing plant is still scheduled to go ahead.

name: Curipamba Sur, Bolivar, Ecuador
headline: Campesinos, mujeres e indígenas que se oponen al desarrollo minero denunciando irregularidades en su aprobación y desarrollo y los riesgos en el agua, tierras y salud. Los oposición ha sido objeto de persecución y criminalización.

name: Explotación de oro aluvial en el río Madre de  Dios, Bolivia
headline: Gold extraction from the Madre de Dios river in Bolivia is still smaller than in Peru but mercury is used in large quantities, and the damage caused to the river bed and river baks is obvious.

name: Nuclear waste storage in Gastre, Chubut, Argentina
headline: In 1996 the people of Chubut in Argentina stopped the project for a large nuclear waste cemetery, which was supposed to store nuclear waste from Argentina and France

name: Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC) Thermal Power Plant at Raghunathpur, India
Shivdaspura Aero City, India
headline: Farmers in 20 villages held a series of protests against land acquisition for a new airport and ‘aero city’ in Shivdaspura. They were unable to utilize land that was reserved for the airport for 15 years, from 2005-2020, stalling development in their area

name: PT DAS conflict, Sumatra
Granadilla Port in Tenerife, Spain
headline: The Port proposal remained in the background of public policy till 2009. Its revival led to a series of uprisings unprecedented in the Canary Islands against destruction and commodification of nature.

name: Lombok Airport, Indonesia
headline: Beginning in the mid-1990s peasant farmers were forcibly evicted to make way for Lombok Airport. In 2005 police fired into a crowd of protesters injuring 33 people. The airport commenced operations in 2011 but disputes over plots of land continue.

name: Yamba dam, Gumna prefecture, Japan
headline: A historical case of resistance to a dam that would affect hotsprings and local livelihood in Gunma province. After a halt, works restarted and are scheduled to be finished in 2019

name: Coal power plant in Saline Joniche, Italy
Shutangshan Village Chemical Factory Pollution in Hunan Province, China
headline: The polluter in Shutangshan village eventually moved away, but compensation for villagers’ health and economic loss, and the responsibility for recovering the environment, were left in question.

name: Lignite mining Nochten II, Germany
Katigan peatland conservation and REDD project excluding traditional owners, Kalimantan, Indonesia
headline: This conflict concerns the population of Bapinang Hilir  in the South of Kalimantan island, Borneo and the Indonesian company Rimba Makmur Utama (RMU). Carbon trading is restructuring local communities.

name: El proyecto del puerto de aguas profundas en la península de Araya, Venezuela
headline: For twenty years the National Government has tried to build a deep water port with other related projects in the fishing peninsula of Araya for export of commodities. Communities, environmentalists and academics have led the opposition.

name: Pasivos ambientales de la Minera Noche Buena, Melchor Ocampo, Zacatecas, México
headline: Environmental liabilities from a mine closed down in 1992. They stopped extracting minerals and the site was left with a high level of contamination in the soil and without remediation.

name: Lof en Resistencia Cushamen vs. Benetton and state repression, Chubut, Argentina
headline: Mapuche resistance to land usurpation by Benetton and in support of  imprisoned local leader is met by  strong police repression in 2017. One supporter, Santiago Maldonado, "disappeared" for almost 3 months until he was found dead.

name: Two of Dong Nai hydropower dams cancelled due to environmental concerns, Vietnam
headline: Thanks to effective lobbying by civil society groups, independent experts and governmental actors, the dams were cancelled and environmental justice could be served to a unique ecological, social and cultural region.

name: Illegal Timber Trade in Oleshky Forest, Ukraine
headline: Politician Kateryna “Katja” Handziuk was attacked with acid for her activism against corruption and illegal logging in Kherson, Ukraine. She died on November 4, 2018. The timber corruption continues.

name: Complejo Petroquímico El Tablazo y las luchas de El Hornito contra PDVSA, Venezuela
headline: "El Tablazo" Petrochemical Complex produces terrible  health consequences on the community El Hornito, which carried out an unprecedented struggle  against PDVSA. They were relocated but never compensated for the socio-environmental damage.

name: Mina Santa Ana belonging to Bear Creek company, and the death of María Choque, Puno, Peru
headline: Aymara communities managed to stop the projected mine in 2011. One mortal victim was Maria Choque.  The company Bear Creek brought the Peruvian state to the CIADI in Washington DC.

name: Extracción Ilegal de Jade en Zacapa, Guatemala
headline: En el Departamento de Zacapa en Guatemala, las comunidades locales denuncian empresas de minería ilegal de jade, algunas de ellas custodiadas por la Policía Nacional en donde actores gubernamentales están directamente  implicados.

name: Tanjung Kasam Coal-fired Power Plant, Indonesia
headline: The 130MW Tanjung Kasam coal-fired power plant led to protests by local residents regarding the environmental and health impacts of coal ashes in early 2013.

name: Oil concessions threaten world's second lung in the Cuvette Centrale, Congo Basin
headline: The peatlands in Cuvette Centrale store enormous ammounts of carbon and are home to indigenous and local populations. The political elites of the Congos and multinational companies are profiteering from this wealth while playing with climate stability.

name: Glencore copper and cobalt mining, Zambia
headline: Sulphur dioxide emissions, acid rains, and smuggling profits out of Zambia without paying taxes and bringing profits to a tax haven, Switzerland: the Zambian receipee of Glencore's profits

name: Sugar cane factory La Troncal, Ecuador
Indígenas yukpa de los ríos Yaza y Tukuko luchan contra la expansión de Carbozulia en la Sierra de Perijá, Venezuela
headline: The Yukpa led by Cacique Sabino Romero struggle  against coal expansion, dispossession of their lands and military and rancher aggressions.  The most emblematic socio-environmental conflict in Venezuela in the last years.

name: Epidemia de Insuficiencia Renal Crónica (IRC) en las plantaciones de caña, Nicaragua
headline: En Nicaragua las familias lloran a sus parientes enfermos y difuntos de Insuficiencia Renal Crónica. La ciencia aún no tiene respuesta pero las comunidades lo relacionan con la contaminación del agua por agroquímicos de las plantaciones de caña.

name: Stara Zagora Landfill Site, Bulgaria
Green Resources AS Niassa Project
Lead poisoning by Huixian Nonferrous Metals Smelting, Gansu, China
headline: Hundreds of people were found with excessive blood lead levels at Huixian County, Gansu province of northwestern China in 2006, the blamed company was ordered to shut down and compensated the victims.

name: Kingston Fossil Plant, Harriman, Tennessee, USA
headline: Lack of Protection from Toxic Coal Ash Sickens and Causes Fatalities in Cleanup Workers

name: Lhaka Honhat (Our Land) Association (Salta) vs Argentina
headline: Lhaka Honhat fights for legal ownership of lands,  650,000 ha in Salta since 1983. Infrastructure projects threaten their livelihoods. Their case is supported by CELS and CEJIL. They won an IACHR ruling in 2020, implementation pending.

name: Air pollution from Jugohrom-Jegunovce, Macedonia
headline: Jugohrom Ferroalloys demonstrated little willingness to introduce environmental measures and reduced air pollution, which is why experts and CSOs demanded from the government to temporary close the factory and put more pressures on its management.

name: Bolivian “Gas war” and Pacific LNG, Bolivia
headline: The severely repressed revolt of the population from El Alto in 2003 led to the nationalization of gas resources by Morales' government.

name: Barcelona World Complex, Catalonia, Spain
Eskom’s Megawatt Park, Johannesburg, South Africa
headline: Environmental activists protested on two occasions at Eskom's main headquarters at Megawatt Park. They advocated against Eskom for its failure to uphold promises to divest from coal and excessive water usage in light of announced price hikes.

name: Extracción de gas por Repsol YPF en Campo Margarita, Tarija, Bolivia
headline: El pueblo guaraní Itika Guasu ha sufrido una configuración sustancial en su estilo de vida por la actividad de la empresa Repsol en su territorio  mediante la extracción de gas, causando no sólo daños medio ambientales sino también socioculturales.

name: Public Interest Litigation against Antai Coking Co. in Jinzhong City, Shanxi, China
headline: All-China Environment Federation filed a public interest litigation lawsuit against Shanxi Antai Group due to an air pollution dispute in 2016 and reached settlemen in 2018. The company continued to be exposed to complaints by local residents.

name: Proyecto Mandé Norte, Murindó, Colombia
Rarámuri (Tarahumara) fight against deforestation, and Isidro Baldenegro's murder, Chihuahua, Mexico
headline: Two very  visible murders (Julio Baldenegro,1986, and Isidro Baldenegro, 2017)  because of their fight against deforestation in the Sierra Madre Occidental. Also other murders.

name: Glencore Xstrata Tampakan Copper-Gold Project in South Cotabato, Philippines
headline: Militarization and killings as key ingredients of one of the largest mining areas in South East Asia for copper and gold; seek for justice still ongoing

name: Three Gorges Dam on the Yangtze River, China
headline: "A river is like a human body, you cannot cut it". But supporters of the largest dam of the world mantain China has no choice

name: Kalpakkam's fast breeder reactor, India
headline: This Prototype Fast Breeder Reactor of 500MW is still not ready by 2016. Such reactors have been discontinued in other countries but they receive government investments in India. Local and national protests are muted so far.

name: Karchana power plant, Uttar Pradesh, India
Construcción de una variante a la Carretera CV311 en Valencia, Spain
headline: New highway in Valencia will heavily affect the Huerta de Valencia, a ecological and cultural patrimony local committees are determined to protect.

name: Explotación petrolera en Casanare, Colombia
Santos' Barossa offshore gas “scraping the bottom of the barrel” in Timor Sea, NT, Australia
headline: Dangalaba and Larrakia people were not consulted and then sued Santos defending their traditional territory. Climate justice organisations oppose the project as the most carbon-intensive gas field in Australia.

name: Contaminación de la Presa de San Lucas, Xochimilco, Ciudad de México
headline: El desemboque de aguas negras en la presa de San Lucas en Xocimilco genera problemas de contaminación y afectaciones a la salud además de poner en riesgo la función hídrica de esta vaso regulador.

name: Itataia Project for Uranium and Phosphate mining in Santa Quitéria, Ceará, Brazil
headline: The federal government in Brazil is interested in extracting uranium and phosphate in Ceará, the Anti-nuclear Network together other EJOs are concerned about health and environmental risks. The project has not started.

name: Acheloos River Diversion, Greece
Coal mining pollution, Santa Catarina, Brazil.
Gloucester Resources Rocky Hill open cut coal mine, NSW, Australia
headline: In 2019, the proposed Rocky Hill coal mine in NSW was rejected in a landmark court decision in part because of its negative impact on climate change and social impacts on local residents and Aboriginal heritage.

name: Unity State oil pollution, South Sudan
Biofuel company likely to lose its licence in Nacala, Mozambique
Asian highway in Karen state, Myanmar
headline: Militarization, evictions and livelihood loss mark the development of the Asian Highway in Karen state. Civil society groups closely monitor the road construction and advocate for reparation of damages caused.

name: Sagarmala ports initiative and SEZs, the case of  Andhra Pradesh, India
headline: A coast and ocean grabbing project that will take away the livelihood of fishworkers, farmers and others near the coasts. Massive industrialization, ecological destruction.

name: Lithium mining in Tres Quebradas and defense of water, Argentina
headline: The company Liex S.A Subsidiary of the Neo Lithium company of Canadian origin begins in 2016 perforations in the Three Quebrades Project (3Q). Autoconvocated neighbors are mobilized and opposed.

name: Puerto Galera waste dump facility may relocate indigenous Iraya Mangyan families, Philippines
headline: While tourists enjoy beautiful coastal town Puerto Galera, the local government lets indigenous people deal with their waste.

name: Demarcation of Indios land in the Serra do Padeiro, Brazil
Amulsar gold mine, Armenia
headline: We can no longer afford mining, especially if two main directions of our economy are tourism and agriculture. There is no such a thing as mining tourism or eco-products next to mines. Thus it is time to choose between life and no life.

name: Illegal Waste Dumps in Pezinok, Slovak Republic
headline: Citizens of Pezinok, which already had an illegal and polluting waste dump , were outraged at a proposal for a new landfill. In 2013, both landfills were declared illegal in a landmark victory led by Zuzana Čaputová.

name: Forest plantation by Green Resources in Kachung, Uganda
headline: Green Resources sells carbon credits after converting grassland, savanna and small-scale cultivated land into non-native tree plantations. This has a tremendous impact on local population and environment.  It has been described as "carbon violence".

name: Farmers use loopholes to force a law change for seeds, United Kingdom
headline: UK farmers use legal loopholes to recover traditional seeds and to force a change in seed law

name: Hidroeléctrica Puebla 1, Puebla, Mexico
headline: Rechazo al proyecto que “no beneficiará a las comunidades, pero sí a la transnacional WalMart”. Opositores enuncian el altísimo nivel de represión y criminalización en el marco de masiva concesiones mineras, hidroeléctricas y de fracking en Sierra Norte

name: Ok Tedi copper mine, Papua New Guinea
Agips Oil Spill in Abacheke Community, Nigeria
Illegal plastic recycling factories in Jenjarom, Malasya
headline: Residents in the Malaysian town of Jenjarom denounced the presence of many illegal recycling plastic factories that were causing the release of toxic fumes. These provoked respiratory and cutaneous diseases within the locals, both adults and children.

name: Xúquer viu platform, Valencia, Spain
headline: Launched in 2003 by political, environmental, citizen and trade union organizations  with claims for an ecological flow, revision of the Xúquer River's Hydrologic Plan,  and stopping water transfer to the Vinalopó River.

name: Illegal radioactive thorianite mining in Amapá, Brasil
headline: Thorianite is a radioactive mineral rich in thorium, uranium and lead isotopes, probably used for its lead content, refrigeration of nuclear reactors and to produce neutron bombs. Illegal extraction threatens local communities´s health

name: Rong County suspends shale gas fracking amid quake fears, Sichuan, China
headline: Rong county in Zigong of Sichuan Province has suspended its shale gas exploration after three earthquakes occurred within two days, which locals have angrily attributed to the fracking.

name: Zimapan waste disposal, Hidalgo, Mexico
Phosphate mining in Matam, Ndiendouri-Ouali Diala deposits, SOMIVA (SERPM), Senegal
headline: Matam's phosphates deposits, originally exploited to relieve Senegal from food insecurity stress, have triggered danger of food insecurity in the local surroundings of the mines' deposits by undermining the locals' arable lands and access to clean water.

name: Wullar barrage-Tulbul project in Kashmir, India
Hirakud Dam, Orissa, India
Presa de Melones (Mayari), Cuba
headline: A dam for  water transfer (possibly for the tourist industry) displaces small farmers from their lands and houses in Arroyo Seco, Mayarí, Holguín.

name: Nuclear power plant  at Astravyets, Belarus
headline: The Belarusian Nuclear Power Plant (NPP) has been built in Astrovets, not far from Vilnius in Lithuania. The 2,400MW NPP will be the first of its kind in Belarus.

name: Sarayaku - Oil extraction in Block 23, Ecuador
headline: In 2012, after the Kichwa peoples petition, the Inter-American Court of Human Rights prevented oil exploitation to happen in Block 23.

name: Chevron North Apoi explosion impacts at Ikebiri Community, Nigeria
headline: Chevron North Apoi explosion has affected many communities in Bayelsa state. Ikebiry community members suffer from polluted waters, dying fisheries and poor health care to cope with a dying environment

name: Shenhua's water intensive coal chemical project in Ordos, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: On 23rd July 2013, Greenpeace published a report titled “Thirsty Coal 2: Shenhua’s Water Grab”, which put the excessive water extraction and illegal wastewater discharge of China Shenhua’s Coal-to-Liquid project in Ordors, Inner Mongolia under scrutiny.

name: Malibya irrigated agricultural scheme in Segou, Mali
Proyecto Fotovoltaico Ticul A y B Yucatán, México
headline: Mayas de San Josée Tipceh contra megaproyecto fotovoltaico impulsado por actores privados denuncian la falta de consulta y violencias contra las comunidades.

name: Black Angel zinc-lead mine since 1972. Greenland
headline: A historical case: Black Angle cliff mining in Kalaallit Nunaat, with direct mine tailings discharges into Affarlikassaa fjord. Inuit seal hunters and industrial workers protested livelihood consequences and low wages imposed by the colonial rule.

name: North American Lithium mining project, La Corne, Abitibi, Québec, Canada
headline: The North American Lithium mine with heavy environmental liabilities could be reactivated since its acquisition by Sayona Mining Limited and Piedmont Lithium and be part of a lithium extraction pole in Témiscaming

name: Li-ion battery recycling factory, Złotoryja, Silesia, Poland
headline: South Korean company dropped the project to build a facility to recover graphite and valuable metals from spent Li-ion batteries and modules. The project aroused big concern for many residents.

name: Nuclear waste disposal, Bure, Meuse, France
headline: Rallies are held  to oppose plans to store highly radioactive waste underground: the expensive and dangerous long-term by-product of France's nuclear energy programme.

name: Los Micos Beach and Golf Resort Project, Honduras
Oil contamination in Thar Jath, South Sudan
headline: Oil's contamination of health and habitat in South Sudan  This briefing takes a look at one of the world's great environmental time bombs - Big Oil's heedless and unscrupulous spewing of toxic wastes into the country's groundwater.

name: Demeter International Katondo Farm Project (Bwabwata National Park) in Mbukushu District, Namibia
La Réunion New Coastal Road, France
headline: The Réunion Regional Council and a number of French construction companies are planning to build a new coastal road in northwest Réunion to accommodate faster and safer car transport. The project is being opposed by ENGOs and residents.

name: Interoceánica as a driver of deforestation and land use change in Madre de Dios, Peru
headline: The Interoceanic Highway has triggered socio-environmentally destructive land use change along its route, with some of the main issues being gold mining, monocultures and cattle farming, leading to further road construction, migration and social conflict.

name: Building ban to  face coastal erosion, Rincon, Puerto Rico
headline: Each year there is a loss of about 1.84 meters of coastal terrain due to the rise of the tide and global warming. Local government agencies have taken notice and are looking for solutions to this predicament.

name: Logging concessions in Mayan territory, Belize
headline: Since 1985  the Government of Belize began granting massive long-term logging concessions in Toledo province to foreign owned companies

name: New Forests in Uganda
Direct violation of Forest Rights Act in the mining belt of Surguja district, Chhattisgarh, India
headline: This is the first case where rights granted to forest lands under the FRA 2006 to the indigenous people were taken away by the government officials to promote coal mining in Chhattisgarh.

name: Contaminación por asbesto en empresa Pizarreño, Chile
headline: La producción de materiales con asbestos ha dejado cientos de enfermos en el país. En protesta, en 2001, Eduardo Miño, un enfermo de asbestosis, se quemó  frente al palacio gubernamental. Las víctimas demandan reparaciones y descontaminación

name: Struggles against in situ leach uranium mining, Black Hills, South Dakota, USA
headline: Uranium mining is possibly coming to the region. Opponents argue uranium wells could leak and would contaminate the underground water, as in other locations. EPA's decision pending.

name: Chrevron's activities in Riau province, Indonesia
headline: Chevron’s production in Riau province, has been plagued by economic and environmental injustice but Chevron has repressed the protests. In May 2013, the anti-corruption court convicted two directors of two Chevron’s Indonesian contractors for corruption.

name: Coal mining in Enugu district, Nigeria
headline: Coal mines at sites in Onyeama, Iva Valley, Ogbete, and Okpara, now abandoned, still cause environmental, public health injustices as locals combat efforts to sell the properties for more mining and coal power processing.

name: Chronic pollution of Periyar river in Eloor, Kerala, India
headline: Eloor supports the largest industrial belt in Kerala with over 247 chemical industries. There are more than 30 effluent pipes spewing toxins into the river directly from the industry. Air pollution is also intense.

name: Think Biotech reforestation concession, Kratie and Stung Treng province, Cambodia
headline: Reforesting forested land? The controversial Think Biotech project turns diverse natural forests into timber monocultures, grabbing the land of indigenous Kuy and local Khmers, who organize to halt further expansion.

name: Soná, Panama
Logging on indigenous Souy land in Kampong Speu, Cambodia
headline: Chinese-owned sugarcane company HLH Group Ltd. began deforestation on indigenous Souy land in 2009. After collective action of all the villagers, HLH agreed to stop. Other companies, however, continued to landgrab when the government later seized the land

name: Agips oil pipeline in Ogunugbene, Nigeria
Coal mine of Baradarha Thermal Power Station, Chhattisgarh, India
Weir Figueiredo: farmers and compensation, Brazil
Fouad Boutros Highway, Lebanon
headline: The Fouad Boutros Highway is promoted as a solution to reduce car traffic in the densely populated Achrafieh. However, activists and experts claim that the project will aggravate the traffic problems and will have several impacts on the environment.

name: Proposed Riau-1 coal-fired power plant shelved after corruption investigation in Indonesia
headline: Riau-1 coal-fired power plant is a proposed 600MW mine-mouth power plant in Riau, Indonesia. The project was shelved after exposure to bribery and corruption scandals. It was also the first major corruption investigation into the CFPP sector in Indonesia.

name: Hidroeléctrica El Bala en el Parque Nacional MADIDI, Bolivia
headline: Una perla de la cooperación empresarial italo-boliviana;  la enorme represa de El Bala en el río Beni vuelve en la agenda energética. Muchos ya se refieren al proyecto como un "crimen de lesa humanidad".

name: Talvivaara nickel mining company, Finland
headline: A court case for environmental crime against the owners of a nickel mine for pollution. The mine discharged toxic effluents and heavy metals into the nearby lakes.

name: Open pit mining in Ucab, La Cordillera, The Philippines
headline: Militant opposition to open-mit mining was successful in stopping expansion by Benguet Corp. of the open pit mines to Barangays Ucab, Tuding, Virac in Itogon.

name: The A45 motorway, Lyon, France
headline: Economic and political actors proposed a new highway (A45) between Lyon and Saint-Étienne. After fierce mobilization from EELV (Europe Ecologies Les Verts), and different associations of farmers and local citizens the project has been cancelled in 2018.

name: Shell oil exploration and extraction, Nigeria
headline: Repression, contamination and impunity in one of the richest environments on Earth; "It is this - Dear friend, turns our free world -Into a dreary prison" (Ken Saro Wiwa). Read here about one of the most striking environmental crimes in the history

name: Gold mining in Halkidiki, Greece
Gautam Buddha Airport, Nepal
headline: Land acquisition for upgrade of Gautam Buddha Airport in 2013 impacted on 2,295 people who lost their land and livelihoods. Acquisition of additional land in 2016 triggered protests and obstruction by landowners that brought construction to a halt

name: Coca Cola plant in Jaipur, India
headline: After depleting groundwater sources, Coca Cola leave Kaladera village with hundreds of affected families and farmers. The plant shuts down but what is the legacy for these people?

name: Sultan Marshes Wetland, Turkey
Mahuva Movement against proposed Nirma Cement Plant, India
Aeropuerto Internacional de la Zona Sur (AIZS), Costa Rica
headline: "Tierra Sí, Aviones No!" Familias campesinas han vivido y cultivado en las tierras de Palmar Sur. Hoy luchan para no ser desalojados ante la eventual construcción de un Aeropuerto Internacional.

name: The 1986 catastrophic nuclear accident in Chernobyl, Ukraine
headline: A catastrophic nuclear accident took place at the Chernobyl power plant causing tens of thousands of excess cancers and many birth malformations.  2,600 square km of forest and marshland on the border of Ukraine and Belarus became inhabitable.

name: Caldag Nickel Mine, Turkey
Land grabbing by Rui Feng International in indigenous Kuoy villages, Preah Vihear, Cambodia
Water Contamination from Paper Mills at Penobscot Reservation, USA
GMOs in Catalunya, Spain
Phosphate fertilizer plant pollution in Liuchong Village, Hubei Province, China
headline: Liuchong is a "cancer village" rising in protest. Villagers who demanded compensation for pollution were accused of “extorting” the polluting company and put into prison. The village is waiting for justice.

name: Huasco - Petcoke, Chile
Vishnugaad – Peepalkoti hydroelectric project, Uttarakhand,  India
headline: "At your Own Risk"; challenging World Bank and IFC funded projects can cause you more troubles than expected. Despite severe ecological risks and the  experts' voices like Dunu Roy. All in the name of development and green energy.

name: Dobrich Landfill Site, Bulgaria
Vostok mega oil project, Taymyr, Arctic Russia
headline: A mega oil project in the Arctic (Taymyr peninsula) with 15 towns, a port, two airports and 800km of pipeline threatens Indigenous Dolgan, their environment and pastoral traditions.

name: Protests against mining of lithium by the Lichu River in Kangding, TAP Ganzi, Sichuan, China
headline: Beginning from 2005, in Minyak Lhagang the lithium-mining operations by Ronda Lithium Co,  have caused  polluting and killing fish in the Lung River, affecting water and livelihood of Tibetans. Many  local protests have led to halt the plant temporary.

name: Gujarat groundwater depletion, India
headline: Depletion of ground water leading to social conflicts and migration. Emphasis must be placed on collective action to reduce consumption and regulation of access.

name: Coal Use in Cement Factories, Egypt
headline: With the support of the EBRD and profiting from the political instability, business tycoons of the cement industry pushed to advance the coal agenda, when the industry enjoys a rather high profit margin

name: Sabetta port, Arctic Russia
headline: The Sabetta port is  related to the Yamal gas mega project. Scientists and environmentalist warn about consequences of the accelerated Russian Arctic development.

name: Exploratory fracking in Arquetu, Cantabria, Spain
Central Hidroeléctrica Rucalhue, Bíobío, Chile
headline: Una nueva central hidroeléctrica por construirse en el Río Biobío. Sería la cuarta hidroeléctrica con mayor potencia instalada en el río. Se demanda la revocación de la Resolución de Calificación Ambiental.

name: The Wadi Al-Hudda Landfill in Tartous, Syria
headline: Residents near the Wadi Al-Hudda landfill in the Tartous governorate of Syria are facing serious health and environmental consequences of the facility's pollution and operation beyond its maximum capacity.

name: Sección de Roma - autopista latina A12
Sydney Tar Ponds Contamination, Nova Scotia Canada
Santa Cruz, Zambales nickel mining impacts sustainable agriculture and fisheries, Philippines
headline: Nickel extraction continues in the rich, arable land of Sta Cruz, Zambales despite the destruction caused to the agriculture and fisheries sector.

name: Sitio de almacenamiento de Taverna del King
headline: El sitio de almacenamiento más grande de la región de Campania

name: Noble Group plans palm oil plantations in Papua, Indonesia
Controversial Amazon route of Transcontinental Railway Brazil-Peru
headline: A planned railway through the Amazon (Sierra del Divisor) was becoming likely. The project seems to have lost political support in favor of other "bi-oceanic" routes.

name: The Turów Coal Mine and CFPP, Lower Silesia, Poland
headline: This coal mine and power plant acquired an extension of its license by the Polish Government and a trasnational conflict between  actors directly affected by its environmental, health and social negative impacts emerged.

name: Destructive Mining of Silica Sands, Bangladesh
headline: A successful legal battle against mining of silica sands from hilly streams yet to deliver fully as defiant miners, in connivance with local authorities, are carrying on extraction activities

name: Alpha Coal-Powered Cement Factory, Mandalay, Myanmar
headline: Villagers complain against pollution and land grabbing by coal-fired-power plant for cement factory financed by Chinese company.

name: Quilombolas land demarcation, Dourados/MS, Brazil
Reserva Ecológica de Chaparri contra traficantes de tierras, Lambayeque, Peru
headline: The first conservation reserve in the country managed by a community is threatened by land grabbing and by the building of a dam.  Several members of the community have been killed.

name: Lower Season II Dam will displace ethnic minorities in Stung Treng, Cambodia
headline: Ethnic minorities in Stung Treng Province, Cambodia call on the spirits to stop the construction of the Lower Season II Dam.

name: Casas GEO en el Cerro de La Tortuga, Mexico
headline: Pueblo de Tetelpa en defensa del Cerro de La Tortuga contra el desarrollo inmobiliario pretendido por Casas GEO

name: Land-grabbing by Congo Agriculture in Malolo, Congo (Rep. of)
headline: Congo Agriculture took 48.000 hectares of land in Malolo district, considered as state owned but actually being used by locals for livestock and agriculture of local grains. It bankrupted but a new company took over with a new deal.

name: Alto Paraná en Misiones, Argentina
Druzhba Adria Oil Pipeline, Croatia
Forced eviction for expansion of Douala Airport, Cameroon
headline: In January 2021 more than 100 families were forcibly evicted for expansion of Douala Airport. Houses were bulldozed and protesters teargassed. Authorities claimed no responibility for resettling people and many were left homeless sleeping in the open.

name: LGV Limoges - Poitiers High Speed Rail, France
headline: Another example of high speed rail expansion, very costly, elitist and environmentally and socially harmful, in western France.

name: Taean National Park Oil Spill, South Korea
Tuna Fattening Farms in Sigacik Bay, Seferihisar, Turkey
headline: Tuna fattening farms in Sigacik Bay, Seferihisar, Izmir have been opposed by a range of social actors for about a decade. Finally, in 2018, the projects have been stopped by the judicial decisions of highest level.

name: Tourism and Indigenous Rights in Hawaii, USA
headline: The growing tourism industry in Hawaii is leading to crowding, pollution, resource pressures and edging native residents out of important economic and cultural spaces including fishing, and agriculture.

name: Koskulana Mini Hydro Power Project, Sri Lanka
headline: Upon inquiry PILF became aware that the mini hydro power project was right on the boundary of the Sinharaja World Heritage Site, last remaining relatively undisturbed remnant of tropical humid evergreen forest in Sri Lanka

name: Aboano coal-fired power plant, Ghana
headline: A small group of students activists in Ghana, without an office and without resources blocked the construction of a 1.5 billion dollar coal plant.

name: Dawei Special Economic Zone (SEZ) and Deep Sea port, Tanintharyi, Myanmar
headline: “Dawei society’s land and livelihoods, shared histories and traditions, ecologies and cultures, and ability to build common futures are all under threat,” [1] says a large CSO coalition demanding the halt of the controversial project

name: New Forests Company and plantation, Uganda
Hydroelectric Project Patuca III (Piedras Amarillas) , Honduras
Big Sandy lithium project, USA
headline: The Hualapai Nation protects their land and a sacred hot spring from an open-pit lithium mine currently under exploration by Australian company Hawkstone Lithium, Ltd.

name: Legal Recognition of Creole Seeds, Brazil
headline: Farmers win recognition of peasant seeds but battle against "Terminator" and WTO still looms

name: Cellulose Factory Celulosa Aurauco S.A., Valdivia, Chile
headline: Celulosa Aurauco S.A. was held accountable for the ecological disaster which decimated black-necked swans' population.

name: Contaminación biológica con cianotoxinas en Lago La Encantada, Zacatecas, México
headline: Through the media, a report of cyanotoxin contamination was made public regarding La Encantada lake, a public place of recreation within the city of Zacatecas, México.

name: Malecón Tajamar-Cancún destruye Manglar en Quintana Roo, Mexico
headline: Intereses turísticos devastan 58 hectáreas de manglar, la población local y ambientalistas de todo el país y del mundo se movilizan para detener el proyecto.

name: Yasuni National Park - ITT oil extraction, Ecuador
headline: Cancelled by the Correa government in 2013, the Yasuni initiative is still one of the most inspiring social proposal to step out from extractivism and a call for the whole world to "yasunize" our territories.

name: Assassination of Nicinha, Jirau dam area, Rondônia, Brazil
headline: Nicinha was a leader of the MAB fighting for the rights of the people displaced by the Jirau dam, denouncing the effects of the dam on fishing activity in the Madeira River. She was killed on January 7, 2016.

name: Pirquitas threatens water of Jujuy, Argentina
headline: Pirquitas is an open pit silver, tin and zinc mine, the biggest and oldest in Argentina, at 80 km to the west of  Abrapampa, at 4300 m.

name: Indígenas  warao (Delta del Orinoco) contaminados por Corporación Venezolana de Guayana y  minería ilegal, Venezuela
headline: Indigenous Warao suffer socio-environmental impacts in the Orinoco Delta which is a sink for industrial, oil and mining waste. Several factors have reduced their capacity for organization and mobilization. Their survival is threatened.

name: Desalination plant, Mamelles' Beach in Dakar, Senegal
headline: The tender process for the desalination plant on Mamelles' beach might be launched soon despite the local population's mobilization asking for an open,  democratic consultation process on the project.

name: Uranium Mining in Jadugoda, Jharkhand, India
Natural resource exploitation in the Dead Sea area, West Bank
headline: Ahava cosmetics denounced for mining resources and factory in occupied territory.

name: Illegal logging and land grabbing TI Uru-Eu-Wau-Wau, Rondônia, Brazil
headline: With Brazil's anti-indigenous policy and undermining of environmental protection, one of Rondônia's last densely forested areas is invaded and destroyed. Indigenous group still oppose organized loggers and land grabbers.

name: Minas de Carbón en Isla Guafo, Chile
headline: Un 40% de la isla Guafo es propiedad de inversores chilenos quienes buscan explotar el carbón para el funcionamiento de hidroeléctricas. Científicos y comunidades indígenas demandan la declaración del Área Protegida y la conservación de la biodiversidad.

name: Oil Spill at Makaraba Village, Nigeria
Excessive logging in Carpathian Forest, Poland
headline: Patience is over! The Wild Carpathians Initiative, a group of environmentalists, has blocked the access to strategic logging areas as the State Forests continues to conduct the intensive forest management plans in valuable parts of the Carpathian Forest.

name: ‘Pak ze aan, de Turnhoutsebaan’ - cyclists' safety in a less car-centric Antwerp, Belgium
headline: The 'Turnhoutsebaan' is a route for cyclists, cars and public transport from the northern and eastern suburbs of Antwerp to the city. Yet, too often the traffic victims in this key route are cyclists.

name: San Jose Huevos Verdes (Argentina)
Hydro Power Plant Boskov Most, National Park Mavrovo, Macedonia
headline: CSOs supported by international conservation organisations have been successfully opposing the construction of the HPP Boškov Most so far, however the fate of the NP Mavrovo will depend on the government's and the EBRD's final decisions.

name: Resguardo Indigena Unificado-Selva de Matavén (RIU SM) REDD+ Project, Colombia
headline: "Hot Air" carbon credits from major Columbian REDD+ project are used by major oil companies to avoid paying taxes and greenwash their image.

name: Rajasthan Atomic Power Station (RAPS), India
Ampliación de carretera en Tepoztlán, Mexico
headline: Frentes Unidos en Defensa de Tepoztlán pretenden frenar el ensanchamiento de la vía que implica expropiación de tierras comunales e impactos irreversibles en un área natural protegida.

name: Movimiento de los “13 pueblos” contra la Unidad Habitacional “La Ciénega”, Mexico
headline: In 2003-06 the municipal administration of Tepetzingo, Emiliano Zapata, Morelos, authorized building a social housing project of 15,000 units which threatened the water supply of 13 villages. Roads were blocked, protestors were jailed.

name: Coal-Fired Power Plant in Luna, La Union, Luzon, Philippines
headline: NGOS involved in environmental protection and climate change, including religious organizations, formed a coalition to block the 670 MW CFPP in Barangay Carisquis, Luna, La Union.

name: Floriculture on Lake Naivasha, Kenya
Wastepickers fight against incinerator in the city of Mauá, São Paulo, Brazil
headline: Wastepickers in Mauá mobilize against the installation of an incinerator that would daily burn 3,000 tons of waste from nine cities, endangering the environment, the population and the livelihoods of families living from recycling.

name: Incinerator of Florence, Italy
headline: The new incinerator in Florence, Italy is possibly going to start  building in summer 2016. The project is dangerous and it has caused strong protests by civic and women's groups.

name: The Mass Killing of the Arabian Sand Gazelle in As-Suwayda, Syria
headline: Illegal hunting of gazelle is described as “extermination”, mainly caused by the economic crisis in the country and hunters bragging about killing the largest number of gazelles.

name: Ube-Nishiokinoyama CFPP, Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan
headline: Coal Fired Power Plant project cancelled  in 2021 in Ube City. Plans for two 600 MW CFPP emerged in 2014 causing local and national opposition.

name: Exploratory Drilling for Oil at Leith Hill, Surrey, UK
headline: In an Area of Outstanding National Beauty, the local community and eco-activists are united in their campaign against exploratory tight/shale oil drilling.

name: Solid Waste Management Plant Lamdeng Khunnou in Imphal, MN, India
PT Tor Ganda conflict, Sumatra
Environmental threats (industrial salmon, new mining concessions) in Chiloé, Chile
headline: Threats in 2016 to environment and local livelihoods by the contaminating salmon industry and by new mining concessions in Chiloé.

name: Melmoth Iron Ore Project (MIOP),  Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa
headline: Since 2011, the Makhasaneni people have been opposing plans by Jindal for an  iron ore mine on their lands. They halted the project but,  because of their mobilisation, activists  suffer severe intimidations.

name: Greenland Mineral Ltd.'s Kuannersuit/Kvanefjeld Rare Earth-Uranium Project, Greenland
headline: The controversial Kvanefjeld/ Kuannersuit Rare Earth – Uranium Project proposed by Australian Greenland Minerals Ltd. would be one of the world’s largest open-pit uranium mines and undeveloped resources of rare earth elements [1].

name: Proposed Hydraulic Fracturing at U.S. Steel Edgar Thomson Plant in Braddock, PA, USA
headline: U.S. Steel has proposed to drill six hydrologically fractured horizontal wells for natural gas on the Edgar Thomson Plant site in Braddock, Pennsylvania as well as a fracking pad near Turtle Creek.

name: Lawpita and Mobye dam, Balu Chaung River, Karenni state, Myanmar
headline: Burma’s first large-scale hydropower project promised ‘progress’ but brought militarization, human rights abuses and livelihood loss to the Karenni people. Civil society groups say, the dam project must serve as a warning for future hydropower plans.

name: Illegal Bunkering causes first Spill on Agip pipeline in Oruma Community, Nigeria
Angostura dam, Chile
headline: A contested dam that is leaving without accessible electricity the local Mapuche communities since its opening

name: “Wake up and smell the smog!“ Parents Against Air Pollution in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.
headline: Respiratory tract infection is one of the major causes of child mortality in Mongolia. In Ulan Bataar, mothers and parents claim for more strict measures to reduce air pollution.

name: Metal Huasi, contaminación minera en Abra Pampa, Jujuy, Argentina
headline: Lead foundry in Abra Pampa town, Jujuy province. Inhabitants, partcularly children, faced high concentration of lead in blood,.

name: Referendum against gold mining, Trun, Bulgaria
headline: The people from Trun rejected gold mining by Euromax in a referendum on 11 June 2017: 1935 voted against, 125 in favor, with a participation close to 60 percent.

name: Roma of Stolipinovo: water and waste collection denial in the European Cultural Capital 2019, Plovdiv, Bulgaria
headline: Inclusion of Roma and their culture in "Plovdiv: European Cultural Capital 2019" was rejected by local politicians, and project proposals rehabilitating water and waste conditions were stopped.

name: Manganese mining in Manggarai, East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia
headline: In the 2000s indigenous groups  joined forces with Catholic groups against manganese mining on indigenous land., working towards a ban on mining in Manggarai and to prevent renewals of existing mining permits.

name: Chirano Gold Mines compensation struggle, Ghana
Coal exports in West Oakland: the Oakland Bulk and Oversized Terminal (OBOT), California, USA
headline: A coalition of environmental and social movements fights against a coal export port in West Oakland. This project would affect a majority of racialized communities already affected by other environmental hazards.

name: Try Pheap Co. Logging Operation in Cambodia
Lukang Anti-Dupont Movement, Changhua County, Taiwan
headline: In March 1986, residents of Lukang Town launched an environmental movement against a titanium dioxide plant and its success became a milestone in Taiwan environmental protection history.

name: Mandira Dam, Rourkela, Orissa, India
Mina de uranio Sierra Pintada, Argentina
headline: Attempt to reopen the mine in San Rafael, Mendoza, a project stopped judicially by collective groups opposing uranium mining. There are claims for environmental liabilities.

name: Okhla waste to energy plant, Delhi, India
headline: Residents filed a case against Okhla waste-to-energy plant, refusing to bear the risk of dioxin. The waste pickers movement also opposed incineration of waste. NGT decided in favour of the plant in 2017.

name: Fishery conflicts in the Ganga River, Bihar, India
headline: Fishers in Bihar face severe conflicts over access to fishing areas. Past feudal oppression, current control of the fishery by mafia gangs, and ecological degradation of the Ganga, has negatively impacted the livelihoods of fisher folk

name: Chemical hazard from  Metales y Derivados plant at Otay Mesa industrial park, Tijuana, Mexico
headline: A successful movement dealing with environmental injustice between Mexico and U.S.A, becoming the first case for cross-border,  community-government collaboration on a toxic site cleanup.

name: Territorial conflicts in Tibú and the oil palm expansion, Colombia
headline: By 2012, the first certified plantations were already in place in Tibú, inspite of the negative social and environmental impacts of the oil palm expansion.  The Inter-church Justice and Peace Commission has denounce that impacts.

name: Hanapepe salt ponds threatened by growth of helicopter operations, USA
headline: Practitioners of Pa‘akai, traditional salt-making, raised concerns over adverse impacts of tourist helicopter flights for many years. Their request for a contested case hearing on permits to expand operations, strongly supported by residents, was granted.

name: Baba Dam Project - Los Rios, Ecuador
Gold mining in county Tyrone, Ireland
headline: Canadian Company,  Dalradian, proposes to start gold mining on the Green Road in Greencastle, Omagh, Co Tyrone, Northern Ireland. In 2016, there is growing resistance against it.

name: Sierra de Aguaragüe , Bolivia
headline: Oil exploration in Guarani territory in the National Park Serrania del Aguaragüe in Chaco . This activity could contaminate the water in the area.

name: Koshe Landfill and biogas plant, Ethiopia
headline: The massive rubbish dump known as Koshe or Repi or Reppi in the outskirts of Addis Ababa slid down on 11 March 2017 provoking the death of at least 113 waste-pickers  and a dozen of injured.

name: Lonmin platinum mine, South Africa
headline: August 16th 2012: 34 workers were killed and 78 injured. The response to one of the toughest rise ups in the country by workers of a Glencore mine

name: Kayenta Coal Mine and Navajo CFPP closures: an unjust transition for residents in Black Mesa, Arizona? USA
headline: In 2019, the Navajo Generating Station and Kayenta Mine closed, leading to economic downturn and leaving environmental legacies. Now, the Hopi and the Navajo seek a just transition away from coal.

name: Cuenca - inhabitants against an industrial polygon, Ecuador
Coastal and land grabbing for tourism in Hacienda Looc, Nasugbu, Batangas, Philippines
headline: Risking their lives,  communities and human rights advocacy groups movilize against the coastal and land privatization for golf and eco-tourism projects that forces the eviction of local communities.

name: Open-air Waste Dumps near Moscow, Russia
headline: Since 2018, there have been widespread protest movements against landfills run by government-complicit "garbage mafias" in the towns surrounding Moscow.

name: Kinangop Wind Park, Nyandarua County, Kenya
headline: The 60.8 MW Kinangop Wind Park (KWP) project in Nyandarua County, Kenya. Withdrawn following widespread citizen protests, litigation, and the death of a protester.

name: Thousands protest against proposed Sino-French nuclear reprocessing plant in Lianyungang, Jiangsu, China
headline: The Lianyungang Municipal People's Government has decided to suspend site selection and preliminary work on the nuclear recycling project after thousands protest.

name: Ventanas Industrial Complex, Chile
headline: This region has been the site of intensive industrial development over the last 50 years.  Given the heavy contamination in the region, it is commonly referred to as a “sacrifice zone”.

name: Sterrebos cut down for car factory expansion, The Netherlands
headline: Plans to clear the Sterrebos, a forested area in the province of South Limburg, to expand a car factory,  were favoured by company employees but triggered resistance from environmental activists.

name: Seli Hydroelectricity Project, HP, India
headline: Hydropower in one of the most ecologically fragile regions of the Himalayas; conceptualizing a hydropower project in a seismically active, high altitude and an avalanche prone zone is a recipe for disaster

name: Luangwa Community Forests REDD+ Project (LCFP), Zambia
headline: Land grabbing in Africa: Fossil fuel giant ENI uses dubious carbon offsets to claim they deliver "carbon neutral LNG," dictates governance of local communities who's right of Free, Prior and Informed consent are violated by project partners.

name: Tours-Bordeaux LGV, France
headline: The French LGV between Tours and Bordeaux is not a perfect story. There is impact on the territory (in theory compensated by new green spaces) and much noise pollution.

name: Xiluodu Dam and giant landslide, Yunnan and Sichuan, China
headline: The second biggest dam after the Three Gorges project is likely to have contributed to reservoir-induced earthquake and massive deadly landslide.

name: OCP-Heavy Crude Oil Pipeline, Ecuador
headline: In spite of the locals' strong opposition and a global campaigning, the OCP is operating since 2003, causing numerous oil spills along its way

name: Pesticide Exposure in Tulare County, USA
Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Changuinola II, Bocas del Toro, Panamá
Untreated waste water dumped by chemical plants into Tengger Desert, Inner Mongolia-Ningxia-Gansu, China
headline: In 2015, eight companies were ruled to pay 569 million yuan for dumping untreated waste in the Tengger Desert between Inner Mongolia autonomous region and Gansu province, with a non-profit organization as the plaintiff.

name: Conflicto por la construcción del Puente Rurrenabaque/San Buenaventura, Bolivia
headline: A bridge projected on the Beni River to be financed by Sinopec and the Interamerican Development Bank  is contested by the population of Rurrenabaque (a touristic town) in the Amazon of Bolivia.

name: Negros Massacre: Murder of 14 farmers in Negros, The Philippines
headline: Killings of peasant men and women and their advocates under Duterte's Memorandum Order No. 32 of November 2018 targeting peasants and activists in Negros, Samar and Bicol, who are being suspected to support the New People's Army (NPA).

name: Pollution of the Yamato River, Japan
headline: Yamato River was one of the dirtiest rivers in Japan with excessive BOD in the 1970s. After a series of recovery policies and actions, sweetfish ( "ayu") returned to the river in the 2000s.

name: Aarey Forest threatened by new DP2034 (Multiple Development Projects), Mumbai, Maharashtra, India
headline: Disregarding presence of valuable biodiversity (including leopards) at Aarey Milk Colony, the state government diverts forest land for building a polluting metro carshed and for real estate development.

name: Jimbitono against mining and hydropower projects, Ecuador
Indigenous peoples and EJO efforts to protect Baikal Lake from many development projects, Russia
headline: Lake Baikal has been under threat from many projects. Indigenous people and the Baikal Environmental Wave protect the lake from paper mills, dams, pipelines, uranium waste, chemical industries and tourism.

name: Nizhne-Zeyskaya HPP in the Amur River basin, Russia
headline: The Russian Far East plan was going to include a number of hydro projects on the Amur river basin to control floods and generate electricity. This project never completed  preparation phase, the dam  was removed from the RusHydro investment plan in 2017.

name: Privatisation of water in La Paz, Suez-Aguas del Illimani, Bolivia
headline: In 2005, the mobilization of the inhabitants from La Paz and from El Alto, raising against the privatization of water, kicked out Suez French multinational from the country

name: Merauke Integrated Food and Energy Estate (MIFEE), Papua, Indonesia
headline: The development of the Merauke Integrated Food and Energy Estate (MIFEE) started in 2011. It is a 2.5 million ha mega project striving to increase Indonesian self-sufficiency in food and energy, but has been referred to as a 'textbook landgrab'.

name: Lobau highway construction, Vienna, Austria
headline: Planned highway project opposed by local citizens’ initiatives, environmental and climate justice groups and environmental NGOs. The main project was dismissed in 2021, yet the conflict intensified with the start of the construction of a subproject.

name: Gosikhurd Dam Irrigation Project, Maharastra, India
Lead contamination by Metalosa factory, Bajos Haina, Dominican Republic
headline: The 'Dominican Chernobyl'.  Soil, air and water contamination for abandoned lead-acid battery recycling smelter. Population has showed signs of lead poisoning since 1990.

name: Illegal Logging in Chuka Forest, Kenya
headline: Illegal loggers have been deforesting and displacing indigenous Chuka people on Mt. Kenya for decades. The Chuka teamed up with human rights lawyer Wendy Mutegi to fight the logging despite government corruption and death threats.

name: Temelin nuclear power plant, Czech Republic
headline: The growth of nuclear power capacity in the Czech Republic at Temelin and Dukovany near the Austrian border  gave rise to transboundary conflicts (including border blockades) since 2000.

name: MAC Oil Palm plantation and timber logging, Tanintharyi region, Myanmar
headline: Tanintharyi's largest palm oil concession facilitates timber extraction. Affected villagers and civil society groups demand the return of their customary lands and forests.

name: Lindane waste in Sabiñánigo (Aragon) left by Inquinosa, Spain
headline: The Inquinosa company left large quantities of lindane residue in Aragon, Spain. The  use of lindane is banned under the Stockholm convention on persistent organic pollutants.

name: Unistoten Camp, BC, Canada
headline: "Heal the People, Heal the Land". Unist'ot'en camp actively resists oil and gas pipelines for 10 years by building a bunk house,  healing center, gardens and community based on Indigenous Laws and Responsibilities.

name: Programme of Triangular Cooperation for Developing Agriculture in the Tropical Savannahs of Mozambique (ProSavana)
Petroecuador guilty of environmental damage, Orellana, Ecuador
Uluabat Lake, Turkey
Andap Valley Complex coal mining, Surigao del Sur, Philippines
headline: Andap Valley Complex holds the world’s largest coal block reserve and is one of the largely militarized areas in Caraga region nowadays. Lumad activists are been killed and forced to leave their land.

name: Sateri (Jiujiang) Fiber Co., Ltd., Viscose plant, Jiangxi, China
headline: Viscose factory that claims to be environmentally friendly has been fined several times over illegal dumping of sewage and toxic waste straight into nearby river.

name: Shanxi Sanwei Group Co., Ltd., chemicals producer, Hongtong County, Linfen, China
headline: A state-owned chemical company in Shanxi illegally dumped toxic chemical waste. Journalists were blocked off when trying to access information.

name: Roma community evicted to a landfill and an abandoned fireworks factory, Campania, Italy
headline: 400 Roma were evicted and placed in the Masseria del Pozzo camp, near a landfill. Some were displaced to a former fireworks factory, waiting for the construction of an Eco-village for them. They were evicted from that site when that plan was revoked.

name: Wastepicker struggles and water contamination in Jardim Gramacho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
headline: With the closure of Latin America's largest dump, thousands of people lost their principal way to sustain themselves. Now waste is dumped illegally, water contamination and social struggles continue while promises of sustainable development remain hot air

name: Opposition to the Tramuntana wind park in the gulf of Roses, Catalonia, Spain
headline: Environmental organizations, fisher people, and touristic businesses  from Costa Brava march together to face a 500 MW offshore wind farm project and protect the unique landscape

name: Eviction of Roma people during the COVID-19 pandemic, Castel Romano camp, Rome, Italy
headline: Almost a hundred people living in the Castel Romano camp (Italy) are being evicted due to the environmental degradation of their settlement, situated in the Malafede Nature Reserve, on a former landfill.

name: Lead Paint and other toxics in Brooklyn, USA
Chrome-rich Great Dyke Area, Zimbabwe
Osage Wind Project, USA
headline: Local residents, conservation groups, and the Osage Nation organized the Protect Osage Coalition to oppose the construction of the wind park owned by ENEL.

name: Defensa del Parque Reforma Social, México
headline: Defensa del parque público "Reforma Social" en la Ciudad de México por parte de los habitantes de la colonia ante la amenaza de su destrucción para desarrollar torres de lujo

name: Fosen Vind project for Storheia and Roan windfarms declared invalid by Supreme Court, Norway
headline: One very important case for environmental justice and renewable energy. The Supreme Court rules  that construction of two enormous windfarms infringes Sami's right to cultural reindeer practices, hence, invalid to operate these wind parks.

name: Racism and environmental harms in El Ejido on the Campo de Dalías, Almería, Spain
headline: Migrant workers and women live in appalling environmental, health, and working conditions amidst greenhouses in a 31,000 ha "Sea of Plastic". No potable water. Workers are daily exposed to pesticides.

name: Quinchía, Risaralda, Colombia
Tren Maya en Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Campeche, Tabasco y Chiapas, Mexico
headline: El mayor proyecto turístico, El Tren Maya, del nuevo gobierno mexicano de Andrés Manuel López Obrador (AMLO), sin consultas indígenas previas.

name: Kaziranga conflict: rhinos and poachers, Assam, India
headline: Conflict in the Kaziranga National Park in Assam after the government evicted people living in the vicinity of the park without any adequate rehabilitation.

name: Illegal logging and cattle ranching in TI Karipuna and Jací-Paraná, Rondônia, Brazil
headline: Illegal logging and cattle ranching have already destroyed half of the Resex Jací-Paraná and are now on the rise in the TI Karipuna. Despite international mobilization and the fear of indigenous genocide, invasions continue with impunity.

name: Myaing Galay cement plant in Hpa-an, Karen State, Myanmar
headline: A military-operated coal-fired cement factory challenged by local inhabitants since 2016. Alleged to be responsible for polluting water. Civic protests lead to the arrest of activists in March 2020.

name: Zonas de Empleo y Desarrollo Económico (ZEDE), Honduras
Afectadas por el DBCP (Nemagón), Nicaragua
headline: Más de 20.000 nicaragüenses aún no indemnizados por enfermedades, esterilidad, abortos, mala formación: el coste real de las bananas y los enormes beneficios de las Republicas Bananeras

name: Trans Adriatic Pipeline (TAP) in Puglia, Italy
Granjas Caroll en la cuenca Libres Oriental, México
headline: Desde hace varias décadas la instalación de granjas de cerdo de la empresa Granja Carroll en la  cuenca Libres Oriental ha provocado problemas de contaminación, de enfermedades y de sobre explotación del agua.

name: Lemoiz, Basque Country, Spain
headline: Lemoiz was a nuclear power station of two units of 1000 MW, only 20 km from Bilbao. It was stopped when almost built by a mixture of actions by civic movements and extreme violence by the Basque nationalist group ETA.

name: ArcelorMittal's tremendous  pollution in Kryvy Rih, Ukraine
headline: The issue of ArcelorMittal is one of the most important in Ukraine. This world's leading steel and mining company damages human health and the environment.

name: Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster, Japan
headline: An earthquake and tsunami knocked out the Fukushima nuclear power plant cooling systems in March 2011, causing meltdowns in three reactors. The radiological release was rated at Level 7, on par with Chernobyl.

name: Ezeiza Atomic Centre in Buenos Aires, Argentina
headline: The Ezeiza Atomic Centre  is a nuclear waste facility and research centre. Surrounding communities are concerned about the nuclear waste being stored on site and lack of transparency from the government about uranium contamination levels.

name: Tin Mining Conflicts in Bangka-Belitung, Indonesia
headline: In 2013, Bangka Belitung accounted for a third of the global tin supply and 75% of the province is licensed for mining. Mining areas continue to expand into protected forests and marine ecosystems, residential areas and local people's plantations.

name: Sappi Ngodwana, South Africa
Rio Cuervo Hydroelectric Project, Aysen, Chile
headline: After Hydroaysén, a 640 MW hydro project is cancelled in Chilean Patagonia in 2017. Dam opponents showed the weakness of the project and the huge seismic risk it would bring along.

name: Sawra-Kuddu hydroelectric project, HP, India
headline: Apple orchards and local agriculture damaged because of dust from construction, poor information to local villagers, cracks in the houses and intense blasting at night. Dams construction and sustainability is rarely a happy marriage.

name: Waste incineration fuelled cement plant in Córdoba, Spain
headline: Mobilizations and concerns about health impacts managed to stop co-incineration, but the company is again trying to burn cheap waste

name: Obudu International Passenger and Cargo Airport, Nigeria
headline: Since 2019 a series of protests by residents in Obudu local government area, resisting displacement for an airport and demanding payment of compensation, have been violently repressed. Villagers have been shot, beaten and detained and two people have died

name: Kamchia sands protected area urbanisation, Bulgaria
Purus REDD Project, Brazil
headline: Purus REDD Project undermines the reproduction of traditional way of life and may cause displacements to urban areas. It has already commercialized its carbon offsetting credits, including to FIFA for the carbon neutralization of the 2014 World Cup

name: Southern terminus of Atlantic Coast Pipeline and industrial hub, USA
headline: Safety concerns with existing and new infrastructure near the pipeline terminus and gas leaks

name: Haripur Nuclear Power Plant, India
Gállok/Kallak Iron Mine, Sweden
headline: In 2006, the company Beowulf Mining was given permission by the Swedish agency Bergsstaten to explore possibilities for mining iron ore in Gállok (also known as Kallak).  Stiil by 2020, opposition prevents the start of the project.

name: Brunsbüttel LNG Terminal, Germany
headline: The first German LNG Terminal in Brunsbüttel is expected to become a source of energy security for Germany. Social movement Ende Gelände warns about dire consequences of the project for the environment and for the poorest people in the Global South.

name: Gold mining and paramilitary attack in San Fernando, Bukidnon, Philippines
headline: Salusan´s NIPAR committs many atrocities against Lumads to control small-scale gold mining, justifying it with red-tagging. They shot at Tigwahanon people, killing Makinit Gayoran.

name: Polavaram Multipurpose Project, Andhra Pradesh, India
Relocation of Kiruna town due to iron ore mine, Sweden
headline: The world largest underground iron ore mine operated for more than 100 years but is now caving in, destabilizing the ground that the town is built upon. Residents are being relocated in an industrial area with unfair compensation measures

name: Golf Park Dubrovnik, Croatia
headline: The opposition to the proposed luxury golf course resort on the hill of Srđ overlooking the UNESCO town Dubrovnik resulted in the Citizens’ Initiative "Srđ is Ours" that became symbol of the resistance to mismanagement in spatial policy.

name: Waste Treatment Plant at Bandhwari, Haryana, India
Environmental liabilities (pasivos ambientales) of Minera San Acacio, Vetagrande, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: Lead and other heavy metals contamination (some of it from colonial times) causes protest actions. No  remediation took place despite effects on the human right to health mainly of children and pregnant women.

name: Chemical contamination at the Cidade dos Meninos, Duque de Caxias, Brazil
Kuther Hydroelectric Project, HP, India
headline: In the name of energy diversification. JSW Energy group plant adds to India "renewable" potential but leaves one of its main Himalayan rivers dry. People cry out the lack of due information and consultation.

name: Verulam Waterworks pollutes Mdloti River and La Mercy Lagoon in eThekwini, South Africa
headline: For years Verulam Waterworks  has been dumping chemical effluents and  untreated sewage into Mdloti River, which feeds into La Mercy Lagoon, in Kwa Zulu Natal.

name: The Sea Empress oil spill, Pembrokeshire, Wales, UK
headline: On February 15th 1996, this supertanker loaded with 130,000 tonnes of oil, became grounded on rocks in the Midlford Haven Waterway in Wales. The resulting oil spill was one of the UK's worst environmental disasters.

name: Informal Waste Collectors in Seoul, South Korea
headline: A 2022 report shows that South Korea is home to at least 15,000 elderly waste collectors, with around 2,400 of them residing in Seoul alone.

name: ALTO MAIPO Hydroelectric Project (PHAM), Chile
Center Parcs in the Chambaran forest, Roybon, Isère, France
headline: La fôret de Chambaran has become the third occupied place by the Zadistes in France. Together with other organizations, they oppose the mega touristic project Center Parcs, which was finally stopped en 2020.

name: Oil spill in 2019 in the sea and on the beaches of Northeast, Brazil
headline: Brazil struggled to identify tanker behind oil leak  contaminating half Brazil’s coast. Thousands of volunteers cleaned the beaches stained by oil.  Great environmental and economic losses.

name: Sand iron mining in Kulonprogo, Java, Indonesia
headline: The "black gold" mining, iron sand mine in Yogyakarta,  along the Southern Java coast. A network of peasants and farmers, the PPLP, struggled successfully against sand land dispossession.

name: Depleted Uranium threat from Gulf War, Kuwait
headline: During the Gulf War, around a Million rounds of DU were fired on Kuwait and Iraq. With many reports on the effect of DU on the Iraqi people and US veterans, the US government still claims DU has no effect on Kuwaiti people and the environment

name: Spotsylvania Solar Energy Center (500 MW, PV) - Virginia, USA
headline: Residents protest against the planned 500 MW solar power plant. Demands for forest restoration and compliance with minimum distances from residential areas have been improved, whereas the large project size remains unchanged.

name: Nenskra hydropower project, Georgia
headline: Resistance against a EBRD funded dam in Georgia’s northern Svaneti region has caused locals to restore the traditional ruling body lalkhor in order to increase the community’s impact on the national decision-making process

name: Changsha Xianghe Chemical Factory in Liuyang, Hunan, China
headline: In 2009, more than 1,500 times the permitted level of heavy metals were found in soil at Shuangqiao Village of Liuyang City in Hunan. The nightmare of cadmium poisoning lasts for years and the impacts still exist.

name: Isua Iron Ore Mining Project, Greenland
headline: The Isua Iron Ore Mine owned by London Mining Greenland A/S has faced a range of criticisms given limitations in the public consultation process and the mine’s location in a hunting area 150 north-east of the capital Nuuk.

name: Mareña Renovables in San Dionisio del Mar, Oaxaca, Mexico
headline: Indigenous communities in Oaxaca (Mexico) successfully struggling against large-scale private windmills in their territory

name: Mayan beekeepers against Monsanto transgenic soya, Campeche, Mexico
headline: "We Mayans are alive, we Mayans are fighting and it is a struggle for life". Not only a struggle against Monsanto, but against the agro-industrial development model that has been imposed on us.

name: Little Andaman development plan, India
headline: A proposed megadevelopment along the coastline of Little Andaman Island entails denotification of forest and Tribal Reserve long inhabited by Onge people. An Aerocity housing an international airport would be ‘the catalyst for development' of the 1st Zone

name: Granite quarrying in Cap Breton, Nova Scotia, Canada
headline: Several struggles in Cape Breton against quarrying, e.g. in  Kluskap’s Mountain, of  spiritual importance to Mi’kmaq people. Opposition to extraction of aggregate for road building in the US. Similar cases in Canso and elsewhere.

name: Shortage of Water in Gwadar, the port at the end of corridor China/ Pakistan
headline: Gwadar’s port city, a hub of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor, suffers from continuous water crisis.  There is citizen unrest against the authorities and the "tanker mafia".

name: Ten hydropower plants on the River Ibar, Serbia
headline: Well-organised local activists from Kraljevo managed to prevent the project of building ten small HPP on the river Ibar.

name: Hotel Algarrobico, Almeria, Spain
headline: Illegal 21-story and 411-room tourism facility built on one of Spain´s few remaining unspoilt Mediterranean beaches, within the Cabo de Gata Nature reserve.

name: Eviction from Manas National Park, Assam, India
headline: Local Bodo communities are threatened by eviction, while other Adivasi and no Bodo communities have faced eviction since the last decade. Are Conservation Organisations complicit in ethnic discrimination?

name: Phosphorite mining, Estonia
headline: Phosphorite, the natural resource that helped topple Soviet power in 1987-88 when Estonians (including university students) took to the streets to protest its planned mining.

name: Arrowhead Landfill, Uniontown, Alabama, USA
headline: Coal Ash is Moved into an Alabama Landfill and Releases Toxic Chemicals into a Predominantly Black, Low-Income Community

name: Decade-Long Opposition to the Iberdrola Horse Creek Wind Project, USA
headline: Iberdrola's proposed Horse Creek Wind Project in the environmentally sensitive and scenic 1000 Islands Region is generating widespread organized opposition from community groups, local governments, environment organizations and other stakeholders.

name: Pollution in the Huai River and the cancer village of Huangmengying in Henan, China
headline: Correlation between heavily polluted water and higher incidences of cancer found in the Huai River watershed in eastern China

name: Comunidad de Vista Alegre contra Compañía Minera La Consolidada, Peru
headline: A successful case of stopping a mining project in a milk producing and conflictive area:  Hualgayoc and Bambamarca in Cajamarca.  Internal divisions in the community led to two deaths.

name: International Airport of Modibo Keita, Mali
headline: This is a conflict on land appropriation by the Government of Mali, with the aim to build an airport zone in the outskirts of capital city Bamako. Local communities protested their displacement and the demolition of their houses.

name: Municipal Solid Waste Management Plant in Berhampur, OR, India
National Hazardous Waste Treatment Center, Bulgaria
Kinder Morgan Natural Gas Pipeline, USA
headline: Pipeline expansion pushes aside the rights of a Massachusetts protected forest area, despite persistent protests and numerous arrests of even a 98-year-old woman. The fight continues...

name: Boat Harbour contamination from pulp and paper industry, Nova Scotia, Canada
headline: Boat Harbour wastewater lagoon is Nova Scotia’s largest contaminated site. Both the levels and  toxicity of contaminants are serious. The Pictou Landing First Nation has been fighting against environmental racism.

name: Thermoelectric Complex Parnaíba, Maranhao, Brazil
headline: ENEVA operates one of the largest natural gas-fuelled thermoelectric power generation complexes in Brazil. Local communities (such as "quebradeiras de coco") complain about pollution, health and environmental damage.

name: Represas río Cautín (Alto Cautín y Doña Alicia), Chile
headline: Irregularidades ambientales y fuerte oposición ciudadana a la raíz de la cancelación de dos centrales de pasada en territorio mapuche en 2016. Por ese caso, el líder mapuche (lonka) Alberto Curamil fue premiado con el Premio Goldman en 2019

name: Authorities of Asparuhovo town blame a flooding event on Roma community, Bulgaria
headline: Flooding in Asparuhovo  in 2014: 14 killed, most of them Roma; but Roma blamed  because of itimber extraction and living in a ravine. Strong hate speech used by authorities.

name: Parque fotovoltaico Oxcum-Umán, Yucatán
headline: Distintas organizaciones comunitarias, académicos y grupos de la sociedad civil, se oponen a la construcción de un parque fotovoltaico para el abastecimiento de una planta cervecera por los impactos ambientales que generaría.

name: La Macarena: Área de Manejo Especial, Colombia
Special Economic Zone Hosur – GMR Krishnagiri Special Investment Region, TN, India
headline: Agricultural land sacrified for industrial purposes; an ever ending mantra for Indian communities

name: Macro-Landfill in Torremendo, Alicante, Spain
Privatización del agua en Guadalajara, Mexico
headline: La conflictiva gestión de las aguas en Guadalajara: privatización, presas y contaminación y la lucha a favor de la gestión pública, en contra de las represas y a favor de la madre tierra y la distribución.

name: Zhetibai Oil Pollution, Kazakhstan
Kfaraabida Beach Privatization, Lebanon
headline: Kfaraabida is one of the many cases of privatization of coastal public property. 170 Km of the country's 220 Km shoreline is currently privately owned.

name: High-speed train Bangkok- Nong Khai, Thailand
headline: The Thai government has rushed to approve a high-speed train between Bangkok and Nakhon Ratchasima (250km) without proper EIA or public consultation.

name: Alamos gold mining company in the “Sonora cluster”, Mexico
headline: El Chanate (Altar) and Mulatos (Sahuaripa) are both gold mines (with major accidents in 2016 and 2018). They belong to Canadian company Alamos Gold (also active in Morelos, Mex., in Turkey and Canada).

name: Sud de France TGV train Station in floodable area, Montpellier, France
headline: In spite of the local population opposition and the possibility of a genuine better alternative to receive the high speed trains connecting Nimes and Montpellier, Sud de France station construction seems imminent.

name: Buol district people´s struggle for their lands, Indonesia
Deforestation & colonization of Indigenous Ashaninka Territory, Peru
headline: The Ashaninka have been resisting the colonization of their territory for centuries but the rainforest frontier keeps moving forward. It was first for timber but it is also now for plantations.

name: Raj West Power Ltd in Barmer, RJ, India
Agresión, detenciones arbitrarias y criminalización de la protesta ante privatización del agua en Querétaro, Mexico
headline: Defensores del agua son criminalizados, detenidos arbitrariamente y reprimidos por protestar en contra de la privatización del agua y la opaca aprobación de la  Ley de Concesiones en el Estado de Querétaro.

name: Smurfit-Kappa, Colombia
headline: During the more than fifty years that they have been on Colombian territory, the company  destroyed a part of the tropical rainforest area in Valle del Cauca (the biogeographical Choco region) and the Andes.

name: Kocacay Delta, Turkey
Sugar workers demand land distribution in Hacienda Luisita, Tarlac, central Luzon. The Philippines
headline: Hacienda Luisita  massacre has become a symbol of the peasants' fight for  land distribution against wealthy landowners in the Philippines.  This  conflict is related to the Mediola street massacre in Manila.

name: Illegal Logging and Other Types of Resource Extraction in Virunga National Park, DR Congo
headline: Virunga National Park is one of the world most dangerous conservation sites. Since 1966, 178 park rangers have been killed while defending the park against bandit groups illegally extracting resources, especially charcoal.

name: San Jose del Progreso, Oaxaca, Mexico
Sanya Hongtangwan International Airport, Hainan, China
headline: Complains by organizations on the procedure and its negative impacts on the habitat for the protected Chinese white dolphin, a controversial airport island reclamation project at one of China’s top tourist resorts Sanya, was halted for more than two years

name: Windmills in the Koyna Sanctuary, Western Ghats of Maharashtra
headline: Several Indian companies involved in the installation of more than 200 windmills in the Koyna Sanctuary. The project also comprises 10 resorts and a dam. Local EJOs claim biodiversity loss and local displacement.

name: Zaporizhstal plant in Zaporizhia, Ukraine
