headline: The steel plant contaminates the atmosphere as well as the water in the city. Activists push local authorities to initiated eco-forums and round tables for a dialogue with the state industry for higher accountability

name: Armadillo case: indigenous in voluntary isolation, Ecuador
Amungme against Freeport-McMoRan, Indonesia
headline: Freeport-McMoran's Grasberg Mine has devastated local indigenous groups ever since the project started a month after a military coup in 1965. Military and guards routinely harass and violently oppress locals.

name: Gumti Hydroelectric Project, Tripura, India
Oil Drilling in Wilmington, California, United States
headline: Over two decades of oil drilling directly next to their homes has caused residents of Wilmington county to protest Warren Resources.

name: Boeung Tamok Lake Filling near Samroang Tboung village, Phnom Penh, Cambodia
headline: Urban development encroaching upon and filling Boeung Tamok has been displacing villagers since 2020. Opposition to the projects has resulted in police and state violence against activists. Governmental officials have no intention of stopping development.

name: Oil exploration in Pilón Lajas, Bolivia
headline: Oil concessions to Petrobras, Petroandina, Repsol, Total ...  for exploration in the biosphere reserve and indigenous peoples communal territory in Pilon Lajas.

name: “034 Metal Recycling” polluting Kragujevac, Serbia
Kuzguncuk Vegetable Gardens, Turkey
Protest against pollution from coal power plant, Cilacap, Central Java, Indonesia
headline: The operation and expansion of the Chinese bulit large CFPP in Cilacap is met by protests by local communities as a response to severe negative health impacts and livelihood losses.

name: Wuzhisan-Pheapimex plantations, Cambodia
Cuyamel Hydroelectric Project on Garífuna territory in Masca, Omoa, Cortés, Honduras
headline: The Cuyalmel Hydroelectric Project is a proposed hydroelectric dam. Its construction has been associated with widespread distrust, violence, and the murder of Garífuna woman defender Mirna Teresa Suazo

name: Minera San Rafael - El Valle - Dominican Republic
Clean Harbor Waste Facility, California, USA
headline: A decades-old battle in Buttonwillow against toxic and radioactive waste disposal which puts at risk lives and health of local residents. The facility has recently been expanded and injustices aggravated.

name: Yacimiento de Cobre Los Pingos, Tulahuén, Chile
headline: La contaminación por polución, el peligro del tranque relave próximo al río que alimenta los predios agrícolas, así como el consumo de agua industrial, han generado un conflicto entre la población local y agricultores y la empresa y el gobierno regional.

name: Banshkhali coal power station, Chittagong, Bangladesh
headline: Agitation in the Gondamara ward against a very large (imported) coal fired power plant results in several villagers being killed in April 2016 and again in February 2017.

name: Acaparamiento de agua por parte de la embotelladora Topo Chico, filial de Coca Cola, en Monterrey, México
headline: Habitantes de la localidad Topo Chico en la ciudad de Monterrey se movilizan contra el acaparamieno de agua de la embotelladora Topo Chico, filial de Coca Cola, en el contexto de la grave crisis hídrica que sufre el estado de Nuevo León.

name: Paladin Africa uranium mine Karonga, Malawi
Bellavista - Miramar (Costa Rica)
El vertedero de Cambalache en Ciudad Guayana, Venezuela
headline: Big open air waste dump Cambalache in Bolívar state creates several socioenvironmental conflicts in the community and impacts on indigenous and city people.

name: Bardia National Park (BNP) and Sonaha indigenous minorities, Nepal
headline: Creation of national park impacted  Sonaha indigenous groups in the Karnali river delta. Despite  participatory conservation they continue to struggle for  livelihoods while facing conservation injustice.

name: Water Privatization, Ghana
headline: One more example of the false promises of better performances under the private sector in water management. National Coalition Against the Privatisation of Water advocates for increased public investment in the sector

name: Lignite mining Garzweiler II (Immerath), Germany
Shell oil spill in 2023 in Ogoniland , Eleme LGA, Nigeria
headline: On June 11th 2023, another oil spill from Shell. This one at Eleme polluting waters and lands. It took over a week  to control the spill.  Affected communities denounce the oil giants lack of accountability.

name: Cross-border air pollution in Slavonski Brod, Croatia
headline: Citizens of Slavonski Brod-Croatia refuse to breathe the most polluted air in Europe contaminated by the oil refinery in Bosanski Brod- Republic of Srpska, B&H.

name: Tourism, waste, and conservation initiatives, Sikkim, India
headline: Tourism has been growing steadily in  Sikkim such that the negative impacts are becoming increasingly obvious. Yuksam villagers started a community based ecotourism initiative for biodiversity conservation, home stays, waste management and more.

name: Baiga’s claim to right to land and forest resources in Chhattisgarh, India
headline: Baiga’s rights to land, forest and forest resources after they migrate from the hills to the plains, and their fight against state violence in Chhattisgarh.

name: Remunicipalisation of Water service in Berlin, Germany
Coca Cola violates labor rights, Colombia
headline: Violation of workers' rights, death threats, judicial persecution, unfair and/or arbitrary dismissals and defamation campaigns. The secret ingredients of CocaCola in Colombia.

name: Israeli Bombing of the Jiyeh Power Plant and consequent Oil Spill, Lebanon
headline: The 2006 Israeli war on Lebanon resulted in human losses as well as environmental ones. The Jiyeh plant bombing on July 12th had serious environmental , economic and social impacts on Lebanon.

name: Taksim Square and Gezi Park construction works, Turkey
headline: When in late May 2013, news spread that bulldozers were moving in to uproot the park’s trees in preparation for the construction of the barracks, a group of activists occupied the park.

name: Sanyou Chemical Fibre, Viscose Factories, Hebei, China
headline: Viscose factories may be linked to heavy air and water pollution and damage to marine life, company denies all allegations of pollution.

name: Gold Panning in Kwekwe, Zimbabwe
Extracción de materiales pétreos en Cerro León, Paraguay
headline: In the historical site of Cerro León, a natural park,  there is a project by the government for extracting building materials. Citizen movements support environmental values and the local Ayoreo people.

name: The Jilin chemical plant explosions and Songhua River Pollution Incident, China
Alumina Factory by Alteo, Gardanne, France
headline: Despite stiff opposition of local collectives and of Frensh Ministry of Ecology against Alteo's activity, Prime Minister acted in favour of the aluminium industry

name: Jiujiang Jinyuan Chemical Fiber Co. Ltd. Viscose Plant, China
headline: Toxic chemicals and untreated industrial waste leads to water pollution and factory worker death at viscose plant in China.

name: High voltage eletricity  transmission lines, Portugal
headline: Govertment's approval for new transmission lines sparkles protests by local people and the creation of a national civic movement called Movimento Nacional Contra as Linhas de Alta Tensão nas Zonas Urbanas

name: Overfishing and seabed mining, Cook Islands, New Zealand
headline: Mining of manganese nodules promises economic gains. Traditional leaders oppose it based on “Ra'ui”  philosophy. The director of the marine protected area Marae Moana, was dismissed.

name: Derrame de crudo de Repsol en La Pampilla, Peru
headline: An unprecedented ecological catastrophe on the Peruvian coast by an irresponsible company and a condescending government that adds to the hundreds of spills in the Amazon

name: Algarve Livre de Petróleo, Portugal
headline: Oil and gas exploration on Southern coast trigger opposition among local population, small entrepreneurs whose income depends on tourism and small business. The government seems deaf to their claims but can't ignore the anti-extraction coalition

name: Bumitama Agri Oil Palm plantation, Indonesia
Oba airport, land conflict and sand mining, Nigeria
headline: Disputes over ownership of land allocated for the abandoned Oba airport project led to protests and violence. Illegal and dangerous mining of sand and laterite at the site has caused gully erosion that places homes and roads at risk of being washed away.

name: Tala de árboles en eje vial Zaragoza, Ciudad de Querétaro, México
headline: En la ciudad de Querétaro pobladores y ambientalistas se oponen a la una reestructuración vial por la tala de arboles y el proceso de gentrificación que generaría.

name: Delong Nickel Industrial Area, Sulawesi,  Indonesia
headline: Delong Nickel Industrial Park, one of the largest ferronickel and stainless steel industrial parks in Indonesia, with captive CFPPs, faced social,  environmental, and labor complaints and violent protests.

name: Nuclear energy programme in Sri Lanka
headline: Assisted by India and the IAEA, Sri Lanka is developing its Nuclear Energy Programme. Environmentalists complain about the programme and argue that Sri Lankans' renewable energy sources can meet energy requirements, if they are properly managed

name: Xiangguang Copper Co., LTD., Yanggu, Shandong, China
headline: A writer disclosed water pollution by Xiangguang Copper in Yanggu, Shandong Province and recalled the conflictive history of the local residents with the company. However all this was denied by the company and the government.

name: Oil Pipeline Doba-Kribi, Chad-Cameroon
headline: The Chad-Cameroon oil pipeline has had negative impacts on local population livelihood and is a meager source of income for alleviating poverty.

name: Resistance to fracking projects, Algeria
headline: Fossil-fuel reliant Algeria has announced that it intends to tap into its shale gas reserves, which stand as the third largest in the world, which would then supply the European gas market.

name: Renuka Dam Project, HP, India
headline: High consumption of few elites and bad management of a thirsty Delhi are  drying up Himalayan rivers amidst lack of clarity and transparency by the government

name: Copper/gold mining, nuclear power in Nagleyngyn, Arctic Russia
headline: Rosatom started to build five floating NPPs in the Chukotka Peninsula to serve mining projects. Indigenous people and local EJOs strongly oppose the project protecting environment and traditional values.

name: PT PHS conflict, Sumatra
Phosphate Mining in Gafsa, Tunisia
headline: Important phosphate mine in Gafsa region. Lack of employment. Working conditions are poor, while pollution affects resident’s health and the water supply.

name: Chatrapur Thermal Power Plant, Orissa, India
Lithium in the Salinas Grandes Basin and Laguna de Guayatayoc, Argentina
headline:
Communities have increased their organization and delayed lithium projects. But the area continues to be of growing interest to lithium mining and technology companies._x000D_
No se han creado procedimientos que garanticen la participación y otros derechos

name: Privación del derecho al agua en San Isidro el Marqués, Mexico
headline: El corte de suministro del agua se usa como coacción para contratar el servicio con operadores privados, un modo de operar que ha ido en aumento en la ciudad de Querétaro.

name: Proposed Crandon Mine in Northeast Wisconsin, USA
Water pollution in the Yueyang and Xiaowu rivers in Boshan District, Zibo City, Shandong Province, China
headline: Coal mine closure leads to rebound in groundwater levels and increased iron content in river water forming "small yellow river". Satirical, artistic protests.

name: Palmer Renewable Energy Proposes Biomass Waste Incinerator to be Constructed in Springfield, Massachusetts, USA
headline: Residents oppose the construction of a biomass incinerator which would worsen air quality and exacerbate medical problems in Springfield.

name: Desplazamientos forzados desde los Parques Nacionales Laguna del Tigre y Sierra del Lacandón, Guatemala
headline: Más de 60 mil personas de 54 comunidades campesinas sufren el desplazamiento forzado por las políticas excluyentes para la conservación de áreas protegidas instauradas por el gobierno de Guatemala.

name: Desert Sunlight Solar Farm, California, USA
headline: Concerns emerged over possible environmental impacts from one of California's largest (550 MW) solar photovoltaic power plants.

name: Antipollution protests against JinkoSolar Company, Haining, Zhejiang, China
headline: Solar is not necessarily clean. The massive production of panels and improper management of polluting agents contaminate waters and soils. 500 local farmers and residents gathered in 2011 at the JinkoSolar plant to demand an end to the pollution

name: Rovni Dam at the Jablanica River, Serbia
headline: Despite the protest from local people, the Valjevska Gračanica monastery have been submerged as result of the construction of the Rovni dam.

name: Hidrosogamoso dam, Colombia
headline: Displacement, grab of sources of livelihood, militarization and misrecognition of all such impacts on the affected peoples. All ingredients for one of the most controversial dam projects in Colombia

name: Copper-nickel project Inari, Finland
headline: Strong preventive precaution against copper-nickel mining by Swedish "Arctic Minerals" company have been taking place in Inari. Sami peoples, the Council and the local government joined forces in explaining how mining is not welcome.

name: Relleno sanitario Doña Juana, Colombia
Dabaa Nuclear Power Plant, Egypt
headline: Egypt’s first nuclear power station has been controversial since its announcement in 2010 and was met with opposition from the local community who raised environmental concerns about the potentially devastating effects of the station.

name: Florestaminas and Replasa plantations, Brazil
Eucalyptus Plantations Aracruz / Fibria Celulose, Brazil
headline: The Atlantic rainforest and food growing areas were lost to eucalyptus plantations for celulose exports by Aracruz (Fibria). Local communities claim the recovery of their ancestral lands. New conflicts arise with transgenic eucalyptus.

name: Exploración de petroleo en Bloque 7 y 21, Ecuador
headline: La historia de la explotación de los bloques 7 y 21 en la Reserva de la Biosfera Yasuní y territorio Huaorani

name: Chone Multipurpose dam on Rio Grande, Ecuador
headline: Promoted for development and flood control, the complex water deviation infrastructure will likely favor other industries and disrupt local productive agriculture. The dam was finalized in 2015.

name: Calcite mining in Nimmalapadu village, AP, India
Proyecto Hidroeléctrico binacional Garabí-Panambí, Brazil-Argentina
headline: Garabí-Panambí is a binational mega dam projected since the 70s to be built on the Uruguay River. Although still not in construction phase and with important local opposition, the dams continue to be a strategic project.

name: Las Huaquillas against Sulliden, San Ignacio Cajamarca, Peru
headline: In 1997 the Canadian mining company Sulliden and its subsidiaries start gold exploration. A chemical accident attracts local opposition backed by the Catholic Church. The project stops in 2005, perhaps only temporarily.

name: Hacienda Las Pavas, Colombia
Crucitas, Costa Rica
Local opposition to the Seagreen offshore windfarm, Montrose, Scotland
headline: What is set to be the world's deepest foundation offshore wind farm continues to face some opposition from conservationist organizations, environmental justice actors and trade union members.

name: Radioactive Waste on Skull Valley Goshute Indian Reservation, USA
Mairykhsky and Beyskiy-Zapadniy areas of the Beyskoye coal field, Russia
headline: The government, coal companies, the police, and security agencies use oppression methods to stop or prevent the activities of activists, journalists, and Indigeouns defenders speaking up against coal mining

name: Borj Chakir Landfill, Tunisia
headline: Since 1999, the Borj Chaker open dump has been receiving Municipal Solid Waste from all the Greater Tunis area. The constant mismanagement has left the inhabitants of surrounding villages in dire living conditions.

name: Kropz Phosphate Mine in West Coast National Park, Elandsfontein, South Africa
headline: Environmental activists and organizations, state departments, and residents have been pursuing legal action to revoke Kropz's permits for its Elandsfontein phosphate mine for  years.

name: Eucalyptus monoculture expansion in Bahia, Brazil
headline: Environmental and human rights activist, Rosane Santiago Silveira was brutally tortured and murdered in the city of Nova Viçosa (Bahia, Brazil) on January 29. She was opposing land-grabbing due to eucalyptus plantations

name: Yoshima Thermal Power Station, Iwaki city, Fukushima, Japan
headline: Coal-Fired Power Plant in Fukushima switched to Biomass Wood Chips after strong opposition from the residents and Environmental NGOs.

name: Plan General de Ordenación Urbana (PGOU) atravesando la Huerta de Valencia, Spain
Municipal Waste in Kraljevo, Serbia
Oil palm plantations in the Bajo Agúan, Honduras
Minera Real de Angeles, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: Minera Real de Angeles did not comply with its legal obligations for mine closure. SEMARNAT fined the company but the fine was not paid. There is a court case going on.

name: Large-scale logging in Białowieża Forest, Poland
headline: This is one remaining part of the primeval forest that used to stretch across the European Plain. Logging limits have been largely expanded, threatening giant spruce trees, oaks and ash trees, and the European bison.

name: Arco Poniente, Puebla, Mexico
headline: A 42 km highway in Puebla, connecting Atlixco y Texmelucan, destroying an agricultural area and depriving many farmers and landless peasants of livelihod.  Leaders of resistance such as Abraham Cordero were imprisoned.

name: PT PHP conflict, Sumatra
2nd Chennai airport in Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India
headline: Moves to acquire farmland in 20 villages for a proposed 2nd Chennai airport in Sriperumbudur met with opposition from affected people. On 12th August 2010 police charged on 3,000 protesters, 20 people needed hospital treatment for their injuries.

name: Hamilton Aerotropolis - Airport Employment Growth District, Ontario, Canada
headline: An Aerotropolis (or Airport Employment Growth District) taking up 555 hectares of farmland around Hamilton Airport was approved in spite of local opposition. An appeal highlighting the availability of brownfield land as an alternative was unsuccessful.

name: Heyuan coal-fired power plant (Phase II), Guangdong, China
headline: April 2014, residents staged sit-ins, organized marches after collecting tens of thousands of signatures to protest the expansion of Heyuan CFPP and the expected increase in pollution.

name: Kinder Morgan Trans Mountain Pipeline Expansion Project, British Columbia, Canada
headline: The very controversial Kinder Morgan Trans Mountain Pipeline Expansion is a USD 3.5 billion dollar project that would establish a new pipeline twinning an existing pipeline from Strathcona County, Alberta to Burnaby, British Columbia.

name: Eco Resort by Con Dau Village, Vietnam
headline: Forced evictions, violent crackdowns and torture are turning the small catholic farming and fishing village Con Dau into a so-called "eco-resort"

name: Logging in San Fernando, Mindanao, the Philippines
headline: After mobilization and occupation of roads and public places in the city of San Fernando and in Manila, the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) banned commercial logging in San Fernando.

name: Chitwan National Park: a violent conflict on resource use rights in Nepal
headline: Relocation, corruption and murders against the Tharu indigenous communities at the Chitwan National Park in the name of conservation.

name: Hatgyi Dam, Myanmar
Nuclear power station in Doel, Belgium
headline: Doel is a cracking, often malfunctioning and already sabotaged plant with possibly the largest number of people living in its near proximity of all nuclear power plants. After more than 40 years of operation, it's time to close it down.

name: Oil Spill at Ojobo Community, Nigeria
Preston New Road Fracking Site (aka Little Plumpton), Lancashire, UK
headline: Community groups tried many routes to prevent a UK energy company from fracking in Lancashire. The company's licence was granted after central Government intervention; activists appealed. They won in 2019 as the company withdrew.

name: Shale gas and fracking, Denmark
Residents protest against foul air in Weiyuan County, Sichuan, China
headline: Protest against pollution in Weiyuan, Sichuan turned violent as residents demand the shutdown of factories blamed for pungent air. Students from the neighbouring middle school pushed down the school gate and tried to rush out joining the protest.

name: Proyecto inmobiliario “Bosques del paraíso” y deforestación en una comunidad Otomí, San Francisco Magú, México
headline: La comunidad Otomí de San Francisco Magú defiende el bosque frente a intereses inmobiliarios con autogobierno comunitario y reforestación.

name: Cobalt Mining in Bouazar and workers' struggle, Morocco
headline: 1,200 miners are working under conditions akin to slavery, more than six hundred meters below the surface without any safeguards against the risk of landslides.

name: Proyecto minero El Cofre y contaminación del río, Perú
headline: A pesar de acuerdos de compensación, la empresa CIEMSA sigue generando contaminación del agua. La población responde con un paro y acciones de sabotaje para defender sus comunidades y sus fuentes de vida

name: Meinung dam and Yellow Butterfly valley, Taiwan
headline: The controversy over the proposed Meinung dam began in 1992. It would damage the local Hakka population and also the biodiversity of the Yellow Butterfly valley. The project was stopped.

name: Casa Pueblo, Puerto Rico
headline: Generated out of the resistance to mining operations, this initiative has strengthened community participation and education on matters pertaining the conservation of natural resources, living space and cultural heritage

name: Ohrid-Prespa Biosphere Reserve threatened by tourism plans, Macedonia
headline: Wetland drainage, an express road, a ski-resort & tourism development zones imminently threaten ancient Lake Ohrid, National Park Galichica & the UNESCO Ohrid-Prespa Biosphere Reserve.

name: Shell Brazil & BASF pesticide plant, Brazil
Mafasir Yatta's water pipelines cut by Israeli occupation forces, Palestine
headline: Mafasir Yatta villagers set up pipelines that would solve their water drought and cost problems; the Israeli government destroyed the pipelines after 6 months.

name: Integrated Kashang Hydroelectricity Project, HP, India
headline: ADB funded project under clean energy programs are often not so green. Local people highlight heavy impacts on the environment, aggravated by multiple infrastructure and underestimated by poor environmental impact assessments

name: Margalla Tunnel Project, Pakistan
headline: A tunnel was planned to be constructed through Margalla Hills, connecting Islamabad with Haripur. It would have caused environmental impacts as well as disrupt the settlements living in the mountain. Citizens protested this and stopped the project.

name: Ecoamerica SAC failed agriculture project in San Martin, Peru
Deadly landgrabbing in Hacienda Dolores, Porac, Pampanga, Philippines
headline: Farmers struggle against land-grabbing for urban and luxury development. Company guards have been legally harassing, intimidating, and violently repressing opposition since 2005.

name: Jiasa River Hydropower Station dam threatens Green Peafowls, Yunnan, China
headline: A large hydroelectric project has been ordered to halt the construction as it threatens the last major habitat of the endangered green peafowl. It is the first public interest litigation on biodiversity in China.

name: Sakatti Mine, Finland
headline: In the Arctic, resource extraction has been increasing since 2005. In the municipality Sodankylä, the mining company Anglo American has underway a controversial project for cobalt, nickel, copper and other metals.

name: Datang Coal-to-Gas project in Hexigten Banner, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: In November 2014, Greenpeace published a report pointing to the environmental pollution issues of the Datang Keqi Coal-to-Gas (CTG) project, including illegal waste water discharge and air pollution.

name: Kunlong (or Upper Thanlwin) dam on the Salween River, Myanmar
headline: The 1,400 MW Kunlong dam on the Salween River would irreversibly destroy a unique ecosystem and the livelihood basis for many villagers. The project faces strong opposition from civil society groups and activists.

name: Artisanal and small-scale gold mining in Portovelo-Zaruma, Ecuador
headline: This ASGM district is the oldest and largest of its kind in Ecuador. Mercury/cyanide pollution, earth's subsidence, transboundary water issue. Conflict related to regulation and civic resistance.

name: Grassroots Seed-Conservation Movement, Greece
headline: Seed conservation despite the crisis; communities leading transformation in Greece

name: Jharia Coalfield Fire, India
Jarch Management Land Deal in Mayom County, South Sudan
US Capital Energy drilling in Sarstoon-Temash National Park, Belize
headline: Mayan and Garifuna communities opposing oil exploration; despite a Supreme Court decision, the company seems to have started operations

name: Amayapampa and Capasirca's masacre, Bolivia
Apropiación de las aguas del Rio Corneja y del Alberche para su comercialización, Ávila, Spain
headline: El Valle del Corneja un territorio con recursos naturales estratégicos para la reproducción social y económica de las comunidades locales que alberga,  se encuentra bajo el punto de mira del extractivismo desde principios del s. XXI

name: Suárez, Cauca, Colombia
Waste water collection and treatment project on the Banlozi Roma settlement, Bosnia & Herzegovina
headline: Green city development project proposed in a Roma settlement without water and sewage. The project includes municipal sewerage network and waste treatment from coal mines, and it means that Roma are displaced or left homeless.

name: The Cattenom Nuclear Power Plant, France
headline: The Cattenom nuclear power plant poses a big threat to its surroundings due to a lack of safety. Several incidents have already shown that it is urgent to shut the reactor down as soon as possible.

name: Henan Xinxiang Hongda Paper Industry Co. Ltd.  causing water pollution, China
headline: Villagers protested for years against the groundwater pollution of a major paper mill. A leading activist was sentenced to 3 years in prison.

name: Cerro Paramo de Miraflores, Colombia
East Side Coastal Resiliency Project in the Lower East Side, New York, USA
headline: “To say that I was angry would be an understatement. It was like, How could you do this to me? I thought we were friends.” -Trevor Holland, local resident

name: Monocultivos amenazan La laguna Matusagaratí, Darién, Panamá
headline: La privatización de tierras en La Laguna Matusagaratí para favorecer los monocultivos de palma aceitera y arroz ha llevado a la contaminación y desagüe de 30.000 hectáreas

name: Pak Lay dam, Laos
headline: Laos officially notified in June 2018 its intention to build a new dam in the Mekong mainstream despite concerns regarding its social and environmental impacts

name: Baglihar Hydroelectric Power Project, India
Karameh Dam, Jordan
headline: The Karama Dam, with a capacity of 55 Million m3, was constructed in 1995 on Wadi Mallaha  in the Jordan Valley area in order to store water for irrigational uses. The dam was constructed in spite of experts’ warnings on many levels.

name: Dirty and dangerous shipbreaking in Alang, India
headline: Shipbreaking is the process of dismantling an obsolete vessel’s structure for scrapping. Alang-Sosiya has been the largest yard in the world.

name: Quirimbas Community Carbon Project, Mozambique
Electrosteel plant in Siyaljori, Jharkhand, India
City hall hampers the activities of waste pickers' cooperatives in São Paulo, Brazil
headline: São Paulo City Hall makes new bureaucratic demands that cause the disabling of 27 of the 49 waste picker cooperatives and directly harms about 750 families.

name: “No a la minería”  in Zacualpán, Colima, Mexico
headline: The local population resist against mining by  a Canadian company. The contamination of water sources, along with dust and soil pollution, would have consequences on people’s health. The community  voted against mining.

name: Kuokuang Petrochemical Technology Company, Taiwan
headline: The Taiwanese state-owned Kuokuang petrochemical project met its end in 2011 due to objections from farmers, local residents and environmentalists, seeing probably the strongest public opposition to an industrial project in Taiwan.

name: Unequal access to safe drinking water in San Joaquin Valley, USA
Michelin Rubber plantations, Nigeria
Shintech PVC Plant in Convent, LA, USA
Delays and misconducts in Forest Rights Act in Dhamtari district, Chhattisgarh, India
headline: The rights of Adivasis over forests are often sacrificed for the benefit of mining. But here even without mining prospects, the government and forest officials do not respect the FRA. Women in particular are denied forests rights.

name: Contaminación por el Botadero K´ara K´ara, Bolivia
headline: A large waste dump  in Cochabamba that was meant to be closed down in 2010, but is still open. There have been tyre fires.  Neighbouring settlements complain.

name: Nadzab Airport Redevelopment Project (NARP) and Airport City, PNG
headline: Gabsongkeg villagers impacted by Nadzab Airport upgrade make repeated calls for consultation, participation and provision of vital facilities. State assumptions of patrilineal clan descent have marginalised women in land-related negotiations and decisions

name: Wuguiqiao Coal Mine in Zhumadian, Henan, China
headline: In May 2014, hundreds of local farmers blocked the gate to the coal mine in Wuguiqiao (Zhumadian, Henan) to protest against the (over) exploitation of coal mines that led to the subsidence of villages, flooding of fields, and cracking of houses.

name: Baiyinhua Coalfield, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: The four coal mines at Baiyinhua coalfield have led to the pollution and ecological degradation of the grassland and caused damage to the environment and livelihood of local pastoralists. Chinese NGO CBCGDF filed public interest litigations in response.

name: Mina de plata Quiruvilca, La Libertad, Perú
headline: Los pobladores reclaman desde hace años por la contaminación del río Moche por relaves de la minera Quiruvilca propiedad de Pan American , nadie se hace realmente responsable de esta grave contaminación que afecta pastos, peces, productos agrícolas, aguas

name: Gripen Gas, Öland, Sweden
Proyecto Hidroeléctrico El Cimarrón, El Salvador
headline: Desde 1997 el pueblo salvadoreño ha logrado impedir la construcción de una cuarta hidroeléctrica en el Río Lempa. Sin embargo hasta la fecha las comunidades siguen alerta.

name: Bara thermal power plant, Allahabad, India
Pak Mun Hydropower Dam, Thailand
Kediri Airport, Indonesia
headline: Construction of Kediri Airport impacted on residents of six villages, damaging their quality of life and livelihoods. Many complained of low compensation and a small number who remained suffered high levels of dust and noise from construction works.

name: Expansión portuaria en La Punta, Valencia, España
headline: Para 2020 se reactiva el conflicto en La Punta, Valencia, tras el anuncio de que se aprobará el PE para desarrollar la ZAL.

name: Wackersdorf nuclear reprocessing plant, Baviera, Germany
headline: The nuclear reprocessing plant at Wackersdorf in Baviera, planned in 1982, was discontinued in 1989 because of very strong protests, and the availability of alternative facilities at The Hague (France) and Sellafield (UK).

name: Suzlon Energy windfarms in Kutch District, India
headline: Large-scale wind power farm of Suzlon company is being deployed on the coast and wetland of Kutch, Gujarat, displacing people and threatening wildlife.

name: Cameco/Areva uranium extraction, Saskatchewan, Canada
headline: The Cameco/Areva deal encounter strong opposition from some but not all members of Dene community who believe they have been forcibly silenced and have not been included in the process.

name: Solvay and the Calanques, Marseille, France
headline: A social movement against quarries and  industrial waste, in a beautiful coastal landscape. Widespread protests in 1910 in defense of culture,  aesthetic values, and regional identity.

name: Incinerador de desechos urbanos de Acerra
headline: Después de años de movilización contra la implementación del incinerador, en 2009 la planta de desechos de Acerra a la energía entró en funcionamiento.

name: Off-shore wind mills project next to the island of Oleron, France
headline: Since 2014, the French State planned to build a  windmills park near the coast of Oléron island (largely extended in 2022). This was resisted by environmental groups, local fishermen and population.

name: Forced Eviction from Nagarhole National Park, Karnataka, India
headline: For forty years, a large number of tribal people have been  evicted from the Nagarhole National Park (a Tiger Reserve), sometimes with relocation and compensation.

name: El Quimbo hydroelectric project, Colombia
headline: El Quimbo hydroelectric dam is located in the upper reaches of the Magdalena River. According to Asoquimbo, 17 000 people have been displaced.

name: Boral Basin Development Project, Bangladesh
headline: The longest human chain was organised to save the Boral River in Bangladesh

name: Hunter Valley Coal, New South Wales, Australia
headline: Communities, Greens Party, health professionals and local government councillors contest coal production in the Hunter Valley. Activist Wendy Bowman is 2017 Goldman Prize Recipient for Islands and Island Nations

name: Thermal power plant Stanari, BiH
headline: Foreign companies and the China Development Bank fostering coal-fired economy in BiH. Coal concessions entail also fresh water extraction permits. Campaigners of "Stop Dirty Energy, Future is Renewable" question government's energy plans

name: Minera Las Palmeras en el Santuario Nacional de Tabaconas en Cajamarca, Peru
headline: In an area of conservation, conflict between local population led by "ronderos" and supported by the Catholic Church, against mining company. A new pilgrimage rite is introduced.

name: PTPN XIII conflict, Kalimantan, Indonesia
Palm oil plantations in Lokutu, Yaligimba, and Boteka, Agro-Colonialism by Feronia Inc., RDC
headline: Feronia Inc. plantations in DRC, a case of agro-colonialism, violate human and labor rights with no accountability and with the complicity of British, American and European development aid agencies.

name: New Hampshire's Granite Bridge Gas Pipeline, United States
headline: Fracking companies produce demand for natural gas in order to expand infrastructure. New Hampshire residents do not fall for the ruse.

name: Controversial coal-fired power plant built in MCL Cement factory, Mon State, Myanmar
headline: Thousands of residents, monks and local civil society organizations mobilize to halt the coal-fired power plant in Kyaikmayaw Township, demanding the use of cleaner energy sources.

name: Palm Oil Monoculture in the Choco, Colombia
headline: Palm oil monoculture growing on the lands of the people evicted between 1996 and 1997.  Afro and indigenous communities living in the area are strongly opposed to these monocultures.

name: Chimanimani Diamond Mining, Zimbabwe
Mt. Canatuan Gold Mine on Subanon Ancestral Lands, Western Mindanao, Philippines
headline: Sacred lands and Philippines’ corporate gold rush: the Subanon indigenous oppose the destruction of their sacred Mountain Canatuan by the Canadian mining company TVI Pacific Inc.

name: Desalojo de comunidad de montubios, Colimes, Guayas, Ecuador
headline: Human right organizations and FIAN (international organization for the right to adequate food) have fought against the eviction of Montubio small farmers.

name: Colquijirca, El Brocal, Perú
Coal Power Plant in Lamu, Kenya
headline: The kick off the construction was planned for December, 2015. Amu Power Company would build a very large  power plant fuelled with South African coal. There is local and international opposition.

name: Coal mining accident in Berguedà, Catalonia. Spain
headline: Coal mines, the two worst accidents in Catalonia were in the Consolation mine on 3 November 1975 with the death of 30 miners, and before that, in 1944, 34 miners died in la Mina Clara in  L'Espà.

name: Successful protests to remain a shrimp-free zone in Polder 22, Khulna, Bangladesh
headline: In the widespread resistance to the Bangladesh shrimp industry, a special case is the relative success of Polder 22 in remaining a shrimp-free zone. In 1990 the  landless leader Karunamoyee Sardar was shot and killed.

name: Ashaninka community against Tawaya biopiracy, Acre, Brazil
headline: What was started as an empowerment project for the local indigenous community, turned into a legal dispute about the commercial use of traditional indigenous knowledge that left the community without much economic benefit or recognition.

name: PPT case: Mekorot and water supply, Israel/Palestine
headline: Since its foundation in 1937, Mekorot has restricted water supplies to Palestinian communities in order to supply Israeli settlers in what has been condemned as a water apartheid

name: Sugarcane plantations in the Cauca Valley, Colombia
headline: Large-scale sugarcane plantations across Cauca Valley have resulted in land loss, damage to water resources, health problems, displacement, and violence

name: Meja thermal power plant, UP, India
Luhri Hydro project on Sutlej river, HP, India
headline: After protests of the local inhabitants, ADB and the companies have to change the dam scheme. “Reduction in capacity is not a solution. The project must be scrapped”: local villagers met with investors and officials and made the World Bank withdraw

name: Ixtacamaxtitlan, proyectos mineros empresa canadiense Almaden, Puebla, Mexico
headline: Communities complain locally and also in Vancouver against the minera Almaden's diverse projects in the Sierra Norte of Puebla, they are against exploration for gold and silver.

name: Pueblos yek’wana y sanemá afectados por minería ilegal de oro en el Alto Caura, Venezuela
headline: Strong mercury contamination in the Alto Caura by illegal gold mining, seriously damaging local indigenous populations. Sporadic resistance.

name: Extracción de gas en el lago Bomba
headline: Extracción de gas en Bomb (CH): una batalla ambiental victoriosa en el área de Abruzzo.

name: Contamination of Lake Titicaca, Peru
headline: Pollution in Lake Titicaca threatens human health, local fisheries and also the survival of giant frogs. There is waste from mining coming into the lake. Maruja  Inquilla is a peasant activist who has been threatened.

name: Antapite Huancavelica, Peru
Dow Plaquemines LA, USA
Multiple Spills in Biseni, Nigeria
Famatina gold mining, Argentina
headline: Famatina remains under the constant threat of mining projects, which have been so far successfully repealed by the continuous efforts of the neighboring communities. New campaign to create a national park and protect the mountains.

name: Vilappilsala waste plant, Kerala, India
Mechanized stone mining killing rivers, Bangladesh
headline: Mechanized stone crushing inflicting devastating impacts on rivers in Bangladesh, in Jaflong (within the rivers Piain and Dawki) and Bholaganj (within the river Dhala).

name: Reserva Nacional de Tariquia y oposición a hidrocarburos, Bolivia
headline: There is a pattern in Bolivia of expanding the frontiers of extraction. The Tariquia reserve in Tarija is threatened by oil and gas exploration. Local peasant unions are against the project,  they have supporters outside.

name: Mina de oro y plata Marlin, Guatemala
headline: En julio del 2012 un Tribunal internacional de opinion condenó los daños causados por Gold Corp en Marlin (y en otras minas en Centroamerica) a la salud de las personas

name: Vila Nazare resists against Porto Alegre Airport Expansion by Fraport, Brazil
headline: More than 2000 families are under threat of eviction because of the expansion of a runway to park wide-body planes in Vila Nazaré, Porto Alegre.

name: Parque Fotovoltaico Yucatán Solar, Valladolid, México
headline: Un proyecto solar  ha causado la deforestación de 200 hectáreas de selva, poniendo en riesgo el patrimonio biocultural de los pobladores, incluyendo un cenote sagrado.  La empresa ha descalificado y presionado en repetidas ocasiones a los defensores.

name: Piper Alpha oil and gas platform disaster in central North Sea, Scotland
headline: On 6 July 1988, explosions ripped through the Piper Alpha platform. Engulfed in fire, over the next hours the topside modules collapsed into the sea. 167 men died and others were injured.

name: Hydropower plant and National park Djerdap, Serbia
headline: Construction of HPP and establishment of National park in the 1970s had an important impact on the local way of life and ecosystem of the Djerdap gorge which led  to only a silent conflict by the affected local communities

name: Exxon Valdez oil spill, Alaska, United States
headline: On March 24, 1989, the oil tanker Exxon Valdez struck Bligh Reef in Prince William Sound, Alaska causing the largest oil spill in U.S. history. A legal battle followed to determine compensatory damages and punitive damages (in dollars).

name: PT PSA Oil Palm plantation conflict, Sumatra, Indonesia
Santa Cruz Barrillas dam and Hidralia, Guatemala
headline: Santa Cruz Barillas dam and Hidralia bringing violence, repression and impunity into local communities; the case was brought to the Permanent Peoples Tribunal hearing in Geneva. Communities finally won: in Dec 2016 Hidralia cancelled the project!

name: Contamination in El Salto, Mexico
Marathon Oil Refinery in Detroit, Michigan, USA
headline: Marathon Petroleum Corporation has a long history of inflicting environmental injustice on a low-income, mostly Black neighborhood next to their refinery. Emma Lockridge and many others fight for justice.

name: Fight Against Russian Nuclear Deal, South Africa
headline: After years of protesting and legal battling, in 2017, Liz McDaid and Makoma Lekalakala won a historic court case outlawing an enormous nuclear deal the South African government made with Rosatom, the Russian nuclear company.

name: ASU_DDT Contamination
Vijayawada Airport (VGA) in Gannavaram, AP, India
headline: Government of Andhra Pradesh realized the potential of Vijawada to be developed into a major international airport. This will expand the surface and increase the operation of national and international long-distance flights from the airport and.

name: Kohala Hydro Power Project in  Pakistan Occupied Kashmir, Pakistan
headline: Due to people's protests for concerns over ecological and social impacts, Chinese financers temporarly withdrew in December 2018. People fear this plant will reproduce distress as in the Neelum Jhelum power project

name: Hydro Power Plant Lešće on the Dobra River, Croatia
headline: HPP Lešće on river Dobra continues operating despite of the fact that it has caused many negative environmental impacts as it has been brought to the attention by the civil society organisations.

name: Kusum Tola, India
headline: Since 2009, demonstrations against  mining have taken places as the mining is polluting the water reserves of Kusum Tola and against the blasting. In Jun of 2018, the young activist, Suresh Oraon, was murdered in Jharkhand.

name: Dangjin Coal-Fired Power Complex, South Korea
headline: South Korea needs a transition away from coal. At Dangjin, the open conflict began in 2016 when environmental activists performed a street theatre play demanding the cancellation of  this and many other CFPP.

name: Contaminación por empresa de cementos en Selva Alegre, Ecuador
headline: A cement factory owned by Lafarge north of Quito is polluting the Quinde river and the surrounding populations.

name: Division Salvador - Bahia de Chañaral
Akkuyu Nuclear Power Plant, Turkey
headline: The first nuclear power plant (NPP) of Turkey will be constructed in Akkuyu, situated within Buyukeceli towns borders in Mersin, commissioned to Rosatom, a Russian state-owned company, through a direct intergovernmental agreement

name: Lack of Green Space and the Bronx River Greenway project, USA
headline: An historically depressed and polluted urban neighborhood in New York is finally developing alternatives to create green spaces and connect communities

name: S7 Polish road construction in Natura 2000 site, Poland
headline: The "Skarżyski" section of the S7 road is a project that devastates nature and violates national and EU law. Thanks to the struggles of activists, the pathology of the road construction system in Poland was exposed and a change in the law was initiated.

name: Marange Diamond Land and Human Rights abuses, Zimbabwe
Transshipment Port in the Portland Bight, Jamaica
headline: The Government of Jamaica is engaged in negotiations with China Harbour Engineering Company (CHEC) to establish a large transshipment port in the Portland Bight Protected Area (PBPA) in the vicinity of the Goat Islands.

name: Mong Kung coal mine in Shan State, Myanmar
headline: Thousands of protesters oppose the two coal mining concessions in Mong Kung that threaten the environment, livelihood and health of ethnic Shan communities.

name: Vinci's plan for a new airport mid-Nature Reserve, Portugal
headline: A second airport is planned in Lisbon, in the natural reserve of the Tagus estuary, which would have destructive consequences for local people, the ecosystem and the planet.

name: Woodlark Gold Mine, PNG
Incendio de formuladora de Plaguicidas ANAVERSA en Córdoba, México
headline: La explosión de una fábrica de plaguicidas en 1991 afectó muy gravemente la salud de la población vecina pero 30 años después ninguna victima mortal ha sido reconocida por el gobierno ni nadie fue indemnizado.

name: Oil shale production in Ida-Viru province, Estonia
headline: Large-scale oil shale is being mined in Estonia’s industrial north-east. Public figures signed a petition to the government for stopping its extraction and realign with the goals of the Paris Agreement.

name: Sumsel-1 coal-fired power plant, South Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: The construction of the Sumsel-1 mine-mouth CFPP in South Sumatra,  a project managed by PT Shenhua Guohua Lion Power Indonesia, encountered environmental, social and labor conflicts over the past years.

name: East Eagle Reliability Project in East Boston: Electricity Transmission Lines & Substation, East Boston, Massachusetts, US
headline: A new High Voltage Electrical Substation in East Boston is proposed in a densely populated neighbourhood that has historically been subjected to environmental injustices.

name: General Alvear suspende minería en el sur de Mendoza, Argentina
headline: Succesful movilizations in 2006 against megamining in Punta del Agua, department of General Alvear, province of Mendoza, because of threat of water pollution.

name: Carreteras en Purús-Iñapari, Perú
headline: Proyectos de carreteras en zonas intangibles, promovidos en nombre del "desarrollo" de la región y para el comercio con las otras regiones, amenazan integridad de poblaciones indígenas y la biodiversidad

name: NNPC pipelines' explosions, fires and spills in Ijegun's comminity and surroundings, Nigeria
headline: The Ijegun community suffered a fire from an NNPC's pipeline explosion in May 2008, at least 100 people died. Again in 2014, another explosion in Ijegun-Imore killed at least ten people.

name: Kerkennah employment protests, Tunisia
headline: The Island of Kerkennah has been the scene of increasing protests against British oil and gas company Petrofac in recent months. The protesters are demanding that Petrofac honour its engagements in local development and employment creation.

name: Çanakkale Çırpılar Coal Plant and Coal Mining Project, Turkey
headline: There is robust opposition from farmers against the 200 MW Çırpılar Coal Plant and Coal Mining Project, on Mount Ida in Çanakkale (Turkey). The plant and mine is planned on high quality agricultural lands and will grab water from irrigation pond.

name: Shrimp Cultivation destroying local livelihood, Bangladesh
headline: Cultivation of saline water shrimp on vast part of coastal area started as an industry since early 80s and reached its boom in the last few years. The sector is an hundred percent export oriented one

name: Vedanta and Konkola, Zambia
Fracking opposition, Tunisia
National Park Sjeverni Velebit, Croatia
headline: The Croatian conservationists and mountaineers opposed the construction of tourism infrastructure in the National Park Sjeverni Velebit.

name: Sasan Ultra Mega Power Project, India
Ayeyarwady Integrated River Basin Management Project (AIRBMP), Myanmar
headline: The World Bank approved in 2014 a plan to study the Ayeyarwady river, the main river in Myanmar, in order to develop the area. Local communities fear that the plan will bring new development projects that will affect their livelihoods.

name: Chevron Activities Degrade Izombe Community, Nigeria
headline: Chevron have been accused of illegal dumping of toxic waste and unabated oil spills in the area, the people demand that Chevron should take responsibility for total remediation of the area.

name: Petrochemical Complex in Itaborai, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Chevron Shale Gas, Romania
headline: Chevron closed its operations in Romania in 2015, due to the public pressure but also because of the international context (low oil prices)

name: Alamos gold mining company in Miacatlan/Xochicalco, Morelos, Mexico
headline: The Canadian firm Alamos Gold would  allegedly mine in an archeological area. Neighbours also complain about cyanide risk to water. New Mexican president, AMLO, should declare all new mining concessions void.

name: Shell's drilling for oil in the Arctic, Alaska, USA
headline: In 2009 Shell got permission from The Mineral Management Service to begin prospections for oil in the Arctic. This created great resistance from local Inuit communities and NGOs.

name: Gas Flaring In Ebocha, Nigeria
Begendik Thermal Power Plant, Turkey
Self-organized Park Navarinou and Zoodochou Pigis str., Greece
headline: The residents of Exarcheia neighbourhood, along with grassroots located in the area, converted a block into a self-organised green free space in a very densely populated neighbourhood of Athens.

name: Belcoo Community Fracking Blockade, Northern Ireland, UK
headline: Ireland is not for Shale! Keep the frogs in and the frackers out! Belcoo campaigners oppose fracking exploration activities and government stops company's exploration activities.

name: Conflicto por la tierra en el territorio indígena de Salitre, Buenos Aires, Costa Rica
headline: Conflicto para la recuperación de tierras en territorio inígena Salitre, Costa Rica. Asesinan al líder indígena bribri Sergio Rojas.

name: Slave and forced labor in the seafood industry, Thailand
headline: Forced and slave labor in the Thai seafood industry have been widespread despite government and industry commitments to undertake comprehensive reforms, which has become visible thanks to the struggle of a range of justice organisations.

name: Deforestacion en Loreto y Ucayali por Grupo Melka, Peru
headline: Deforestation and cocoa and palm oil plantations deep inside the Amazonia of Peru. Many social actors complain and environmental defenders are being criminalized

name: Socotra Island Military Takeover by UAE amid Climate Change Woes, Yemen
headline:
Socotra is threatened in 2018 by the war in mainland Yemen, but the UAE and Saudi Arabia are bringing      _x000D_
"aid" and infrastructure, endangering its unique ecosystem and many endemic species.

name: Deforestation in the sacred forest of Massaha, Gabon
headline: This case focuses on logging activity by a Chinese company in a Gabonese forest considered sacred by its residents. Residents proposed the government to sanctuarise the area in order to prevent logging.

name: Wind Farm CDM project in Kalpavalli Community Forest, Anantpur, AP, India
headline: The Nallakonda Windpower project has negative  impacts on the Kalpavalli area which was restored by a local reforestation initiative by the Timbaktu Collective

name: Kylylahti Mine, Finland
headline: Located in Northern Karelia, the mine obtained local support and was mainly seen as something positive despite its social and environmental impacts. Now, after the mine closed down, the mining company still has to restore the area.

name: Devastación ambiental por pedreras en la región de Monterrey, México
headline: En la zona metropolitana de Monterrey (Nuevo Léon) las pedreras devasten cerros y generan graves afectaciones a la salud de los habitantes.

name: Tilaiya Ultra Mega Power Project, India
Protest against commercial shrimp farming in Rufiji Delta, Tanzania
headline: The successful campaign against a large proposed commercial shrimp aquaculture in the Rufiji delta which would have otherwise destroyed the largest mangrove forest in Eastern Africa.

name: Protests in Bandung against plan for multiple incinerators, Indonesia
headline: The government in Indonesia has planned the construction of incinerators in 7 cities, despite the Supreme Court’s ruling against this construction. National environmental NGOs and residents in Bandung urge the government to stop the projects.

name: Contaminación ambiental en La Huaca por quema de caña, Perú
headline: A pesar de que se aseguró que no habría emisiones de humo a la atmósfera, la quema de la caña y el transporte en camiones genera contaminación. La empresa no se hace responsable de la salud de los habitantes locales y la gente toma la calle

name: Mulanje Massif Rare Earth Mineral Exploration, Malawi
headline: Listed on UNESCOs Biosphere reserves, Mulanje Massif is also home to locally endemic fauna and flora such like Mulanje Cider, yellow-throated apalis etc. Its various resources also constitute an essential livelihood lifeline to the indigenous population occupying the surrounding plains. Local mobilization opposes mining activities.

name: Represa Portezuelo del Viento en Mendoza, Argentina
headline: Portezuelo del Viento dam project have generated a conflict over the use of an inter-provincial basin in Argentina. In mid-2020 the conflict is unfolding among the province governments.

name: See Garden (Varna) grab, Bulgaria
Principle Capital Holdings Biofuel project in Dombe, Mozambique
Zama zama diamond mining in Kimberley, South Africa
headline: To combat violence and environmental degradation from mining companies and criminal syndicates, zama zama artisanal miners received mining permits for their own fair-trade practice with Michelle Goliath and Elisa Louw's assistance.

name: Castilla Thermal Power Station, Chile
Yanacocha Mine, Peru
headline: Minera Yanacocha arrived and still expand its operation in despite of the opposition . Contamination remain-

name: Ban Chaung coal mine, Karen state, Myanmar
headline: Indigenous Karen representatives have filed a complaint to the National Human Rights Commission of Thailand to request an investigation of alleged human rights violations caused by the Thai coal miners.

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Veracruz, Mexico
headline: “Un río que se seca es una de las cosas más tristes que podemos ver en esta vida”. Comunidades indígenas nahua rechazan esta central hidroeléctrica en el río Apatlahuaya.

name: Titanium Mining in Thuan Nam district, Ninh Thuan province, Vietnam
headline: Titanium mining in Thuan Nam district has caused health and environmental damages, while consuming scarce groundwater, needed for daily living and agriculture. Villagers strongly oppose the mining activities.

name: Hazelwood Open-Cut Coal Mine Fire, Australia
headline: The worst disaster in the history of Latrobe Valley led to damage worth more than A$100mn. A fire burnt for 45 days, releasing overwhelming smoke and ash seriously affecting the immediate and long-term health, everyday activities, homes, etc

name: Islanders resisting nickel mining permits, Wawonii, Southeast Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: Since 2007, the Wawonii residents have resisted large-scale industrial mining on the island. Protests have been violent and met by police repression. Some permits have been revoked.

name: Sakhon Nakhon Potash Mine, Thailand
headline: Villagers from Sakon Nakhon province, in northern Thailand, have raised against a potash mine that is planned in the area and whose license has been given to a Chinese company

name: Iron ore mining and mineroduct, Grão Mogol, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: Family farmers, urban populations and traditional communities of Minas Gerais are resisting a large iron ore mining project, and plans for a 480-km mineroduct in a semi-arid region, aggravating water scarcity.

name: Xiaonanhai Hydroelectric Dam on the Yangtze River in Chongqing, China
headline: China’s environment ministry refused approval for a hydropower dam on an ecologically vulnerable river already damaged by construction, a rare setback for the country’s extensive dam-building program.

name: Dolphin hunting conflict, Taiji, Wakayama prefecture, Japan
headline: During the six-month hunting season, hundreds of terrified dolphins are violently herded into a narrow cove. Most are slaughtered for meat — but scores of “good-looking” ones are captured and shipped off to aquariums.

name: Ban of rat hole mining across Meghalaya, India
headline: Coal mining, once the driver of Meghalaya’s economy, was proscribed in the state by the NGT since 2014. But it continues to be mined – illegally, and often in collusion with the authorities.

name: Oil Spill in Egbebiri Community, Nigeria
Lloyds Steel iron ore mine in Gadchiroli, MH, India
headline: Caught between police brutality, paramilitary forces and private corporations, tribals bear the brunt of 'development' amidst ongoing blatant disregard of constitutional rights.

name: Ffos-y-fran opencast coal mine, South Wales, United Kingdom
headline: Since 2003, the United Valleys Action Group (UVAG), Reclaim the Power and other groups have resisted the largest UK opencast coal mine at Ffos-y-Fran in Merthyr Tydfil, South Wales.

name: City of Trees Conflict - Haabersti Willow - Haabersti Pajupuu, Estonia
headline: Tallinn's people against Tallinn City, illegal and unnecessary logging and deforestation, bad planning, desecration of cultural and natural heritage.

name: Logging gangs and violence against indigenous environmental defenders, Maranhao, Brazil
headline: Brazil signed the Paris Agreement on Climate Change and committed to eliminating illegal deforestation by 2030. But violence against environmental defenders, corruption, and institutional and political changes threaten that goal.

name: Retortillo mine exploitation of uranium in Spain-Portugal border, Spain
headline: Mine exploitation of uranium deposit and a project of construction of a factory of uranium concentrates in Salamanca province, Spain-Portugal border.

name: Opposition to highway to bypass Strasbourg, France
headline: Opposition by "zadistes" to the construction of a motorway to bypass Strasbourg, the Grand Contournement Ouest , complaining of destruction of wetlands and protected animal species.

name: Contaminación en la presa de El Batán, Querétaro, México
headline: La Presa El Batán sufre problemas de contaminación ligados al proceso de urbanización salvaje de la zona metropolitana de Querétaro. Existe además un riesgo de cambio de uso de suelo y urbanización en la reserva ecológica donde se encuentra la presa.

name: Leasing of the Cirali Coast, Turkey
PT Karya Canggih  Mandiri Utama (KCMU) conflict, Sumatra
Chooz Nuclear Power Plant, Meuse River, Ardennes, France
headline: Early conflict  against EDF nuclear power plant (two 1500 MW reactors). Local population refused them because of risks of nuclear power. This generated violent demonstrations and sabotage. The reactors were built.

name: OCESPCC de Guerrero lamenta la muerte de Juventina Villa, Mexico
headline: Struggling against deforestation, Campesinos Ecologistas, organization founded by Felipe Arriaga, Rodolfo Montiel, Teodoro Cabrera, has suffered many killings. One more victim was Juventina Villa in 2012.

name: Lobbying for the new Mining Code and cooptation of indigenous communities along Rio Negro, Amazonas, Brazil
headline: Mining activities in the Amazonian Rio Negro region seem to undergo a revival as companies have developed strategies to increase access to minerals and a powerful lobby is pushing forward the regularization of commercial mining in indigenous territories.

name: Extension of Tucuruí transmission line to Roraima, Brazil
headline: A new government decree is advancing the start of construction of an electrical transmission line between Boa Vista and Manaus, crossing through the indigenous reserve of the Waimiri Atroari, who have been opposing the project but were not consulted.

name: Standard Gauge Railway Project Phase 1 Mombasa to Nairobi, Kenya
headline: May 30, 2017 marked the launch of the impressive Mombasa-Nairobi Standard Gauge Railway (the Madaraka Express) in Kenya, financed and built by Chinese interests. There have been some complaints by conservationists and pastoralists.

name: Water Rights of the Dineh-Navajo Tribe, USA
headline: The Navajo Nation was left out of agreements between states for allocating water from the Colorado River. One hundred years later, they are still negotiating to secure their water rights.

name: Diablo Canyon stopped for ever, California, United States
headline: In June 2016, PG&E announced it was closing down the Diablo Canyon nuclear plant, a very controversial investment since the 1960s.  No electricity will be now produced from nuclear energy in California!

name: Balbina Hydroelectric Dam, Amazonas, Brazil
headline: Widely considered as one of the worst hydroelectric projects ever realized, Balbina is highly inefficient in producing electricity and a major GHG emitter, has flooded vast areas of rainforest, destroyed local biodiversity and displaced local communities.

name: Marina Isla Valdecañas, Extremadura, Spain
headline: Next to the large Valdecañas dam in Extremadura (70 sq. km), a crazy nautical resort and urbanization plan has been fought in the courts by Ecologistas en Acción and is also in trouble because of the economic crisis.

name: Veracel Celulose, Brazil
ADB Embankment subproject in the Brahmaputra river of Kaziranga, Assam, india
headline: The indigenous Mishing communities at the fringe of the KNP, fighting to reclaim their rights to land and fair compensation against an ADB funded project.

name: Amarawewa Forest clearing for biofuel, Sri Lanka
headline: Landmark victory by Sri Lanka's environmentalists! After the mobilization by local environmental organizations the Supreme Court stated to stop a Gliricidia plantation for bio-fuel production set in a National Park which was hurting the local environment.

name: Depleted Uranium, Iraq
headline: The amount of devastation caused by the Depleted Uranium (DU) weaponry used against Iraq since the Gulf War is historically unprecedented in modern warfare and its effects on the environment and human population are catastrophic.

name: 800 MW CCGT Power Plant in Arrúbal, Spain
headline: The plant started to operate for Gas Natural in 2005, but it was sold to ContourGlobal in 2011. Its two groups of 400MW hardly operates, but when they do, they consume high amounts of water from the Ebro and emit toxics. Only few local residents mobilize.

name: Fracking de petróleo en Mendoza, Argentina
headline: En Malargüe, Mendoza, el gobierno apoya a las petroleras, mientras asambleas de agua, organizaciones ambientalistas y comunidades indígenas rechazan la actividad y promueven una ley que declara a Mendoza "Fracking-Free".

name: Toxic spill from mining company belonging to Grupo México, Sonora, Mexico
headline: Three years after  Grupo México caused a great ecological disaster (2014), the mining company owned by Mexico's second richest person, German Larrea,  allegedly has failed to fulfill its obligations to the victims.

name: "Red Adriático" METANISTUCTO MASSAFRA - Minerbio y Sulmona Compresión Central
headline: Un metanadox que cruza 10 regiones italianas y que corre el riesgo de cruzar lugares a alto riesgo sísmico, así como áreas de paisajes de alto nivel

name: National Grid's natural gas transmission pipeline in North Brooklyn, New York, USA
headline: Despite the New York state ban on fracking and in tension with CLCPA goals, National Grid is continually attempting to expand fracked gas transmission infrastructure.

name: Pungarayacu oil block, Ecuador
Golfech Nuclear Power Plant, in the Garonne river. France
headline: The undemocratic building and running of Golfech NPP has high economic and environmental costs. This nuclear power station cost billions of Euros. It contaminated the Garonne river and caused some accidents and incidents

name: Angangueo community vs Grupo Mexico, Michoacan, Mexico
headline: Grupo Mexico announced reactivation of Angangueo mine using underground mining technologies to extract silver, zinc, lead and copper. This place hosts El Rosario sanctuary that is part of the Monarch Butterfly Biosphere Reserve.

name: Remunicipalization and anti-privatization movement in Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain
headline: Social movements in Barcelona are challenging the dominant position of AGBAR-Suez in the cities drinking water supply and fight for public and democratic water distribution.

name: The retreat from Monsanto Bt cotton in Burkina Faso
headline: In 2015, some seven years after Monsanto Bt cotton was first commercially cultivated in the country at large scale, a decision was taken to return to conventional cotton.

name: Parque eólico Pililín en Cerro Oncol de Acciona Energía, Chile
headline: Old temperate Valdivian rainforest threatened by wind power project in coastal Mapuche ethnic territory. This area is rich in endemic species, one of the last untouched evergreen coastal forests, a sacred site for the Mapuche.

name: Gungormez and Bahcekoy Quartzite Mine, Turkey
headline: A quartzite mine is planned to be built in the forest area nearby the Gungormez, Bahcekoy and Sefaalani villages of the city of Tekirdag, expected to destroy the water sources and livelihoods of nearby villagers.

name: Mina Víbora y derechos de concesión, Bolivia
headline: El conflicto por los derechos de concesión de la Mina Víbora entre los municipios de Betanzos y Tacobamba comenzó por la lucha de una concesión minera y desembocó en una pugna por limites.

name: Thervoy SEZ, TN, India
Native American´s Sioux against the Dakota Access Pipeline (DAPL), USA
headline: "We are not protestors. We are life protectors": Standing Rock Sioux Tribe resist against the construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline, an 1886 km underground oil pipeline. In July 2020, a judge ordered to shut it down for violating the NEPA

name: Park church Savica, Croatia
headline: The local people of Zagreb neighborhood Savica are opposing the construction of a church in the local park.

name: Mangrove forest destroyed by Shell in the Niger Delta, Nigeria
Cochiti Dam, New Mexico, USA
headline: Cochiti Dam is a 5.5 mile long Dam forcibly placed onto the indigenous reservation of Cochiti Pueblo that represents the long and complex relationship between national interest and marginalized Native American communities.

name: The South Korean conglomerate POSCO Daewoo expands oil palm plantation in Papua, Indonesia
headline: POSCO Daewoo operates in Indonesia since 2007, through its subsidiary PT BIA. Between 2012 and 2017, PT BIA destroyed 26,500 ha of forest in connection to its concession, and has been met by resistance both locally and abroad.

name: Marcopper Placer Dome Mining Disaster, Marinduque Island, Philippines
headline: Flooded villages, toxic rivers, ill residents, children dying: The 1996 Marcopper Placer Dome mining disaster remains one of the largest environmental disasters in Philippine history. The fight for justice still goes on.

name: Imperial Metals, Mount Polley Mine, BC, Canada
Oil leak is threatening nature and local people's health, Mauritius
headline: Japanese ship MV Wakashi leaked tonnes of fuel and diesel into Mauritius's pristine nature in July 2020. Coral reefs, mangrove forests, lagoons and livelihoods of thousands of people are threatened.

name: Airport and hotel project on Fainu island, Maldives
headline: A new airport threatens to wreak ecological destruction on Fainu Island. A long stretch of white sand coastline, dense forest and agricultural land are at risk. Residents opposing the development established the #SaveFainu campaign.

name: Potosí (San Bartolomé), estabilidad geologica del Cerro Rico, Patrimonio de la Humanidad, Bolivia
'Covid Act' residential developments in Bemowo, Poland
headline: 12th section of the ‘Covid Act’ lasted 180 days in 2020, introducing a far-reaching facilitations of the construction process. Developers took advantage of this situation. The Poles will struggle with the consequences of this imprecise law for many years.

name: Land grabbing by Navy and Special Task Force, Sri Lnka
headline: 17 July 2010: 150 families in Ragamwela and Shastrawela villages violently chased from their homes by armed men and 1,220 acres of land confiscated and no one was informed for what

name: Busanga Dam on Lualaba River, DRC
headline: Villages are forced to evacuate their land to make space for the 240MW Busanga hydropower dam project of the Sino-Congolese Hydroelectric Company. The dam is part of the Sicomines agreement to extract copper and cobalt

name: Gasductos en Sechura afecta a Pescadores, Perú
headline: Construcción de gasoducto afectará a pescadores de la población de Sechura que se dedican al cultivo de concha de abanico.

name: Puerto las Américas de grupo Daabon en Bahía de Taganga, Colombia
headline: The Taganga community in the Caribbean region of Colombia is threatened by the building of a harbour for petroleum and other liquid products such as palm oil.

name: White Mesa Uranium Mill, Utah, USA
headline: The White Mesa Uranium Mill has been opposed from members of the nearby Ute Mountain Ute Tribe and local environmental organisations, because the mill contaminates local water supply among other concerns.

name: Desaguadero oil spill - Transredes S. A., Bolivia
headline: Oil spill into the Desaguadero river in 2000 still imposes a burden on the environment and the population.

name: Cobre Panamá from First Quantum Minerals Ltd, Panama
headline: The deforestation began with the exploitation of gold by the Panamanian capital company Petaquilla Gold and has continued with the exploitation of copper by Minera Panamá, a subsidiary of the Canadian First Quantum Minerals.

name: Fishmeal factory emissions in Hout Bay, Western Cape, South Africa
headline: For years, bad odours plagued some residents and businesses while other, poorer people, wanted to keep the factory running for the sake of jobs. The factory eventually closed down in 2019.

name: Hazardous garbage dumping and new waste-to-energy projects in Colombo, Sri Lanka
headline: Uncontrolled dumping has been a major problem in the Colombo metropolitan area, causing deathly contamination and disasters. Dumping has now shifted further away, WtE-plants are being constructed, but the informal recycling sector remains sidelined.

name: Shuangma No.1 Coal Mine, Ningxia, China
headline: This coal mine was involved in a water access conflict due to a viral video where a 64-year-old "internet celebrity" requested the coal mine to supply water for his tree plantations in the name of desertification control.

name: Anti-privatization of water supply and Remunicipalization struggle in Jakarta, Indonesia
headline: Privatized water management left the city of Jakarta with poor water quality and access; a civil society coalition is seeking to remunicipalize water for the public good.

name: Sime Darby plantations, Liberia
Zayandeh Roud dam and water diversion, Iran
headline: Farmers are increasingly turning to protests due to water allocation and drought. The government banned news about water allocations and protests.

name: Disputas de los indígenas del Alto Paragua en torno a la minería ilegal en sus territorios, Venezuela
headline: Intense conflict over illegal mining in the Paragua  river. Indigenous Pemon occupy Tonoro mine and start an autonomous and communitary project,  with self-defense forces. They argue that indigenous mining  can be environmentally friendly.

name: Illegal Iron Ore Mine on Bangka Island in the Coral Triangle, Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: Sea critters, fishermen and iron: The Battle for Bangka

name: Agrochemical pesticides and kidney related diseases, Sri Lanka
headline: Monsanto, Bayer and other companies importing illegally prohibited pesticides and acting against preventive measures taken.

name: Lowell mining company in Shuar territory, Ecuador
Onggi River movement, Mongolia
headline: In a long fight against gold mining with some successes, the Ongi River movement started in 2001 in response to the environmental degradation of the river basin.

name: Poçem hydropower dam stopped, Albania
headline: The first-ever environmental lawsuit in Albania concerns the Vjosa river and the future of hydroelectric plans in the country. In May 2017, a local court announced its decision against the Poçem dam project.

name: Gold and polymetallic ores mining in Brad and the battle against cyanide, Romania
headline: Brad in Hunedoara  is an old mining centre. Activities stopped in the town in 2006, with the state mines being considered inefficient. The Hunedoara Environmental Protection Agency decided against the new Eldorado project in 2013.

name: Reppardfjord/Nussir copper mining case, Norway
headline: The company Nussir ASA plans a large copper mine in the inner part of the Reppardfjord, a rich fishing fjord hosting  Norwegian and Sámi fishers.  The project also disrupts the  livelihoods of the reindeer herding Sámi community.

name: Criminal groups land grabbing farms and logging protected woodlands for avocado production in Uruapan, Michoacán, México
headline: In recent years, criminal groups have been asking for ransom, seizing lands and destroying protected woodlands in the region of Uruapan, in the state of Michoacan, Mexico. This is related to the avocado production industry.

name: Represa Urrá en el río Sinu, Colombia
headline: The Urrá dam turned upside down the Embera Katío communities' way of living and threatens the ecological biodiversity of the region.

name: Lead poisoning caused by Jiaozuo Oriental Gold and Lead Co., Ltd., Henan, China
headline: Continuing lead poisoning by a smelting company forced local villagers, especially for children and pregnant women, to migrate out and seek for a safe environment.

name: Seeds under European law, Austria
headline: The grey areas of agriculture and farmers resistance

name: Unilever refused responsability for Kodaikanal mercury poisoning, India
headline: Unilever's thermometer plant in Kodaikanal exposed many workers to mercury poisoning, without giving them any protective equipment or information about the disastrous health effects of mercury.

name: Ambassador Bridge in Detroit, USA
Barbuda Ocean Club. Antigua and Bermuda.
headline: In Bermuda, destruction of the  Codrington Lagoon, a wetland protected under the Ramsar Convention. What is planned is hundreds of luxury residences, an exclusive resort and an 18-hole golf course .

name: A2 Motorway, Portugal
headline: The second largest freeway in the country, with 240.2 km in length, was completed in 2002 but raised concerns over the Castro Verde Special Protection Area.

name: Threats facing the Tana River Primate Reserve, Kenya
Uzere Community Protest against Shell, Nigeria
Complejo de hidroeléctricas en el Río Usumacinta, México y Guatemala
headline: Proceso de resistencia binacional a diferentes proyectos hidroeléctricos en la cuenca de uno de los ríos más caudalosos de Mesoamerica. Desde los '60 la población se opone y logra pararlo hasta la fecha.

name: Thermal Power Plants in Sapeacu, Brazil
Overfishing and illegal fishing in Casamance, Senegal
Contaminación por asbesto, Colombia
headline: Campanya para la eliminación de asbesto en Colombia. La red "No mas asbesto" trabaja con sindicatos a nivel global mientras que las familias están promoviendo juicios contra Eternit por la afectación en la salud.

name: Oposición a reactivar la mina el Tránsito, Honduras
headline: Small scale gold mining opposed by the neighbours of El Transito in Departamento del Valle in Honduras. An agreement was reached in 2015 with the owner of the mine to stop mining.

name: Water contamination in the Caño Tiburones Reserve, Puerto Rico
headline: Sugar cane plantations and thermal power plant altering a delicate aquatic ecosystem. Currently the SOPI (Sociedad Ornitológica Puertorriqueña Inc.) is trying to expand the Nature Reserve to help prevent further contamination

name: Himalayan Ski Village, HP, India
headline: A luxurious winter tourist station on the Himalayan mountains; communities ally with local deities in opposing the disruption of more than 6000 ha of land and its water resources.

name: Labelling legislation for genetically modified food, Sri Lanka
headline: Thanks to the engagement of several EJO's, Sri Lanka has regulated the labelling legislations for genetically modified food since January 2007. However public institutions fail to assure that food is either GM free or labelled

name: Artisanal Small-scale Gold Mining, Uganda
headline: In Uganda, almost all artisanal gold is mined and exported illegally. Unregulated gold mining has been leading conflicts in the mining sector, smuggling of gold, child labour, human rights abuses, environmental and human health concerns

name: Conflicts within the REDD+ Oddar Meanchey Community Forests, Cambodia
headline: Different forms of forest conflicts occurred both within and between communities and powerful external actors, such as mining and economic land concession holders, the Cambodian military, illegal loggers and land speculators.

name: Nuclear waste storage in Scanzano Jonico, Italy
Mobilizing against Environmental Injustices Post-Katrina: New Orleans East, Louisiana, US
headline: For over two decades, New Orleans East has been resisting environmental injustices, from an unlined landfill post-Katrina to gas power plants.

name: Manganese mining in Chiatura, Georgia
headline: On June 9, 2021 the dwellers of village Shukruti, Georgia, ended the 31 day-long hunger strike and 110 day-long protests. Demonstrators, including 10 with sewn mouths shut, demanded compensation for environmental damage caused by the manganese extraction.

name: EXPO 2015, Italy
Conserving Bio-Cultural Diversity in the Sacred Tsum Valley in Gorkha District, Nepal
