headline: Tourism and other activities threaten to impact the natural beauty and the biological diversity maintained through the cultural and religious beliefs and practices of the Tsumba people.

name: Crisis del agua en la Zona Metropolitana de Monterrey, México
headline: A los habitantes de la gran Zona Metropolitana de Monterrey (ZMM), México se les vulneró su derecho humano al agua, por el acaparamiento de aguas para empresas cerveceras y refresqueras.

name: Hanakon Thermal Power Project, Karnataka, India
TOTAL & MOIL Bemolonga Tar sands, Madagascar
Displacement of Roma community due to reforestation in Lozenetz, Stara Zagora, Bulgaria
headline: Roma evicted due to afforestation project that never took place, in Lozenetz quarter in the town of Stara Zagora.  They got support from other Roma  in Fakulteta district in Sofia.

name: Kol Dam Hydropower Project, HP, India
headline: After investing in fossil fuels for decades, the Indian public company NTPC explores the hydro sector; its first hydel project raise protests, floods pilgrimage site and threatens a wildlife santuary. But it also faces fincancial distress.

name: Saudi airstrikes targeting farming land, Yemen
headline: There is substantial evidence emerging that the Saudis and their coalition allies are deliberately targeting Yemen’s tiny agricultural sector in a campaign which, if successful, would lead a post-war Yemeni nation into starvation.

name: Pak Beng dam, Lao PDR
headline: In 2017, the Lao government approved a controversial project to build a dam that will displace thousands of people and will affect ecosystems in the Mekong river.

name: Proposed nuclear waste storage facility in south Bruce, Ontario, Canada
headline: Proposed nuclear waste storage facility in south Bruce, Ontario, faces opposition from local farming community and residents.

name: GMOs law in agriculture and husbandry, Serbia
headline: The law which forbids growing, trade and transport of GMOs in Serbia might be changed to meet the requirements of admission to the EU and the WTO.

name: Indígenas kariña de la comunidad de Tascabaña afectados por la industria petrolera (PDVSA), Venezuela
headline: In the state of Anzoátegui, a traditional area of the oil industry, the indigenous kariña are affected in their livelihoods, mainly due to water contamination by methane gas. Their survival is threatened.

name: Paraxylene (PX) plant expansion in Pengzhou, Sichuan, China
headline: To silence the protest in Chengdu, the local government even moved the weekend dates and prevented participation in the "silent march". Project is operating but will the government manage to convince the residents about the safety of PX production?

name: Chongquing Soybean Growing and Manufacturing in Bahia, Brazil
Air pollution and land-grabbing for phosphates in Petite Mine, Sephos S.A., Senegal
headline: Sephos S.A. is about to close the Petite Mine phosphates' deposit without having profited to the local populations who faught for health and job benefits, while their cultivations were diminishing due to phosphates' dust.

name: BioPalm plantation and Bagyéli community, Cameroon
headline: A 200,000 ha oil palm concession violates human rights of hunter-gatherer Bagyéli communities in Cameroon

name: Nitta Gelatin India Ltd (NGIL), India
BT Kemi, Teckomatorp, Skåne, Sweden
Guarani people against Tenda construction company, São Paulo, Brazil
headline: Building firm fells many tees very near Guarani territory. Guaranis occupy the site demanding compliance with Brazil's Constitution and ILO Convention 169. Amid all this, a project is presented to create the Guarani Culture Memorial.

name: Proyecto Expansión Andina 244 CODELCO, Chile
headline: The extension of a very large copper mine near Santiago to be carried out by Codelco, threatening glaciers. The project stopped in 2015 because of local opposition, and the low price of copper.

name: Death of Inner Mongolian herder run over by coal truck driver led to conflicts in the region, China
headline: In May 2011, one herder in a group blocking coal transportation was dragged and killed by a coal truck,  which fueled the tension between mining groups and herders as well as between ethnic groups.

name: Tiradero al cielo abierto “Bicentenario”, Mexico
headline: Tiradero de basura al cielo abierto Bicentenario de la Independencia de México, operado por la Empresa Tersa del Golfo, Cuautitlán Izcalli, Estado de México.

name: Tourism Development on Garifuna Lands along the Bay of Trujillo, Honduras
headline: Canadian real estate developers have been trying to turn the Bay of Trujillo into a hotspot for tourism. However, the lands acquired for their developments have been communal lands of the area’s Afro-indigenous Garifuna communities.

name: Eastern Economic Corridor, Thailand
headline: The Eastern Economic Corridor is one of the flagship development projects of the Thai government. It will include new industrial areas, the expansion of ports and airports, and new railway connections.

name: Explotación petrolera en el municipio de Acacias, Meta, Colombia
Stora Enso plantations, China
Mong Kok (Mai Khot) coal mine and power station, Shan State, Myanmar
headline: Campaigns and protests by Shan and Thai groups against the coal mine and power plant have achieved to stall the project for several years.

name: Philex's Padcal mine, the biggest mining disaster of the Philippines
headline: Responsible mining? The Philex Padcal mine caused the largest mine tailing spill in terms of volumes of toxic tailings. Groups protest to stop the mine.

name: Leningrad Nuclear Power Plant II in Sosnovy Bor, Leningrad Oblast, Russia
headline: The original Leningrad NPP (1976) is being replaced by a new Leningrad NPP2. Despite protests by activists,  the new project is currently under construction.

name: Hollongi Greenfield Airport, India
headline: The Hollongi Airport project in India is causing displacement of Chakma populations, potential air and water pollution, soil contamination, and biodiversity loss. Activist organizations of the region are protesting.

name: Mina de uranio Don Otto, Salta, Argentina
headline: Exploration of uranium mine in Salta, Argentina. Uranium project stopped by mobilization of autonomous assemblies, indigenous people, farmers and other social organizations.

name: Sri Nakarin Dam National Park and Chalerm Rattanakosin Forest Reserves, Kanchanaburi, Thailand
headline: An agreement was made between the community members and park officials so that villagers could continue to cultivate and extract resources in the protected areas.

name: Cementera en Los Haitises, República Dominicana
Historic Fracking Ban Passes in Heart of “Frack Country”, USA
headline: Denton, Texas was one of the first counties in the US to experience fracking. After nearly two decades of fracking throughout the community, citizens are vigorously pursuing a ban on further drilling.

name: Wastepickers lose access to recyclable waste due to closure of a landfill, Panama
headline: Denied dump access to wastepickers in the district of La Chorrera, Panama, who might lose the only way to make a living.

name: Ganadera Bocas S.A. in Naso indigenous territory, Panama
headline: Companies' greed put Naso's territorial integrity under threat. They held protest rallies against the destruction of their land and reclaim legal recognition of their ancestral territories.

name: Earthquakes & conflict linked to fracking, Nuevo Leon, Mexico
The Guahory Crisis, Paraguay
headline: The Brazilian soy plantations are expanding in Guahory, Caaguazú, leading to the displacement of peasant families. Although the ownership of the lands is unclear, the police violently intervened to protect and support the soy producers.

name: Kilimanjaro International Airport, Tanzania
headline: Residents of eight villages, mainly Maasai pastoralists, surrounding Kilimanjaro International Airport resist moves to evict them from customary land. Ownership of 110 sq km of land has been disputed since it was allocated for development in the 1980s

name: Simhadri thermal power plant Andhra Pradesh, India
Air pollution from brick factory 'SPREMO', Serbia
headline: The brick factory in Gornja Rogatica village was using animal carcasses as a process fuel which provoked reaction by local community and activists that managed to close it in 2012.

name: Golf course and resort in agricultural land in Tiracol, Goa, India
headline: Most village land in Tiracol has been sold off by disregarding tenancy law for the construction of a luxury golf resort in Goa, leading to protests.

name: Exploration of Oil in Block 10BB and Block 13T, Turkana, Kenya
Ferrovia de Integracão Oeste-Leste (FIOL), Brazil
headline: A railroad of 1.527km long distance aiming to facilitate de transport of iron ore is threatening local communities along the path. Chinese financing is likely.

name: Roma evicted due to urban planning, Saint-Priest, Lyon, France
headline: Almost 200 Roma were evicted from their settlement allegedly due to the town of Saint-Priest's interest in the privately-owned plot of land urban development.

name: Invasión de las laderas, peñas y cerros de Hércules y la Cañada, Querétaro, México
headline: Movilización de comunidades vecinas por la alteración ecológica, vulneración hidrológica y daño cultural derivado de la urbanización de cerros y laderas.

name: Hawaiians stop telescope symbolizing Western colonisation on Mauna Kea mountain. USA
headline: Native Hawaiians oppose construction of massive telescope interfering with cultural practices related to the mountain. The project, a symbol of Western colonisation, is stopped after 5 months of protests.

name: Waste incineration in Curitiba, Paraná, Brazil
headline: Curitiba City Hall starts incineration for energy use in cement kilns. The current Minister of the Environment endorses incineration as an alternative. Waste pickers claim that this violates the National Solid Waste Plan.

name: Wind Farms in the Sustainable Development Reserve of Ponta do Tubarão, Brazil
headline: Artisanal fishermen and traditional communities who managed to obtain a Sustainable Development Reserve are now affected by the construction of wind farms destroying dunes and lagoons.

name: Irenes Serenade oil tanker explosion in Navarino Bay, Greece
headline: On February 23, 1980, the Irenes Serenade tank, loaded with around 102,660 tonnes of oil, took fire and exploded in the Navarino Bay, in Greece. Two sailors died and 4,000 tonnes of oil burned in the 14 hours fire.

name: Water conflict across two provinces on the Río Atuel, Argentina
headline: The conflict is between the provinces of Mendoza and La Pampa on the Atuel river, going back more than 60 years. Mendoza "steals" the water.

name: Eko Atlantic city, Lagos, Nigeria
Lead contamination in Santo Amaro, Bahia, Brazil
Conflicto del Plomo Boliden, Cerro Chuño en Arica, Chile
headline: Between 1984 and 1989, Chile imported 20,000 tons of toxic waste (lead, arsenic, mercury) from the Boliden company in Sweden causing death and sickness in the Arica communities, mainly children.

name: Chevron's Gorgon gas extraction meet with labour unions' opposition, Australia
headline: Labour unions across Australia, New Zealand and US join hands to oppose Chevron's unfair treatment of workers and lack of safety in one of the biggest gas extraction stations in the world

name: SEPTA Natural Gas Fired Power Plant in Nicetown, Pennsylvania, USA
headline: In an already-heavily polluted urban neighborhood of Philadelphia, a state transport authority proposed a natural gas fired power plant. Local activists and organizations rallied to protest the construction of the site.

name: LGV Bordeaux - Spain. Northern Basque Country, France
PCB Contamination in Warren County, USA
Laguna Verde, Mexico
Saving the “Last Natural River in Japan” and Nagara River Estuary Dam
headline: Debate over Building a Dam over Japan's Last Virgin River

name: El Cerrejón mine, Colombia
headline: Environmental contamination affects the company’s workers and the inhabitants of both the mining areas and the port, while international capital benefits from one of the biggest cola mines in Colombia

name: Bhushan Power and Steel Limited, Jharkhand, India
PT ICA land conflict on Sumatra, Indonesia
New Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, Uganda
headline: Batwa communities evicted and marginalized by the creation of the BINP. Limits of conservation policies towards 'community participation' approach.

name: Groundwater Contamination with Chromium-6 in Hinkley, California
headline: Residents of the town of Hinkley, California, alleged that PG&E knowingly dumped wastewater contaminated with chromium-6, a known carcinogen since 1925, into the region’s groundwater.

name: Taraira, Vaupes, Colombia
Humedal la Isla, Bogotá, Colombia
headline: La comunidad se organiza para la protección del ecosistema, el cabildo indigena muisca, la secretaría de ambiente y la alcaldía de Bogotá unen esfuerzos para cumplir los acuerdos de la acción popular.

name: Kochi paper factory producing pollution, Japan
headline: After many decades of air and water pollution,  citizen and fishermen groups in Kochi city initiated a movement to remove the paper pulp factory. They resorted to direct action. The factory closed down in 1972.

name: Mieu Mon military airport, Vietnam
headline: A land rights dispute over expansion of Mieu Mon military airport, onto farmland villagers say was unfairly taken over, escalated to deadly violence. In January 2020 a community leader and 3 police were killed in a massive police raid on Dong Tam village.

name: Closure/modernisation of Monchegorsk nickel and copper smelter, Kola peninsula, Russia
headline: Mine tailings and a smelter from the Soviet era still pollute the area around the "monotown" of Monchegorsk. There are prospects for new investments but not remediation of past environmental liabilities.

name: Water and sanitation privatization in metropolitan Manila, Philippines
headline: Success by profitability and privatization of profits, the recipe of the World Bank in one of the biggest metropolitan areas of the world to ensure its vision on the "right to water"

name: Flower market Square Redevelopment Plan, Zagreb, Croatia
headline: The citizens and NGOs managed to stop the attempt to the redevelopment of Flower market square in Zagreb after some changes to this public area were already made.

name: Korindo's oil palm operations in Gane, South Halmahera, North Maluku, Indonesia
headline: PT Gelora Mandiri Membangun (GMM), a subsidiary of Korindo Group, is operating in the Gane region since 2013. The company has been accused of human rights violations, operating without permits, and illegally burning the area.

name: Relocation of the Vreoci village, Kolubara coal basin, Serbia
headline: The process of Vreoci village resettlement to give way to the open pits for coal is riddled with many irregularities and causing numerous negative environmental and social impacts.

name: Kamoto Copper mine, Congo DR
headline: The mine operated by Glencore and Gecamines was the site of the collapse of two galleries that killed 43 artisanal miners in June 2019. Companies decline responsibility while social and environmental impacts leave local communities impoverished

name: Tansim open pit lithium mine project, Canada
headline: On the unceded territory of Long Point First Nation, the project is part of the wider objective of creating a "lithium pole" in Abitibi-Témiscamingue and in Nord-du-Québec. The first nation officially asked the government to suspend the project.

name: Bangun Nusa Mandiri palm oil plantation in Jelai Hulu, Ketapang district, Indonesia
headline: Indigenous communities of Silat Hulu see their livelihoods threatened by the establishment of a  oil palm plantation of Golden Agri-Resources.

name: Dique de colas de San Miguel, Cantumarca, Potosí, Bolivia
headline: The tailings dam of San Miguel in the community of Cantumarca accumulated over 4 million tons of tailings in 45 years with nasty environmental and health consequences. Comibol and Jungie Mining are involved in the cleaning up.

name: Proposed Windfarm on the Isle of Lewis, Scotland
headline: In the ‘Stornoway Wind Farm’ joint venture, multinational companies EDF Energy and Amec Foster Wheeler plan 36 wind turbines. However local farmers would prefer a community-owned wind farm.

name: Chota Nagpur conflict, Jharkhand, India
Potassium mining sinkholes in Berezniki, Russia
headline: Berezniki, in the Ural mountains, is disappearing into the ground. The industrial city, with a population of over 150,000, was built on top of a potash mine. Since the 1980s, huge craters gradually swallow the city.

name: Relaves mineros en el Río Pilcomayo, Bolivia
headline: Pollution by minerals in Bolivia, Paraguay and Argentina along the river Pilcomayo because of mining in Bolivia, aggravated by the breaking of tailing dams (Porco and others).

name: Central Hidroeléctrica OCO 2010 en el río Ocoña, Perú
headline: Capital mexicano invierte en producción eléctrica en Perú, afectando a la ecología y la economía local del camarón. Pescadores y concejales se movilizan y intentan parar el proyecto.

name: Somkhele coal mine owned by Tendele, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa
headline: Tendele’s coal mine leaves local communities without water. It was denounced by the South African Human Rights Commission, WoMin, The Women’s Water Assembly, for its human rights and environmental violations. Murder of local environmental activist.

name: Cerro La Jacoba, Colombia
Gyeongju nuclear waste site, South Korea
Textile industries and pollution in Tehuacan, Mexico
headline: Textile industries's water pollution in Tehuacan, also known as the international capital of Blue Jeans is threatening local livelihoods in Puebla, Mexico.

name: Conflict over Bears Ears National Monument, Utah, USA
headline: President Trump shrinks Bears Ears National Monument, opening up sacred lands to fossil fuel development.  Historic coalition of five tribes fights back.

name: Proyecto inmobiliario Lomas de Angelópolis de Grupo Proyecta, Puebla, México
headline: Un proyecto inmobiliario de la empresa Grupo Proyecta ha provocado la invasión de terrenos ejidales, redujo el acceso al agua para la población local y genero actos de violencia e intimidaciones.

name: SIFCA Rubber and Oil Palm Plantations, Liberia
Derrame de crudo en el Golfo de Morrosquillo, Colombia
headline: Desde 1993 a la fecha más reciente en 2017, se han presentado seis casos reportados de derrame de crudo en el Golfo de Morrosquillo, afectando a pescadores artesanales y pobladores. Esta situación aun no ha tenido resultados de medidas aplicadas a Ocensa.

name: Gas and oil extraction, Kamchatka, Eastern Siberia, Russia
headline: Indigenous communities, activists and the civil society have been criminalised by opposing several oil and gas project on the peninsula.

name: REDD+ pilot, Lacandon Jungle, Chiapas, Mexico
Prirazlomnoye oil field, Russia
headline: Prirazlomnoye is an Arctic offshore oil field located in the Pechora Sea, capable of extracting 5 million tons per year. In 2012-13 Greenpeace and other environmental organizations protested strongly because of the risk of oil spills.

name: Mining project Caçapava do Sul, Rio Camaquã, RGS, Brazil
headline: This project has found strong local opposition in 2017, against the wishes by Votorantim to explore for several minerals including zinc, copper, lead.

name: Hydro power plants on the River Lim, Serbia
Phosphate mining project in Lavras do sul, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
headline: Australian company claims that president of Brazil is "pro mining" and intends to extract phosphate ore and limestone as a secondary product. There is resistance and the concern that the landscapes and way of life of the pampas will be weakened.

name: Lanco Babandh power station, Dhenkanal, Orissa, India
Air pollution and nuisance in the area of Schiphol Airport, The Netherlands
headline: The Schiphol Airport activities create ultra-fine particles and noise pollution that reduce the life expectancy of those in the area surrounding the airport and a huge distress for everyone capable of hearing the noise.

name: Minería en Urrao, Colombia
headline: Areas de grande biodiversidad y abundancia de recursos se encuentran dentro del interés de empresas trasnacionales para la exploración y explotación de oro, plata y platino, denuncia la campanya “No a la Minería en Urrao”

name: InfraVest Project of Improper Wind Turbines, Yuanli, Taiwan
headline: A movement against "Crazy" Windmills by the German company InfraVest has forced demolishment of controversial infrastructure and extended to other areas like anti-nuclear power, and agrarian justices movements

name: Surf Park Saint Père en Retz, France
headline: A recreational project creates some tensions between inhabitants in search of economic dynamism and ecologists and neighbours opposed to the artificialization of the grounds.

name: Norlite Plant burning PFOA's for Department of Defense, Cohoes, NY, USA
headline: Tradebe-owned Norlite Plant burning chemical foam for US Department of Defense in Cohoes, New York, affecting residents of a nearby neighborhood. EJ mobilization managed to stop the plant, for now, awaiting for scientific tests of contaminants

name: Proyecto hidroeléctrico La Miel II, Colombia
Conflicto internacional sobre el Rio Lauca, Bolivia – Chile
headline: El conflicto  internacional entre Bolivia y Chile por el rio internacional Lauca se da a causa del desvio del curso de este por parte de Chile en 1962 para regar el valle de Azapa. El conflicto sigue vigente actualmente.

name: E.On Centrale Bois-Énergie de Gardanne, France
headline: A coal-power station is converted to (imported and local) biomass by the German company E.On. It will receive a subsidy of €900,000,000 over 20 years for this "biomascarade".

name: Denied access to water for Roma in Prasnik, Slovakia
headline: For Roma, water is a basic need which has been denied in a city rich in water and spa resorts. Other non-Roma residents, tourists, and businessmen have access to and  enjoy waters, hot springs, and luxury hotels.

name: Yuzana agricultural concession in Hukawng Valley, Kachin state, Myanmar
headline: Powerful actors behind this 81,000ha biofuels crop concession. Kachin groups resist the plantation development , demanding a return of their croplands and the protection of a very large tiger reserve.

name: Advance Agro plantations, Thailand
Logging blockade in Aalistunturi, Arctic, Finland
headline: Metsäliike Forest Movement has blocked logging activities in Aalistunturi,  Finnish Arctic, demanding  a protected area status of the site.

name: Amazon Prime cargo hub at CVG Airport, Kentucky, USA
headline: Residents living near the construction site of an Amazon Air Hub at CVG Airport filed a class action lawsuit after months of complaints about excessive dust, noise and shock waves from blasting works. An ironworker was killed in an accident at the site.

name: Midcat gas pipeline in Catalunya, Spain
headline: The Midcat is a gas pipeline that would link Spain and France with the goal of allowing an Algerian gas flow into Europe. The first phase of the project was carried out in 2012 under local resistance, and it is planned to be resumed in 2019.

name: Sinar Mas APP Group’s Forest-Pulp-Paper Integrated Project in Yunnan, China
headline: Multiple protests against a forest-pulp-paper integration project in Yunnan causing deforestation and land grabbing led to a slowing-down of its expansion in the 2000s.

name: Basurero Las Matas en Minatitlán, México
headline: Al lado de la ciudad de Minatitlán, uno de los basureros más grande del país ha generado graves problemas de contaminación ambientales.

name: Fracking in the Parana Basin, Brazil
Explotación de madera bajo el AVA-FLEGT, Honduras
headline: Garifuna people in Honduras express misgivings on a possible agreement with the EU regarding governance of wood trading.

name: Marcventure’s mining operations in Cantilan, Surigao del Sur, Philippines
headline: Marcventures mining activities threaten ancestral lands, endangered species and crucial water reserves. Several thousand villagers protest against the mine.

name: Proyecto de planta de biometano en Latina Scalo
headline: La lucha de la población de Latina Scalo contra la construcción de la planta en Biometano

name: Dhopave Thermal Power Project, Maharastra, India
Vital AD polluting Vrbas, Serbia
headline: Since 2004, Vital AD - factory for edible oil and vegetable fats - is in the focus of NGO Ekoloski pokret Vrbas due to the negative effects of its activities on the environment of the town of Vrbas.

name: Cimenterie Nationale Factory in Chekaa, Lebanon
headline: As the leading exporter of Cement in the MENA region, Cimenterie Nationale is one of the biggest industrial facilities in Northern Lebanon. High levels of coughs and phlegm have been found in the surrounding area

name: Waste dumps and plastic recycling pollution in Adana, Turkey
headline: Waste imports from the EU are piling up in Adana province, where the natural environment, residents, and waste facility workers suffer the consequences of illegal waste dumping and burning.

name: Obuasi Gold mines in Ashanti region, Ghana
headline: Obuasi Anglo Gold mine has been accused of water and land pollution for years. In 2014 the mine closed down in order to reestructure and become more efficiente, but nothing was said about the  liabilities from contamination. In 2018, it will reopen.

name: Mong Len gold mining,  Shan state, Myanmar
headline: Farmers documented the destructive activities of gold mining companies in the hills of Mong Len. They demand a stop to industrial mining and the restoration of the environment on which their livelihoods depend.

name: Uranium Extraction Plans in Saudi Arabia
headline: Saudi plans for "self-sufficient" nuclear power risk causing environmental risks,  impacts and injustices that can potentially spread to its poorer neighbours and countries in the region.

name: Concentrated Animal Feeding Operations and minority residents in Kenansville North Carolina, USA
Thjórsárver  reservoir, Iceland
headline: Hydroelectricity from Thjórsárver would have been used for the expansion of the Rio Tinto Alcan smelter at Straumsvik, Hafnafjordur. However, in 2007 a local referendum there ruled against the expansion.

name: Ntacua tree plantations in Zambezia, Mozambique
Yamuna Express way, Uttar Pradesh, India
Yozgat Uranium Mine Project, Turkey
Cheyyur Ultra Mega Power Plant, Tamil Nadu, India
Sicogon Island Tourism Estate, Philippines
headline: In the chaotic aftermath of Typhoon Yolanda authorities failed to protect residents of Sicogon from land-grabbing. Developers seized upon the opportunity to develop the island for tourism. The first phase includes an airport and beachfront accommodation.

name: Four Communities: Imiringi, Elebele,Otuasega and Oruma stage peaceful protest against Shell .
Sagay Massacre of Sugar Farmers, Philippines
headline: Nine sugar farmers were murdered in 2018 during a land occupation at the Hacienda Nene sugar cane plantation. They were unemployed (in the "tiempo muerto") and hungry.

name: Villa turística de Forti - Porto Tolle
SOSUCAM and Samdiaa sugar operation in Haute-Sanaga, Cameroon
Rio Tinto / BHP's iron mining destroys sacred Aboriginal sites, Western Australia
headline: To make way for iron mining Rio Tinto destroys Juukan George, of  significance to aboriginal people. BHP follows suit. Protests against such barbarity make companies apologize (too late) and reconsider decisions.

name: Saida Garbage Mountain, Lebanon
headline: Established in 1982, and managed by the Municipality of Saida. The dumpsite first received rubble and demolition waste from destroyed buildings but has since received all kinds of waste from municipalities of the Saida district.

name: Fábrica de amianto Uralita en Cerdanyola del Vallès en Catalonia, Spain
headline: Desde 1907 hasta los años 90 existió en esta localidad cercana a Barcelona una gran industria del amianto que dejó numerosos casos de enfermedad y muerte.

name: High Speed Two railway, United Kingdom
Upper Kengtawng dam, Shan State, Myanmar
headline: The construction of the Upper Kengtawng dam fuels further tensions in a conflict-prone area and provokes fears over heavy socio-ecological impacts on locals. Villagers and civil society organizations call for an immediate stop of the conflictive project

name: The ban on pesticides aerial spraying in banana plantations in Davao, Phillipines
headline: EJOs are seeking a response from the government by expanding the conflict on aerial banana spraying from Davao City to the entire country.

name: Gulf Coast Hydrogen Hub (HyVelocity), Texas, USA
headline: ExxonMobil plans to transform a 50-mile industrial channel into the world's largest carbon capture and storage (CCS) facility, creating the "hydrogen hub". Home to some of the biggest polluting industries in the US and supported by the US Government, clean air campaigners raise concerns over the heightened health risks for the local community.

name: Nyamjang Chhu dam and hydropower expansion in Tawang, Arunachal Pradesh, India
headline: Protests against dams started in 2011. On 2 May 2016, two protesters lost their lives in police shooting, when they supported Buddhist monk Lama Lobsang Gyatso who is also "Save Mon Region Federation" secretary.

name: PT Inti Indorayon Utama eucalyptus plantation conflict, Sumatra, Indonesia
Alto Chicama, Peru
Portland Harbor Superfund Site on Willamette River, Oregon, USA
headline: The Portland Harbor Superfund Site is an 11-mile stretch of contaminated river sediment and river bank due to industrial activity on the Willamette River in Portland, Oregon that has affected the North Portland community and others for decades.

name: Huaneng Haimen coal-fired power station, China
headline: Protests and blockades for stopping a coal power station did not achieve their goal. Repression and violence against protesters put at place while China expands energy generation capacity.

name: Plantation companies grab Orang Rimba indigenous land on Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: Since the 1970s, most of the forest managed by the traditionally semi-nomadic Orang Rimba has been converted into large-scale rubber, pulp and palm oil plantations, depriving them of the possibility to live solely in and off the forest.

name: Oil and gas prospections in the Balearic Sea, Spain
Nitrogen crisis and farmers' protests, The Netherlands
headline: Dutch farmers strongly mobilized against green reforms enacted by the government aimed at reducing nitrogen levels. The Farmer Citizen Movement (BBB) became the leading party in the 2023 provincial elections.

name: Río Atoyac (Tlaxcala-Puebla), infierno ambiental. Mexico
headline: In Alto Atoyac basin there is socio-ecological devastation  because of municipal and industrial toxic waste dumped from the industrial corridors into the Atoyac,  Zahuapan and Xochiac rivers.

name: Nickel ore exploration mining, Trstenik, Serbia
headline: Despite strong opposition by local people and authorities of Trstenik, the New Law on Mining and Geological Research from 2015 allowed for issuing exploration permits for nickel exploitation without consulting the municipal authorities.

name: Deva Muncel gold and polymetallic ores exploitation, Romania
headline: In Deva Muncel, the exploration and drilling permits were given to Eldorado Gold without a previous public consultation. All the drillings conducted in this area were made without the community consent.

name: Tribes halt Hudbay Minerals' copper mine on ancestral lands, Santa Rita Mountains, AZ, USA
headline: In 2019 , a federal judge  overturned the U.S. Forest Service’s approval of the Rosemont copper mine in Arizona.  Part of a battle across the West over the use of public land for mining.

name: Cocula, Guerrero, Mexico
Afectadas por el DBCP (Nemagón), Costa Rica
headline: Entre 12.000 y 30.000 costarricenses reclaman una indemnización económica por los daños sociales y ambientales sufridos producto de la utilización del pesticida Nemagón durante la década de los 70 en las plantaciones de banano.

name: Brokdorf nuclear power station, Germany
headline: Several events marked the beginnings of the German anti-nuclear power movement: among them, the huge protests over the Brokdorf reactor, which began in 1976 and lasted until 1986, leading to violent confrontations with police.

name: Chiquita Brands, Colombia
headline: Chiquita Brands enjoys impunity in spite of the fact it has been proved it has repeatedly remunerated paramilitary forces oppressing the local population.

name: Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor, India
headline: DMIC bringing land grab, loss of livelihood, unemployment, and larger resource grab from commons. Growing inequality and distress as per the corporate agenda. Blooming threat to democratic rights of people in states covered by DMIC.

name: The agony of the Atlantic Empress, a large sinking oil tanker in flames. Trinidad Tobago.
headline: On July 19, 1979, two VLCC tankers collided off Tobago in the Caribbean Sea.  The collision killed 27 people and spilled some 280,000 tons of crude oil, the 5th largest oil spill on record.

name: Holcim cement plant in Puttalam, Sri Lanka
headline: The biggest plant in a cement-hungry Sri Lanka threatens the health of local population, while workers complain for low wages. The Swiss company downplays their claims and continue co-incineration of hazardous and non-hazardous waste to fuel its kilns

name: Deep sea port and airport on Kalagote Island, Myanmar
headline: Residents of Kalagote island are concerned they might lose their farming and fishing livelihoods to megaprojects, including a deep seaport, airport and a bridge. They have not been informed about the plans and have formed a group to monitor the projects.

name: Bayan Obo world biggest rare earths mine, Baotou, Inner Mongolia, China
headline: The"Hometown of Rare Earth" in Bayan Obo, upon which half of all advanced technologies in the world rely, is also one of the most heavily polluted areas of the world. Local inhabitants, ecosystems, and the Yellow River are paying unbearable costs

name: Pakri-Barwadih Coal Mining in Jharkhand, India
GMR Kamalanga Energy Limited Thermal Plant, India
Jilanja Mouja-Attempted Conversion of Reserve Forests for Housing of Public Officials, Bangladesh
headline: Illegal conversions of reserve forests plots for the housing of government officials are successfully contested by civil society and the court

name: Vele Colliery Mine next to the Mapungubwe National Park in Limpopo, South Africa
headline: A coalition of locals and environmental organizations, Mapungubwe Action Group, fought against Coal of Africa's Vele Colliery Mine for over a decade to protect the Mapungubwe National Park.

name: Sabal Trail Pipeline from Alabama to Florida, United States
headline: The Sabal Trail Natural Gas Pipeline, currently under construction, covers three US States. Opposition stems from civilians and environmental groups, such as the Sierra Club, due to severe environmental impact.  However, construction pushes ahead.

name: Coal Mining Project Extirpates Burnt Pine Caribou Population, Moberly Lake, BC, Canada
headline: West Moberly First Nations went to court against the BC government over the permission of coal mining activities on critically threatened caribou habitat.

name: Metan se opone a proyecto Leon, Salta, Argentina
headline: "Por Metán no pasarán". Pressure from neighbours stops the Cerro Leon copper mining project, declaration of conservation area.

name: Land grabbing in Igbin Ojo and cargo airport construction proposal, Nigeria
headline: Villagers are resisting land-grabbing of a large area of farmland, 64,750 hectares, in Igbin Ojo, Ogun State, where a cargo airport is proposed. About 5,000 people from 20 villages could be affected. Farmers have been intimidated, their crops bulldozed.

name: Multinational Oil Companies on the Niger Delta, Nigeria
headline: Coutless number of oil spills in the Niger Delta and immunity of the responsible oil companies. Still, late 2015, Shell was held accountable by Dutch justice.

name: Spire's Natural Gas Pipeline for St. Louis, MO, USA
headline: Spire pays for its environmentally damaging pipeline installation - in some cases - while others are still fighting for justice.

name: Defence of Magdalena Teititipac against gold mining , Mexico
Al Bassa landfill in Latakia, Syria
headline: Mountains of garbage and the negative impact of Al Bassa Landfill on Latakia's environment and people

name: Salal hydro power project, Jammu & Kashmir, India
Caffaro industry contamination in Brescia, Italy
Karachaganak Oil and Gas Condensate field, Kazakhstan
headline: Local inhabitants and EJOs have long denounced severe environmental and air pollution without being heard. On November 28, 2014, a mass poisoning of children at the school of Berezovka occoured.

name: Nandi Forest Multipurpose Dam on Yalas river, Kenya
World Tristar Entertainment Ltd. land grab in the Koh Sla region, Kampot, Cambodia
headline: Evictions instead of employment: Economic Land Concessions for agrobusinesses affect Cambodia's poorest farmers.

name: Mahmoodkot power station, Pakistan
headline: In 2016, farmers successfully blocked the construction of a coal-fired power plant that was included in the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor plan.

name: Saudi Arabia land leases and dam conflicts, Sudan
headline: Sudan's traditional and pastoral communities have been suffering from the results of massive land grabs over the past decades.

name: Marine industrial aquaculture, Greece
headline: Aquaculture barons vs protected areas and local communities in coastal and marine areas of Greece

name: Proposed petroleum refinery in Ratnagiri district, Maharashtra, India
headline: Indian government's plan to set up the biggest refinery of the country in Ratnagiri district, Maharashtra faces opposition form agitated villagers and local NGOs and politicians.

name: Exposure to Agent Orange, a case of “ecocide”, Vietnam
headline: During the Vietnam War, the U.S. Air Force sprayed more than 80 million litres of Agent Orange and other herbicides contaminated with dioxin, a deadly compound that continues to poison the land, the rivers, the ocean and the people.

name: Waste Incinerator in Resnik, Zagreb, Croatia
headline: Many years of citizens and NGOs opposition to building waste incinerator in Resnik resulted in cancellation of the project by decisions of the state and city of Zagreb authorities.

name: Waste Tire Burning for Energy Production in Cemex Plant, Ponce, Puerto Rico
headline: A CEMEX cement factory is located in Ponce, Puerto Rico. In 2002 it started to burn used tires to save costs. As in many other cases around the world, the neighbours strongly complained.

name: Incineración de residuos en una fábrica de Cemex en Huichapan, Hidalgo, México
headline: El grupo local CUMA y la alianza internacional GAIA lograron que las autoridades mexicanas prohibieran la incineración de residuos en la fábrica de cemento de CEMEX en Huichapan en 2012.

name: Red Frog Beach Tourist Complex, Panama
headline: The local population achieved to contain the ostentatious deployment of the touristic complex thanks to the Court Supreme has declared in their favor.

name: Canariaco Norte - San Juan de Kanaris, Peru
Save Pulangi Alliance, Bukidnon province, Mindanao, Philippines
headline: Environmental defender Margarito Cabal was killed  in 2012. However, the 5th hydropower project in the Pulangi River that he fought against, seems to be going ahead in 2018, for a 250 MW dam.

name: Copper-nickel mining in Voronezh, Russia
headline: "Khoper is ours". The proposed copper-nickel mine in Voronezh faced strong local opposition demanding complete ban on mining activities in the entire Chernozem region.

name: Dispute over trash dumping from Canada to Manila (Company Chronic Inc), The Philippines
headline: The Philippines and Canada had a six-year dispute over 103 containers that were sent to the Philippines wrongly labelled as waste for recycling. The conflict escalated due to criticism from environmentalists, the Philippine government, and other groups.

name: Industries cause water scarcity in 5 villages, Chittagong district, Bangladesh
headline: No water to drink due to industrial withdrawal of ground water

name: Imider Silver Mine, Morocco
headline: Imider is the biggest mine on the African continent, and 7th largest producer of silver in the world. It is also home to a 5-year long fight, as a group of protesters has been living on Mount Alebban, protecting the village's groundwater.

name: Small scale land-grabbing by political and economical elites in the Central Kalahari Game Reserve, Gaborone, Botswana
headline: Botswana is placed in high danger of land-grabbing issue because of the vast rural area and the dynamic of the population. We are presenting here on of the most publicized case of land-grabbing in Gaborone: the relocation of San communities from the CKGR.

name: City of Buenos Aires installs ‘anti-poor’ waste containers against wastepickers’ rights, Argentina
headline: The City of Buenos Aires installs ‘anti-poor’ smart containers that impedes the access of wastepickers to recyclable waste. Demonstrations have been repressed with tear gas, and no dialogue has been promoted.

name: Ashaninka of Rio Amônia and Saweto against illegal loggers at border Peru-Brazil
headline: On 1 Sept 2014 Edwin Chota and three Asháninka leaders were murdered.  Ashaninka communities in this Brazil-Peru border region have long been struggling against illegal logging invasions but received public recognition for their environmental activism.

name: Standard Gauge Railway Project Phase 2A Nairobi-Naivasha, Kenya
headline: Angry people marched in the Kenyan capital Nairobi to protest plans to build a railway line to Naivasha and Kisumu over the Nairobi National Park.

name: Pak Bara deep sea port project, Thailand
headline: Satun’s Mu Ko Phetra National Park, a source of local food and major tourism income is currently threatened with disappearance for building the Pak Bara Deep Sea Project . Villagers are protesting and demanding the cancellation of this project.

name: Hidroelectricas de Atzala-Coyolapa, Puebla, Mexico
headline: Puebla is threatened by mining and dams mostly in indigenous territories. Local residents fear this new hydroelectric "proyecto de muerte" in Sierra Negra may do further damage. There is extreme violence against activists.

name: Rajpura Thermal Power Project, Punjab, India
Hydropower Plant on the River Komarnica, Montenegro
headline: The project of construction of HPP on the river Komarnica has faced opposition by the NGOs and it is currently stopped due to the potential geological problems. However, it remains considered of strategic importance by the Montenegrin government.

name: Uranium mining pollution and health threats, Gabon
Controversy over planned paraxylene (PX) plant in Xiamen, Fujian, China
headline: Opposition by scientists and journalists led to a street protest on 1 June, 2007 that was attended by 8000-10,000 local residents. This was one of the first large scale protests against PX plants.

name: Prestige Oil Spill in Galician coast, Spain
Marginalized informal recycling and the start of waste-to-energy in Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan
headline: Waste pickers in Lahore are the pillar of all recycling work, but continue to face obstacles and exclusion. Waste is handed over to the private sector and the province of Punjab is moving forward to install six new incinerators with Chinese investment.

name: Urraca Fracking Project by BNK Petroleum en Burgos, Spain
Suncor Oil Refinery in Commerce City, Colorado, USA
headline: Latinx communities organized against toxic pollution from Suncor Oil Refinery in Colorado. The facility may have polluted the city’s water supply with toxic “forever chemicals.”

name: Casablanca Water Privatization, Morocco
headline: Since the mid-1980s , Morocco’s economic and political decision-makers have pushed for the liberalisation, privatisation and the lowering of the trade barriers agenda that has been prevalent in the country since 1983. Most public companies were sold.

name: Parque Nacional Cordillera Azul (PNCAZ) REDD+ Project, Peru
headline: Kichwa communities win landmark Free, Prior and Informed Consent case for the rights of Indigenous peoples in Peru

name: Energy Answers Incinerator Poisoning Main Agricultural Region, Puerto Rico
headline: Incineration is not the answer. Communities affected by environmental injustices since long time are reaffirming their contrariety to a plant in Arecibo. The area already has high levels of pollutants in air and waters and land

name: Lead poisoning by a Taiwan battery plant in Changzhou, Jiangsu, China
headline: More than 70 employees, or one-third of the total number of people employed by a Taiwanese battery plant in Changzhou, Jiangsu have been found to have extremely high levels of lead in their blood.

name: Ringland vs. BAM, Belgium
headline: Since 1996, the  government of Flanders tried to build a new highway that would close the ring road around Antwerp. Despite the name, the ring road does not go around the city but runs through the city.

name: Deforestacion de Manglar San Blas, Nayarit, Mexico
Shell petrochemical plant and Pollution in Norco, USA
Shell's Batan delivery line spill, pollution and harassment of the locals, Nigeria
headline: Shell's old and unadapted equipment caused Batan's delivery line spill but yet the multinational unethical behavior enabled it to avoid taking any responsibility for it.

name: Discrimination of the “Khashtalo” community: a “forest” Roma settlement in Hetea, Romania
headline: The small “Khashtalo” Forest Community in Hetea is discriminated on the basis of their race and excluded from forest lands access and use.

name: Illegal logging and trafficking of teakwood in the forest of Bayottes, Senegal
headline: Logging of the precious teakwood is forbidden but yet happens without the effective measures being taken on the ground to stop its trafficking and smuggling to bordering countries, accelerating the deforestation of Casamance.

name: Tengiz Oilfield and Processing Plant, Kazakhstan
Clustering of Waste Facilities in Chester, USA
El Barzon vs. MagSilver (Cascabel), Chihuahua, Mexico
headline: Ismael Solorio Urrutia and Manuela Solís Contreras were killed because of their opposition to water grabbing and mining (by Canadian company Mag Silver), in Chihuahua.

name: Gorakhpur Nuclear Power Plant, India
Uranium mining proposed within the Amrabad Tiger Reserve, Telangana, India
headline: Environmentalists and Chechus local community against the proposed Uranium mining by the UICL in Nalgonda district and within the Amrabad Tiger Reserve forest, in Telangana.

name: Anti Uranium mining protest, Issyk Kul, Kyrgyzstan
headline: Uranium mining in Issyk Kul (a protected bio-ecological area) put on hold due to local opposition and open citizens`protests in Kyzyl Ompol. The country's parliament enacts legislation stopping the project.

name: Ninus and María Inés, Mendoza, Argentina
headline: In Uco valley, department of Tunuyán, "self-summoned" opposition to mining projects included marches with participants in various disguises, and  swimming pools for children in the road blockades.

name: Guadalajara Airport, Jalisco, Mexico
headline: A decades-long land dispute has delayed expansion of Guadalajara Airport, including a new runway. Communal landholders argue they are owed compensation for 307 hectares of land and protests have blocked entrances to the airport terminal and car parks.

name: Projet Grande Côte for zircon and ilmenite mining, Senegal
headline: Projet Grande Côte displaced vegetables gardeners and continues pumping the water resources at the expense of agriculture. The cohabitation between the zircon mining project and the inhabitants is fragile due to the many unkept promises by the company.

name: Oil and Gas Exploration in Block L6, Lamu and Tana Delta Districts, Kenya
Construction plans over the Büyükçekmece Albatros Park in Istanbul, Turkey
headline: The Buyukcekmece Municipality in Turkey sold a green public space to a group private investors despite strong public dissent. Residents oppose the transformation of "their park". Court cases are pending.

name: Minería de Uranio cerca de la Rioja, Argentina
headline: Comunidades y asambleas detienen con bloqueos de ruta y protestas la exploración de uranio cerca de la ciudad de la Rioja.

name: High Speed Train Basque Country, Spain
Philadelphia Energy Solutions refinery's toxic releases in South Philadelphia, US
headline: The Philadelphia Energy Solutions oil refinery released high levels of carcinogens into the air for many years, creating health problems in the predominantly black neighborhood of Grays Ferry.

name: Coal mining in Tete Province by Vale and other companies, Mozambique
headline: While soon 6 million ha - more than half of the area of Tete province - will be covered by coal mining concessions, resettled families still haven't received proper compensation. In 2013, Hussen Antonio, died fleeing from the police when a group protested

name: Resisting free trade agreements to protect local seeds, Thailand
headline: Thai farmers resisting free trade agreements for their food sovereignty

name: Lead poisoning by Shanghang Huaqiang Battery Company, Fujian, China
headline: In 2008-2009, villagers repeatedly protested against a battery plant which polluted the air, water and soil of the local environment and sickened more than 100 children with excessive blood lead in Shanghang, Fujian.

name: Papagayos threatens la Laguna del Diamante, Mendoza, Argentina
headline: A mining project threated a protected area. Local resistance, in the form of the Self-Summoned Citizens' Assembly ("vecinos autoconvocados") of San Carlos, managed to stop the project.

name: Variante de Canal de Bocachica y dragado del arrecife coralino de Varadero, Bahía de Cartagena, Colombia
headline: Arrecife Coralino de Varadero, digno representante de un ecosistema sobreviviente a la contaminación  en la bahía de Cartagena, no obstante en peligro de extinción por el desarrollo económico del sector público y privado que pretenden dragarlo.

name: Lignite mining and the Ende Gelände movement, Germany
headline: "To potential buyers: if you want to invest in lignite, we will meet you with our resistance. Coal’s time is up. Now, we as a global society need a plan – how to organise and finance a socio-ecological transformation".

name: Krakow waste incinerator, Poland
Dams construction on the Narmada River, India
headline: An overview on dams construction along the Narmada river in India and the 30 year long struggle of the Narmada Bachao Andolan Narmada for life in the  river valley and for livelihood of local communities

name: Parque Nacional Natural Tayrona, Colombia
Contaminación de los canales de la zona lacustre de Xochimilco, México
headline: Algunas áreasde la zona lacustre de Xochimilco, se contaminan por el crecimiento de la mancha urbana, siendo las descargas de aguas residuales parte importante de la contaminación de los canales, afectando los cultivos de la zona Chinampera.

name: Yeongheung Coal Plant, South Korea
Yokkaichi asthma, Japan
headline: In Yokkaichi city,  many cases of asthma were reported after power stations, oil refining and petrochemical plants were put in operation after 1955.  A court case was won by plaintiffs in 1972; this is one of the Big Four Pollution Diseases.

name: Richmond County and Enviva pellet plant, NC, USA
headline: Enviva, one very large producer of wood pellets, builds a new facility near Hamlet, NC. Citizens and EJ communities denied opporunities to participate in decision making process for this major pollution source.

name: Kyaukpyu Special Economic Zone, Myanmar
headline: The government of Myanmar has planned a Special Economic Zone in Kyaukpyu, in the restive region of Rakhine, whose construction will displace around 20,000 people.

name: Vitroplant resistance, Woodlark Island, Papua New Guinea
headline: While protests in Woodlark Island, PNG, were able to stop a massive oil palm plantation in 2008, the future of the island remains uncertain.

name: Okomu oil palm plantation, Edo State, Nigeria
headline: Expansion of the Okomu plantation causing deforestation and displacing villagers. Acquisition of land (over 13,000 ha) alleged to be illegal.

name: Complexo Industrial Portuário Governador Eraldo Gueiros (Cips), Pernambuco, Brazil
headline: Foro SUAPE and communities accuse "Complexo Industrial Portuário de Suape" of violence, forced evictions, water contamination and threats to local inhabitants and activists

name: Black Hills gold mining and land theft, South Dakota, USA
headline: Sioux people have been fighting for the return of their sacred lands for 150 years in a meta-conflict that shapes regional struggles for control of land, gold, oil, and narrative about US history

name: Iron Ore mining on Mount Nimba, Guinea
headline: Near the Simandou, Zogota, Yekepa iron ore mines, the transboundary UNESCO World Heritage Site at Mount Nimba is threatened by an open-pit iron ore mine owned by US-Canadian firm High-Power-Exploration.

name: Planta de incineración y desechos sólidos de Holcim, El Salvador
headline: La empresa suiza quema, contamina y gana dinero. EJOs locales lanzan campanas para una disminución del consumo y alternativas al manejo de desechos y de practicas agrícolas.

name: Battle against small hydro for Sutjeska, BiH
headline: Battle for Sutjeska started in 2013 as an reaction to plans for construction of five hydro power plants in National park Sutjeska.

name: Tikul A y B, megasolar project, Yucatan, Mexico
headline: Ticul A + B are a mega solar projects in Muna, Yucatan, Mexico. Over 700 ha deforested to place solar panels. It's the biggest solar project in Latin America and was allocated without Indigenous consultation.

name: Sultanpur Dabas village Landfill site, Delhi, India
Coal fired power plants, Batangas, Philippines
headline: Four 150-megawatt coal plants on a 20-hectare site in Barangay Pinamucan Ibaba, adjacent to JG Summit's Batangas petrochemical plant. Local opposition led by Catholic Church.

name: Mina La Lupe en Tlamanca y Zautla, Puebla, México
headline: La empresa china JDC Minerales fue expulsada en 2012 por vecinos del municipio de Zautla, Puebla

name: Salango Comuna against Pesquera la Polar, Ecuador
Kolaghat Thermal Power Plant, Purba Medinipur, West Bengal, India
Eviction in Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary and Muthanga Adivasi agitation, Kerala, India
headline: Protest against an animal reserve (elephants, tigers) and for recognition of land rights. Known in 2003 as the Muthanga agitation,  Wayanad tribals fought for land in that year and afterwards.

name: Saami/Metsähallitus Forest Conflict, Inari, Finland
headline: Greenpeace and the Saami people could victoriously announce that the Finnish state had agreed to protect 80,000 ha of mostly unlogged old-growth forest.

name: Chemical Valley, Sarnia, Ontario, Canada
Zhanaozen oil strike and massacre 2011, Kazakhstan
headline: In May 2011,  thousands of workers from Kazakhstan's oil and gas sector started three separate labor strikes.

name: Conflict around a planned solar power plant at Luitré-Dompierre, Brittany, France
headline: In 2021, a private landowner proposed a plan to build a solar farm in the site of an old tungsten mine. Environmental associations and residents opposed it as it would imply the cutting down of 6 hectares of woodland.

name: Cascadas de Agua Azul, San Sebastián Bachajón, Chiapas, México
headline: In 2006, the Governor of Chiapas announced that it will build a new Cancún on the  north of Chiapas. Two Human rights defenders were killed and three were tortured in prison for defending their  land and protesting against this tourist project.

name: Asbestos contamination from Salonit-Vranjic, Croatia
headline: The asbestos-containing material producing factory Salonit was closed in 2006. However, only part of its workers managed to receive pension rights and compensation for health impacts cause by occupational exposure to asbestos.

name: Mining and murders on indigenous land in San Teodoro, Mindoro Oriental, Philippines
headline: Mining in Mindoro Oriental is heavily intertwined with the military, leading to military violence against indigenous peoples and environmental defenders. Expedito, Manuela, and Arman Albarillo were red-tagged and murdered for campaigning.

name: Landfill Site at Maidan Garhi, New Delhi, India
Banten Suralaya Coal-fired Power Complex, Banten, Indonesia
headline: The Banten Suralaya coal-fired power complex is building two new units that have stirred up  opposition from environmental activists, civil society groups, and residents in the form of petitions, protests, and lawsuits.

name: Vinto fundidora de antimonio y estaño, Bolivia
Patancheru industrial area, AP, India
headline: In Medak district, Patancheru lies off the Hyderabad-Pune highway. Untreated industrial effluents let out into water courses poison the groundwater, affecting agricultural lands and also the drinking waters of about 15 hamlets.

name: Cattle ranchers, the Monte Pascoal National Park and carbon offsets in Pataxo indigenous territory, Brazil
headline: Pataxo warriors continue after centuries to fight against colonial and neo-colonial forms of appropriation of their lands.

name: Zydus R&D unit in Gujarat, India
Shrimp farming at Chilika Lake, Odisha, India
headline: The conflict between the Chilika Lake dwellers and the local shrimp mafia continues for over two decades. The dispossession of Chilika’s traditional fishers began when the global export market discovered its prawn potential in the 1980s.

name: Kathmandu-Terai/Madhesh Fast Track Road Project, Nepal
headline: A mega highway in Nepal being constructed by the Army threatens displacement of indigenous Newar settlements in Khokana and Bungamati from their lands and livelihoods and their cultural and historical sites in south of Kathmandu.

name: Israel's blockade and its effect on Gaza's water supply and sanitation, Palestine
headline: Israel is practicing a policy of destruction of Palestinian water resources in Gaza and shows that it is ready to violate the Geneva Conventions by using water as a tool of coercion and control.

name: Ambler 350 km mining road project, Northwest Arctic,  Alaska, US
headline: Inhabitants in Alaska have their livelihoods threatened by a  350 km road construction. Their survival depends directly on clean rivers, healthy fish and caribou pastoralism that would be threatened  by the project.

name: Bauxite mining in Cockpit Country, Jamaica
Glencore and Prodeco coal mining, Colombia
headline: Blatant violation of the American Convention of Human Rights, of the Colombian Constitution, of the Covenant of Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights, as well as of the Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights.

name: Titanium Mining in the Kwale District, Kenya
headline: After years of local struggle against a mining project for ilmenite for titanium, exports to China have started in 2014.

name: Teesta V and other dams, Sikkim, India
headline: NE India is heavily targeted by hydropower power. However, Affected Citizens of Teesta (ACT) say that these dams pose a serious threat to  bio-diversity, and the livelihood of thousands of people.

name: Shell Shale Gas Project, Skåne, Sweden
Taldy-Bulak Levoberezhny gold deposit, Altynken LLC, Kyrgyz Republic
headline: This is  the first gold mine after Kumtor to be launched in post-independence Kyrgyzstan. There is Chinese investment by Zijin. Orlovka is a mining community that never stopped resisting.

name: Poaching, illegal mining, and other crimes in Corcovado National Park, Costa Rica
headline: Corcovado National Park is rich with biodiversity and natural resources, making it a prime target for a wide variety of illegal activities. Park rangers, wildlife, the environment, and locals alike face violence because of these criminals.

name: Illegal fishing in Bicol, Philippines
headline: Decades of illegal fishing practices have decimated fish populations in Bicol. The Sagñay Tuna Fishing Association has fought poachers with improved success after the murder of their secretary, Gerlie Alpajora.

name: Mtwara – Dar Es Salaam gas pipeline, Tanzania
headline: The construction of a Chinese funded gas pipeline from Mtwara to Dar es Salaam, possibly turning Tanzania the third largest gas exporter in the world, causes protests and violent repression by state forces.

name: Rio Tinto Zinc in Molleturo, Ecuador
Hidroelectrica Gaya en el rio Apulco, Puebla, Mexico
headline: Since 2013,  people of San Juan Tahitic resist against extractivist projects, "proyectos de muerte". Several environmental defenders have been killed in the Sierra Norte of Puebla.

name: Opposition to Keystone 1 Pipeline in South Dakota and huge oil leak, USA
headline: Resistance to Keystone pipeline continues after most recent spill,  while South Dakota Public Service Commission warns TransCanada Inc that they could pull the permit allowing them to operate the pipeline in the state

name: Chiping Xinfa Huayu Alumina Co., Ltd., Liaocheng, Shandong, China
headline: The subsidiary of Xinfa Group polluted the groundwater in Chiping County. The illegal discharge and infiltration of red mud into the environment threatened the food security of local villagers.

name: ASU_Duke Energy Coal Ash Spill in North Carolina
headline: Understanding the Coal Ash Spill in North Carolina

name: Rio Blanco, Molleturo, Azuay, Ecuador
headline: This Chinese owned gold mine has been prevented from mining by local resistance against threats to water availability near the Cajas National Park. By 2019 it seems to be definitively stopped.

name: Ozbek Village Stone Quarry Construction, Turkey
Port City Project, Sri Lanka
headline: Sri Lankan fishermen and EJOs fight against the Colombo Port City development Project, an offshore city with luxury apartments and facilities that will generate adverse impacts on marine biodiversity and on the livelihoods of local communities.

name: Unconventional gas exploration and production banned in Victoria, Australia
headline: A five-year campaign based on strong community organising successfully stopped the exploration and production of unconventional gas. Quit Coal advocates for renewable energy and decentralisation

name: Tapeba Indians threatened by companies and public policies in Caucaia, Ceara, Brazil.
Comuna of Agua Blanca against the poly-oil pipe, Ecuador.
Volta Grande Mining Project, Pará, Brasil
headline: Despite the damage caused by the Belo Monte Dam, the government of Pará approved a licence for the biggest gold mining project in the same region.

name: Pollution of leather industry in Belém, Brazil
headline: Traditional communities struggle against contamination from tanneries in Belem. Pollution of rivers and air, and  health damage to the dwellers are the main concerns.

name: Kashagan Oil Field, Kazakhstan
Blayais nuclear power plant, France
headline: A nuclear power plant threatening the Gironde. In December 1999, strong winds produced a sudden rise in the waters of the estuary and the flooding of part of the plant. Risks have not been suppressed.

name: Dispute Over Indigenous Miskito Lands, Nicaragua
headline: Indigenous communities all over Nicaragua’s Caribbean coast say they are under attack by settlers who have taken over their ancestral lands. At least 30 Miskitos have been killed in this conflict.

name: Corredor Interoceánico del Istmo de Tehuantepec, México
headline: El corredor abarca diversos proyectos de inversión, producción y transporte de mercancías, economías de enclave, contención migratoria, etc. La población responde con campañas: #ElIstmoEsNuestro

name: Displacement for conservation in Achanakmar Tiger Reserve, CG, India
headline: Tigers vs humans, a misleading reading of a complex issue. Unjust relocation of tribal communities from Achanakmar Tiger Reserve in Chhattisgarh

name: Save the forest of Rades, Tunisia
headline: In order to fluidify the road traffic in the south-east periphery of Tunis, the government planned to build an express road passing through the only forest of the area.

name: Chiloé wind power project in Mapuche territory, Chile
headline: Indigenous and rural communities of Chiloé claiming proper consultation and implementation of a wind power project in their territory

name: Ezulwini gold and uranium mining, Gauteng, South Africa
headline: Intense gold and uranium mining is having a detrimental effect on local communities' and workers' health due to accumulated radioactive waste. Miners and local residents protest unsafe working and health conditions.

name: Mong Ton (or Tasang) Dam, Myanmar
headline: The Mong Ton Dam, also known as Tasang, is one of the seven proposed dams in the Salween river in Myanmar. If completed, it will the largest dam in the country. So far, up to 300,000 people have been displaced.

name: Two high voltage power lines in Llucmajor, Mallorca, Spain
headline: Installation of two high voltage lines in Llucmajor, Mallorca, will affect negatively a natural space with high interest at ecological and ethnological level. Mobilisation against Red Eléctrica de España are going on.

name: Subernarekha Multipurpose project (Kharkai Barrage), Gamharia in Seraikela-Kharsawan, India
Bafa Lake Nature Park, Turkey
Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Limited (MRPL), Karnataka, India
La Boverie lime quarry affecting Tridaine water source, Belgium
Tablistas (surfers) contra la destrucción de playas en Lima, Peru
headline: National and international surfers in Lima defend successfully the beaches in 2015 against plans to pave them over to expand a ring road.

name: Rathupaswela water contamination, Sri Lanka
headline: Venigross Gloves Factory is located in Rathupaswela (about 17 km from Colombo). The factory caused water contamination, affecting twelve villages. People  demand clean drinking water.

name: Coal power plant to be built by Jiuquan Iron & Steel for alumina production at Nain, St Elizabeth , Jamaica
headline: In February 2017 it seemed that  the Chinese company Jiuquan Iron & Steel would build a 1000 MW coal power plant at the Alpart bauxite-alumina factory. Opposition arose.  Bauxite mining might also become contentious.

name: Women “Soap Movement” against Freshwater Red Tide by Uroglena Americana in Lake Biwa, Shiga, Japan
headline: A women-led movement against water pollution, red tides, eutrophication, moved administrators and companies while changing Japanese society.

name: Wilmar International grabs Kapa and Sasak customary lands in West Sumatra, Indonesia
headline: Wilmar International has violated the rights of Kapa and Sasak people for years. After protests buy the Kapa and Sasak, the RSPO ruled in favour of a complaint filed against Wilmar. It remains to be seen if RSPO sticks to its ruling.

name: North Sea Producer ship breaking, Bangladesh
headline: Violating international law, Maersk ship containing radiation ends up on the beach of Bangladesh for breaking purposes; import and export being investigated by United Kingdom and Bangladesh authorities

name: Anacostia River Environmentally Degraded by Pollution and Urban Waste, Washington, D.C., USA
headline: Anacostia Watershed, home to low-income communities of color, faces pollution from sewage, storm water, and more. The people living by the Anacostia are disproportionately affected by its contamination.

name: Exploración de uranio en Tilcara, Argentina
headline: Uranium mining exploration in Tilcara, Jujuy. Opposition of neighbors, peasant and indigenous groups. Court rulings slowed the progress of uranium mining. World heritage in risk.

name: TuNur Solar Park, Tunisia
headline: In July 2017, a request for authorization was filed to the Tunisian Ministry of Energy, Mines and Renewable Energy for an export-oriented solar project with a capacity of around 4.5 GW

name: Fracking Voelkersen, Germany
PT Wilmar Sambas Plantation conflict, Kalimantan, Indonesia
Karonsi'e Dongi people and Vale mine in Sorowako, Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: More that fifty years of Pt inco/vale mining company operating in Sorowako. Indigenous women lead the principal actions against the mining activity on their traditional land.

name: Despojo de agua a comunidades originarias en Amealco, Querétaro, México
headline: La comunidad indígena de Santiago Mexquititlán se opone a la extracción ilegal de agua por actores privados mientras la población sufre de graves problemas de acceso y escasez de agua.

name: La huella de Chevron en el Lago de Maracaibo y otras regiones, Venezuela
headline: Chevron operations in Venezuela meet with low opposition, despite the severe environmental impacts. The oil giant operates together with the state-led oil company PDVSA and aims to adventure in a new extractivist frontier, the Orinoco oil belt

name: Vora Airport and tourism development, Albania
headline: Vlora Airport is opposed by many environmental organizations because the site is within the Vjosa-Narta Protected Landscape, a vital habitat for many bird species. Tourism development on adjoining sites, including a hotel and resort area, is planned.

name: Proyecto inmobiliario Tierra Noble de Grupo Carther en el ejido Zapote, México
headline: La empresa inmobiliario GrupoCarther intenta desarrollar un proyecto dentro de una Area Natural Protegida, sin contar además con los permisos de uso de suelo ni el acuerdo de todos los ejidatarios, dueños de la tierra.

name: Bosques, agua y territorio en Cherán, Michoacán,  Mexico
headline: Since  2008 Purépecha populations of Cheran, Michoacan have been victims of deforestation by "talamontes". In 2011 they opted for autonomy and self-defence against mafia organizations.

name: Jeju naval base construction, Republic of Korea
headline: Famous academics and international activist protest against naval base in Gangjeong (designated UNESCO Geoparks) with local activists, religious groups and villagers during more than 7 years (2009-2016).

name: Enel coal power plant project in Porto Tolle, Italy
Conservation of South Sandwich Islands (UK), Antarctica
headline: Environmental group Great British Oceans call for South Sandwich Islands to be declared a marine sanctuary. The UK government is  reviewing the effectiveness of the existing conservation measures.

name: Coal mining operation led to subsidence in Hejin, Shanxi, China
headline: Coal mining in Hejin led to subsidence and cracks in the houses and left local residents with unsatisfactory relocation plans and livelihood interruptions.

name: Puerto de Paracas, Peru
headline: Un conflicto detenido gracias a la intervención de la población, científicos y autoridades ambientales. Pero también muestra el conflicto de intereses entre la industria del turismo y la industria minera.

name: Ivanplats Platreef Mine in Mokopane,  Limpopo, South Africa
headline: The Platreef Mine  of Ivanhoe Mines, currently still under construction, has caused controversy for years owing to corruption, grave desecration, violence, smear campaigns, and more.

name: Cementerio nuclear (CADER) en Temascalapa, México
headline: Un sitio de almacenamiento de desechos radioactivos amenaza el medioambiente y la salud de la población cercana. Los desechos están confinados allí desde 1984 a pesar de que el sitio fue declarado no apto para el almacenamiento definitivo.

name: Son La Hydropower Dam, Vietnam
Extension of the Nice Airport, France
headline: A project to increase the capacity of the Nice Airport is being criticised for its impact on the environment and the climate. The project is challenged in court but still pending.

name: APNRL coal power plant in Padampur, Jharkhand, India
Protests stopped the eviction of Roma due to urban development project in Mazargues, Marseille, France
headline: The Roma community living in the Eynaud land of Mazargues, due to an alleged fire hazard and posterior redevelopment plan. After many protests, the eviction was stopped.

name: Chicago's Toxic Doughnut, USA
Los Pescados River hydroelectric project in Veracruz, Mexico
headline: Communities opposing the construction of a dam by a Brazilian company which will divert water to the capital of the state and generate electricity to be sold expensive, while leaving the basin dry.

name: Altai people against the  “Power of Siberia 2“  gas pipeline to China, Russia
headline: The pipeline project was highly opposed by the Telengit and finally  it will not be built across their cultural highlands. The people have won against the Russia/ China "power(s)".

name: Hinuguruwelpitiya Quarries, Sri Lanka
headline: Since 2012 six quarries and metal crushers have been established in the Hinguruwelpitiya forest causing adverse impacts on the forest ecosystem which include forest clearance, rock blasting and blocking of the elephant corridor which has resulted in eleph

name: North coal-fired power plant, Pomerania, Poland
headline: The power plant will not be built! This is the greatest success of the Polish campaign for climate protection so far and a model example of cooperation between local people and EJ organizations.

name: Pollution of the Barada River, Syria
headline: The Barada river, a crucial source of water for Damascus and its vicinity, is facing persistent severe pollution and the added effects of the ongoing conflict. A tragic example of the impact of conflict on the environment and people in Damascus

name: “Movilizaciones del gas” protest against industrial pollution in Erandio, Basque Country
headline: Movilizaciones contra la contaminación industrial en Erandio durante el régimen franquista dejan dos muertos. En 2022, Erandio sigue siendo el municipio con mayor índice de contaminación de Bizkaia.

name: Liulitun Waste Incineration Power Plant, Haidian District, Beijing, China
headline: One Beijing community's successful fight against plans to build a garbage incinerator shows how environmental activism intersected with a nascent homeowners' rights movement.

name: Addax Bioenergy bioethanol project in Makeni, Bombali District, Sierra Leone
Ejidatarios confront Minera Madero (Peñoles) in Morelos, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: A group of ejidatarios and residents of the municipality of Morelos, Zacatecas, carried out a blockade and sit-in at the Madero Peñoles Mining Unit, to demand payment of land rent and promised public works.

name: Mackenzie Valley Pipeline, Canada
headline: The Mackenzie Valley Pipeline and Gas Project were a series of proposed fossil fuel extraction and development projects in the Canadian North. Although they didn't come to fruition, lasting impacts were left on communities living in the Mackenzie Valley.

name: Nayachar Chemical Hub, India
Umicore, Hoboken, the ecological debt of an industrial plant, Belgium
Mali water privatisation, Mali
Parque Eólico Chicxulub en ejido de Ixil, Yucatan, Mexico
headline: In the Yucatan Peninsula, the Mayan community of Ixil is opposed to a large wind mill project and the privatization of their common use land, linked to this project and the urban expansion of Mérida.

name: BHP Billington Mozal aluminium smelter, Mozambique
headline: A big smelter that consumes much cheap electricity. In 2010  (according to Justiça Ambiental) it bypassed its filters for 4 months, spewing toxic gases straight into the air of Maputo.

name: Nandigram Chemical Hub, India
Lio Tourism Estate and Lio Airport, The Philippines
headline: A cease-and-desist order was issued against Lio Tourism Estate, a luxury development served by a private airport, alleging encroachment on the Tagbanua Tandulanen tribe’s ancestral lands. The project also blocked fisherfolk's access to fishing grounds.

name: Mineria La Morada de Miski Mayo, Peru
headline: La explotación de cobre en la provincia de San Marcos (Cajamarca) presentó severas irregularidades desde sus inicios. Fue detenido por la resistencia de los comuneros

name: Mina El Mochito en Santa Barbara, Honduras
Asuwei waste incinerator in Changping, Beijing, China
headline: Following a landfill crisis, several incinerators were planned in Beijing. Those in Liulitun, Gaoantun, Asuwei,  met fierce opposition by local residents. Asuwei incinerator  is now (2017) under construction.

name: Anti-fracking movement and Petrobras Shale Gas Exploration Field AC-T-8 – Vale do Juruá, Brazil
headline: A victory for the environmental justice in Brazil. Suspension of shale gas exploration by use of fracking at the Vale do Juruá (Amazonas and Acre), in a campaign by COESUS that reaches other states also.

name: Nuevo aeropuerto Internacional (NAIM) en Atenco, Mexico
headline: Strong repression against the Frente de Pueblos en Defensa de la Tierra who opposed the new airport proposed by Vicente Fox. In 2019, AMLO scrapped the project but proposed a new location to the Military Base Santa Lucia

name: Fuel switching by Cimentos de Mocambique-Matola Gas Company, Mozambique
WestConnex Highway Project, Sydney and NSW, Australia
headline: The 33km WestConnex highway project currently underway in inner Sydney is the biggest and one of the most controversial urban infrastructure projects in the city since the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

name: Libertad mining project, Chontales, Nicaragua
headline: Artisanal miners from Nicaragua oppose large-scale mining by the Canadian company B2Gold.

name: Acid Mine Drainage, South Africa
Proyecto minero Kimsa Orcco y oposición de comunidades de Ccarhuarazo de Tintay, Perú
headline: Proyecto minero amenaza fuentes hídricas  y territorio considerado sagrado por las comunidades campesinas de Ccarhuarazo

name: Proposed Jambi-2 coal-fired power plant, Jambi, Indonesia
headline: WALHI Jambi published suggestions to the Jambi Province Governor to cancel Jambi-1 and Jambi-2 coal-fired power plant, as well as remove CFPP in Jambi’s electricity planning.

name: Ennore coal power plant and Fisherfolk protest, north Chennai, India
headline: A sacrifice zone with coal power plants, chemical industries, a port and a landfill. Fisherfolk defend the commons (the Poromboke), against pollution and encroachments affecting their livelihood.

name: Land grab for a power plant of Gujarat Power Corporation Ltd. in Bhavnagar, Gujarat, India
headline: More than 5000 farmers in Gujarat protest against land grab for setting up a thermal power plant and lignite mine by pleading for "mass euthanasia", as without the land they won´t survive.

name: Second airport in Jeju (air force base),  south coast, South Korea
headline: Communities on Jeju, South Korea's 'island of peace', are resisting a second airport threatening the island's farming. They have set up a protest camp and their resistance is garnering support from many organizations.

name: Waste-to-Energy Incinerator in Haiyan County, Zhejiang, China
headline: In 2016 a Waste-to-Energy project in Haiyan, Zhejiang province, was halted after local residents' protest but resumed after improved public communications, participation and transparency of information.

name: Depredación inmobiliaria en el Tangano, Querétaro, México
headline: El Tangano I y II son una área natural protegida que se conectan con el Parque Nacional El Cimatario por medio de un corredor biológico, el cual no está considerado como tal y actualmente un desarrollo inmobiliario amenaza con destruirlo.
