name: Ranthambore Tiger Reserve, Rajasthan, India
headline: Since its inception in 1973, the creation of a tiger reserve led to forced eviction and relocation of pastoralist Van Gujjars and other traditional communities, without proper resettlement land and services

name: Hydroelectric barrages along the Mur River, Styria, Austria
headline: No more barrages! Hydroelectric power plants along the Mur River in Graz, Austria, provoke strong mobilizations by local citizens groups

name: Perenco Muanda, Dem. Rep. Congo
Gentrification in West Oakland, USA
headline: Gentrification is not only changing the character of Oakland, it is making residents sick because of financial distress, loss of community services, and overcrowded substandard housing conditions

name: Zueitina oil port blockade, Libya
headline: Zueitina oil port is under control of armed rebel groups and operates without environmental control and regulation.

name: Enbridge/Northern Gateway Pipeline, Canada
headline: BC First Nations and supporters successfully oppose Enbridge's Northern Gateway pipeline project. Project cancelled in 2016.

name: Katwa Thermal Power Project, West Bengal, India
Oil spill in Etimboué Region, Gabon
headline: In 2020, the Perenco company, accused of previous environmental damaging activities in other areas of the world, caused oil spills in several sites in the Etimboué region in Gabon. Local NGOs and communities sued the company, helped by international NGOs.

name: Movement against industrial Renewable Energy Resources (RES) in Chios, Greece
headline: Windfarms of Iberdrola coming up on the Greek island, disturbing bird population and migration but also increasing pressure on seabed due to transmission cables.

name: Suzlon windfarm in Dhule, Maharashtra
headline: Wind energy project and carbon offset scheme in Dhule: controversies on land grabbing against Adivasi people and deforestation

name: Tenke Fungurume Deposit, Democratic Republic of Congo
headline: Tenke Fungurume is one of the largest copper and cobalt deposits in the world. As a result of this mine, local communities are left with nothing, and compensations do not equate to their livelihood loss.

name: Fomi Dam for water diversion and hydropower, Guinea-Mali
headline: The Inner Niger Delta in Mali is one of Africa’s largest wetlands. The Fomi dam in Guinea would produce electricity and water for mining and large scale agriculture under the name of poverty reduction. World Bank still selling old flawed discourses.

name: Mutare City River Pollution, Zimbabwe
La Grecia Sugar Mill in Marcovia, Choluteca, Honduras
headline: On April 2, 2020, La Grecia violently evicted peasant farmers living on 20ha of government land set aside for their subsistence. Woman leader Iris Argentina Álvarez was murdered during the raid.

name: Stade des Lumières - OL Land. Decines, France
Port of Newcastle and Break Free 2016 blockade, Australia
headline: Break Free 2016 blockade of world's largest coal export port in Newcastle, Australia, stops ships for a day and highlights impacts of global warming, particularly sea level rise on Pacific Island Nations.

name: Maithon Dam and the Damodar River Valley Project, West Bengal, India
Lead poisoning by Jiangsu Chunxing, Pizhou, China
headline: A battery recycling enterprise in Pizhou, northern Jiangsu, was relocated after protests from local residents as more than 100 children were poisoned by excessive blood lead.

name: Law to ban bullfighting in Catalunya, Spain
Refinaria Abreu e Lima (RNEST), Pernambuco, Brazil
headline:
Workers defend strike claiming labor rights and better_x000D_
working conditions at the Abreu e Lima Refinery - Industrial Complex of Suape - PE - Brazil

name: Toxic waste leak at Zijinshan Gold & Copper Mine, Fujian, China
headline: Toxic waste from a mine operated by China's top gold/copper producer polluted the Tingjiang River, threatening  drinking water supply and the fishing industry along the river.

name: Proyecto de minería de oro Los Domos, Aysén, Chile
headline: El proyecto de exploración minera de oro y plata "Los Domos" se ubica en terrenos fiscales, adyacentes a zona de conservación de la biodiversidad y patrimonio arqueológico y paleontológico, Reservas Nacionales y el Parque Patagonia.

name: Waste-to-Energy Project in Kibera, Kenya
headline: Infamous for its overcrowded and hazardous conditions, Dandora landfill has been selected as the site for constructing a new incinerator, which threatens to further marginalize wastepickers there.

name: In wake of toxic dumping, Tamaqua Borough passes Rights of Nature ordinance, USA
headline: Community groups in Tamaqua Borough, Pennsylvania, successfully passed the world's first Rights of Nature ordinance in the wake of a toxic sludge dumping conflict

name: Janna Dam, Lebanon
headline: One of the major water veins of Lebanon, from Adonis valley to Beirut, is threatening important biodiversity hotspots. Despite a halt order, construction continues. Opponents sent a drone to get the proofs

name: Chumbivilcas, Peru
Movement against the third bridge, Turkey
headline: The 3rd bridge is a bridge and interlinking highways project planned in the northern part of Istanbul on the Bosphorous, between Garipce Village and Poyrazkoy. It is operational since August 2016.

name: Mes Aynak Copper Mining, Afghanistan
headline: Mes Aynak is the second largest copper mine in the world, and an ancient Buddhist archeological site. Through the company MMC, China bought extraction rights for billions of cubic metres of ore. At what cost?

name: Gila River Community against Loop 202 freeway project, South Mountain,  Phoenix, USA
headline: Tribal members consider South Mountain Park to be sacred. They fought to preserve the area from the expansion of the Loop 202 freeway since 2012. However, the damaging project has been approved in 2021.

name: Deepwater Horizon oil spill, USA
headline: Deepwater Horizon Spill in Gulf of Mexico causes deaths and extensive damage; beyond compensation paid, international activists have called for recognition of Rights of Nature under universal jurisdiction

name: Dardanelos Dam in Amazonia, Brazil
headline: Indigenous groups in Mato Grosso took over a hydroelectric dam in 2010 that polluted vital fishing grounds and destroyed sacred burial grounds, demanding compensation and  that no more dams be built without prior consent.

name: Bar Elias Litani Pollution, Lebanon
headline: people in Bar Elias used to drink and swim in the Litani River. Twenty years ago, the river started to get severely polluted due to factories and household wastes being dumped in the stream in the river causing many health problems for locals

name: Exploración y explotación petrolera en la Provincia de Sugamuxi, Colombia
headline: La exploración petrolera en Boyacá, aunque menos activa, sigue latente. Los procesos de modificación de las licencias ambientales otorgadas siguen su curso. Grupos activistas de la Provincia de Sugamuxi continúan luchando por la protección del territorio.

name: Compañía minera Victoria, explotación de depósitos de hierro en la Comunidad Nueva Esperanza, Honduras
headline: In Honduras, a successful case of resistance by local inhabitants and external allies   against exploration of iron ore deposits.

name: Bapro's coal mine in Rybnik, Poland
headline: In 2016, the Polish government planned to open a new mine in Rybnik, Silesia. Local authorities and citizens protested and launched a court procedure. After repeated judicial to-and-fro, the mine project was stopped in 2022.

name: Shark Finning Industry or “Aleteo” in Costa Rica
headline: In the last 50 years shark populations in Costa Rica decreased by 60 per cent mainly because of "finning", the practice of fishing sharks and cutting off their fins, for export.

name: Bengkulu Coal-fired Power Plant, Indonesia
headline: The Bengkulu coal-fired power plant has caused multiple negative effects on the local environment and population, which has led to opposition by residents and environmental organizations since before construction began in 2016.

name: Aoos River Diversion and Hydroelectric Projects, Greece
headline:
The Aoos river diversion project involves the construction of hydroelectric power plant, although areas are registered in NATURA 2000._x000D_
There is opposition as the benefits are controversial. The project is temporary suspended, but included in the RBMP.

name: Engen oil refinery pollution in Durban, South Africa
headline: The Engen oil refinery has polluted Durban over decades spanning hundreds of accidents and incidents. Protesting groups fought for the right to  mobilize after legal action banning demonstrations outside of the refinery.

name: Brahmapuram Solid Waste Processing Plant, Kerala, India
headline: The indiscriminate and unscientific management of urban solid waste by the Kochi Corporation at Brahmapuram posed over the years environmental and public health hazards to the residents in the area.

name: Shell's environmental racism against the Ogbodo-Isiokpo community, after a pipeline's explosion and spill, Nigeria
headline: Shell did not respond rapidly, leading to 50,000 barrels of oil spill in Ogbodo land. They falsely accused the locals of provoking it, then did not lead a proper clean-up nor did provide an adequate support to the locals living under extreme conditions.

name: Andes Petroleum Oil Proposal in Sápara Indigenous Territory in Amazon Rainforest, Ecuador
headline: Gloria Ushigua fought against Andes Petroleum's plans for oil exploration in Yasuni National Park in the Amazon rainforest. After delaying the project for years, the company withdrew in 2019.

name: Saudi Star Agriculture and Irrigation Project in Gambela, Ethiopia
Burning and sinking of the oil tanker MT Haven, Genoa, Italy
headline: MT Haven was leased to Troodos Shipping. In 1991,  loaded with 1 million barrels of crude oil, it caught fire and sank off the coast of Genoa, killing six Cypriot crew. The outcome of the court case angered environmentalists and trade unions.

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Xalalá, Guatemala
Podocarpus National Park and mining, Ecuador
Illegal landfill in Martinaj village-Plav Gucinje, Montenegro
Illegal dumping of organic waste Travnik, Bosnia and Herzegovina
headline: In 2013, a meat-processing industry Bajra illegally disposed a large amount of untreated organic waste near the village Goleš, Travnik.

name: The violent death of Betty Cariño, Oaxaca, Mexico
headline: When she was killed, Betty Cariño was 37 years old, with a long trajectory of struggle for women's freedom, for environmental  and human rights, and for self-determination of indigenous peoples.

name: Lower Churchill Falls Project Phase 1 (Muskrat Falls) in Labrador, Canada
headline: Local Inuit people resisted the flooding by the 834 MW dam arguing it will contaminate the area with methylmercury. The company continued with the project and flooded the 41-sq-km reservoir.

name: Rönnbäcken Nickel Mine, Västerbotten, Sweden
headline: In November 2013, the UN Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination called on the Swedish government to stop activities at the proposed nickel mine. The Sámi herd their reindeer in the area.

name: Rio Tuba and Coral Bay nickel mining and processing in Palawan, Philippines
headline: Production of nickel and cobalt sulfide from ores mined in open pit by Filipino and Japanese companies, possibly endangering human health and biodiversity.

name: Phulbari coal mine project, Bangladesh
headline: Read the story of one of the most violent repressions in Bangladesh, with several female and male victims, leading to a ban on open-pit mining in the area and withdrawal of international funding

name: Greenwashing by the Jewish National Fund, Israel
headline: The Jewish National Fund has been for years operating under the status of "charity" while it enforces and conceals war crimes by planting exotic trees as a means to  further dispossess Palestinians from their lands and traditions.

name: Aerial Fumigation with glyphosate in the Putumayo, Colombia
headline: After over a decade of dangerous contamination, aerial fumigation with the pesticide have ended in May 2015. A new anti-drug policy was approved and relocation of families started

name: Khandwa water service development and privatization, India
Resistencia de los Maya Mam contra proyectos de minería en Huehuetenango, Guatemala
headline: Mediante el ejercicio democrático de consultas comunitarias, los 13 municipios que conforman la región Maya Mam del Departamento de Huehuetenango declaran No a la Minería.

name: Kynnefjäll, Nuclear Waste Storage, Bohuslän, Sweden
Great Panther Silver mining and water contamination, México
headline: The waste derived from the metal extraction processes, in charge of the Canadian mining company Great Panther Silver, in the Guanajuato Mining Complex, heavily contaminated water sources

name: Mountaintop Mining Removal in West Virginia, USA
Iron ore mining in Gandarela Mountain Range, Minas Gerais, Brazil
headline: Vale plans to extract iron ore in an area of great ecological importance. The boundaries of the Gandarela National Park, created in 2014, have been defined so that the mine can be built.

name: Minería de cobre y molybdenum Cerro Verde en Arequipa, Peru
headline: Complejo minero de cobre y molibdeno, es la tercera mayor mina de cobre de Peru. Se demostraron grave contaminación del aire y vertimientos de filtraciones cancerigenas.

name: Ventura Timber Corporation’s logging operations on ancestral lands of Mamanwas and Manobos, Northern Mindanao, Philippines
headline: “We are deprived by the resource management of our Ancestral domain, we will not let the development projects like mining and logging enter our territory.” Datu Ceasar Batao, leader of indigenous KATRIMMA organization.

name: Eucalyptus monoculture and common lands, Portugal
headline: The largest monoculture plantation of eucalyptus in Europe: more than 800,000 hectares covering a quarter of Portugal’s forest area and 9% of the continent's territory

name: Urban solid waste incinerator of Asturias, Spain
headline: Government of the Principality of Asturias and COGERSA pushing for its construction in absence of a logical waste management plan compliant to the European Waste Directive

name: Zaldibar industrial waste dump, Basque Country,  Spain
headline: The Basque Country suffers an industrial waste crisis made more obvious after the collapse in Febr. 2020 of the Zaldibar dumpsite that admitted 500,000 tons per year (including asbestos). Two workers lost their lives.

name: Cagayan black sand mining in shore areas, Luzon, Philippines
headline: Ten black sand mining companies operating in the province of Cagayan were suspended, following large negative impacts on coastal communities and the environment. However, illegal mining goes on and continues to threaten people and the environment.

name: Etalin hydroelectric project in the Dibang valley, AP, India
headline: Protests as the government of India deliberates on granting forest clearance for a massive dam project in the biodiverse rich forests inhabited by the Idu Mishmi tribe in Dibang valley, Arunachal Pradesh, India.

name: Yongxing Cancer Village near Likeng Landfill and Incinerators in Guangdong Province, China
headline: Villagers have been fighting in an endless vicious circle – protest and failure – against the construction of incinerators and a waste treatment plant in Likeng, Guangdong Province.

name: Oil spills from the ConocoPhillips and CNOOC fields at Bohai Bay, China
headline: In 2011, spills took place in Penglai 19-3 oilfield,  Bohai Bay,  producing 57% of China’s oil output and 12% of its natural gas. Disputes over information transparency, corporate liability and compensation lasted for years.

name: Sterling and ExxonMobil Offshore in Ampasindava, Madagascar
Yusufeli Dam, Turkey
Tuirial Hydro Power Project, Mizoram, India
Perenco guilty for environmental liabilities, Ecuador
Proyecto minero Las Bambas, Perú
headline: Las Bambas could be the second world mine for copper production. Despite the opposition of communities, this project continues under construction by the MMG company supported by the Peruvian state.

name: DBCP class action suit, Ecuador
Exploración de Petróleo en la Mosquitia, Honduras
headline: La exploración y posible explotación de petróleo en la plataforma marítma de Honduras, coloca en serio peligro a las comunidades Miskitas y Garifunas a largo de la costa caribe de Honduras, Guatemala y Belice.

name: Militarised conservation in Liolondo, Tanzania
headline: For decades, Masaai communities have been suffering threats, dispossession, loss of livelihoods and violence in the name of ‘protected’ areas.

name: Weigyi dam on the Salween River, Karen and Karenni state, Myanmar
headline: Most of the electricity would be exported to Thailand. The plans for the massive 4,500 MW dam on the Salween River in Karen and Karenni state are contested through strong opposition from civil society groups.

name: Tumarín hydroelectric Dam, Nicaragua
Oil and gas drilling plan in the Ruby Mountains, Nevada, USA
headline: The US Forest Service issued their final Environmental Assessment on Nevada’s Ruby Mountains-- denying the Bureau of Land Management’s (BLM) request to offer parcels for leasing in the landscape.

name: Privatization of Water and Energy by Union Fenosa, Colombia
headline: The Spanish company holds here monopoly of water and energy basic service, controlling a war on tariffs and violating national laws

name: Unemployed movement in oil and gas rich Ouargla town, Algeria
headline: Ouargla is one of the wealth poles of Algeria and the richest energy towns in the country, where most of the big oil and gas companies are based. Yet, since February 2012 there has been growing discontent about the lack of jobs for local workers.

name: Deforestation and agrotoxics linked to Harvard University's land speculation, Piauí, Brazil
headline: Circumventing legal restrictions through a complex corporate structure, Harvard after 2008 massively invested in Brazilian farmland. In Piauí, this has led to the destruction of forests and community land and polluted water through pesticides.

name: Buxa Tiger Reserve, West Bengal, India
headline: Many cases of murder by shooting or other means by employees of the forest department within the Buxa Tiger Reserve were reported. There was a dispute on whether the victims were members of a "timber mafia" or rather local tribal villagers.

name: Roma evicted to a polluted sites and close to a landfill in Naples, Italy
headline: Due to a land plot owned by two real estate companies, Romani people were evicted by local authorities to segregated and heavily polluted sites outside the city or left homeless.

name: Guicheloudaya land grabbing, Morocco
headline: Tribes in Morocco are facing violent evictions in the face of rapid urban development in the region of Rabat

name: Hydroelectric Project Caculo Cabaça, Angola
headline: Big Chinese investment on hydropower on the river Kwanza, for domestic consumption but also for export to South Africa and possibly for aluminium smelting. Very significant impacts but opposition is limited due to government control.

name: Pichanaki and Pluspetrol,  Peru
headline: Gas exploration by Pluspetrol led to complaints by local people and to police repression with several deaths in February 2015. Project stopped for the time being.

name: Atewa Forest bauxite mining, Ghana
headline: Mining  bauxite in Atewa Forest for aluminium production, Ghana will destroy the water source for 5 million Ghanaians, and the home of critically endangered wildlife.

name: Krabi coal-fired power station project, Thailand
headline: Alternatives to coal are plenty; opponents to the Krabi plant made it clear they don't want more coal facilities but a greener and just economy based on sustainable tourism and clean energy

name: Heilongian/Beidahuang in Rio Negro, Argentina
Green chemistry project in Porto Torres, Italy
Bukit Jaya, Bumit Harapan & Piondo villages against PT BHP & PT KLS oil palm companies, Indonesia
headline: The oil palm conflict in Central Sulawesi began in the 1990s. Communities resistance against the PT BHP and KLS companies  resulted in an arrest of 23 farmers and miners, among those the land activist Eva Bande.

name: Dams on the Niger and Sokoto Rivers, Nigeria
Baia Mare gold exploitation, Romania
headline: Cyanide spill in 2000 caused severe contamination and it took ten years to restore fauna and flora in what is called "the second Chernobyl"

name: Liquefied natural gas project -LNG 2,  Gydan peninsula, Arctic Russia
headline: Across the Yamal penninsula where already a mega Arctic LNG1 is in operation, a new  LNG 2 project is under construction. Total (France) is very much involved.

name: Athirapally dam, Kerala, India
headline: Resistance for ten years to the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) proposal for the Athirapally 163 MW hydroelectric project on the 144 km heavily dammed Chalakudy River

name: Local Residents Protest Sea-3 Liquid Propane Gas Expansion, Providence, Rhode Island, USA
headline: The Company Sea-3 Providence aims to expand its storage and operations for liquid propane gas. Opposition suggests the proposal could continue the social and environmental harm from the industrial port. affecting a minority and low-income population.

name: Jubilee Field: oil versus fish, Ghana
Tarda agricultural farming in Tana River Delta , Kenya
headline: TARDA and the Mumias Sugar Co. wanted to farm sugar cane for local consumption in Kenya and for export (ethanol)  in 40,000 ha. An alliance of pastoralists and conservationists stopped the project.

name: Amarakaeri communal reserve against Hunt Oil and Repsol, Peru
headline: Harakbut, Matsiguenka and Yine in the Amarakaeri community reserve in the province of Manu (Madre de Dios) oppose gas and oil exploration by Hunt Oil and Repsol.

name: Indigenous peoples land for rubber plantations, Cambodia
headline: Indigenous peoples in Ratanakiri have struggled against plantation encroachment as early as the 1990s, but the problem significantly worsened in 2001 with the introduction of Economic Land Concessions (ELCs).

name: Wind Farm Installation in the Protected Area of Karaburuni Peninsula, Albania
headline: In the beginning of 2008 the Albanian Government granted approval for the construction of a large (500 MW) wind farm in the protected area of Karaburuni Peninsula.

name: Poisoning lead smelting plants in Jiyuan, Henan, China
headline: More than 1,000 children in China's biggest lead smelting center confirmed with excessive levels of blood lead. 35 lead smelters were temporarily suspended, 15,000 residents were planned to be relocated.

name: Shell’s toxic legacy, Curaçao
headline: The pollution by the Isla refinery on Curaçao has been a problem for many years. Curaçaoans living downwind of the refinery experience many health issues on account of its toxic emissions.

name: Mezica Valley, Slovenia
Antipollution protests against solar panel manufacturers, Quanzhou, Fujian, China
headline: More than a thousand of local residents protested since December 2015 against  a solar panel manufacturer near their residential area in Quanzhou City, Fujian Province.

name: Panchgaon's community forest rights, Maharashtra, India
headline: The people of Panchgaon faced livelihood insecurity due to denial of access to the forest that they had depended on. They  struggled to obtain legal rights, becoming the first village in their district to get these rights.

name: Growth in Shrimp Farming for export in Chinandega, Nicaragua
headline: Coastal families became poorer with the arrival of PESCANOVA , a Spanish firm that monopolised the shrimp export market. It is blamed for environmental pollution, loss of magrove forests, and violation of human rights.

name: Rio Dagua gold mining, Zaragoza, Colombia
Refinería eni de Taranto
headline: Desde la actividad de la refinería hasta el proyecto Temppa Rossa

name: Expansion of coconut plantations threatens the Tremembé indogenous people, Brazil
headline: Coconut plantations, irrigation projects and tourism infrastructure are threaten indigenous Tremembé in Ceará

name: Redmud disaster Kolontar-Devecser, Hungary
Mattala Airport, Sri Lanka
headline: Mattala Airport, built in the midst of wildlife sanctuaries, wages an ongoing battle against birds and animals that could pose a risk to air safety. Removal of habitats and obstruction of migration routes has led to an increase in human-elephant conflicts

name: Hydrocarbon exploration and blowout at Dibru-Saikhowa National Park, Assam, India
headline: Blowout at OIL India well  has killed and displaced people; it will damage the protected environment; locals already protested against the project before the explosion in May 2020.

name: Sewage mismanagement in Bloemhof, North West, South Africa
headline: A sewage spill resulting from unfixed holes in pipes caused widespread diseases resulting in the deaths and illnesses of hundreds of people in Bloemhof

name: Banana workers affected by  agrotoxics in Barú, Panamá
headline: The soil and water ​contamination ​is an inheritance left by the ​banana ​companies that controlled the pests​ with hazardous substances. The ​human ​victims have managed to file several lawsuits, however, are still​ ​waiting for​ a​ just​ compensation.

name: James Bay Hydro Project, Québec, Canada
headline: The James Bay Hydro Project is a hydroelectric development project in North West Quebec constructed in the 1970s. The project has long standing environmental and social impacts and ignited a push towards rights and sovereignty for indigenous communities.

name: Jalaput Dam, Orissa, India
headline: The dam impounds water for the downstream 120 MW Machkund Hydro-Electric Scheme, as machineries of this latter infrastructure becomes obsolate. Inhabitants of the area have been demanding due compensation for seven decades

name: Shell's Adibawa delivery Pipeline pollutes Ikarama Community, Nigeria
Toktogul dam, Kyrgyzistan
headline: A historical transboundary water management dispute between Central Asian countries; a dam built in the Naryn River in the late 1970s flooded 26,000 ha of land and archeological sites. Further dams are planned.

name: Gardarem lo Larzac ! Peasant fight against a military camp in the Larzac plateau, France
headline: In October 1971, the Minister of Defense announced the expansion of a military camp in the Larzac plateau threatening local farmers’ livelihoods. In response,  thousands of activists organised to refuse the project.

name: Fortress Conservation, Poaching and Logging Threatens Mbendjele Communities, Republic of the Congo
headline: Mbendjele hunter-gatherers have inhabited the northern rainforest of Congo-Brazzaville since time immemorial, but now face threats from neoliberal forces such as fortress conservation and intense resource extraction.

name: Indígenas yabarana, hoti y e’ñepa afectados por minería ilegal en Manapiare, Venezuela
headline: Indigenous communities from Manapiare  suffer the impacts of growing illegal mining in their territories. Important disputes occur as Amazonian indigenous organizations campaign against this problem.

name: Radio Corporation of America, Taiwan
headline: RCA Taiwan was found to have dumped toxic waste at its Taoyuan factory polluting soil and underground water, leading to alarmingly high rates of cancer among its workers, among them many women.

name: Sendai Coal-Fired Power Station, Sendai City, Miyagi Prefecture, Japan
headline: Among a wave of construction of new CFPP in Japan,  a lawsuit against a single coal-fired power plant was launched by residents of Sendai City.

name: Conflicto de los Mineros Cooperativistas y el Gobierno (Panduro/La Paz), Bolivia
headline: Mining cooperatives exploit wage workers. The conflict between mining cooperativists and the State is mainly economic and social and also environmental. It escalated violently in August 2016.

name: Aliaga Industrial Conflicts, Turkey
Shell Bonga Oil Spill, Nigeria
headline: On December 2011, 40,000 barrels of oil spilled from Bonga field. Shell was fined by Nigerian court but refuses to pay and compensate the impacted populations.

name: Circuito Exterior Mexiquense, Mexico
headline: Ejidatarios protestan contra OHL por indemnizaciones pendientes por predios utilizados para la construcción del Circuito Exterior Mexiquense

name: Landfill construction in Keratea, Athens
headline: Local communities react to the implementation of landfill and recycling plant in the Attica region, imposed with no consultation and forcing land acquisition

name: Lucha por el agua de mujeres indígenas Mazahuas, Mexico
headline: In 2003, Mazahua peasants from Villa de Allende, México, suffered flooding because of overflowing of Malacatepec River, originating from the Villa Victoria dam. One year after, the Ejército Zapatista de Mujeres en Defensa del Agua arose.

name: New airport in Mondulkiri Province, Cambodia
headline: Soil excavation to prepare for construction of a new airport began before authorities had discussed the matter with villagers, who say the works encroached on land used for growing cashew nuts and peppers, and burials grounds indigenous Bunong people

name: Trans-Panama Pipeline, Panama
Mining in indigenous territories and the RENCA Amazon reserve, Amapá - Pará, Brazil
headline: A broad civil society movement opposed plans for commercial mining in a large protected area in the Amazon, as part of a wider struggle against Brazil's current economic growth policies undermining of socio-environmental rights.

name: CAPECO disaster, Puerto Rico
headline: 30 million gallons of petroleum released to water bodies, and neighboring wetlands to San Juan Bay, dead wildlife and health impacts on the population. But CAPECO declared bankruptcy and did not repair its damages

name: Vale Mining in Voisey's Bay, Labrador, Canada
headline: Voisey's Bay nickel-copper-cobalt mine in northern Labrador, owned by Vale, operates despite strong resistance by Inuit and Innu peoples in the 90s. Now the open pit mine is being transformed to an underground mine creating further risk and damage.

name: Mountaintop Removal Coal Mining in Laciana Valley, Spain
Nuclear waste in Orchid island, Taiwan
headline: The Tao have been fighting to remove nuclear waste for 30 years but the  waste still remains. Located a two-hour ferry ride from Taiwan’s southeast coast, Orchid Island — known locally as Lanyu — houses nearly 100,000 barrels of  nuclear waste.

name: Augustów Bypass in Rospuda Valley, Poland
headline: Rospuda Valley, one of the best-preserved ecosystems in Europe, was endangered by a plan to build the Bypass to ease the pollution in Augustów.

name: Industrial complex in Pontevedra, Spain
Iron ore conflict, corruption and illegal operations in Bellary, Karnataka, India
headline: Bellary District in Karnataka suffered from massive illegal mining operations and corruption in iron ore operations leading to a mining ban in 2012.

name: Minería submarina de fósforo Don Diego, Mexico
headline: Las comunidades pesqueras y organizaciones ambientales se movilizan contra el proyecto minero "Don Diego" que extrae fosfato del fondo del mar para conservar su ecosistema marino y la actividad pesquera.

name: Forced evictions and land grabbing for sugarcane plantations, Oddar Meanchey, Cambodia
headline: EU “Everything but Arms” (EBA) initiative is leading to brutal forced displacement of Cambodian farmers.

name: Roma community in Transylvania evicted to waste water plant surrounded by wire fence, Romania
headline: Roma community evicted from the center of the Miercurea Ciuc town to live in metal barracks next to a sewage water filtering station warn of and suffer toxic danger.

name: Cuarto Cinturó B40 highway, Barcelona, Spain
headline: The Campanya contra el Cuarto Cinturó is opposing the fourth ring of motorways around Barcelona.  Since the 1990s associations from Vallés Occidental and Oriental have been demanding alternative public transportation and the preservation of rural areas

name: Monocultivo de Quinua en Oruro, Bolivia
headline: Intensification of quinua production for export in the altiplano of Bolivia causes social changes against small holders, in a process of enclosures.

name: Producción de Cemento en Suesca, Colombia
headline: Entre agricultura y ecoturismo, ha empezado la industria del cemento y minería para la expansión urbanística, incluso en la Reserva Forestal Protectora de la Cuenca Alta del río Bogotá. La población y Ciudadanos Unidos Por Suesca responden!

name: Equatorial Palm Oil project stalls in Bassa, Liberia
Mondi and Sappi plantations in Zululand, South Africa
Pesticide pollution in Western Cape, South Africa
headline: South African agribusiness has depended on pesticides as early as the 1930s to the detriment of environmental and human health conditions. The Women on Farms Project advocates for a ban on 67 pesticides already banned in the EU.

name: Masoala rosewood Illegal logging, Madagascar
Conflicto por la denominación de las Aguas del Silala, Potosí, Bolivia
headline: Conflicto internacional entre Bolivia y Chile por el derecho al uso de las Aguas del Silala.

name: MOIL Tsimiroro heavy oil, Madagascar
Gold mining site in Palyul county, TAP, Sichuan, China
headline: In Palyul county, on August 17, 2010 four Tibetans, protesting against the mining environmental damages, were killed by the police in a shooting. They picked outside local governmental office for three days  to complain the increasing mining operation.

name: Crocodile Bay Resort and Marina, Golfo Dulce, Costa Rica
Selaulim Dam Goa, India
Bataan Nuclear Power Plant in Morong, Philippines
headline: The Bataan Nuclear Power Plant was built in 1984, but has never been operational owing to decades of activism and political engagement preventing it from functioning.

name: Derrame de ácido sulfúrico de Grupo México en el mar de Cortés, Sonora, México
headline: Un fuga en las instalaciones portuarias de la empresa Grupo México derramó 3,000 litros de ácido sulfúrico en el Mar de Cortés

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico Agua Zarca, Honduras
headline: Lenca indigenous sacred territory affected by  a hydropower plant, funded by international banks and climate funds. Lenca people are negated the use of water and leaders are criminalized and murdered. Bertha Caceres was assassinated in March 2016.

name: Rio Tinto's Bunder Diamond Mine and Murder Scandal in Madhya Pradesh, India
headline: Activist Shehla Masood was killed when exposing Rio Tinto's illegal mining proposal at the Bunder Diamond Mine next to the Panna Tiger Reserve. Her assassination was blamed on a love affair but many say otherwise.

name: Ibi Bateke Carbon Sink Plantation, DRC
Oil drilling project Ombrina Mare, Abruzzo, Italy
headline: Peoples' mobilization stopped oil drilling concessions in the Adriatic sea and push for the creation of ecotourism based activities and a national park. Meanwhile, UK based oil company Rockhopper launches arbitration claim against Italy

name: Protest against proposed relocation of Gaoqiao paraxylene (PX) plant into Jinshan, Shanghai, China
headline: Protests against the construction of a new PX plant in Jinshan District, Shanghai have taken place throughout a week as frustration builds over plans to relocate chemical plants to the district.

name: Korindo clearing forests for oil palm plantations, Papua, Indonesia
headline: The Korean palm oil and timber conglomerate Korindo Group is the biggest oil palm plantation company on Papua. In 2013, it started to clear the islands's precious forests, partly through illegal use of fire.

name: Oil palm and fires in Riau (Sumatra), Indonesia
headline: Serious consequences of the oil palm industry in Riau province, Sumatra. There is overlapping between the hotspot of fires, oil palm concessions and peatlands.

name: International Minerals Corporation (IMC) in Molleturo, Ecuador
Environmental and social concerns at the Lihir gold mine, Papua New Guinea
headline: Environmental and social issues have marked the Lihir mine. Indigenous land owners use traditional taboo markers made of ginger roots as a customary and non-violent grievance mechanism to denounce tensions and concerns regarding the mining operations.

name: Mineria ilegal, Jamundí, Colombia
Media campaigns to save the “Linda Potato”, Germany
headline: We want Linda back! The story of the migrant asylum seeker patato

name: Red Sea-Dead Sea Water Conveyance project, Israel, Jordan and Palestine
headline: In 2013, Israel, Jordan and Palestine signed an agreement on a project to replenish the rapidly shrinking Sea by transferring in water from the Red Sea along a 110-mile pipeline, in a region where distribution of water is a contentious issue.

name: Roma and Sinti settled to toxic landfill, Hamburg, Germany
headline: As part of the reparation of the crimes committed in the state against Sinti and Roma, the city authorities developed a housing plan on a landfill, exposing families to hazardous substances through soil and groundwater.

name: Rice monocultures and land conflicts with Quilombola communities in the Marajó archipelago, Pará, Brazil
headline: Land grabbing by the Quartiero family  to increase rice production theatens Quilombola communities.  Also, agrochemicals  endanger their health.

name: Lumber companies threaten extractive communities of Lábrea, Brazil
Perdida de Manglar, Tumaco, Colombia
Urbanización no planificada en Jurica y Juriquilla, Querétaro, México
headline: La expansión inmobiliaria de Querétaro está provocando inundaciones en diferentes puntos de la ciudad. Los daños materiales e inmateriales a viviendas o vialidades no están siendo indemnizados y por ello la población se va organizando

name: PFAS (PFOS) pollution by 3M, Belgium
headline: Chemical multinational 3M has been releasing toxic PFAS into the environment since the 1970s. The company has been sued multiple times, and constructions of the Oosterweel Tunnel raised concerns among locals.

name: Arsenic poisoning in 1955, Morinaga Milk, Japan
headline: Many babies who had taken arsenic-tainted milk produced by Morinaga Milk Industry died. A head of factory production was sentenced to jail after an 18 year long legal case.  Families' alliances asked for compensation.

name: Minas de cobre Cerro Chorcha y Cerro Colorado, Panama
headline: La oposicion a la mineria e hidroelectricas motivó grandes protestas contra la legislacion que las permite, argumentando la autonomia indígena.

name: Stone Crushing Machines in Sylhet district, Bangladesh
headline: Half a million people are affected by the havoc of stone crushing machines and heavy pollution in North-East Bangladesh for the production of building materials

name: TALCO's impact on Uzbekistan's border districts, Tajikistan
headline: Transnational complaints because of pollution and water issues caused in Uzbekistan by the Tajik TALCO aluminium company since 2010.

name: Crisis ambiental en la Bahía de Cienfuegos, Cuba
headline:
Oil and arsenic spills damaging the fishery, from heavy industry (oil refinery, fertilizer factory, thermal power station). _x000D_
_x000D_

name: Koh Phangan Airport, Thailand
headline: Provincial and forestry authorities intervened to halt construction of an airport on Koh Phangan, a mountainous, beach-fringed island in the Gulf of Thailand, when it was discovered that land clearance encroached on forest land in Than Sadet National Park

name: Urban development project in Maro, Malaga, Spain
headline: Farmers, citizens and environmental activist protect their cultural and natural landscape in Maro against a mega-urban development project.

name: San Mateo de Huanchor, Perú
Wastepicker mobilization against incinerator in São Bernardo do Campo, São Paulo, Brazil
headline: Wastepickers of São Bernardo do Campo have been at the forefront of a broad civil society alliance against the incineration of waste, leading to the temporary halting of one incinerator project and ongoing struggles against others in São Paulo.

name: Recognition of Indigenous Lands in Raposa Serra do Sol, Brazil
headline: After decades of repression and struggle for their rights, the indigenous communities of Reposa Serra do Sol obtained the recognition of their territory in 2005. Still, the defense of their land and human rights remains a hot matter.

name: Water Supply Project in Lake Kasumigaura, Ibaraki, Japan
headline: Fisher Cooperatives filed a court case against the water transfer project which destroys the biological communities and the ecosystems. The project has later been reconsidered by incorporating their opinions.

name: The right to fish in the Kamchatka region, Russian Federation
headline: The Itelmen are a small indigenous group  in Kovran, to the  West of the Kamchatka peninsula in the Far East region of Russia. Their right to fish is undermined by commercial fishing companies.

name: Djab Wurrung sacred trees and Western Highway expansion, Victoria, Australia
headline: An ongoing dispute over a highway extension in the state of Victoria which would see the cutting down of hundreds of trees culturally significant to the Djap Wurrung people.

name: Sinop Hydroelectric Dam, Mato Grosso, Brazil
headline: The recently opened Sinop Dam has revealed the inadequacies of Brazil’s environmental licensing system and caused massive fish die-off and methane emissions. Operations are currently interrupted, while affected communities still struggle for compensation.

name: Privatisation of the Almoraima, Cádiz, Spain
Emelle nation's largest hazardous waste landfill, USA
Cancellation of Korean 2nd coal plant in Sual, Pangasinan, Luzon, Philippines
headline: In October 2020 Korean's KEPCO stopped the plan for a 2nd CFPP in Sual, agreeing to stop overseas investment in coal power due to Korean New Deal.

name: Campaña StopMine Salau y Salvem Salau, Pirineos. Francia y España
headline: En ambos lados de la frontera franco-española en los Pirineos hay resistencia contra la extracción de tungsteno por parte de Apollo Minerals de Australia.

name: Hidroeléctrica Tranguil, Chile
headline: A small hydroelectric investment by RP Global causes a large conflict. Mapuche communities ask for investigation of death of an environmentalist in August 2016.

name: Deforestation on Orang Asli Temiar territory in the Balah Permanent Forest Reserve, Gua Musang, Malaysia
headline: The Temiar tribe of Orang Asli people have been blockading their territory against encroachment from deforestation by timber and plantation companies. The companies  continue to act with impunity despite successful legal action.

name: ArcelorMittals iron ore mining, Liberia
Eco-friendly hotels hurt the Andarawewa Forest Reserve, Sri Lanka
headline: Corruption, clientelism and land grabbing in order to construct a luxury resort in the Andarawewa Forest Reserve.

name: Atlântico Sul Shipyard, Pernambuco, Brazil
headline: Families were forced out of there homes and evicted from their lands in the Suápe region in Brazil. The local authorities have decided to expand the shipyard and the sea-harbor in order to make it accessible for very large tankers.

name: Protests and legal action against Fracking, Coahuila, Mexico
PT TSG conflict, Sumatra, Indonesia
ArcelorMittal steel production factory, Zenica, Bosnia and Herzegovina
headline: The citizens of Zenica are not convinced with the ArcelorMittal steel factory claims about the intentions to seriously invest in environmental improvements given that the Zenica’s air is still one of the most polluted in B&H.

name: Rejection of lithium extraction in the Tapias, Córdoba, Argentina
headline: The interest of exploring lithium minerals on a large scale in the tapias unleashes a local mobilization that leads to the local ban on large-scale mining in this locality.

name: Xinchang Jingxin Pharmaceutical Company, Zhejiang, China
headline: Antipollution protest by more than 10,000 villagers in Zhejiang against Xinchang Jingxin Pharmaceutical Company resulted in a temporary stoppage of the production and stringent environmental monitoring.

name: Oil exploration in the Black Sea, Russia
headline: "Hand off Sochi!", a small scale protest against oil exploration near Sochi (Сочи) to protect a closed territory that has no direct access to the ocean. Boycotts and pickets to stop explorations

name: Ruptured Pipeline Spews Crude Oil, Nigeria
Highway Orte-Mestre, Italy
Glencore in Tintaya copper mine in Espinar, Perú
headline: Militarization, abuses of human rights, police repression to the protesting communities and massive contamination of heavy metals in the soil and in the bodies of peoples and animals.

name: Greenlink Nevada Transmission Project in Nevada, USA
headline: Environmental organizations and residents protest the plan for two, large transmission line projects on mostly public lands that would allow remote areas of the Nevada desert to be opened to utility-scale renewable energy projects.

name: Planta Hidrometalurgica de Coro coro, Bolivia
headline: Las comunidades denuncian la violación de multiples derechos, a la consulta previa, libre e informada, la usurpación de suelos, el desvío de aguas, las amenazas  las amenazas físicas contra dirigentes y la constante incertidumbre sobre el futuro.

name: Daule Peripa hydropower dam, Ecuador
Yellowknife gold mine and arsenic pollution, Canada
headline: The gold  Giant Mine in the Yellowknife region operated from 1948 to 1999, releasing 237,000 tonnes of waste arsenic trioxide dust from ore extraction and roasting processes.

name: Opposition in Vancouver (Canada) to Deep-Sea Mining in Nauru
headline: A proposal to mine the deep sea has prompted rejection from environmental groups and corporations alike who fear catastrophic levels of carbon could be released from the subsoil.

name: Shrimp farming, Bangladesh
headline: The increase and the intensification of shrimp farming along the Bangladesh coast remains on the governmental agenda in spite of the industry's verified and denounced environmental and social costs

name: Navarrese Corridor High Speed Rail, Spain
headline: More infrastructure for development and higher speed? The same old story in the country of big costruction business.

name: Kasompe Airstrip, Zambia
headline: On 20th August 2022 Chingola Municipal Council and Zambia Police Service demolished more than 300 houses on land around Kasompe Airstrip. Alternative land was not provided and victims received only limited help of food relief and shelter at a campsite.

name: No to privatization of water in New Orleans, USA
headline: Water for all, not for profit. Citizens in New Orleans kick off Veolia and Suez from their commons

name: Jindal Steel captive power plant in Godda, Jharkhand, India
Romainville Leisure Park, east of Paris, France
headline: The conflict concerns the development of a leisure park instead of a forest. The conflict divides the Ile de France region and the local authorities from the ecological associations who want to avoid the destruction of  the forest.

name: Simlipal National Park, conflict over conservation project, Odisha, India
headline: Tribal populations pushed out from their forest - a case of displacement and dispossession from the Simlipal Tiger Reserve in Odisha.

name: Controversial incineration plant in Tatarstan, Russia
headline: Five incineration plants are to be built near Moscow and Tatarstan; over the last couple of months people have started to protest against the construction of the plants due to too much pollution.

name: Miike coal mine explosion and disaster, Japan
headline: The Mitsui Miike coal dust explosion on 9 November 1963 was the second deadliest coal mining disaster in Japan. 458 miners were killed in the accident and twice as many were permanently injured. Monetary compensation was small.

name: Amager Fælled: the defence of the commons in Copenhagen, Denmark
headline: "Who wants to live in a stone desert?" The nature reserve Amager Fælled, i.e. the ‘Amager commons’, is a park of the people, home of species distinctive to the region. Under threat now for urban infrastructure projects by By & Havn.

name: Baku–Tbilisi–Ceyhan pipeline, Georgia
headline: Ensuring energy security to Europe; the BTC pipeline will bring oil from the Caspian sea to the Mediterranean leaving on the ground socio-environmental impacts, violence and corruption

name: Baspa II Hydroelectric Project, HP, India
headline: 300MW, the first plant of this size in the private sector, is also one of the main conflictual plants in Kinnaur valley. Workers also join hands with affected communities under the slogan "Kinnaur Bachao"

name: Enbridge natural gas compressor in North Weymouth, MA, USA
headline: Enbridge’s construction and operation of a natural gas compression station in densely populated North Weymouth, MA has met opposition over the significant environmental justice and safety concerns it presents.

name: Farmworkers poisoned by DBCP (Nemagon), Philippines
headline: For more than 20 years farmers in Philippines who worked in banana plantations were never told they were spreading a hazardous poison.  Water and soil still toxic nowadays.

name: Water contamination in Biesiesvlei, North West, South Africa
headline: Consistently corrupt water governance practices have led to infant deaths and widespread illness among those living in Biesiesvlei owing to raw sewage contamination.

name: Takahama Nuclear Plants 3 and 4 reopen for commercial use, Japan
headline: Two of Kansai Electric Company's nuclear reactors, Takahama 3 and Takahama 4 are now in operation for commercial use, after a high court injunction was lifted.

name: Bauxite Mining in Paderu, Visakhapatnam, India
Inga 3 and Gran Inga complex hydropower project on Congo river, DRC
headline: World Bank withdrew from what might become the largest hydro scheme in the world per generation capacity. A first step towards stopping ever more centralized energy control and promoting micro schemes

name: Bafokeng Platinum mine, South Africa
Paramo de Santurbán, Colombia
Illegal logging and ‘timber laundering’ in Lumphat Wildlife Sanctuary, Cambodia
headline: Corruption and illegal practises under the Economic Land Concessions scheme of the Cambodian government

name: Glencore-Katanga Mining Ltd., Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC)
headline: The largest worldwide production of Cobalt brings environmental and water pollution, but also child and forced labour, smuggling of materials, fiscal and tax evasion, violence on activists and human rights defenders

name: Sardinal, Costa Rica
Don Sahong hydropower project, Laos
headline: The real cost for 260 MW? Read about the story of the Don Sahong dam and support the demands of EJOs for more impact studies and ultimately the reconsideration of the whole energy plan.

name: Harvard investment in grabbed land and the displacement of peasants in western Bahia, Brazil
headline: Between 2008 and 2012, Harvard University endowment purchased two farm areas in western Bahia, rekindling longstanding land conflicts that have led to the displacement of peasant communities for the sake of profit.

name: Contaminación por carboeléctricas de la CFE en Coahuila, México
headline: Centrales carboeléctricas generan contaminación del aire y enfermedades en el municipio de Nava en Coahuila

name: Mining of building materials and quarry threats indigenous Pitaguary, Brazil
headline: The indigenous group tried to speak with the company’s representatives but received death threats. Hence, the Pitaguary decided to occupy the quarry on November 2011.

name: “Exxon, the World Bank, and One of the Biggest Oil Discoveries of our Time”, Guyana
headline: Exxon gets a lifeline for its declining profits on the most rapidly expanding oil frontier in the world and leaves only the crumps to the people of Guyana. The project threatens to release 4 GtCO2 and an oil spill would cover the whole Caribbean.

name: Illegal logging in Northern Sierra Madre National Park, Isabela, Philippines
headline: Large-scale illegal logging networks, appropriating millions of dollars, threaten primary forests and thousands of villagers, depending on the ecosystem services provided by the unique Natural Park

name: Dahanu Thermal Power Station, Maharashtra, India
Geraizeira communities against land enclosure through Fazenda Estrondo, Bahia, Brazil
headline: In the southern Cerrado, where industrial agricultural expansion clashes with traditional communities, the mega-farm Estrondo has taken over land of the geraizeiros and converted the savannah ecosystem into cash-crop monocultures.

name: Rovina gold and copper mining, Romania
headline: In the area already affected by the Baia Mare cyanide spill disaster, the largest mining operation in the country is being proposed by the Canadian Carpathian Gold. It would be the first fully private mining project in Romania

name: Riaño dam, Spain
Cape/Gencors asbestos mining & milling activity, South Africa
Daewo blocks only source of natural water  in Okordia Clan
Abandoned tin mines endanger communities, Plateau State, Nigeria
Kangqiao lead poisoning incident, Shanghai, China
headline: Dozens of children in Shanghai have tested positive for excessive levels of lead in their blood since September 2011. Related firms were ordered to halt lead-related operations and to clean the contaminated soil.

name: Georgetown's garbage woes and small attempts to include waste pickers, Guyana
headline: International investment led to the closure of Guyana's most problematic dump and supported affected informal waste pickers, however without including them fully at the new landfill. In the meantime, waste continues to pile up in Georgetown's streets.

name: A. Brown / Nakeen Corporation palm oil plantation and human rights violations in Opol, Misamis Oriental, Philippines
Mining Project Sonora Lithium in Sonora, Mexico
headline: In the municipality of Bacadéhuachi in Sonora, it is intended to open the first Lithium Mine in Mexico and one of the largest worldwide, which has awakened debates and criticism at the national level on the exploitation of lithium in Mexico.

name: Esmeraldas refinery, Ecuador
Saving Goolengook Forest Block, Australia
Tianjingwa waste incineration power plant in Nanjing, Jiangsu, China
headline: Local residents complain about the Tianjingwa landfill site and appose the planned waste incineration power plant.

name: Sand mining and related violence in Makueni County, Kenya
headline: Residents are divided between those protecting the sand and those harvesting it for money. Mining without a  permit is banned, but illegal harvesters come day and night in Kenya's sand mining boom.

name: Touristic development of Muzil peninsula, Croatia
headline: "The Civil Initiative for Muzil" opposes the exclusive touristic plan of giving under concessions or selling public areas in the Adriatic sea coastal zone and call for public participation in defining tourism planning.

name: Industries polluting Taihu Lake in Jiangsu, China
headline: It's not only climate or rainfall change; industries are also responsible for contamination of water bodies and death of aquatic life.

name: The Fujia Petrochemical Paraxylene (PX) Plant protest in Dalian, Liaoning, China
Hainan residents against construction of coal-fired power plant, China
headline: Hainan residents protest against a 300 million dollar coal-fired power plant since 2011 and are violently repressed.

name: Installation of a photovoltaic park by Limes Renewable Energy in Val di Noto, Sicily, Italy
headline: Solar panel installation conflict on a UNESCO site between Noto and Pachino (Sicily)

name: Billion Tree Tsunami Afforestation Project, Pakistan
headline: The government has targeted the forest area in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province for a major enhancement. Conflicts between state authorities and ethnic Gujjars have emerged over forest enclosures.

name: Mozambique Gas Project, villagers dispossessed for off shore drilling, Cabo Delgado, Mozambique
headline: The project leads to awful changes in Cabo Delgado province, displacing farming and fishing communities who lose their livelihoods, giving incentives to youth to join  Islamist rebel groups.

name: Millions of tonnes of radioactive waste from Soviet-times, Istiklol (Tabošar), Tajikistan
headline:
Million tonnes of radioactive waste from uranium mining remain in unsecured sites.  Tajikistan is concerned over rehabilitation and safety of tailings from Soviet times._x000D_
Soviet-time nuclear waste in the country is 55 million tonnes.

name: Save the mangrove forest in Pitas (Sabah), Malaysia
headline: Sabah’s laws which are supposed to safeguard the environment are being blatantly disregarded by the proponents of the large Pitas Shrimp Park, according to Sabah Environmental Protection Association.

name: Soda ash mining in Lake Natron, Tanzania
Resistance to soy monoculture expansion in Colonia Barbero, San Pedro, Paraguay
headline: The rural community of Colonia Barbero is struggling against the expansion of soybean monocultures, which employ almost no local labour while using strong agrochemicals, polluting neighbouring plantations.

name: Kitchenuhmaykoosib Inninuwug peoples against platinum exploration by Platinex Inc., Ontario, Canada
headline: Kitchenuhmaykoosib Inninuwug protect their traditional lands and waters in response to Platinex Inc acquired mining interests 19 km2 in their territory.

name: Mina San Felipe de Minera Frisco, Baja California, Mexico
headline: Las mineras Real de Ángeles, San Felipe y María, subsidiarias de Minera Frisco del magnate Carlos Slim, han ocupado medio millón de hectáreas en la región colindante con el delta del Río Colorado a unos pocos kilómetros del Mar de Cortes.

name: Massacre of Curuguaty, Paraguay
headline: On June 15th, 2012, 11 landless peasants and 6 policemen were killed in Curuguaty, as the peasants were violently evicted from Marina Kue in order to sow transgenic soybeans by the Campos Morombí company.

name: Exxon Mobil human rights abuses in Aceh, Indonesia
headline: The cost of gas in terms of human rights. Complicity and impunity of the large gas company in the militarization and violence in the extraction area

name: The Bridge over the Strait of Messina, Italy
Fracking and flooding in Fares, Egypt
headline: In 2008 oil company DanaGas set off explosives to assess rock formations for fracking. Soon after the explosions, contaminated waters started to rise out of the ground, destroying farms, trees, water supplies and homes in the nearby village of Fares.

name: Gubin Brody lignite mine, Poland
headline: The towns of Gubin and Brody on the Polish-German border proposed as a location for new open pit lignite mine became the epicenters of the anti-coal movement in Poland.

name: Resistance against Rotterdam and Amsterdam fossil fuel ports, the Netherlands
headline: Amsterdam and Rotterdam are the two largest petroleum and coal harbours of Europe. Coal boats arrive from Colombia, USA, South Africa and Russia with 70% of the coal heading to Germany. Large protest camps have taken place in the last years.

name: Safi power station, Morocco
headline: Clean coal power for nationals and renewables for export to Europe? The interesting story of Safi, whose citizens do not believe in the clean power promises and they still remember air pollution from major sulphur dioxide leaks five years ago.

name: Methanol plant on the Taman Peninsula, Russia
headline: Stiff opposition to the Methanol plant on the Taman Peninsula in Russia forced Abu Dhabi's companies to withdraw.

name: Waste incinerator near Wrocław, Lower Silesia, Poland
headline: The local community near Wrocław resists the planned waste incinerator, sold as "RDF-fired heat and power plant" by the promoters. After six months of conflict, they have produced a 63-page report describing their fight for justice.

name: Sewage Dumps, St Lawrence River, Quebec, Canada
headline: Government-approved raw sewage dumps compromise water quality and put species at risk against the wishes of local Mohawk and Francophone communities.

name: Tourism development versus nature conservation in Wadi El Gemal Protected Area along the Red Sea, Egypt
headline: The conflict is latent and intractable as it reflects the legal chaos in Egypt, particularly in relation to natural resources management and development.

name: Hidroeléctrica Cachuela Esperanza en el Río Beni, Bolivia
headline: This dam would be for electricity export to Brazil, part of the Madeira-Beni system of dams. It is questioned by environmental groups and indigenous communities because of displacement, loss of biodiversity.

name: Anti-asbestos Campaign, Australia
Planta industrial de cloruro de potasio y planta de carbonato de litio en el Salar de Uyuni, Bolivia
headline: Exploitation of lithium by Bolivian and Korean companies from a large salt flat at more than 3,000 meters above sea level. Conflicts over the use of water and also over the difficult coexistence with tourism.

name: Oil Spills devastates Swamps in Ikeinghenbiri Community, Nigeria
Oil palm plantation conflicts in Bangka-Belitung, Indonesia
headline: The two main islands of Sumatra, Bangka and Belitung are covered by palm oil plantations. 70% of their forest have been replaced. Communities protest against land conflicts, water contamination and deforestation caused by the plantations.

name: Lungmen Nuclear Power Plant (“Nuke 4”) stopped, Taiwan
headline: The 4th Nuclear Power Plant (2600 MW) is stalled since 2014 because of opposition before and after the Fukushima accident. Uranium fuel rods had been uploaded. What should be done with them?

name: Barra Grande Dam on River Pelotas, Brazil
Landless farmers and rubber tappers displaced by cattle rancher in Capixaba, Acre, Brazil
headline: The expulsion of landless farmers and rubber tappers from Seringal Capatará through a rancher illustrates the persisting struggle for land and social rights and the increasing pressure on traditional communities and forests from large-scale agriculture.

name: Hydroelectric power plants on the Schwarze Sulm River, Austria
headline: Little electricity for much environmental damage: Defenders of the Schwarze Sulm River protest against the construction of hydroelectric power plants within the protected Natura2000 habitat.

name: Agro-business for biofuels in the Ndiaël Reserve, by Senhuile-Senethanol S.A., Senegal
headline: Senhuile S.A. project to cultivate bio-fuels in the Ndiaël has been a failure. Yet the company remains present on the 20.000 hectares granted by Presidential decree, disrupting the locals' grazing lands.

name: Waste incineration fuelled cement plant in Morata de Tajuña, Spain
headline: The big Portland cement company reduces production costs by burning cheap urban waste as do other cement companies in Spain. The city council orders air quality study .

name: Contaminación por quema de caña de azúcar en Nueva Esperanza, Perú
Bory Solar PV farm in Saint-Trinit, France
headline: The renewable energy company Q Energy is planning to build a solar plant in the commune of Saint-Trinit in southeast France. Residents are opposing, mainly on aesthetic and environmental grounds, and have launched a public campaign to stop the project.

name: Trollvind Floating Offshore Wind Project, Norway
headline: World's largest offshore floating wind project planned off the coast of Norway. The massive expansion plans for Norwegian offshore wind are partly driven to meet increasing electricity demand. The project was put on hold in 2023 due largely to economic inviability.

name: Heliopolis Municipality Completely Removes Tram Line, Egypt
headline: Egyptian state removes tram line in Heliopolis amid public outrage, and despite previous public appeals for its overhaul

name: Manantial Espejo, gold and silver mining, Santa Cruz, Argentina
headline: Minería de oro y plata a cielo abierto y subterránea cerca de Gobernador Gregores, propiedad de Pan American Silver. Riesgos laborales y accidentes ambientales en una provincia (Santa Cruz) promotora de la gran minería._x000D_

name: The Cleaner Lagos Initiative Threatens Wastepicker Livelihoods, Nigeria
headline: The Cleaner Lagos Initiative has improved business for private waste management companies like Revive and Visionscape while further marginalizing wastepickers and threatening their livelihoods.

name: Artvin Kabaca Valley Hydro power plant, Turkey
The New Reppie Incinerator at Koshe Landfill in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
headline: In August 2018, Reppie, Africa's first waste to energy incinerator, was inaugurated at the Koshe landfill site, on the outskirts of Addis Ababa, Ethiopia. The project's completion threatens waste picker livelihoods by burning recyclable materials.

name: Wyhl anti-nuke movement in Kaiserstuhl, Germany
headline: Wyhl is where the German anti-nuclear movement cut its teeth in the early 1970s, based on Bürgerinitiativen and university researchers. The expression "Energiewende" (energy transition) so important in German energy policy was born in this struggle.

name: USA Mobile User Objective System (MUOS) in Niscemi, Italy
Listuguj First Nation conflict over fishing and logging rights, Canada
headline: Listuguj Mi'gmaq First Nation faced police raids in the 90s over fishing rights. These conflict led to community mobilizing and to the successful assertion of Mi'gmaq governance over fisheries on the Restigouche River.

name: Rogun Dam, Tajikistan
headline: Serious human rights abuses from World Bank-funded dams caused the institution to move away from large hydropower projects in the '90s. But the bank is now back and is considering funding the highest dam ever in the world.

name: Mawchi tungsten (wolfram) and tin mine, Karenni state, Myanmar
headline: The Molo Women Mining Watch Network and other civil society groups mobilized to halt the further expansion of the centuries-old Mawchi tungsten and tin mines

name: Tauramena, Casanare, Colombia
Shells Operations contaminate Okorogbene Community, Nigeria
Cross Bronx Highway, USA
headline: An historical urban justice issue in New York city, when between 1948 and 1972 a highway was built by one of the biggest infrastructure promoters of the times, known as the "master builder"

name: Lafarge's limestone mining at Bangladesh border, in Meghalaya, India
headline: The company has a 935 ha limestone mine, transporting it through a 17 km conveyor belt to the cement plant in Chatak in Bangladesh since 2005. The company was forced to stop in 2007; the Supreme Court allowed mining in 2011.

name: Roma exposed to epidemics due to waste overflow in “Block 20”, Yambol Bulgaria
headline: Romani families exposed to epidemics and infections due to waste overflow in Block 20 in Rayna Knyaginya,  Yambol. The bloc was demolished by the authorities and Romani families live in shacks.

name: Contamination of drinking water by chlorothalonil in Cartago, Costa Rica
headline: Chlorothalonil, a toxic fungicide banned in Europe but still sold in Costa Rica, is polluting the ecosystems and threatening people's health in Cartago. The problem is likely to be the tip of the iceberg in the region.

name: Minería de Oro y Cobre Cerro Casale/Aldebaran, Chile
headline: Este proyecto sería la mayor explotación de oro del mundo. A pesar de todos los EIA, lo que ha tardado el proyecto y la oposición de comunidades indígenas y agrícolas, está actualmente en fase de exploración esperando, de ser aprobado, operar en 2022.

name: Illegal, unreported and unrecorded fishing practices by Chinese industrial fleets, Ghana
headline: Ghana's fisheries risk extinction, putting under jeopardy the livelihoods of millions of Ghanians. At large scale, Chinese fishing practices threaten the whole Western African stocks.

name: Gold Fields' Cerro Corona gold mine, Peru
headline: Gold Fields' most profitable mine worldwide demobilizes people through huge Corporate Social Responsability investments but leaves behind pollution and impoverishment

name: Tata Steel creates pollution and public health concerns  in IJmuiden, The Netherlands
headline: Steel production severely impacts public health and environment. Even though Tata Steel is the country's biggest emitter of CO2 and nitrogen, the factory is still operating as usual.

name: Pheapimex-Fuchan conflict, Cambodia
Singur FIAT-TATA Project, India
headline: Thanks to the local population severe opposition to the car factory, the company withdrew from the fertile lands of Singur. Still the farmers have not been given back their lands.

name: Industrial Complex Porto Açu, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
headline: Industrial Complex Porto Açu, to the north of Rio de Janeiro State, directly impacts 5.000 people and imposes degradation in an area of environmental protection  to the benefit of iron ore exports.

name: Radioactive contamination from an old uranium mine, Köprübaşı province, Turkey
headline: The remainders of an old uranium mine in Manisa, Turkey pose great radioactive dangers to the local communities. Authorities on their side deliberately take no action.

name: Sri City SEZ in Sathyavedu, AP, India
Uranium mine reopening in Pecs, Hungary
PT Indo Bharat Rayon Viscose Plant, Indonesia
headline: The largest viscose plant in Indonesia may pose serious health risks for plant workers and local residents through toxic processes, air pollution, water pollution, and suspected illegal dumping of toxic waste.

name: Panem Coal Mines, Jharkhand, India
headline: Local villagers protested against one of the largest coal mines of Jharkhand, they went on strike. Sister Valsa John, involved in movement against displacement of tribal Santhal people, was killed.

name: EcoPark Satellite City Project, Hanoi, Vietnam
headline: A ‘perfect harmony of humans and nature’? The EcoPark Satellite City Project causes currently the largest land conflict in Vietnam, due to forced evictions of farmers, depending on their agricultural land to make a living

name: Norocholai Coal Power Station, Sri Lanka
headline: Norochcholai Power Plant is the first Sri Lanka's Coal Power Plant. The implementation of the central is causing several environmental effects and is affecting the livelihoods of the population living in the surrounding area.

name: Fatty oil and caustic soda spill in Msunduzi River, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa
headline: On August 13, 2019, Willowton Group leaked 1.6 million liters of fatty oils and caustic soda into the Msunduzi River, near Pietermaritzburg.

name: Maruti Suzuki Gujarat Plant, India
New Yogyakarta International Airport (NYIA), Java, Indonesia
headline: Farmers resist against eviction for New Yogyakarta International Airport (NYIA) since 2011. NYIA is not just an airport infrastructure but an aerotropolis, i.e. recreational, business, residencial and industrial areas

name: Balangir Power Station, Orissa, India
Caserones, Chile
Impacts of iron ore mining in Conceicao do Mato Dentro/MG, Brazil
Gori/Kori Nuclear Plant 1, South Korea
headline: The Kori Nuclear Power Complex was slated to house ten reactors in a highly populated area in South East Korea, close to the country's second city Busan. By 2017 such plans are being reduced drastically.

name: Pesticide Pollution, Australia
headline: Australian Pesticides Map: “We are concerned Australians worried about pesticide contamination. Isn’t it odd that almost all of the information on this website has not been made easily available to members of the public in the past?” https://pesticides.au

name: Rubber tappers against cattle ranchers and the murder of Chico Mendes, Brazil
headline:
Chico Mendes, a Brazilian environmental defender _x000D_
campaigned against ranchers to stop the deforestation of the rainforest. In 1988 he was shot down. He and his fight are symbols  for the Global Environmental Justice Movement.

name: A51 highway extension, Trièves, France
headline: A highway project to connect Grenoble & Marseille has been opposed by local resistance for over 20 year. Parts have been constructed but after persisting local mobilization the construction of the rest of the highway has been suspended.

name: Mgbede Community and abandoned oil well site, Nigeria
Maritime Terminal of Teluk Rubiah of Vale, Malaysia
headline: Local movements raised against environmental disruption due to a iron ore processing facility, which covers a vast area of Protected Natural Reserve.

name: Baita Craciunesti Teascu gold deposit, Romania
headline: A gold exploration site purchased by Gabriel Resources in the NATURA 2000 site ROSPA 0132, at only 5km away from Certej mining area

name: Puerto Ebano (Manabi) against shrimp-farming, Ecuador
Mining and logging operations in Pantaron Range, Talaingod, Davao del Norte, Philippines
headline: The Pantaron Range is the central cordillera of Mindanao and land of Manobo communities. Intrusions, evictions, killings and threats against Manobo communities were recorded since 1991 from mining and logging companies.

name: Nile Basin Reforestation Project, Uganda
ANSWERS and Sheridan Avenue Steam Plant (SASP) in Sheridan Hollow, Albany, NY. USA
headline: Sheridan Hollow for Renewable Energy (SHARE) demand the phase out of ANSWERS and SASP thermal plants in their Albany neighbourhood and propose alternative solutions including geothermal energy.

name: Asbestos damages  in Casale Monferrato by Eternit, Italy
headline: Breathing in the the dust of death, the most famous and emblematic case of asbestos production in italy

name: Mejia Thermal Power Station (MTPS), India
Great Nicobar development plan, Nicobar islands, India
headline: A proposed transhipment port - with an airport, power plant and residential area - would take up 18% of the island, with large potential impacts on indigenous Shompen people and the great variety of wildlife including migratory leatherback turtles.

name: Lithium mining in Salar Coipasa, Chile and Bolivia
headline: In the Salar de Copaisa, the Aymara community of Ancovinto opposes the lithium exploration project of the Canadian company Lithium Chile for its socio-environmental affections.

name: New Zimbabwe Steel River Pollution, Kwekwe, Zimbabwe
Lithium exploitation in the Salar de Oroz-Cauchari, Argentina
headline: It advances lithium mining (and potassium) in the Salares de Ororoz and Olroz-Cauchari. They are impact on the availability of water and protected areas and the division between communities.

name: Hydroelectric Power Station, Laxá River, Skútustaðahreppur, Iceland
Allianoi Ancient City and Yortanli Dam, Turkey
PT Pakerin land use conflict with Pangkala Bayat community, Indonesia
Access to Green Space in Los Angeles, USA
Ilegal mining in indigenous territories Kayapó, Pará, Brazil
headline: The Kayapó people of the Amazon are excellent guardians of the forest but illegal gold mining and big business interests  is threatening their ecosystems and livelihoods.

name: Dirty and dangerous shipbreaking in Gadani, Pakistan
headline: Gadani is located about 60 km south-west of Karachi, on a 10 km stretch of coastline, it is the largest ship-breaking yard in the world after Alang and Chittagong. Unhealthy working conditions.

name: Afrodita-Dorato, Condorcanqui, Peru
Presa La Maroma, San Luis Potosí, Mexico
headline: La construcción de una presa amenaza el territorio sagrado de Wirikuta y comunidades locales. Hasta junio 2021 el proyecto continúa suspendido.

name: Hydropower Dams in the Verdon river. Chasteuil, Provence, France
headline: The hydroelectric dam of Chasteuil, Castellane,  caused a conflict of several local organizations against EDF. It was not built. It would lead to more tourism and a degradation of the territory and landscapes.

name: Sakhalin-1 and -2 oil and gas development projects, Russia
headline: Mobilizations against environmental impacts and harm to gray whale shakes shareholders partnership and makes EBRD withdraw

name: Cancer Village Xiping and Pingnan County Chromium Pollution Case in Fujian, China
headline: Local villagers of Xiping collected water samples and together with a local doctor approached state authorities. They finally won a legal case which earmarked the history of environmental controversies in China

name: Lack of Clean Water in Central Valley, CA, USA
Brétignolles-sur-mer Yatch Marina, Vendée, France
headline: Private companies are trying to create a marina at the cost of millions of euros from public money and destroying biodiversity. The local inhabitants will not let their beach and dunes be destroyed.

name: Ho Chunk Nation of Wisconsin fights for Rights of Nature, USA
headline: In September 2016 , the Ho-Chunk Nation in Wisconsin was the first tribal nation in the United States to advance an amendment to their tribal constitution to recognize the rights of nature.

name: Waste incineration facility in Cercs, Barcelona, Spain
headline: A waste incineration facility planned to be placed in Cercs, using the infrastructure of an old coal power plant and presenting high risks for the population and the environment.

name: Kashipur Anti-Bauxite mining movement, India
headline: A short chronicle of the long and violent struggle of Kashipur against the UAIL bauxite mining and alumina refinery.

name: Adivasi protest in Gare Pelma coal mine, Kosampali, Chhattisgarh, India
headline: A two decade long conflict over coal mining in the Gare Pelma block in Chhattisgarh, involving violence, prolonged struggle and with mixed results and uncertainties.

name: Enchroachment on Mau Forests Complex, Kenya
Environmental discrimination of Roma people along Sajó wetlands in Hungary
headline: Fewer resources in building public infrastructure and providing access to water, heating, and sewage in the flooding part of the Sajó river where Roma community reside.

name: Wind farm at Volovja reber, Slovenia
headline: Elektro Primorska, a state owned firm, wanted to build a massive wind farm at the Natura 2000-listed Volovja reber but its plans were thwarted by environmental opposition.

name: No Fracking in the Guaraní Aquifer in Uruguay
headline: The Guaraní Aquifer System is being threatened in Uruguay and Argentina by a drilling scheme in search of hydrocarbons that can irreversibly contaminate the soils and underground deposits.

name: Ikwezi Coal Mining Project in Dannhauser, Newcastle, South Africa
headline: Ikwezi Mining displaced community members, destroyed graves and livelihoods. No prior and informed consent. Local activists and  EJOs are pursuing legal action and protesting.

name: Minera Tres Valles en Coquimbo, Chile
headline: Graves impactos sobre el agua, falta de información y consentimiento de la población, y graves afectaciones a la actividad agrícola y ganadera son solo algunas de las consecuencias de la minería en esta región, por Vale y otras empresas

name: Granite extraction in Karoonjhar Mountain in Sindh, Pakistan
headline: Residents of Nagarparkar protest against the extraction of granite from Karonjhar mountains.

name: New Terminal of the Paris Roissy Airport, France
headline: Between 2018 and 2021, the project of creating a new terminal at the Paris Roissy Airport was contested by activists in online compain and during protests. The French government abandoned the project in February 2021.

name: Tanjung Jati A coal-fired power plant, Indonesia
headline: WALHI West Java filed a lawsuit against the issuing of the environmental permit of the Tanjung Jati A coal-fired power plant on grounds of climate change and public finance burdens. The plant was canceled by PLN due to financial reasons in July 2022.
