name: Proposal for a Nuclear Repository on Treaty 3 land near Ignace, Ontario, Canada
headline: The Nuclear Waste Management Organization (NWMO) is considering establishing a nuclear waste repository near Ignace, Ontario, Canada, on Treaty 3 Territory of the Anishinaabe people.

name: Tamanthi dam on Chindwin River, Sagaing Division, Myanmar
headline: The Tamanthi dam, proposed by India’s and Burma’s government, would have threatened ethnic minorities and a unique river ecosystem sustaining local cultures and livelihoods. Civil society groups welcomed the cancellation of the project in 2013.

name: Global public pressure for Antarctic Ocean Sanctuary
headline: Greenpeace's demand with over two million signatures for Antarctic Ocean Sanctuary in Weddell Sea against krill overfishing and other damages was blocked as Norway, China, and Russia voted against the protected area.

name: Proyecto minero Morococha, Perú
Sponge Iron Plants in Odisha, India
Rukuda irrigation dam, Orissa, India
Oil seed farming project in Tana River Delta, Kenya
Celtejo's SLAPP against Arlindo Marques -  Celulose do Tejo, SA, Portugal
headline: Pulp mill operator, Celtejo (Altri Group), sued an environmentalist for €250,000 in compensation for his allegation that pollution levels in the Tejo River are unacceptable.

name: Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP), Central Sulawesi, Indonesia
headline: The Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park (IMIP), Indonesia’s largest nickel-based industrial area, has raised environmental, social, health and labor right concerns and faced a number of protests related to nickel  processing and captive CFPP activities.

name: Cochabamba Water War, Bolivia
Minera Aguilar threatens Quebrada de  Humahuaca, Jujuy, Argentina
headline: Mining pollution in Jujuy province, at over 4,000 m. high. Complaints because of contamination with lead. Also, active labour movement.

name: Israeli stone quarrying in the Occupied Palestinian Territory
headline: Cemex, Heidelberg Cement and Israeli quarrying activities in the OPT violate rights and run counter to a United Nations resolution demanding that Israel cease exploitation, damage, depletion and endangerment of Palestinian natural resources.

name: Proyecto Hidroeléctrico El Chaparral, El Salvador
headline: Comunidades desplazadas por el Proyecto Hidroeléctrico El Chaparral, El Salvador. Más de 60 mil campesinos y campesinas  afectadas.

name: Silawathurei large-scale Cashew plantations, Sri Lanka
headline: The Civil Security Force has appropriated land for cashew plantations at the boundary of Wilpattu National Park, affecting local environment, already under pressure by human settlements of returnees from the civil war.

name: Agroquímicos e insuficiencia renal, San Luis Talpa, El Salvador
Cerro Matoso, Colombia
headline: F

name: Puesco-Momolluco complex and Tolten Watershed hydropower plans, Chile
headline: "Los ríos nos unen" (rivers unite us), say basin-wide opposition to "sacrifice watersheds"; read about this RoR project included in the government study aiming at massive exploitation of major river basins in the country

name: Nuevo aeropuerto y tala ilegal en Creel, Chihuahua, Mexico
headline: Una comunidad indígena Rarámuri se opone a la construcción de un aeropuerto en Creel, parte del megaproyecto turístico "Barrancas del Cobre". El 6 de junio del 2020 el líder indígena Antonio Montes Enríquez fue encontrado sin vida en las afueras de Creel.

name: Hydroelectric power station in Gratkorn by Verbund and Energie Steiermark, Austria
headline: The hydropower plant project in Gratkorn raises concerns about water quality and species protection.

name: China National Nuclear Corporation Longwan industrial park, Jiangmen, Guangdong, China
headline: China National Nuclear Corporation (CNNC's) Jiangmen uranium processing plant is scrapped after thousands take part in protests.

name: Shell's gas flaring furnance in Opolo-Epie, Nigeria
headline: By 2011, Shell opened a new gas flare and even though Nigerian law officially banned such gas combustion devices in 1984. Such practice pollutes the locals' air and environment while heavily contributes to climate change.

name: Tabio - Rio Frio mining activities, Colombia
Marsh Arabs and Draining of Iraqi Wetlands, Iraq
headline: The draining of the Mesopotamian Marshes occurred in Iraq and to a smaller degree in Iran between the 1950s and 1990s to clear large areas of the marshes in the Tigris-Euphrates river system.

name: Oposición de comunidades indígenas a la XI Ronda Petrolera, Ecuador
headline: The XI oil licitation round in the South East of Ecuador has received some offers from companies from China, Spain, despite indigenous opposition.

name: Minera Tahuaya in Salaverna del grupo Frisco, Zacatecas, Mexico
headline: Salaverna, a town that could disappear at any moment. This semi-desert community has resisted the pressure of open-pit mining exploitation called Tayahua (belonging to Carlos Slim ).

name: Small scale fishery and tourism in Xcalak, Quintana Roo, Mexico
headline: In the small locality of Xcalak, the local fishery has been a means of livelihood. However, it has been threatened by the tourist business dominated by foreign capital.

name: Serlui-B Hydropower Project, Mizoram, India
Ecocido en el Río La Pasión en Sayaxché, Petén, Guatemala
headline: ¡Ecocidio! 150 km del río La Pasión en el Petén fue contaminado con un plaguicida que mató a miles de especies y perjudicó a más de 30.000  de familias. La denuncias cobraron la vida del activista Rigoberto Lima Choc.

name: Tata Mundra Ultra Mega Power Project, Gujarat, India
Virginia's King William Reservoir Project, USA
headline: Plans for a reservoir on the Mattaponi River threaten to disproportionally impact the lives of the Mattaponi Tribe, as well as resulting in the greatest permitted destruction of wetlands in the mid-Atlantic area since the enactment of the Clean Water Act.

name: Acueducto Independencia, Hermosillo, Sonora, Mexico
Coltan Parque Nacional Puinawai, Colombia
Bogota wastepickers’ inclusive labor conditions put at risk by change in policies, Colombia
headline: In 2013 the wastepickers were recognized and obtained a success (with their leader Nohra Padilla) but in 2018 their labor conditions are put at risk by a change in policies.

name: Exploración y explotación petrolera en el Piedemonte Llanero, Colombia
Mtunzini - Exxaro proposed sand mining, South Africa
Laguna de Llancanelo, Mendoza: actividad petrolera en área natural protegida, Argentina
headline: Oil extraction in a Ramsar site,  protected area in southern Mendoza, Argentina. The environmental organization OIKOS temporarily stopped the oil project through a "writ of protection", ratified by the Supreme Court of Justice from Mendoza.

name: Monsanto GM crops, Egypt
New airport on the island of Barbuda, Antigua and Barbuda
headline: Construction of new airport in Barbuda began without residents’ approval, while they were forcibly evacuated after the island was devastated by Hurricane Irma. Forest land used for farming and hunting and hosting rare species has been destroyed.

name: Illegal industrial discharge from coal chemical plant threatened villagers’ livelihood in Yulin, Shaanxi, China
headline: Villagers in Yanggou village in Yulin, Shaanxi Province, China, repeatedly questioned and contested the illegal discharge of sewage by nearby coal chemical enterprises in the Yuheng Industrial Park.

name: Mina de oro en Titiribí, Antioquia, Colombia
Ross Sea protected area, Antarctica
headline: ASOC is a coalition of over 15 NGOs which pushed for and achieved  environmental protection of the Ross Sea, Antarctica.

name: Benapole-Jessore Highway and deforestation, Bangladesh
headline: US poet Allen Ginsberg famous poem “September on Jessore Road” refers to this very important road for Bangladesh, historically and culturally. Eventually, the national high court stayed the decision of the government to cut down trees

name: Kushinagar International Airport, UP, India
headline: New International Airport is proposed in the one of the four holy places declared by the Buddha to be fit. The land required for the airport site is cultivable land and the farmers were not willing to give their land for the project.

name: Tipaimukh Dam, India
Digby Island proposed Nexen Aurora LNG (fracked gas) export facility, BC, Canada
headline: China's Nexen corporation's proposed Aurora LNG (fracked gas) export facility, near Prince Rupert in British Columbia, Canada threatens the fishing community of Prince Rupert, displaces local residents and enables the expansion of hydraulic fracking.

name: Areva Uranium mining in Imouraren, Niger
Tucuruí hydroelectric dam, Pará, Brazil
headline: Tucuruí, one of the world’s largest hydroelectric dams, has displaced 32.000 people since the 1980s, leaving communities in an ongoing struggle for compensation and land rights. Six people, including leading MAB activist Dilma Silva, were killed in 2019.

name: Anambra Airport City / Cargo Airport, Anambra, Nigeria
headline: After farmland was cleared for Anambra Airport City/Cargo Airport concerns that the project might be unviable proved well-founded as the project has not been completed. Neighbouring communities complain of extension of the project site and land grabbing

name: Resistance to Chevron-YPF Fracking, Argentina
headline: At the beginning of 2016 over 500 shale wells were operative, making this community one of the areas in the world most affected  by fracking, outside the USA.

name: Avenue Royale Casablanca, Morocco
headline: The Avenue Royale project in the heart of Casablanca illustrates how major urban projects give rise to conflict when they confront the people who live in the areas to be developed. Around 60,000 people from poor backgrounds are affected in this case.

name: Artesanal mining in Esmeraldas, Ecuador
headline: Desde 2005-2007, motivadas por el incremento del precio del oro en el mercado, empresas ilegales de explotación minera, carentes de toda concesión o título, comenzaron a asentarse. El gobierno lanza el “Plan Minero Metalúrgico Artesanal Comunitario”

name: Tan Rai bauxite mining in Central Highlands, Vietnam
headline: Despite initial opposition for some years (including General Giap, Buddhist groups, scientists), this large bauxite-alumina project is going ahead.

name: Gazprom's Obskaya – Bovanenkovo railroad in  Yamal peninsula, Arctic Russia
headline: Yet another construction related to the Yamal mega gas export in the Yuribey river, at the expense of local bodiversity and the Nenets indigenous population's cultural and social values.

name: Sabatoru suffers oil spill from Agip Pipelines, Nigeria
European Fishing Vessels, Western Sahara
headline: 70% of Moroccan catch comes from Saharan area. European-Moroccan Fishing Deals Perpetuate Marginalization and Exploitation of Saharan Population.

name: Incineration of hospital and industrial waste in Camargos, MG, Brazil
Ixtoc gigantic marine oil spill, Campeche, Mexico
headline: Between 3 June 1979, the date of the blowout, and 23 March 1980, when Ixtoc I was finally capped, it spewed aboout 475,000 metric tonnes of oil into the sea not far from Ciudad del Carmen on Mexico's Yucatán Peninsula.

name: Movement against imported coal plants, Greece
headline: Plans of private and public private companies for new coal plants in Greece have been abandoned thanks to citizens' mobilization and strong advocacy for alternative sources of energy and power saving measures.

name: Defenders of the Akbelen forest  resist coal mine near Ikizkoy, Turkey
headline: Since 2019, villagers and activists  resist efforts by YK Energy to cut down the Akbelen Forest for the expansion of a coal mine. They refuse losing their lands and the health and ecological costs associated with mining.

name: Wilmar International sugar plantations in Meraukee, Papua, Indonesia
Agip endless Spills in Emago-Kugbo, Edema and Otuabagi, Nigeria
Fish processing plant in the tourist town of Abéné in Casamance, Senegal
headline: Fishmeal factories mutiply on the Senegalese coast. Fishmeal is exported to Northern countries. Once it started operating, the plant in Abéné triggered the inhabitants' strong opposition and mobilization to get it shut down.

name: Makwa Initiative against Enbridge's Line 3 Replacement Project, USA
headline: "The Anishinaabe people were told by the creator to protect the minowan/wild rice. We are standing up against this pipeline and by doing so we are standing up for our wild rice." The Makwa Initiative is stopping Enbridge's Line 3 Replacement Project.

name: Namakhvani HPP dam in Imereti region, Georgia
headline: In 2019, the Georgian government agreed with two foreign private companies to builg a hydroelectric power plant and a dam in the Namakhvani area in the Imereti region. Massive protest led to the project’s abandonment in 2021.

name: Nuweiba Power Plant, Egypt
headline: Locals of Nuweiba stopped the construction of a power plant by the Egyptian Electricity Holding Company, which would have had a detrimental effect on the environment and tourism in the area.

name: Underwater gas pipeline along the Ob River, Novy port, Yamal, Arctic Russia
headline: Local groups fear the new underwater pipeline connection across the great Arctic bay will pose threat to Arctic ecosystems and their traditional livelihoods.

name: Acueducto río Pance, Cali, Colombia
Monoculture of sugar cane in Ribeirao Preto, Brazil
Illegal hunting at the Strait of Messina, Italy
headline: Illegal poaching of raptors such as the European honey buzzard was a serious threat to migrating birds of prey until Anna Giordano began anti-poaching activism and vigilance camps cutting down bird shootings from 5,000 annually to less than 200.

name: Suruí  controversial Forest Carbon Project, Rondônia, Brasil
headline: Carbon offsets mitigation project generates bitter internal conflicts among the Paiter Suruí indigenous populations of Rondônia.

name: Sanitary landfill in Waga Pelpola, Sri Lanka
headline: In 2008, the project to establish a sanitary landfill in Waga Pelpola has been abandoned thanks to local communities protests, but Sri Lanka still face problems with waste disposal in many other sites.

name: Locals against the privatization of the Pari island (Pulau Pari), Indonesia
headline: Residents controlled Pulau Pari's land for generations,  in 2010 initiating community tourism. In 2015, PT Bumi Pari Asri claimed 90% of the island. Since then residents experienced  intimidation and criminalization.

name: Extracción de materiales CEMEX in Payandé, Colombia
headline: La extración de materiales para la fabricación de cemento está afectando la calidad de vida de una  población del Tolima, la cual ha visto cómo se deterioran sus viviendas, salud y especialmente la amenaza a los ecosistemas y fuentes hídricas.

name: Protests in Ahvaz covered in brown dust due to oil and gas factories, Iran
headline: At least 9 oil  and gas companies are operating in the city, causing extreme air pollution and dust. As malcontent rose, the government declared any form of protest illegal.

name: Recrecimiento Embalse de Yesa, Spain
headline: A long fight against the dam at Yesa (Aragon), strong police repression in October 2012, the issue is still open.

name: Uwa, exploración petrolera en su territorio, Colombia
Bribri, mineria, Costa Rica
Dar es Salaam water management, Tanzania
Three Mile Island, Pennsylvania, United States
headline: On March 28, 1979, Three Mile Island's nuclear power plant unit 2 (almost 1000 MW) suffered the US worst commercial nuclear accident. Radiation was released. Many people were evacuated. The effects were felt in the country and abroad.

name: Sea Level Rise and Tribal Relocation in Isle de Jean Charles, Louisiana, USA
headline: “The last thing anyone wants to do is sign away the legacy from their ancestors who worked so hard to keep it." Native communities forced to resettle due to the disruption of Mississippi delta ecology.

name: Ban on Onshore Fracking in Nova Scotia, Canada
headline: A moratoria to fracking has been introduced in Nova Scotia in 2014 following citizens' protests and anti-fracking campaign since 2011

name: Reque -  Explotación minera de La Granja y planta de lixiviación, Peru
headline: This plant to built in Reque by Rio Tinto was discontinued in 2009. This plant would be in preparation for a very large copper mining project in La Granja.

name: Sand mining in Vasai Creek, Mumbai, India
headline: Vasai Creek: miners drowning due to illegal manual sand mining in Mumbai, for the building industry. Sand dredging operations continue despite official bans.

name: Mechanized Sand Mining in the Maha Oya, Sri Lanka
headline: Maha Oya river is one of the main sources of sand for the increasing needs in construction materials by Sri Lanka. River sand mining has high environmental and social impacts. Local EJOs succeeded in forcing the government in regulating the activity.

name: Illegal sand mining in Peam Krasop Wildlife Sanctuary, Cambodia
Mayrouba Sand Quarries, Lebanon
headline: The town of Mayrouba has been plagued with illegal sand and gravel quarries for more than a decade.

name: Nalgonda Uranium Mining, Andhra Pradesh, India
Silicosis victims of stone quarries in Rajasthan, India
headline: Miners of one of the Indian richest states in minerals suffering from lung diseases due poor healthy conditions

name: Heavy Polluting Transit in Massachusetts, USA
headline: Successful story against urban transport heavy air pollution and how local citizens groups came together and mobilize to demand institutional changes and reparation

name: Illegal sand mining along the Cau River, Bac Ninh province, Vietnam
headline: Illegal river sand mining increases with Bac Ninh's construction boom. While few actors appropriate large profits, the local population carries the environmental and socio-economic costs of river degradation.

name: Beach Erosion in Gaza, Palestine
headline: Beach erosion in Gaza due to man-made structures, is a major issue in the densely populated strip. Many of these structures are in Gaza itself and were installed between 1972 and 2010 with no prior study.

name: Forced eviction of Roma families to an isolated farming area, Garmen, Bulgaria
headline: Public authorities in Bulgaria evict Romani families to an isolated agricultural area without offering alternative housing and deprive children with disabilities from basic living conditions and adequate infrastructure.

name: Offshore sea sand harvest in Kwale district, south of Mombasa, Kenya
headline: The national environmental tribunal (NET) in Kenya stopped China Roads and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) from harvesting sea sand in Kwale County for construction of the terminal of SGR after locals appealed against a license issued in 2015.

name: Climate change displacement of Shishmaref native Alaskans, USA
headline: Residents of a small Alaskan village voted in 2016 to relocate their  community from a barrier island that has been steadily disappearing because of erosion and flooding attributed to climate change.

name: Gravel and Sand Extraction from the Drina River, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Remediation of Palic Lake, Serbia
headline: What can make a lake die? Palic lake affected by agrotoxics from the surrounding agricultural activities, and bad sewage treatment waits for appropriate measures to be applied.

name: Law enforcers grab children’s park in Khilagon, Dhaka, Bangladesh
headline: A legal battle challenges the attempts of law enforcers to grab the only children’s park in one of the most congested neighbourhood of Dhaka

name: Extracción de materiales del río La Vieja, Colombia
headline: Small scale sand mining facing legislative changes; now the sector is under the mining law and big mining corporations are jumping in. The overexploitation of the the river's sand makes the activity not renewable anymore

name: Illegal sand mining along the Tien River, Dong Thap province, Vietnam
headline: Illegal sand mining in Dong Thap province has drastically increased with the Vietnamese construction boom. But the sand rush is leaving villagers without ground under their feet.

name: Extracción de materiales en río Luisa, Colombia
headline: Mientras las empresas extraen material de construccion  y contaminan del río, los campesinos no cuentan con agua para consumo humano y actividades agrícolas y su salud se encuentra afectada

name: Contaminación de agua con metales pesados y agrotóxicos en Poncitlán, Jalisco , Mexico
headline: About 100 deaths because of renal insufficiency in Poncitlán, Jalisco. The community believes that illness is caused by water contamination by heavy metals and  agro-toxics.

name: London Array offshore wind farm, United Kingdom
headline: The largest windfarm in the world at the time of its construction is developed by oil and gas and utility companies, supported by Greenpeace, Friends of the Earth and RSBP and resisted by local residents and conservation groups.

name: Tiradero Jilotzingo, Mexico
headline: In this area near Mexico City, local activists risk their lives in protests against a waste  dump and also in defence of forests and ejidal land. Lawyer Fernando Mayén was killed in 2008.

name: Extreme Heat Events Phoenix Arizona, USA
Roma families fear displacement due to construction of an ecoduct across National Road, Svrcinovec, Slovakia
headline: Roma families in Svrcinovec face the risk of displacement due to the construction of an ecoduct across roads with high traffic density.

name: Riachuelo-Matanzas: 200 años de contaminación, Argentina
headline: The Matanzas-Riachuelo River Basin is over 60 kilometers long and houses many industries releasing effluents into the river, which cuts through 14 municipalities in Buenos Aires. The Supreme Court ordered in 2008 a sanitation plan.

name: Noise Pollution and Building Damages from the Supersonic Russian Aircrafts at Hmeimim Airbase in Latakia, Syria
headline: Residents of Hmeimim Town report widening cracks in their houses, decreased property values, and a halt to urban movement due to Russian military operations

name: Segregated Roma community lack adequate access to waste and water in Sajókaza, Hungary
headline: The Roma neighbourhood in Sajókaza is cut off from the Hungarian part of the village by a separation wall. Roma families suffer from the lack of access to water and sanitation, from low indoor air quality due to energy poverty and mold.

name: Massive sediment extraction from the River Drava, Croatia
headline: Due to an old-fashioned water management system, the River Drava had been used for massive gravel and sand sediment excavation. Controversial extraction still persists but people oppose and demand respect of EU regulation on rivers

name: Landfills in Mapuche Territories, Chile
headline: Governmental environmental racism against native Chilean Mapuches threatens their ancestral territory where have been authorized 17 landfills. Illegal landfills on their lands are also starting to sprout.

name: Julakay Ltd. sand mining in Faraba Banta, The Gambia
headline: Julakay started mining for sand on Faraba Banta's rice fields, without prior informing and consent of the villagers,  threatening their food supply. Police repression killed two people, bringing the case under national scrutiny.

name: Korle Lagoon Restoration Project and displacement from Accra's Old Fadama Slum, Ghana
headline: When the slum gets in the way of tourism development, a flood opens opportunity. The government is using natural disasters as a reason to unilaterally determine the fate of the slum, while ignoring the rights of the people who are impacted

name: Meiningen Deep Geothermal Energy, Germany
Beni Oukil Gravel Quarries, Morocco
headline: Since 2014 the villagers of Beni Oukil have been fighting against a quarry on the nearby Jbel Dchira. They have been often faced with violent answers from the local police and several arrests.

name: Sand Mining in Asilah, Morocco
headline: The continuous and extensive Sand mining on the coast of Asilah, Morocco poses real danger on both the town's cultural heritage and its economy.

name: The Arterial Highways of Poughkeepsie New York, US
headline: Poughkeepsie's Arterial highways led to the City's downfall, and now hinder safe and accessible intracity travel, pollute the environment of the houses that border them, and prevent the City from distributing wealth and opportunity to residents equitably.

name: Mainland Mine Manakara, Madagascar
Gravel mining in Goptapa, Kurdistan Region of Iraq
headline: The Lesser Zab has been the lifeblood of riverside farming communities from time immemorial. Unrestricted gravel mining now endangers that delicate connection.

name: Illegal sand mining along the Dong Nai River, Vietnam
headline: Illegal sand mining along the Dong Nai River is causing large environmental and socio-economic destruction, including death of residents due to massive land-slides.

name: PINDECO. Pineapple Development Corporation-Del Monte,  Costa Rica
West Harlem and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, USA
